Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Good benefits, free meals, great work environment. It can be a fun place to work if you have the right mindset, as per usual the people make the place, get to know one another. Some of my best friends are my co-managers and employees. Work hard and you shall be rewarded.
Cons: For management, we are expected to do a whole lot more for not that much more than crew, no incentive for managers to stay, which is why the company is always looking for more managers. If they paid us more, their lives as well as ours would be a lot easier.
Advice to Management: Get to know your people and make sure you listen to their complaints/concerns, 95% of the time they have solid ideas and are right, don't be afraid to let them get involved too (within reason of course)

Cons: Was not always guaranteed a lunch break even with 8 hour shifts. Can be really tiring job at times

Title: "Take Out Specialist"

Advice to Management: Do more for your employees, and maybe you won't have such a high turn over rate. Work can be back breaking, and the managers do not help nearly as much as they should.

Title: "Chipotle Crew Member"
Pros: Meet some good people. You do get tips, I just don't know how much annually. Customers are generally not mean. Like to stay active. Free meals and 50% discount every time you go in.
Cons: Bad management. Discriminatory. Too much gossip. Men made women lift heavy things and didn't offer any help. Vulgar language in front of customers. Unprofessional
Advice to Management: Don't allow managers to harass employees.

Title: "Service manager"

Advice to Management: Promote people who exude the 13 characteristics you speak so highly of but don’t display and be professional.

Title: "It was okay"

Title: "service manager"

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Free food and having the opportunities to make customers happy
Cons: Not enough pay for the amount of work done, as well as the attitudes of coworkers and managers.
Advice to Management: Mangers are lazy. Crew members tend to do more work. The amount CEOS make a year we should definitely get a higher pay!

Title: "General mgr point of view"
Pros: If you work hard you will be rewarded by raise or promotion. It was for the most part a fun place to work . You learn a lot of great culinary skills . I worked very hard , became asst mgr inside of 3 mo. , a salaried mgr in a yr and general mgr of my own store in 15 months . If you go there with experience they are not afraid to start you at a higher pay if you ask.
Cons: As it is a fast growing company they tend to promote people that are to young or just not ready to be a mgr. A person who is a great worker isn't always a great mgr. In the past 2 years the company has come under fire in the press with ecoli and other issues and it seemed that every month they were changing how we did things . They also went on a hiring and firing spree of Area and General mgrs. some with little to no reason . Also if you have a family salaried position is not for you here. They told me in my interview salaried mgrs. work 55 hrs or more almost never ? I worked my share of 70 hr weeks and if I left 1 hr early I would get a phone call.
Advice to Management: my time at chipotle I would not take away . As a kitchen , service or even apprentice manager it was in the top 2 or 3 jobs I've experienced. Once you reach General mgr you seem to lose your voice upper mgt . I was asked my opinion and saw more action taken as a lesser mgr explaining issues . Once I became gm everything was very negative no matter how much good we did.

Title: "Chipotle Service Manager"

Advice to Management: Always communicate, critique, and know your boundaries.

Advice to Management: I have experienced countless lose/lose situations at Chipotle. If you have things to do in the back but there is a huge line then its either finish your tasks in the back and be yelled at for not helping or help the line and be yelled at for not finishing your tasks. The managers are under too much stress and need everything to always get done and that's not at all realistic.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: It really was like another family. Pay is above the standard for QSR, and vacation time adds up quickly. The mission behind the company is one I truly believe in.
Cons: Work/life balance, you get that at most restaurants but at Chipotle, you would miss your family for weeks at a time sometimes. Long hours, no breaks, "empowered" employees (which basically means a team of know it alls that want everyone else to do their work).
Advice to Management: Recognize your employees (especially management) days off. You will get less productive employees if you don't allow them to actually have time off. Honor vacation time.

Title: "Area Manager"

Title: "Crew Member"

Title: "Stressful amount of work expected but good pay"
Pros:
-good pay for a first job
-learn a lot about customer service and working with others
-flexible hours
Cons:
-never acknowledged for your hard work
-management valued older employees (since I am a minor my 7+ months of experience didn't mean anything compared to a new employees who are over 20 years old)
-when new management came into the store, I was scheduled to do dirty work new hires didn't want to do
-my hours were cut going from 20+hours to 3 hours a week. (these 3 hours were spent watching new hires and training)
Advice to Management: Give credit to everyone that works not just your specified age group. Chipotle is for diversity so allow minors to feel appreciated for their hard work too.

Title: "Grateful for the Experience"
Pros:
Working for Chipotle was an amazing experience as a college student! I started as part time, but moved into full time because I needed more hours.
If you are looking for a temporary or a in between job then Chipotle is for you.
My employer worked with my hours and I had a lot of fun working with my coworkers. Plus cross-training is easy and you get a lot of hands on experience with customer service, cash, front and back of house. I actually was able to be part of the team on Fort Hood opening day, it was pretty hectic but a lot of fun. I am grateful to have been a part of the beginning of that stores journey.
Cons:
Management works hard, but not smart. Meaning if someone messes up the manager will just do the job to get it done.
Your training will depend on what store your applying for. if its an insane busy location then your training will lack.
Advice to Management: Better training for management.

Title: "Hm..."
Pros:
Build Strooooooong Work Ethic
Free Meal At Work
50% off at your restaurant
Cons:
-expecting minimum wage workers to make miracles
-short staff due to turnover rate and level of speed required
-managers incredibly overworked and passive aggressive about low pay
Advice to Management:
Hire more people. Pay them better. Stop shoving food safety down everyone's throats. You expect a crew of 10 to run a "fast food/casual dining" restaurant serving over 200-300?+ people in one dinner rush?.

Also, put someone on broom and stall duty. The restaurants are dirty with rice all over the place, its very bad for the company when a customer cant eat at the restaurant because their seat is covered in rice, or the floor is covered in rice.

I think your company will succeed no matter what, people love our food. So please, send help to your restaurants in need. Even if you have to hire nationwide specialists who go store to store until the staff problem is fixed.

Title: "Totally depends on which chipotle"

It was hard-work for that much pay; but it was worth it because it was a great place to work. It's cool that they promote from within.
Cons: The second chipotle was the WORST place I've ever worked. Management didn't care and wasn't on top of things so we always ran out of stuff which led to angry customers. People weren't trained well so everything was a train wreck everyday.

Title: "Oops."

Advice to Management: I suggested and offered a Queso recipe back in 2009. I was laughed at. This summer, guess what Chipotle came out with post salmonella outbreak to try to save their sales? Queso. Just think of the millions in dollars in lost sales and market share over the year. Lesson to those who read, listen to your employees.

Cons: sometimes late shifts, my particular management was not trained properly --> led to problems with scheduling. When you walk into your perspective store, look around to see how devoted your coworkers are. Chipotle wants top performers, empowerment, and high standards. make sure your team has all of those. look at how the store looks. is there stuff everywhere? how happy are the workers? does it look like an "establishment"?
Advice to Management: be more particular with who you hire. Firing and rehiring can cause chaos. Don't hire a bunch of worker's friends just because they vouched for them. continue to work around people's schedules, ESPECIALLY high schoolers and college kids.

Title: "Very good company to start career with."
Pros:
Amazingly friendly co-workers at my store. Sometimes you will get sent to other stores and will be called in (if you want to) on your days off. There are a lot of potential for overtime if you are looking for it. The benefits are very good. Free meals on days you work and 50% off on days you don't. Health/dental/vision is only $66 a month and $90 a month with a spouse included. They give financial aid (not loans) for employees who have been with the company over a year, as well as paid time off, and 401k.

The work, although frustrating sometimes and low-ish pay, is pretty fun. You usually get a sense of accomplishment when you make a meal or make a customer's day.

The best part with Chipotle is the people. My store has some of the best people I have ever worked with. Funny, chill, hard working, and kind. I find myself spending a lot of time outside of work with some of these co-workers. Although I cannot speak for all the stores, my store definitely has connected me with some of my best friends.
Cons:
Hard work with relatively low pay.
Can get frustrating when it's a busy day and someone calls out.
Advice to Management: For how hard we work, we really should get higher pay.

Title: "Xiane Lewis"
Pros: Everything is great I love the job and I love working @ any job
Cons: The distance and the time and effort it took to get there was tremendous I do love working tho
Advice to Management: Work with me as much as possible but I am a great worker that does the job well

Title: "Crew Member Review"
Pros: Always was given a meal each shift, no matter how long the shift was. Coworkers were very driven to work hard and were very personable. Managers were nice, but weren't afraid to keep the crew focused if needed. The company prefers to promote managers from within, and will gladly help you attain those goals if you talk to them.
Cons: Very fast, hard work for not much pay. They tend to brainwash employees to see the Chipotle "vision" and hope that the crew works towards that, rather than earning higher pay. The store was run off a skeleton crew, despite being one of the busiest locations around. This was very stressful and exhausting, as everyone had to work twice as hard to keep up, yet we still didn't receive any extra pay. Employee turnover was a little high, but new employees were always hard workers. Just very easy to get burnt out.
Advice to Management: Staff the line appropriately, especially during busy hours. Pay your crew a little bit more.

Title: "Crew Member"

Cons: They expect you to hustle all the time with little to no down time while you only make 19K. They also make you learn and memorize a whole bunch of corporate lingo that doesn't really make you a better employee.

Title: "Service Manager"

Title: "System does not make sense: cashier overloaded with duties while expo does almoast nothing"
Pros: The company has benefits and everyone is friendly. Would be a great college job if it wasn't for the cons I listed below
Cons: The system doesn't make any sense. The cashier is overloaded with duties while expo doesn't do much at all. Now that I work there I understand why every chipotle dining room is so trashed all the time. Dirty tables and filthy bathrooms are a constant in every Chipotle anywhere. Now I understand why. It is because while the rest of the people on the line are only responsible for one task, the cashier is responsible for half of the responsibilities of the restaurant and he/she is not allowed to get help with such duties from any other worker (like zero common sense teamwork ). Besides having the regular responsibilities of a cashier, this position requires that you keep each table and counter clean in the dining room, also the bathrooms and floors, also wipe and stock trays, constantly stocking and restocking the dining room, ask customers if everything is great all that while having an endless line of people. Yes, I get the multitasking concept but it doesn't make any sense to put all these responsibilities on a one person while the rest of the employees on the line have one task only. Now I see why all Chipotles dining rooms and bathrooms are always so filthy while I see people just chilling on the line and while the cashier is always so busy and unable to complete the overload of expected duties. And yeap they all get paid the same.
Advice to Management: I know you are a corporation and your system comes from above. But maybe it is time to take a look at your system because as a customer before I worked at Chipotle, my family and I would always be disgusted to have to eat on top of beans, rice and salsa spilled on dirty counters and tables, and we would never dare to use your always filthy bathrooms. Understand it doesn't make any sense to put so much responsibility on the cashier while the expo doesn't do much, and while there is so much need to keep the dining room and bathrooms clean and restocked. I don't know how this corporation and its managers so blindly follow this pointless system and no one dares to speak up. Or is it that every manager is so out of touch not to realize how messed up is to run a restaurant with always filthy dining room and bathrooms?? And how it just doesn't make any sense to expect the cashier to efficiently do all their tasks while others are not expected to do much and are not even allowed to help?? Some common sense from the management is desperately needed in that corporation

Title: "Good first job"
Pros: organized, easy opportunities to move up, kept a system, colleagues were open to constructive criticism, good community to be around
Cons: Not much to say about the cons of this place.

Title: "The peaks and valleys of the Chipotle leadership path"
Pros:
- Chipotle is a large company with a lot of tools and resources.
- There are a lot of bright and talented leaders working for the company.
- The company has very high standards and will push one's leadership abilities to a new level.
Cons:
- The company is still recovering from the food born illness, and will be for quite some time.
- The company has always struggled with turnover. This combined with the companies learning curve has damaged the quality of a lot of restaurants.
- Losing their CEO Monty, along with many board members caused the company to deviate from what made it special, which was its amazing people culture.
Advice to Management: Chipotle prides its self on developing its managers from within the company. If you are growing within the company you have a good idea of what to expect. If you are hired on as an external manger, this means you have some good management experience. It is impotent to know, the GM position is very different from most companies. The time given form the labor matrix will require you to spend many hours working the line, prep, grill, etc. I have seen them hire over 30 outside managers with in the last 3 years and only 3 are currently working for Chipotle. Their biggest complaint is feeling like an overpaid crew member due to time constraints. However, for those who can push past the challenges, there is still a lot of opportunity to be made. Much of the changes and turnover leave open positions for those driven to achieve them.

Title: "Service manager"
Pros: Great teams great environment and opportunities
Cons: Chipotle has a bad rep with certain things , but I enjoy proving and teaching our high stands with crew and chipotle lovers

Too much work to complete in small periods of time

Title: "Longshifts"
Pros: work goes by fast because you are always working, and one free borito a day
Cons: I was in the chipotle that had the most sales in the east coast so I was always tired

Title: "Not worth the effort."
Pros: The pay is okay and some team members are nice. Convenient location as well with good businesses and corporations nearby.
Cons: A lot of picky customers, training isn't good, you will be rushed into working straight away, fellow team members are disrespectful towards new men, you will be told to do other people's work just because you're new.
Advice to Management: Treat the newcomers better, don't expect them to do EVERYTHING so fast on their first few weeks, actually train them, follow protocol and don't slack off with your employees, speak to them and find out their wants and needs so you can work around their schedule.

Title: "A harsh, yet friendly environment"
Pros: An amazing potential for growth. An amazing team.
Cons: CEO's message does not fit compensation for hourly employees. Incredible expectations for just above minimum wage.

Title: "Ok"
Pros: Benefits, career opportunities, free meal during shift, 50% off when not working, holiday parties
Cons: Short breaks, takes up a lot of your own time especially when manager, upper leaders expect a lot from you but not enough payment, burns, cuts, sweaty environment, lots of labor work.
Advice to Management: Need to be more fair and genuine with staff

Title: "Good pay, bad tips, huge mix on customers"
Pros: Skills are easy to pick up and improve on, but you get stuck in a rut after a while if you don't become a manager. Good pay (Seattle minimum wage)
Cons: but tips are horrible, customers don't tip since we don't have credit card tipping ability. Some really bad managers that needed to be retrained (and our general manager knew) but weren't improved on. Company culture was very insulting, lots of hurtful jokes and overly mean managers
Advice to Management: When you know a manager/crew member is bad don't make fun of them, train them and help them

Title: "Great Environment"
Pros:
Awesome team
Management truly cares about you as an individual
They only hire the best, so you will not be working with people who slack off
LOTS of opportunities for growth in the company
You are encouraged and motivated to do your best
Free employee meals
Competitive pay/slightly better
Cons: Very high expectations- if you like to do the bare minimum, do not apply here

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: I learned to prepare food.
Cons: Unorganized and same people doing the same thing everyday for weeks at a time.
Advice to Management: Switch it up and make sure someone is learning something different everyday.

Title: "Needs some work"
Pros:
Free food on breaks
Good pay
Cons:
Mangers
The way things are run
Advice to Management: Don't hire mangers who don't know anything about the place!

Title: "Solid core, rough around the edges"
Pros:
Starting pay is 9/hr, within 3 months I got a raise.
Company takes their food quality and customer service seriously.
Easy to work your way up the corporate ladder. Within 6 months or so I was offered a kitchen manager position.
Cons:
Worked there less than a year and saw the rise and fall of 4 different general managers.
Many problems that arose had happened before. (clogged drains resulting in a flooded kitchen, broken equipment, etc)
My point is, management is a bit shaky and struggles with finding permanent solutions.
Advice to Management: Value your employees the same way you value your restauranteur status.

Title: "Decent job must be a fast learner"
Pros: Free meal, cool company merchandise, superb company ethics and values in which other companies should follow. Great customers, easy menu and the food is good.
Cons: Lack of hours, over staffed, poor communication at times, poor training with unrealistic high expectations to learn and perform prematurely. Those who don't catch on quick enough will not get hours and without consistent hours It will take longer to gain experience. Favoritism managers giving hours to those they like personally instead of performing quality job duties.
Advice to Management: Train people properly not by taking lazy shortcuts and throwing them under the bus when corporate comes around because they are not doing things the Chipotle way. Lead by example. If you want top performers then stop showing favoritism to those who don't deserve hours because you are friends or an inside crew at work.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Fun, fast paced environment that is also very team oriented.
Cons: Low wage for amount of work put in

Title: "Weekend Job"
Pros:
1.) free food after every shift
2.) 50% off on days not scheduled
3.) for the most part pleasant co-workers
4.) flexible hours
5.) tips at end of each shift
Cons:
1.) disrespectful customers
2.) back hurt after a busy day
3.) 30 minute unpaid break
4.) lack of proper training
5.) not enough pay for the work done unless you work few hours just to benefit from the 50% off
Advice to Management: Put up posters or some type of sign showing the portions the company wants us to serve so the customer knows that it's not the employee being skimpy but rather that's just the portion they're supposed to get.

Title: "Not worth it"
Pros:
- Reduced payment for meals on your break
- Great experience working in a fast paced restaurant
- Opportunity to work on most of the stations as well as opening and closing shifts (learn what you can and get out!)
Cons:
- Micro-managed for everything big and small
- The staff did not work as a team
- Staff was unprofessional coming to work out of uniform, high and/or drunk
- Staff was cutting pay and hours from employees they did not like
- The workers progress book was often belittling with the managers focusing on flaws not strengthens
Advice to Management: Treat the employees like humans and not like robots, build moral and a more positive teamwork environment,

Title: "Good place to work, can be stressful"
Pros: Crew becomes like a family, fast paced, decent start pay, as long as you've got nice customers you'll have a good time.
Cons: Very stressful during busy times, trying to achieve some of the times they ask of you start to make you cut corners not allowing you to hold up the standards they have.
Advice to Management: Pay attention to the people that work below you. Throwing a ton of regulations doesn't work if you want us to achieve it in half the time necessary.

Title: "Not the Best or the Worst"
Pros: Benefits are great and they are prompt to cater to your needs in regards to equipment and desk supplies.
Cons: Work environment is stressful and there was quite a bit of gossip. Myself and fellow coworkers took our work home with us to ensure everything we needed to do got finished on time. Although it was not suggested many co workers did this work off the clock due to a soft rule of only 2 hours overtime per week. Most weeks you could put in 5-7 hours of overtime and not get everything done. Managers either knew this was going on and turned a blind eye or they had no idea. Not sure which is worse. Need more employees and a more skilled management team.
Advice to Management: Stay professional and aware of what is going on in your department.

Title: "Good people, hard work"
Pros:
great coworkers and management
decent pay
free food
tuition help
Cons:
understaffed
unnecessarily hard work
emotionally tasking
very busy environment

Title: "Apprentice overview"
Pros: The best part about this job is the benefits.
Cons: Positive or negative experience depends too much on upper management. Company changes policies excessively frequent which adds stress upon staff.
Advice to Management: Loosen grip of area managers and other specialized departments like marketing and staffing because it adds extra stress to GM's and App's which can effect performance very quickly.

Title: "The best job I've ever had"
Pros: That everyone I work with is so upbeat and happy! I love coming to work with such an energetic crew!
Cons: Sometimes it can be a lot of work
Advice to Management: Keep pushing us to be the best!

Title: "Don't do it"
Pros: Lots of growth opertuniteis available
Cons: To much work not enough pay
Advice to Management: Icreasecompensation

Title: "Ad"
Pros: Place has good food and benefits
Cons: Issues with food safety and declining sales

Title: "Don’t work here unless you want to do more work than any other food place for minimum wage."
Pros: 1 free meal that you have to eat inside their store, you can’t save it for later or take it home.
Cons: There’s 1 day of training then they expect you to know everything the next day. It’s way too much to handle especially as a first job. They had a meeting while I was working and so many people were in the kitchen without hats on, it’s just gross and they don’t follow all health codes either.
Advice to Management: Go to school to learn better management skills and train new hires for 2 weeks like you’re suppose to do.

Title: "Would recommend"
Pros: Free food and paid breaks. If you are willing to work hard, there is room for advancement.
Cons: Management can be unprofessional and the work can be difficult.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: The work is extremely fast-paced, time goes by fast. Coworkers have been, for the most part, a joy to work with.
Cons: Closing takes too long, because we clean so much.

Title: "Lasted 4 weeks"
Pros: Free meal after every shift, decent starting pay
Cons:
stressful, expected to absorb a lot in a short period of time

lasted 4 weeks before the anxiety actually seriously affected my health

Title: "Great place"
Pros: Great salary and Great environment
Cons: Sometimes it can be stressful
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Fast paced environment"
Pros: Great opportunities for career advancement. Can start as a crew member and work your way up the company.
Cons: A great deal of work considering the pay scale.
Advice to Management: Make your crew members feel valuable.

Title: "It's not for everyone"
Pros:
$10/hr somewhat flexible
Learn communication skills
Cons: Very fast paced, rude, no communication
Advice to Management: Actually speak to your employees about how to make the workplace better and inform on any new rules

Title: "Apprentice"
Pros: People you work with that still care were great
Cons: Everything changed and they expect too much

Title: "Good place to work"
Pros: free food. Good practices. Good contact with corporate if you ever have any issues.
Cons: Pretty hard work. My store was pretty slow too. Working in a kitchen is intense and not for me.

Title: "Fun Place to work, Bad upper Managment"
Pros:
The people were the reason, i got up every morning to go to work.
Many of my regular customers were very chill.
Free Meals of course
Cons:
Not enough pay for my Co-workers
Upper management would not listen to reason
Advice to Management:
Start Communicating better with your teams.
Stop being to Damn stingy with pay, these employees work really hard for you.

Title: "Great first job to teach work ethic"
Pros:
- company sets standards high
- emphasis on team engagement
- teaches exceptional work ethic and how to take pride in your job
- builds values in employees that create a solid foundation
Cons:
- expectations can be a bit too high
- there were a number of issues in legality of practice such as employees working off the clock or times changed

Title: "OKay first Job"
Pros: Free Food with every shift and 50% off meals
Cons:
only 10-minute break per & hour shift worked
Work can be intensive
Advice to Management: Be consistent when enforcing rules

Title: "ehh"
Pros:
-short shifts
- coworkers are nice
Cons:
-no hours
- not well organized
Advice to Management: try harder in providing for each employee

Title: "Cashier/Team Member"
Pros: Free meals, which insured that anything gross would not get into your food because if you work the morning shift, you personally prepared all the food.
Cons: Extremely long hours. Base shift was 10 hours. If you were full time, you were pushing almost 60 hours a week for a measly 10 dollars an hour.
Advice to Management: Hire more qualified individuals that will set an example for employees, not people who break the rules and treat employees badly.

Title: "Chipotle Crew member"
Pros: Offers a decent tuition reimbursement program if you are willing to stay for a year.
Cons: The company tends to care more about its image than its' crew members. Salary positions also greatly benefit every 6 months from bonuses where as hourly positions get 5 cent raises. If you work the position of prep you will not receive a break.
Advice to Management: Make sure EVERYONE has a break.

Title: "Poor job training"
Pros: Nice hourly pay compared to other fast food restaurants. Tips are also provided. Nice benefits.
Cons:
Poor job training. I never got to watch the safety videos until the last week of my employment.
Horrible work hours. When they first hired me, I asked for 15 to 30 hours weekly. They over hired and ended up only giving me on average 8 hours weekly. They also let me out on average two hours before my actual shift was supposed to end. Once, I stayed an extra 4 hours just to complete the food safety video.
Advice to Management: Train your workers effectively and only hire them if you can provide the hours that they request.

Title: "All about who you know"
Pros: Promote within, second family. Love the face time with regulars.
Cons: Too much corporate red tape; all about how it looks on paper; two faced upper management.

Title: "crew"
Pros: fun coworkers and free food
Cons: work way too much to be under appreciated and for minimum wage. Don't pay according to job position. Someone on the line makes the same amount as the person on grill or prep who works 10x harder and has way more job responsibility. Its just an unfair pay system. No incentive to want to learn more positions because there is no pay increase.
Advice to Management: If you start off on line you should be payed minimum wage and as you work your way up you should get a pay increase. For example once they learn cash that should be a $.20 in crease and once you go to the back of the house that should be like another $.50-$1 more in pay. Why would i do 10x more work for the same pay? it doesn't make any sense

Title: "Enjoyed my time there for the most part"
Pros:
-Paid lunch time
-Free food
-Great coworkers
Cons: Too high expectations from management
Advice to Management: Be more lenient on crew training new members. We can't do everything on our own.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: It was a great team to work with, everyone would always help out each other to make sure we all succeeded at our tasks, plus there was 50% whenever you bought from them.
Cons: They would never hire enough people to do all the tasks required for the day and expected works to work harder to make up for the work that needed to be done.
Advice to Management: Set realistic expectations of employees of what can be done

Title: "Tough Job"
Pros:
Free food
Paid break
A little more per hour than your typical fast-ish food restaurant chain.
$9.00 hour in Florida
Cons:
Lot of work
Not the best hours, hard to get over 20, bad structure for schedules due to having like 50+ employee's
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Good place to work"
Pros: Fun workplace where the work isn't too difficult. Requires you to work hard everyday but definitely feels rewarding.
Cons: There can be some very frustrating days
Advice to Management: The focus on customer experience is taking precedence over the culture of empowering and its reflected in the work of employees.

Title: "Awesome"
Pros: Best people evaa like om
Cons: Nothing bad at all I like it

Title: "Terrible management"
Pros: I made one friend. We bonded complaining about how poor the management was.
Cons:
Where to start!?

There is an immediate air of mistrust at this place. The manager emphasized over and over how important it is to stand in a certain place where the camera can see you buying your food, to prove you're not stealing it. Then he yelled at a girl for doing it wrong the first time.

You go through way more training than you should for the job that it is. Please don't make it seem like some "awesome boot camp" when all we're doing is blending salad dressing and scooping beans for people who will actually treat you like scum for charging extra for guacamole (which they usually can't even pronounce correctly).

Last, but not least, my manager left me responsible for getting my shift covered when I had mono. I had a doctor's note and was so obviously sick, but that still wasn't good enough for him. He said I had to figure out another employee to cover for me, even though the only other employees whose numbers I had were already working that day. He wasn't at all concerned about me having a terrible virus while serving people food... He just didn't want to deal with finding another person to do it or doing it himself.

Horrible!
Advice to Management: Choose your store managers wisely. It makes all the difference. Also, like I said before, this is a bean-scoopin' job. If you're going to treat us like we have the responsibility of surgeons, please pay us accordingly.

Title: "Couldn't stay any longer"
Pros: Only money and the food.
Cons:
Cult like atmosphere.
Terrible training.
Unprofessional managers.
Keep track of your hours - Don't trust them!

Since I was new, I had no way to clock in. The manager said she'll put my hours in the computer. When payday came around, they didn't have a check for me. Apparently the manager never put my hours in and then went on vacation! I had to wait until she got back and guess the amount of hours I've worked.
Advice to Management: Don't just pass new people around to be trained by a bunch of different people who may not even be qualified. You are a manager for a reason. Act like it.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Good family vibes in the job itself.
Cons: Everyone who worked there were stuck up in there own ways and did not act like how they portrayed the company
Advice to Management: Choose better and more confident people

Title: "Chipotle Mexican Grill"
Pros: The starting pay is great, there is a lot of room for growth. They offer free uniform and benefits.
Cons: There was never a set time to leave if you closed because you would stay until you finished.
Advice to Management: Communicate with the crew members better for better schedules and better hours.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Something I like about this job is that you are cleaning as you go , it's fast pace job. You are constantly moving and the people you work with are friendly.
Cons: There is favoritism amoungust the managers and crew members and people get moved up quickly without knowing there roles.
Advice to Management: Properly train your crew, people that have more knowledge about the company and job should be put into consideration also. For scheduling you shouldn't put people to close on day and open the next.

Title: "Not paid enough for what we deal with"
Pros:
high standards
free meals
health insurance
education assistance
Cons:
high turnover rate
very high standards for its employees
not paid enough if you meet said standards
they tell you there is lots of opportunity for promotions, but in reality they would rather import someone from a different store then promote from within
Advice to Management: if you are going to have such sky high expectations for your employees, you need to compensate the ones who meet them properly. 9$/hr isnt cutting it

Title: "Neutral"
Pros:
-room for advancement
-good quality food
-free meals at every shift
-paid breaks
-50% off when not working
Cons:
-discount is only valid at your own store
-can not take your free meal out of the store
-closing so late
- coming home with food on you or smelling like food

Title: "Chipotle Mexican Grill as second job!"
Pros: Fast passed environment, Free food! Delicious fresh food. 50% discount when you're off your shift. Fun environment with lots to do constantly:)
Cons: Lots of work! There's not a day where I leave without sweating. Have to wash your hands very very often and lots and lots of dishes to clean. There's always something to do as it's a fast food business.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: The Pros would have to be working with my people at work. If it wasn't for my people, I wouldn't be where I am at today . My people constantly made me better and pushed me, and challenged me as much as I would challenge them. I was able to establish connections with my team, and showing them that I cared for them and made them feel wanted and important, made my team work even harder for me to get our store and achieve our goals each month.
Cons: Management above which include ATL, Team Directors and above didn't pay or showed they cared for us
Advice to Management: Pay for attention on the good and not the bad all time

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Great company. Love what Chipotle believes in. Love how people who work there for the most part truly care about you as a person.
Cons: Things are often miscommunicated to the stores about new up coming promos and such.
Advice to Management: Go back to focusing more on the people!

Title: "It's a winning experience and I learned great balance."
Pros: They teach you empowerment through training in kitchen for management. Many positions to choose from. Line, prep cook, grill, cashier, and few others that make a big difference. Being a part of Chipotle can expand your expectations and your customer service skills.
Cons: Can be challenging for those who don't like to stay bisy and alert. Hours could be terrible. Must be willing to work weekends if you want to make a success of the experience.
Advice to Management: Keep pushing the team by leading with perfect example of following leadership goals.

Title: "Better places with same pay for half the work."
Pros: Free meal once per day.
Cons: Lots of work for minimum wage, managers micromanage, environment is gossipy and hateful
Advice to Management: Get some better managers who know how to teach. Pay your employees what they're worth.

Title: "Not bad depending on management"
Pros: Free food, decent pay if it's just a summer job ($10 and hour), goes by quickly
Cons:
Management makes your life easy or so that you don't want to come back, hard work, long rushes, can't make many mistakes.

My store wasn't too bad before we had several transfers to bring over a new manager and while the rest of the team works harder than before, he is never wrong, talks down to everyone, and creates an awful work environment. This job really depends on who you get with management because while the customer is in and out in 22 seconds, you're with your crew all day
Advice to Management: Have an environment where it's okay to make mistakes, not everyone is going to be a top performer all the time, learn people skills not only for customers, but for your employees

Title: "Worker"
Pros: Nice people, Mostly chill environment
Cons:
Low pay
Lots of work
Mean management
Lots of turnover

Title: "Unbalanced"
Pros: Plenty of work to do, plenty of roles to play.
Cons: Work is demanding and unbalanced. Responsibilities don't line up with role and pay.
Advice to Management: Keep a closer eye on mentors. If they're setting bad examples, talking negatively about employees behind their backs, maybe better discipline.

Title: "My experience working at chipotle"
Pros: Flexible hours decent hires decent ma agent
Cons: Unfair promotions lack of diversity
Advice to Management: Treat all associates fairly when it comes to promotions

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Very busy fast paced enviornment
Cons: Little to know communication from upper management. They want everything done a certain way but never explained why.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great, thorough training. Easy access to caring managers. Room for growth in company. Employees are given meals.
Cons: Fast food industry is still fast food industry
Advice to Management: Keep hiring great managers and your crew will be able to meet Chipotle's standard with ease

Title: "Good to bad"
Pros:
Opportunity
Some leadership
Great food
Cons: Its about who you know not what you know
Advice to Management: Lead

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: The best reasons i would say was working with the employees, i've grown so close with some of them and we've became a family. always helped and was there for eachother. I also liked the fact that some days i'd actually love working it was just a sudden urge i'd get.
Cons: The customers where sooooooooo rude. THE MANAGER WAS VERY CHILDISH, VERY PERSONAL AND DISCRIMINATED A LOT. The schedule was always messed up, they literally care about themselves and not us. the only time management was on top of us was when SSR came other then that, he would barely be at the store, or in the office playing candy crush. All i have to say is this company alone is FAKE!
Advice to Management: Hire managers who really want to handle things the way that they should be handled, and loves their job. stop hiring scammers who is just in it for the benefits and the hourly pay and actually get someone who is interested in working for the company and help building the store as it should be. PERIOD!

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: I honestly have no pros
Cons: The management and workers were very rude and unprofessional. They were constantly yelling and cursing so loud that guests would constantly complain to me.
Advice to Management: Treat your new workers with more respect and be more professional

Title: "Take out specialists"
Pros: Learn skills in the kitchen and what great customer service looks and high standards to food quality to cleaning
Cons: Too many expectations for little money
Advice to Management: Advice to corporate or who ever makes the rules. Actually work in a chipotle store before you began to make more standards because something's are almost impossible and you can. Only do so much .

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Great work culture. The team is amazing.
Cons: Low Pay. The pay was only 9 dollars.
Advice to Management: Increase wages

Title: "Apprentice"
Pros: Great Benefits, good people culture.
Cons: Working more hours than required, you are at salaried so there is no compensation from working a lot more extra hours.

Title: "Worked with creative team"
Pros: Fun people with good design sense. Brand that has lots of different projects going on so you might not get bored easily.
Cons: Smallish team and managers stretched a bit thin. Not as much mentorship for junior team members. C suite pretty removed from what's happening on the ground.

Title: "Great place to be a manager if you're good."
Pros: Good pay and benefits, if you have a good field leader it's a great environment as well.
Cons: Requires a lot of flexibility and things change quickly with little notice.
Advice to Management: Focus a little more on training the GMs or hire outside a little more. A lot of great GMs would kill to get what these 22 year olds complain about. Also some of your field leaders can't teach someone how to be a good GM, figure out who they are and remove them.

Title: "fun"
Pros: great food, always meet new people and fast pace
Cons: always busy, overwhelming, start to get low energy

Title: "great comany"
Pros: decent pay, relatively easy work
Cons: not many opportunites for promotion

Title: "worst place to ever work at never work there"
Pros: they are all bad people,
Cons: dont work there never ever ever
Advice to Management: get a better team overall

Title: "Pretty Good Company"
Pros: It was a great company to work for, and really taught me how to work hard. In jobs after this one, they often feel too relaxed and I feel like I should always be doing something lol
Cons: The work as well. It was strenuous to always have to be doing something, always be at the register before guests finish ordering, never have guests waiting,etc.
Advice to Management: The new general manager I had at my store was the reason I quit. He singled me out, definitely. Needed to be more friendly and have a better attitude.

Title: "Prep"
Pros: Good pay, free food and an easy / fun job if you have a good attitude.
Cons: Sometimes you can get some super uptight managers that switch up "policy" and don't tell their crew members. And as soon as the crew members breach it, they flip out at you like you knew better.
Advice to Management: Super annoyingly bias pay. You will never get a raise for working hard it's all personal preference. Don't try to trash college and make employees slaves to the company.

Title: "Not too bad...Good starter job"
Pros:
$9.50 is good pay for this was my first job so i had no experience
 Super chill and fun managers, at least at my location
1 free meal when you work and 1 half-off meal
everyone who works that day splits tips, this can be a pro or con but i said pro because you make like 30 extra dollars in tips every month
Cons:
The amount of work you do is not worth the pay, for crew members.
managers expect excellence during closing everything has to be spotless and done fast
so people who come are rude but you expected to never be rude even with disrespectful customers
you must call off two weeks early sometimes more or they wont let you off
no one ever wants to cover for you even if you do for them

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Fast paced and most customers are happy to be there. Pays a little above minimum wage.
Cons: No major cons, it is your typical low wage food service job.

Title: "Prep Cook"
Pros: Cool Co-workers to hang around with.
Cons: It's a job where you have to work and clock in.

Title: "great"
Pros: great work environment friendly workers
Cons: hard work, long hours, hot

Title: "Apprentice"
Pros: Chipotle Mexican Grill provides an excellent opportunity for young aspiring business leaders to learn the intricacies of running a business day to day through leading an empowered workforce to achieve company goals. Added benefit that they provide tuition reimbursement and management opportunities to any that apply themselves and crave knowledge, experience, and success.
Cons: Long work weeks if you do not cultivate people culture.

Title: "Good"
Pros: Some good coworkers, good company, free food & discounts, room for improvement & moving up in the company, breaks, very comfortable uniform, flexible hours
Cons: Fast paced, stressful, gossipy coworkers, some heavy lifting, extremely annoying customers, constant company changes and new regulations, long hours into the night or early in the morning but flexible
Advice to Management: help the people on cash & line during peak times to avoid them getting overly stressed out - that was the biggest reason I left the job

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great benefits. Great professionalism and standards.
Cons: Not enough hours. Very hard to get hours due to amount of employees.

Title: "Only 3 weeks in and it's terrible"
Pros: The pay is alright, free food, not super hard work
Cons: Don't expect your requests to be listened to. Just because your shift ends at a certain time or your GM has agreed to keep you off the schedule for certain days, it's worth less than salt.

Title: "chipotle"
Pros: pretty easy job that i like
Cons: boring job that i don't like
Advice to Management: none

Title: "So great! Work with awesome people, work under excellent people."
Pros: The environment is upbeat, and fast paced. They are always pushing you to do better, and the benefits, and promotions, will not be overlooked if you're a good worker
Cons: Definitely fast paced, can be hard to keep up with everything. But if you have good management, and a team that cares, it's awesome.
Advice to Management: Just keep in place the core values of hiring good people. When we get a sub-par person in here, it kills the vibe, and hurts the whole team.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Work with Great People! Opportunity to advance personal skills and personal development along with mastering team building and management skills
Cons: Very demanding job. You are expected to do a lot and perform high quality work which can be stressful.
Advice to Management: Work on a better plan for compensating workers; especially those at higher volume stores. These store are always the most demanding .

Title: "pay your dues to get to management"
Pros: opportunities to move up, money/benefits are fantastic once you get to salary, gratifying work, good overall people culture, free food, high cleanliness and food safety standards
Cons: high standards require complexity in execution, perfection is the expectation, poor work/life balance, long work days/ work weeks for managers
Advice to Management: Reduce complexities in food preparation, reduce manager work weeks/workdays, decision to expand menu is a mistake

Title: "Ugh!"
Pros: Pay was decent! Training was very easy!
Cons: I was hired on spot. Training took a week for learning how to work the tortilla machine. Racist Coworkers. Cliques.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Free food during your work schedule, nice co-workers, 50% discounts when you are not working
Cons: Low payment rate, poor training, too much work under high preassure...If u are lucky u get about 32 hours maximum as a full time!

Title: "Positive and easy interview"
Pros:
Great staff
Pays nicely
Keeps you busy
Opportunity to move up
Free food
You can wear jeans to work in (bless)
Cons: I have a twenty word minimum to fill, but there aren't any cons to working here. This is a great workplace.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work

Title: "INTERVIEW"
Pros: THE COMPANY ITSELF IS GREAT AND THERE IS ROOM TO GROW
Cons: The management kindof sucked because of the location i was at

Title: "chipotle"
Pros: good pay, lots of ability to move up in the company
Cons: unorganized, stressful, busy, lots of customers, customers are entitled and impatient.

Title: "Nothing is ever good enough"
Pros: the teams can be very close and create a strong bond and the food is always great
Cons: no matter how much you do nothing is ever good enough and it creates a sense of failure or disappointment. I've worked at 5 different locations from crew to GM and there is no overhead support or communication. Too much work for too little pay.
Advice to Management: either give regular honest reviews and training or don't promote people who aren't ready or lack the training.

Title: "Chipotle Mexican Grill"
Pros: Good pay, fun environment, good benefits.
Cons: Shifts can be a little bit excessive for a high school student working on a school night.
Advice to Management: Keep more professional relationships between yourself and coworkers - learn when to separate business and personal connections.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros:
Pay well
Good crew
Nice hours
Flexible

My store I work at is great with working with my schedule and was always very elevating, we go through the "chipotle process" and we are one of the best stores in the area.
Cons: Very picky and pushy and in my opinion everything surrounds restaurateur and theres nothing really that great for the crew members.

Title: "High pressure work environment food safety guidelines and great customer service through hands-on experience"
Pros: Higher base pay than minimum wage, 30 minute paid breaks, free entree on work days, half off one entree on non-work days, teaches great life skills, casual interview experience, friendly work environment
Cons: High pressure, steep learning curve, time management for minors, stressful lunch and dinner rushes, searches for specific innate attributes in interview
Advice to Management: Bring back the importance of being a top performer.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Pay is better than minimum wage, free meal every shift that you work lets you save money on food, company culture is supportive and promotes from within
Cons: Customers are often quite rude, which can make customer service difficult, lunch rushes are very long, tiring, and intense

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros:
free burritos
commitment to quality
Great pay
Cons: Management can be a little pushy

Title: "Its a job"
Pros: good hours and great advancement opportunities in company
Cons: stressfull days it feels never ending

Title: "Cashier/FOH"
Pros: free food, real food, made from scratch, cuts raw veggies and makes guac fresh, management inspired us
Cons: not enough pay for the amount of work, super busy no breaks (this depends on your location), a lot of relationships going on lowkey
Advice to Management: needs to promote more people and not just favorite workers, a lot of relationships within work space creates favoritism

Title: "Appentice"
Pros: The people there create a great energy to work there.
Cons: The higher up management changes what is required daily.

Title: "They sucked"
Pros: Free food, paid lunches, and good benefits.
Cons: Supervisor harassed workers and created an unhealthy work environment. HR had to get involved. Of course this was just at my chipotle, so working at a different one might be different.

Title: "Not the worst, but had massive flaws..."
Pros: Great coworkers, flexible hours and scheduling, hire high schoolers without experience (might be a con to some, but for a high schooler without experience it was a saving grace)
Cons:
I didn't realize until I got another job how dismissive and rude two of my managers were to the employees... Anytime I would ask a simple question (even when I was first hired) they would roll their eyes at me and scoff, and I felt bad for the tiniest mistakes. It was a very unhealthy environment.

The biggest flaw, and what puts it down to a 2 star review for me, is that one of my managers was literally a convicted sex offender who still works with minors. I was not made aware of this until 4 months after I had worked there and it was through the grapevine. It was ultimately the biggest reason why I quit. Simply put, someone who got convicted for underage pornography should not be in charge of minors.
Advice to Management: Do background checks before you hire managers and be more understanding.

Title: "Employment"
Pros: Works well with your scheduling.
Cons: Management needs to be worked on.

Title: "Overall, a great place to work as a student"
Pros: Wage combined with tips and employee meals make this a great choice for students. There is definitely room for growth for those who seek it, and the tuition reimbursement and credit hours are awesome.
Cons: As in most food-service jobs, the work becomes very repetitive and can often be quite tiresome. Some jobs (prep, grill) require considerably more effort than others (tortilla, salsa, cash) and pay the same unless if you are a takeout specialist. There is also very little realistic emphasis on the so-called "Chip talks"; crew is simply asked to sign, without having to watch any videos or really look at what they are supposed to in-depth.
Advice to Management: If you want to improve any aspect of the store, look at other stores that are doing better. Corporate isn't always right, but some of the information/tips/education that is provided could help improve one or more aspects of performance.

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Free meals, co workers/ management who cares, lots of hours
Cons: LOTS of cleaning plus all the cons of working in a restaurant

Title: "Cook"
Pros: Fun place to work at.
Cons: Fast paced and stressull sometimes.
Advice to Management: Pay employees more money at times.

Title: "Restaurateur"
Pros: Great benefits, free food, used to be great, can be fun, good people, great concept, high quality ingredients, decent pay, plenty of opportunity to grow
Cons: Poor training, poor leadership, lack of support, badbonus structure, business model hasn't evolved with the changes. Leadership unwilling to listen and see the changes that need to be made to business model and processes.
Advice to Management: Listen to your managers. They are in the trenches everyday and know what needs to happen. There's a reason you're getting sued every other day. People cheat the system to achieve results so labor issues are covered up by making people clock out and work, train off the clock, make fake credit requests to achieve results in food cost. The culture has become tainted and seeing people rewarded for cheating the system is disheartening and robs yourpassion.

Title: "Fast-paced!"
Pros: Friendly employees. It's like your very own family. Team work is awesome. Every body helps every body so thats a great thing .
Cons: None yet as I have just started and I hope that things stay this way & not change when I starting to grow deeper.
Advice to Management: None yet!

Title: "Horrible"
Pros:
Only pro- free food
Few workers are friendly, most just act way better then you
Free food.
Thats it. Nothing else
Cons:
Management sucks
Expect you to complete work in a certain time that's impossible to do
Work schedule sucks. They dont listen to days you want off.
Ridiculous amount of hours
No flexible scheduling!!!
Dont work here!
Advice to Management: Hire more people so we dont have to do the work of 4 people. Stop standing around on your phone and talking when we need help. Give us the schedule we want.

Title: "Don't do it!"
Pros: Your coworkers are the best part, they're what make it tolerable and fun. Free chipotle doesn't hurt either but you do get sick of it overtime. You'll learn how to deal with stress and maybe gain some knife skills.
Cons: low pay for all the work required, micromanaged constantly, held to impossible standards, always understaffed, working LONG hours, throwing people in positions with little to no training because we just don't have the people to teach them. If you're understaffed then it's absolute HELL. And upper management doesn't care at all. We'd have to open the store with as little as 3 people some days.
Advice to Management: don't run your employees ragged, or at least pay them well if you're going to give them so much work

Title: "Great Work"
Pros: Its great if you want to gain mroe customer service expierence and move up. They are always looking for people who want to move up in the business and deliver great customer service.
Cons: Not alot of hours given during the week
Advice to Management: Give more hours to great crew memebers

Title: "Chipotle rocks"
Pros: Great team. Competitive yet encouraging. Fun. Exciting. Never a dull day. Friends for life.
Cons: Crazy hours. Busy days. Needs more benefits for crew members, not just managers and other high ups

Title: "Great place, thou it depends on where you are"
Pros:
- great food
- great working experience (depending on location)
- great place to just help you progress as a person.
Cons:
- none so far.
- benefits comes after working for a year.
Advice to Management: talk to management.

Title: "Overall easy"
Pros:
*Free food while working
*50% off while not working
*Coworkers are usually nice
*They will work with your schedule if you're in school or have another job.
*They offer good benefits if you plan on staying there full time.
Cons:
*Super fast pace
*During peak hour there is extreme pressure on tortilla
*You need to be constantly doing something, never just standing in one place
*If you're new and working on tortilla your coworkers will get mad if you aren't fast enough
Advice to Management: Maybe give new people a little more time to pick up their speed. If you're going to have someone train a new person, make sure that they are one of, if not THE best person at that station because that could make or break that new employee. It isn't the new employee's fault if they were trained badly.

Title: "Throw you to the wolves"
Pros: The team was high energy and seemed to enjoy the work
Cons: Measuring portions was a hot button issue and you kind of have to (try to) learn on the fly during the insane rush of customers and then get yelled at in front of said customers when you measure too much for a portion
Advice to Management: Chill out

Title: "Apprentice"
Pros: Culture, People, Business Fundamentals, Experience
Cons: Salary, expectation, Customer Base.

Title: "Don't recommend that much"
Pros:
You get tips
You get to experience customer service
Co workers are okay
Free food
Employee 50% discount
Payed break
Cons:
Fast paced
Rude customers all the time
Managers have favorites
Online ordering
You get super long lines during lunch time
Advice to Management: Get better management

Title: "crew member"
Pros: Friendly coworkers, tuition reimbursement, flexible hours, a lot of room to grow
Cons: you receive low hours and it takes a long time to get a raise
Advice to Management: listen to the crew members more often

Title: "ONE OF THE BEST FAST FOOD PLACES TO WORK AT"
Pros: Easy to move up if you tried hard enough in the job. Every time you worked, you got a free meal. The breaks were also paid for which was nice. Work was always something different but also challenging and exciting. The company really is pushing for healthy fast food which I liked a lot.
Cons: Favoritism was shown in the location I was working at. The pay could of been better for how hard I was working.

Title: "Fun environment"
Pros: Love the team environment and past-paced nature of work. There is ALWAYS something to do so you're never bored.
Cons: Fast-paced jobs inevitably can be stressful at times. I also feel we should be paid above minimum wage for how intense working there can be.
Advice to Management: There seems to be little time for proper training due to the fact that we are constantly busy, so learning from experience takes a bit longer than if we got more feedback and correction

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Wonderful team members, environment conducive to teamwork, free lunch
Cons: Unrealistic time expectations, high pressure, exhausting

Title: "apprentice"
Pros: lots of great experience running a business and working with great people
Cons: poor compensation, they take advantage of you being salaried and try to work you 60+ hours.
Advice to Management: Please pay your people more, or promote sooner. If they are doing the job of a manager, they should be paid for it. This company makes a habit of making its employees work double for the same pay.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Working with amazing people if you hire correctly.
Cons: They have completely lost their way, dollar sign is all that matters to this company. Zero loyalty or appreciation but they will pay well.
Advice to Management: Do not expect to be treated as a person you are a part of their plan only if you do successful

Title: "One of the Hardest and Best Work Experiences of My Life"
Pros: At Chipotle, you don't just work with a team of top performers, with high standards, to create a unique extraordinary experience, your team becomes your family. Chipotle really looks for hard working people who want to go that extra mile. They offer you benefits, and really do care about their employees. Never have i worked in an environment quite like this. This company changes lives, it changed mine!
Cons: The interview is probably one of the toughest interviews i've ever had to get through. My advice is to be prepared and have some knowledge about the company. Be prepared to go above and beyond for your store at times, they really like when you go the extra mile (ex. high dusting, cleaning toilets, fixing things that are broken,etc.). If you choose, you can move up but you really need to prove that you want it and you can go far. Be prepared to memorize some stuff like your in school in case someone higher up comes in for restauranteur such as what is a top performer? what are high standards? and what is empowerment? I always had a hard time memorizing everything because it was a lot and it was overwhelming. In a way i didn't think it was necessary and they didn't pay me enough to do that. It depends on how your store your hired at, but the one i worked at seemed like some of the crew had their click of people they were close to. I would feel left out at times in the conversations and my manager and a bunch of workers would sometimes go into the office and shut the door and talk for hours about who knows what. I did not like that at all. Make sure you have a great attitude in the interview as well they look for that too.
Advice to Management: If at all possible, work on creating an environment for employees to be as one instead of divided and there should be rule of everyone working on a shift not gathering in the office and shutting the door and talking about a bunch of nonsense. Leaving one employee on the line handling the line is no fun.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Good hourly pay, free meals while working, co-workers are usually friendly and pleasant to work with. Short or long shifts, just depends
Cons: Hard to move up in management, workers tend not to help each other out, never schedule enough people to work during extremely heavy rush times, you will probably never get out of work at the exact time you're suppose to. Favoritism to certain employees
Advice to Management: Do not hire 20 people for the summer and give each worker 10 hours, especially if they're use to working 20+ hours the rest of the year. Also respect each employee and make sure you hold KMIT/SMs accountable also.

Title: "it's a CULTure"
Pros:
free food on shift
school tuition scholarship
promotions quickly
empowering positions
good hours
Cons:
not very regulated in procedures
long hours
stressfull when busy
Advice to Management: stop playing politics

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Communication, benefits,good hours,good work environment
Cons: Not enough pay, parking,long time to get raise

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: flexible, fun, fast paced, good food
Cons: kids managing kids, policies change weekly

Title: "crew member"
Pros: free food on break is great
Cons: very strict, low pay for what you do

Title: "great team of people. not hard work but very demanding work"
Pros: the crew members are great, free food when you work, customers are nice, the work can be very satisfying at times
Cons: demanding work, management doesn’t care about you as much as they want you to think, not paid enough for the amount of work you do
Advice to Management: higher up management needs to care about individual stores and actually help when needed instead of putting incredible workload on crew

Title: "cashier"
Pros: eating lunch and a great manager
Cons: rude customers and silly procedures

Title: "Cook"
Pros: Great working environment, good pay, friendly staff
Cons: Great place to work no cons
Advice to Management: Be more lenient with the schedule

Title: "its not worth it"
Pros: chipotle as a whole is a great company to work with, just not in savannah...
Cons: Do not work at any savannah location. The field leaders are terrible and the pay sucks. Some crew members are getting paid just as much as some management to do nothing, while regular crew members have the same job and get paid less. in addition, this area is completely short on managers, yet the pay is not rising and field leaders are trying to overwork the current management teams there
Advice to Management: get out while you still can

Title: "A decent entry level job"
Pros:
Great Benefits
Awesome coworkers and managers
Decent pay for fast food
Fast pace work environment
Tuition rembursment
Cons:
Work/life balance can be a struggle when the school year starts
Closing shifts can be long during the school year

Title: "OH H NAW"
Pros: Free food and drinks, easy to get into Management,and a great work environment, and you are constantly pushed to be great
Cons: if you got a busy store your screwed ,
Advice to Management: Be tough from the get go, dont let the crew do whatever they want and become lazy

Title: "Chipotle was terrible for me"
Pros: Free food everytime you work
Cons: depends on what store but the store I worked at everything else was a con . rude customers. you'll get horrible or little to no hours if management doesn't like you. training is all over the place. lots of favoritism. culture and values don't apply to mangers. great amount of work with very little pay. very unprofessional

Title: "Management? Yes. Leadership? NO."
Pros:
* Great co-workers
* Generous customers
* Good food
* Meet police officers and military veterans. Great conversations!
Cons:
* Management talks behind workers' backs, BESIDE their other co-workers. As if there is not enough stress? What "empowerment". If employees knew what was being said about them, there would be more problems. Asked management if there were any complaints against me. The answer was silence, and then a snarky, "Why?"
* Co-workers complain how their hours were cut drastically.
* This store has had poor reviews in the past.
* Does not care about military veterans. Dismisses them. Not even a "thank you", more concerned about their money.
* Pay is not a good compensation for the amount of stressful work. $.50 every 6 months. In addition to making people sick these past few years.
* Tasks are not meant for creativity, they are routine and mundane. People with personality are hired for jobs without room for expressing such. Basically, you're a "production line", to put it in actual stated words.
* With the over-hiring, you're essentially a number.
* If you have health care you currently like, don't join. Corporate will throw a plan down your throat without announcing and refuse to cancel, basically costing you money to work. Even if you don't sign any contract for a plan.
Advice to Management: Over-hiring = low retention

Title: "Decent Place, Random Work Schedule"
Pros:
They have great benefits if you stay for a year
You can get insurance once you are hired
Friendly staff in most places
Cons:
There work schedule is not consistent
There is little consistency in food preparation

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Good team atmosphere at the restaurant
Cons: A lot of work is expected
Advice to Management: Be more flexible

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros:
- Great atmosphere
- Free food when working and 1/2 off any other day
- Health benefits
- School assistance and reimbursement
- Flexible hours
Cons: - Have to wait a year until tuition assistance or reimbursement
Advice to Management:
- Be accountable with crew members
- Make Chip Talks a priority for every shift

Title: "Makes you realize lots about life"
Pros: Free food, great experiences, makes you work for your money. Very friendly workers and know how to have fun and enjoy your day
Cons: Lots of work for 9 an hour starting, very demanding sometimes and smelling like a burrito all day. Finishing late after closing and waking up early to prep all morning
Advice to Management: Pay raise for the amount of work and those who deserve it

Title: "Team Crew"
Pros: Customers were great at location.
Cons: Some of the Management disrespected the staff a lot. Management would not train staff, they allow staff to train each other.
Advice to Management: Treat people like you want to be treated. Management should always train there staff.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Benefits, food, corporate vision, goals
Cons: Management sometimes forgets that the crew is the key to a successful store.
Advice to Management: Your customers don't care about the restaurateur program. Your crew and lower level managers are the key to success. If they love you, they will perform, but you have to treat them properly.

Title: "Its tough working here"
Pros: There really isn't a lot of pros working here. Maybe if you like to cook, but even then you don't actually cook. The food is all organic which is sweet.
Cons: Minimum wage for a lot of intense work, and the company tries to suck every bit out of you while you are at work.
Advice to Management: PAY YOUR EMPLOYEES BETTER. This place is too much for minimum wage.

Title: "Work hard for minimum wage"
Pros:
Opportunities to advance in the company and reviews that actually lead to better pay
Good staff that actually values/enforces teamwork
Cons:
Low pay for a lot of work
No compensation for extra work
Cult like when trying to cultivate company loyalty

Title: "Meh"
Pros: The staff is really nice. The store is small, about half-sized of a regular Chipotle so you don't have to clean bathrooms and you don't have a separate takeout line. Sometimes with a full staff, it can feel really crowded. The people who work there really make the job.
Cons: The customers are literally the rudest people on the planet. I have never been so disrespected in my life.
Advice to Management: I don't even know what to say. The management has nothing to do with the customers, it's just the location.

Title: "okay job"
Pros:
-Free meal
-a chance to promotion
-flexibility
-tuition reimbursement
Cons:
-hard work, little pay
-managers extremely hard and are sometimes underqualified
-workers get frustrated with corporate
Advice to Management: more training and better communication with corporate

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Crew members (at my location) were awesome, and management really wanted people to excel and improve.
Cons: Pay was alright for the job it was, but could have been better.
Advice to Management: Upper management should think about budgeting more for workers' wages.

Title: "Just a review for chipotle"
Pros: Nice people, busy environment, great training
Cons: The are no cons of working here
Advice to Management: No advice needed

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Free meals incentive people to work shifts that would otherwise be undesirable. Also, is a fashionable place to work.
Cons: Horrible management and job security
Advice to Management: Promote stability instead of rapid growth

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Some of the Pros about working at Chipotle, is that we have a really good team, hardworking, working together, and the environment is positive
Cons: Some of the cons about Chipotle, is sometimes we can have rude customers but we get through it
Advice to Management: Have fun and work hard, it gets you further in life and love what you do

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Free food when working. Some of my co workers were friendly to work with.
Cons: The work schedule was all over the place. I wanted to be part time, but they would still give me full-time shifts. It seemed like the manager would not listen to any of us and just did their own thing. After I left my ex-coworker told me the manager was fired and that the new manager is worse than the last one and gives attitude to them. We need to be empowering and lifting the team to make the store run smoothly, I don't get why my area doesn't seem to comprehend that.
Advice to Management: The area managers need to make sure the members they are promoting to management are actually there for the company as well as making sure their crew is happy. They shouldn't be having students miss or be late to class because they "forgot" they had class during that time, not bother to switch the schedule and make the employee stress about not finding a replacement.

Title: "Hostess/ assistant manager"
Pros: It's full time and always hiring
Cons: Very slow on advancement

Title: "Not a bad place to work."
Pros: Free meal per shift (literally anything you want) and the food never gets old.
Cons: Work can be high stress at times, especially if you run out of something and have a line of customers who are waiting.
Advice to Management: Work on training your crew members to be faster and more efficient, especially on the line. There were lot of people who were not well trained and slowed the line down as a result. It seems like there was a lack of motivation to improve.

Title: "Tooo many Indians thinking they are Chiefs."
Pros: Interesting customers, free food, cooking skills, knife skills, the dress code.
Cons: Everybody thinks they are a manager. And it's mostly ran by kids. No mature business minded management there.
Advice to Management: Get it together.

Title: "Great Job Potential"
Pros: You receive free lunch on your break of either 10 or 30 minutes depending on the length of your shift.
Cons: Coworkers talk about you in Spanish. Not necessarily saying bad things, but they make comments about you to coworkers and/or management yet they never say anything to you directly.
Advice to Management:
Make sure all of your employees are thoroughly trained and not made to look like fools.

It would be nice to make sure all of your employees feel comfortable and welcomed.

Title: "Good atmosphere"
Pros: Good pay. Fast paced. Fun environment. Team work.
Cons: A lot of teenaged kids who don't appreciate a job. Maybe not getting a good job and company.
Advice to Management: Offer incentive to motivate employees to work hard.

Title: "Ok work place"
Pros: Schedule was good. Loved the people I worked with.
Cons: The Pay was not great.

Title: "Good"
Pros: Friendly work environment and providing healthy options for consumers.
Cons: There weren't any cons working here.

Title: "Okay for gaining experience/starting a career"
Pros:
Free meals
Gain lots of experience
Tons of advancement opportunities
Cons:
Not great for long term work if you don't want to advance
Management pushes to promote you to become management, which doesn't work if you're a full time college student unable to work 80+ hours a week.
You're pushed to "empower" others to help Chipotle grow but then get scolded for pointing out problems like food being in the sanitation water (food shouldn't get that far. It's all supposed to be washed off before you even rinse the soap off)
Management only cares about being a "Restaurateur". Will do anything and everything to get it.
Advice to Management: If you just do what you're supposed to do instead of constantly focusing on weaknesses and neglecting strong areas so much they become weaknesses, you'll stop being in the deadly cycle and maybe you'll actually become Restaurateur.

Title: "Company Review"
Pros: The people you work with are awesome. Free food and downtimes are great.
Cons: The managers are pretty young, and don't act mature enough when dealing with certain issues within the store.
Advice to Management: Make sure that younger managers are mature enough to handle certain situations.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: I don't know exactly what to say here because I didn't stay long but there is a great pay and everyone is friendly
Cons: I can't really think of any cons to put here. I liked the job a lot
Advice to Management: Don't have any.

Title: "Former Employee"
Pros: Free Food! Fast paced environment
Cons: Overworked. Not enough employees for the work entailed
Advice to Management: Hire more folks! Be realistic with standards

Title: "Great"
Pros: Great employee discounts, flexible hours, great benefits.
Cons: Management was unprofessional at times.

Title: "Great coworkers, bad upper managment"
Pros: Chipotle allows you to have dyed hair, tattoos, and piercings as long as you work hard. They don't care what you look like as long as you present yourself as a hard worker and come to the store clean and groomed. The coworkers are always amazing and there is a huge sense of teamwork. They're good at creating the sense that this job is more than just a paycheck. They have amazing career opportunities. (if you can get that far.) They also offer eye care, health insurance, and dental.
Cons: The work life balance is terrible. Everyone's life gets consumed and it becomes all you can think about.

Title: "First Job"
Pros: Free food, pay is good compared to other places like Taco Bell or Burger King, and paid breaks
