Cons: Long hours, never leaving at designated time, and not trained enough
Advice to Management: They should be trained well enough to train crew member

Title: "Slave Work-But Great Opportunities"
Pros: Chipotle is a great place to go if you want to grow into a management position quickly.
Cons: Chipotle requires that you give your blood, sweat, tears, and soul to them in exchange for promotions.
Advice to Management: Get your people culture back. Stop letting your managers do crew work and stop being cheap! Spend more money on labor and less money on marketing.

Title: "Really good people but the work is a lot"
Pros: If you work a shift that day you could have a free meal and there is a discount you have on days you don't work
Cons: Always busy and can fall behind on tasks easily. Never too much free time and always given new tasks to do when not doing anything
Advice to Management: Pay more because the amount done is ridiculous

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Staff is family and works hard together
Cons: Work is very rigorous and hard

Title: "You're Hired Based on Your Personality"
Pros: Free food, 90% college tuition reimbursement, easy career growth, and social atmosphere.
Cons: A lot of the restaurants are discriminatory against non-Hispanics.
Advice to Management: Training could be better.

Title: "Team"
Pros: Conditions one to learn teamwork, detailing, and hard work.
Cons: The environment is pretty petty. Middle-aged workers engage in tattle-tailing because they think it will help them get promoted.
Advice to Management: Be smarter about who is being hired.

Title: "Welcome to Chipotle"
Pros: Consistent hardworking elevate everyone
Cons: Hardworking elevating everyone young crew only cared about hard work if it didn't inter with life style
Advice to Management: When t b email entire crew is under 21 and they all want to party.

Title: "crew memeber"
Pros: good schedule and ver clean workspace
Cons: not any really but maybe more tables and choices
Advice to Management: Have more options on the line

Title: "Great job"
Pros: Excellent work place for someone right out of high school looking for growth in a part-time job. They have high standards and really teach employees great customer service and teamwork skills.
Cons: You need to know everything about the company and will be quizzed on the information sometimes (this isn't really a con- employees should know about the place they work at!!).

Title: "Loved it. It took a while to learn my first position, bit after that I mastered the other with little difficulty"
Pros: The pay is good and you get a free meal plus 50% off
Cons: Its more so the customers than the actual employees. We have to be fast. You'll have to learn to be very fast

Title: "Great place to be, if your willing to put forth the effort"
Pros:
We get to split tips at the end of the night.
We get paid to eat a 30 minute lunch break.
The people you work with are like family
Cons:
It's hard work, especially if your store wants to achieve restauranter.
stressful when you're not properly set up
Advice to Management: Become closer with your teammates, and learn how you can achieve the best top performers.

Title: "Excellent"
Pros: The People I worked with
Cons: The work I had to do

Title: "Clean environment"
Pros: Fun serving the foods and stiff
Cons: Work you have to be active
Advice to Management: Work do not be lazy

Title: "Line Worker"
Pros: Food was free during breaks and discounts were good.
Cons: Unrealistic expectations regarding multi tasking.

Title: "Fast Paced Food Service"
Pros: The culture that Chipotle promotes has a focus on personal responsibility and kindness, and the people they hire generally fall into three categories: those who are already responsible, those who become responsible quickly, and those who wash out in a couple weeks.
Cons: As in most food service jobs, one is often required to acquiesce to absurd demands made by customers and put up with terrible attitudes with no protest. This is common across fast food, but seems particularly concentrated at Chipotle.

Title: "Not The Best"
Pros: Amazing hours. Friendly coworkers. Get to eat free food and take some home. Get to a free meal for break.
Cons: Horrible management. Despicable training system. I was new and was getting yelled at the second day. The customers are horrendous and have hideous attitudes. This is customer service so what do you expect
Advice to Management: Do better job at training new employees. Better communication among each other. Better scheduling.

Title: "Fun, hard work"
Pros: Fast paced, steady work, friendly coworkers
Cons: I wasn't paid for my work, and when I called the manager to get it figured out he yelled at me and hung up.
Advice to Management: Pay attention to payroll, an employee should never quit because they weren't paid, and management should never hang up on an employee.

Title: "Decent minimum-wage gig"
Pros: I appreciated being able to work for a company that, at least in terms of the fast food industry, is generally fairly ethical. My store took the 13 core values very seriously and we were always reminding each other about the Chipotle Mission. While this can get annoying on an 8-hour shift, it was nice knowing that the company mission was genuine and that my coworkers were invested.
Cons: The management at my store was a really mixed bag. My bosses/managers were, for the most part, very kind and supportive people. However, my schedule might change at a moment's notice (I would often come in for a 4-hour shift to find that it had been switched to an 8-hour shift without my knowledge), and often weekly schedules were late coming out. I was also eventually working the max number of hours that they could keep me on as "part time," (about 34-36 per week), and while I didn't need the benefits of full-time employment I could see this being an issue for others.
Advice to Management: I don't know what corporate management could do about this, but store managers: please stick to the schedules. It's unfair to have to cancel plans that you made around your work schedule because your work schedule changed at the last minute.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: Great enviroment to work in and love meeting new people and the workers you build a great bond with them also your manager its like a little family in the work place and i would recommend people to come aboard for a job any day you will love it as i do.
Cons: I really dont have anything bad to say about this company

Title: "Great First Job"
Pros: i learned a ton about the food industry, got free meals, friendly coworkers
Cons: schedule conflicts, managers were always stressed about losing money
Advice to Management: spend more time making schedules

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Team Environment, clear objectives, company sticks to its beliefs, upper management is always helpful
Cons: Hard work, unpredictable schedule
Advice to Management: Empower lower management to work with the teams for more consistent schedules

Title: "Cook"
Pros:
Benefits
Great training
Many promotion opportunities
Competitive pay
Cons: Great place to work, do not have negative remarks at his time

Title: "Restaurant Team Member"
Pros: Great pay for a fast food job, very easy to get a position, interview process is simple (especially for a new opening) most people you work with are nice, easy to move up in the company
Cons: Seems like you can only work full time because of the hours you have, management can be annoying as in they want you to smile all the time, be fast paced, but no mercy
Advice to Management: Really listen to your workers sometimes. If you want full time workers then let them know because some of us want to go to college after and it makes it hard.

Title: ""Loved my experience.""
Pros:
- You meet great people and truly learn how to be a part of a team
- Of course, the free meals any time you're scheduled to work and the 50% discount at the store you work at on your off days (I promise, if you take advantage of this benefit as much as I did, you will hate the food after a while)
- If you stay there for a year, you are eligible for tuition reimbursement, so if you are in school or have a desire to go back to school, this works for you
- The pay is better than what you'd probably get at any other fast food business
-They'll train you on anything that you desire, so you'll learn how the store operates; this advantage can also lead to quicker promotions (especially if you're a top performer)
-The fact that there are plenty of advancement opportunities
Cons:
-Strict on sick/absence policy (they will fire you if you don't follow protocol)
-Various changes (this only happens if you work at a low-performing store)
-Some managers play favorites (also depends on the store you work at and if you're a top/low performer; didn't happen at my main store, but when I went to visit other stores, I could see it, clearly)
-Can be demanding at times if your store is understaffed; however, you'll quickly learn how to manage things after this happens a couple of times
Advice to Management: Continue to instill values in all of the employees throughout the company. However, learn when to step in and help an employee when you see them struggle.

Title: "Can't take the heat, don't work in the kitchen"
Pros:
Easy advancement up to GM
Free meal on shift
Generally good training
I can't think of any other pros but Glassdoor has a 20 word minimum.
Cons:
Corporate often prioritizes middle managers over the crew and manager actually at the restaurant
Long hours
Little support from upper management
Advice to Management: Support the people actually in the store. I've seen so many GMs develops health problems because of the stress they were under from area managers trying to pad their numbers. Requiring Gms and apprentices to work 50+ hours for a 30-40k salary is ridiculous. Many will end up making less per hour than hourly managers.

Title: "Great people but disorganized"
Pros:
Great coworkers
Free food when working
Cons:
Training was disorganized and expectations were not always made clear

Understaffed
Advice to Management: Need better communication between other managers and crew.

Title: "Terrible"
Pros: Its good food and great customers.
Cons: Too much to be done in so little time. expects to be wonder woman when it comes to closing. Over looks EVERYTHING, and doesnt give a fair chance.
Advice to Management: Stop overworking your employees and just hire more staff for closing. Giving a 2 person job to one person its absolutely ridiculous.

Title: "crew member"
Pros: They offer 1 free lunch per shift. you can also get 50% off purchases. They also pay for your lunch breaks.
Cons: Theres no consistency. Hours fluctuate constantly and the environment is toxic. Promotions take forever and the standards have fallen tremendously.
Advice to Management: Be more organized. Hire older experienced qualified individuals for the title of managers.

Title: "restaurant crew"
Pros: free food and 50% discount
Cons: not 40 hours every week

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Young and ambitious group of coworkers
Cons: Misunderstandings and lack of leadership
Advice to Management: Lack of leadership can create mistrust and no direction for team members

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Free meal, often poorly made but tastes good.
Cons: Not enough pay for what they ask, very stressful, hard work, takes skill, and my manager screwed me over when they let me go.

Title: "Not Worth It"
Pros: Advancement opportunities, benefits, tuition reimbursement possible
Cons: Poor management, late scheduling, non flexible
Advice to Management:
Ok, sorry this is going to be long. I was hired at Chipotle by the GM (at that time, she eventually was fired because a bitter former employee told corporate that she was making people work off the clock). Once she was fired, the apprentice was moved up to the GM position when they were NOT ready, instead of Chipotle finding someone qualified to take the position. The apprentice at the time was only apprentice for a few months, and although they had worked their way up from Crew, they still had a lot to learn about managing people. Once this person took the GM position, things went left.

I can only REALLY speak on experiences from my store, but it is my understanding that MOST Chipotle's in college towns don't give a crap when you have class, or another job, or really any other responsibilities. If they put you on schedule, even if it was their mistake and you aren't available, it is your problem. If you requested off 4-5 weeks in advance and they accidentally schedule you- oop! Oh well! Better find someone to cover or you're in trouble! Also... they do not care how many hours you request to work. If you're a student be VERY specific about how many hours you want, and even then there's no guarantee that will be respected.

There's no telling when you'll get breaks, especially if the store's busy. There are times where no one went on break until the store literally closed, and by that time you just want to hurry up and finish your work so you can get the hell out of there! That's a 9-10 hour shift with no food or break. If you're on a "short shift" such as 4-9:30 you better believe you're not getting a break even if the law says you're supposed to after 5 hours of work.

Also, no matter what shift you're scheduled for (7:30am-3:30pm or 3:30pm-11:30pm) you're NOT getting off when the schedule says you will. So, if you're the type of person that can't handle working all night then getting up early for class, DON'T close.

In my opinion, Chipotle asks way too much of employees, and management treats these employees very poorly. Even though the pay is over minimum wage, and personally I received a raise even above that, I didn't feel it was worth the things I was put through by management. There's a tuition reimbursement program that offers up to $5200 every year that you work if you're enrolled in school. I kept pestering my managers about this when finally one day they told me I missed the "deadline" that I'd been asking about for weeks... I was miserable. $5000 extra for a college student is like winning the lottery... or really for anyone having that extra money would be extremely nice. When I finally decided to quit, I was told I'm "dumb" for going to college because I will be in debt anyways. I was also told by my GM and another manager that they "make more money in a year than I ever will with my degree" - LOL. Considering they spend 60-70 hours a week rolling burritos I'm pretty sure my salary will be nicer and require a lot less crappy work. Chipotle needs to not turn the other cheek anymore with all the complaints employees put out about management...there are countless reviews just like this one, so please don't take this as a bitter ex employee review. I loved working at Chipotle because of my coworkers despite the crap we went through, but after losing out on 5 grand because my managers were angry towards students for no reason I decided I had to leave for my sanity.

Title: "I would not recommend this position."
Pros: Working at Chipotle has its benefits. You get free food and a good team to work with. Management can be kind as well.
Cons: Working as closing prep was an absolute nightmare. If you work a 8 hour shift, your washing dishes by yourself for 6 of those hours. If you want to train in another position, good luck.

Title: "former crew member enjoyed time"
Pros: its a great place to work
Cons: none from my experience working

Title: "A place to work"
Pros: The pay is okay, but watch out for back stabbing managers
Cons:
No overtime pay
No free uniforms
So so managers

Title: "Hard work sometimes rewarding, often unnoticed"
Pros: High energy environment, teamwork oriented
Cons: Exhausting at times, refused to cut my hours when I was 16

Title: "It was ok"
Pros: Fast and Fun, very entertaining
Cons: Coworkers were annoying and very clique like.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Great pay, comes with hard work
Cons: A lot of turn-overs due to lack of great training.

Title: "Be prepared to be burnt out"
Pros: Okay pay, tips, lots of hours, free meal
Cons:
Break musr be taken when mangers tell you too its usually a half hour to hour intil your shift, too much work for too little money, alot of micromanaging, horrible life work balence. Minors are very often taken advantage off. Also parents of teens, unless your kid needs to know thw value off good hard work, dont let them work here. I have seem some very bright kids eventually drop out if school to become managers here.
They will burn you out and replace you. $9 an hour plus tips is nice but thete r other places that offer similar and not better salaries.
Yes you do learn to work hard but I would be careful.
Advice to Management: Stop micromanaging and give realistic time goals also make sure your managers are trained about what you can and cant do. Also stop hiring so many friends of the crew members and also managers shouldnt fratinize with crew members and even shift leaders. Its unprofessional. Also stop letting children rum these stores

Title: "Bad management"
Pros: Free bowls, free bowls, free bowls, free bowls, bowls
Cons: Clueless managers, rude customers,
Advice to Management: Stop hiring young people

Title: "over worked"
Pros: free food, cool people, good experience
Cons: terrible upper management, harrassment, forced to work overtime and not get paid for it.
Advice to Management: treat your employees with respect.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: It was a fun experience
Cons: It can get hot if working the tortilla line.

Title: "Hard work but good place to start"
Pros: What you put in is what you get out of it. If you're really dedicated and put in the effort and time, you will move up. The best part is working with the other crew members which can sometimes be fun. They work around your schedule.
Cons: It's physically challenging more than anything. You're on your feet and constantly moving around. Expect cuts and burns if you're not careful. There's a proper way to do EVERYTHING.

Title: "Crew/Line Member"
Pros: Fast pace, great staff, flexible scheduling, opportunity for growth
Cons: A lot of prep work in short amount of time.
Advice to Management: More nurturing of Apprentice

Title: "Its probably on a manager basis"
Pros: I hadn't even started so I can't list pros
Cons: The manager only communicated via text, and my phone did not recieve those texts, so I could not reply. Rather than emailing or calling, he assumed I had turned down the job (despite submitting my W-2 and I-9 in the employee site) and terminated me without any communication. It was probably just the location I was hired at, but it shows how low expectations are for managers.
Advice to Management: Try harder to communicate, and hire managers that actually put effort into communicating

Title: "Great Culture"
Pros: When Chipotle says "food with integrity", they mean it. I loved working for this company but I think part of the reason was that the management worked very hard to live the culture. I worked at a Restaurateur location and I feel that made the world of a difference. The environment allowed us all to be ourselves, create friendships, yet still work hard.
Cons: The prep or grill positions are by far the hardest. Whenever I did prep I was definitely worked. Our store sold quite a bit everyday so there were great amounts to prep on a daily basis. It would be nice if we had gotten some of the more advanced equipment to work with.

Title: "Carpel Tunnel and Crippling Anxiety"
Pros: Benefits, nice coworkers, above minimum wage.
Cons: Carpel tunnel, like a cult, try as hard as you can and nobody will recognize your achievements.

Title: "Crew Morale"
Pros: Good pay, plus crew members get tips.
Cons: Management unaware of morale of store.
Advice to Management: Listen to your employees, specifically what they talk about, and how, to see where your morale is low, and why.

Title: "Line Cook"
Pros: The free food is definitely a plus. i enjoyed having good coworkers and the environment was pretty friendly.
Cons: There really isn't much room for professional development within the company. Being worked to the bone and not being paid adequately.
Advice to Management: I would recommend treating your employees better or at least increasing pay for the positions that you're hiring for that aren't management.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Working at my particular store was great due to the people that worked both alongside me and above me. My team of managers were very helpful with any issues that i had.
Cons: Any majors cons of the position are due to the industry in which it resides. Dealing with customers can sometimes be unpleasant, and workload can fluctuate tremendously.
Advice to Management: Continue to encourage hard work, promoting from within is a great method to do so. Try to find ways to keep team members motivated in both times of work and boredom.

Title: "A day in the life of a burrito roller."
Pros: Working at chipotle can be a great enviornment to work in. You will learn a lot working here. I love to interact with customers and I made great friends among the crew. I have favorite managers who are now great friends but also help improve my work skills.
Cons: The managers do not help close and do not know about respect. I usually leave the store around 11 p.m. because I am doing everyone else job to help close. I was also thrown on cash for the first time and did not feel comfortable handling cash without proper training.
Advice to Management: Some of the managers are very disrespectful and need to be toned-down.

Title: "Company Reviews"
Pros: After reviewing about the company, it seems like it's a great place to work at. I've learned quite a lot from reading the reviews from former/current employees. Who are willing to provide a helpful and positive feedback about the company. Which also allows those who are currently preparing for an interview to be able to get a bettee understanding of the company. Workers are friendly and helpful.
Cons: Grill preparation is the hardest position.

Title: "Overwhelming amount of work but fun with great benefits and pay."
Pros:
Benefits (health, dental & - insurance)
Pay higher than min wage
Tips
Great ethics and emphasis on team work
Thorough training
Paid breaks
Free food when working, 50% off when not working
At my location, great managers and co-workers
Programs that help with school and work shoe costs
Cons:
Probably too much work for one person
Must work very fast and efficiently
Overwhelming at times
High expectations
No discounts for family/ friends
On your feet all day rushing around to get things done
Takes a long time to work your way up
Advice to Management:
Spread the work out a little more across more employees
Family/ friends discount

Title: "kitchen manager"
Pros: Free food, people, knife skills
Cons: Pay, management, grill, the people culture is fake.
Advice to Management: Pay your grill cooks more.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Flexible hours, decent pay, room for pay improvement, tuition reimbursement
Cons: tiring work, long hours, low starting pay

Title: "Chipotle Employee"
Pros: Awesome people to work with. The best part about the job is that Chipotle only hires outgoing social people. Everything is a team environment there and there is plenty of opportunity to learn new things everyday.
Cons: It is hard work. Sometimes I have burned myself. You are always on your feet. But some people like this type of work as it makes the day go by faster.
Advice to Management: While working there for me was an overall beneficial experience, the work put in at the job was not worth the pay. If you can accept that you will be working very hard everyday, than the pay is fine, and it is a fun job with the people that work there.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros:
Great opportunity to lead people
Being a manager at chipotle looks good on resumé because of how much they focus on PnL
Very family like atmosphere which allows you to build your people skills
Cons:
A lot of work and even more responsibility for not enough pay; unpaid hours for "salary" managers
Also sometimes I feel like upper management tends to look down on us.
Advice to Management: Don't assume we're all idiots because we didn't finish college. It was just too expensive for some of us.

Title: "Be prepared"
Pros: pay was decent. $10.50 an hour. My crew was very nice as well.
Cons: Managers are biased and will protect their favorite employees. A lot of backstage politics in my old work site.
Advice to Management: Treat everyone the same, we are all humans.

Title: "Pay scale problems, but rewarding."
Pros:
Co workers and Co managers are like a family to me, and my job has provided me with cooking and management skills that I can use for the rest of my food career.

Promotions are given to those who want them
Cons:
The amount of work that you have to do for certain positions (back of house) versus the amount of work for other positions like Tortilla, Salsa, or Expo is extremely skewed. Having worked all positions, that is firmly what I believe. Every crew member gets paid the same give or take the 6-month raises Chipotle provides. This creates low incentive to want to progress towards promotions and management, as it is generally required to know the back of house positions well to become a Kitchen Manager.

Always changing procedures and guidelines.

Also, since the end of the unique team based culture, the upper management style is now more akin to a typical corporate restaurant. We get frequent changes, which are difficult to implement sometimes. This also has management pushing themselves and their crew harder than before with labor variance and the importance of good business numbers.
Advice to Management:
Pay Grill and Prep more. Take out specialists are paid slightly more, and the work is easier than that of a grill person's. It would create competition for good potential managers, and the restaurants would succeed in the long run.

Honestly, I enjoy my job. I am very critical of it, but it's only because I care about my crew and fellow managers and I want us to succeed.

Title: "Chipotle experience"
Pros: One of the great reasons to work at chipotle is the awesome and amazing people you meet.
Cons: The really rude costumers, but hey it's customer service what do you expect.
Advice to Management: Don't let the position you have get a little over your head. You we're once where we we're at too.

Title: "Chipotle Pros/cons"
Pros: The environment that the coworkers provide as to that of a family. I enjoyed working with the people who made work fun.
Cons: The policies were quite ridiculous

Title: "Be ready to work your rear off"
Pros: Can be a great team to work with, has growth opportunities if you're willing to work for it and the benefits aren't too bad. This company pushes to practice what it preaches and as soon as the company was aware of the health concerns, they raised their standards even higher to keep the food safe.
Cons: This job is demanding. Be ready to cover several areas and be certain you are signing up with a good team. I worked multiple locations and it always appeared understaffed, which put pressure on everyone. Very few people last long because of this and when the few who stay overreach their authority.
Advice to Management: Be aware more aware of your people and how they interact. In the end, it was the managers' lack of respect and understanding that made it hard to stay.

Title: "Licensing & Finance Support Specialist"
Pros: $100 monthly Chipotle meal card, opportunities to grow within business.
Cons: High turnover, at times disorganized structure.
Advice to Management: Invest more in entry-level staff.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Easy job and Good teammates
Cons: No growth and long hours

Title: "It's a decent job and you can move up in the company"
Pros: Free meals. Advancement opportunities. Free uniforms. You can where jeans.
Cons: They work you like a slave, and if you don't keep up they fire you.

Title: "Best Place Ever"
Pros: 5 Stars, awesome place to work
Cons: None cause it was sweet

Title: "Lost their integrity , went from people culture to $$$."
Pros: Work hard, keep your mouth shut, get the hours.
Cons: Change , Change. Get back to your people culture.
Advice to Management: Do the right thing. To many yes people in upper positions. It is all about the stock price.

Title: "cook"
Pros:
free food
good food
easy to work
Cons:
horrible management
Dont really care about minimum wage workers

Title: "It was fun and had purpose. We cared about each other."
Pros: Open and friendly environment. They train you and provide uniform. The food is non GMO. It's a clean place to work. Very goal oriented. Fast paced. A variety of people. Nice opportunity to grow within the company.
Cons: New management was brought in all the time. We were understaffed mostly due to management. Overtime is not approved. Extremely fast paced. They worked you to the bone without stopping to appreciate.
Advice to Management: Listen to your people. If you are there for us we will certainly be there for you.

Title: "Good place to work if u want opportunities!"
Pros: Need to set goal for yourself there's lots of opportunities to move up in company and Free meal!
Cons: Standing on your feet all day!

Title: "Prep Review"
Pros: Great training, managers make sure you work at a comfortable pace while its not hurting the development of the company.
Cons: Long hours, not meant for the lazy.

Title: "Very rewarding job as crew, not as manager"
Pros: It's very fast paced so time goes by fast, coworkers are great, I learned some good culinary skills
Cons: Being on grill is stressful and we don't get paid anymore than FOH crew. Higher ups are always complaining about the smallest things. You almost never get a break. We are sometimes even expected to work during half of our 30 minute breaks because some people slack off or managers don't take the full responsibility.
Advice to Management: Stop the extreme critisism towards crew for missing one little crumb while sweeping.

Title: "Terrible"
Pros: Free lunch - if you work a full shift
Cons:
terrible management
stressful work environment
Advice to Management: Tell your managers they can't hold teens (still in high school) to the same attendance expectations as the adults. Some of us are too young to have a license and car or can't afford a car and can't be at work every waking moment, also cause we have school.

Title: "Year at Chipotle"
Pros: Fast Paced, Free Food, Good Hours, Fun Environment, Great Coworker.
Cons: Unstable Management, unstable hours, very focused on labor hours, a lot of favoritism.
Advice to Management: Get to know you crew if you go to a new store so you can better utilize everyone's abilities.

Title: "Good company, good job"
Pros: Good benefits, gave me experience
Cons: Customers could be a bit to handle

Title: "Fun at the beginning"
Pros: The experiences of the kitchen and all the different positions you can be
Cons: The customers can be very picky and rude.
Advice to Management: Lead the shifts better, don't be afraid to put your foot down.

Title: "Good Summer Job"
Pros: It is incredibly fast paced so you don't have much downtime. There is always something to do and you grow bonds with the people you work with quite quickly.
Cons: There can be some miscommunication when peak times arise. The schedule can be quite monotonous and team members not holding weight can be an issue, but that can be fixed with accountability talks and consistent communication.
Advice to Management: I would recommend that management play more of an active role in the front. They are often in the back looking over documents on the computer.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Received one on ones very frequently which helped develop a stronger connection with manager/apprentice and allowed for growth to be exposed.
Cons: Scheduling was usually done last minute as well as shift changes which caused conflict among many employees when trying to find coverage
Advice to Management: create more consistent work schedules and refrain from last second schedule changes.

Title: "Horrible,horrible, horrible"
Pros: the free gear after the fire you
Cons: manaer changes basically every month, the hiring process took forever, they dont care about new hirees
Advice to Management: hire better managers

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Great staff decent managers flexible hours decent pay
Cons: My location was super busy like crazy busy
Advice to Management: Listen to your crew more we have ideas worht hearing

Title: "Fine High School Job"
Pros: The schedule worked around being in high school. The food is good and free while you're working.
Cons: Hard, hot, and messy work. Management pins employees against each other and purposely fires people for next to no reason. People don't stay long.
Advice to Management: Be more selective in hiring and train more intensely. Don't just give up on people because you need to fire SOMEONE.

Title: "Cashier/crew member"
Pros: The manager is nice and other employees seems friendly.
Cons: I just got the job and haven't started working yet.

Title: "Part Time Chipotle"
Pros:
Active Work
Great team atmosphere
Motivated people
Cons:
On feet all day
Can be tiresome if you don't like manual labor

Title: "Wow..."
Pros:
High pay rate
Flexible hours
Good college help
Seasoned food
Cons:
Awful management
Rude employees
Too much demands for one person
Managers not being managers.
Advice to Management: Be nicer to your employees and maybe you'll actually have better business.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Great people, motivated, good atmosphere
Cons: Tough customers, busy all the time, too many things to do at once
Advice to Management: Make it easier for an employee to get the day off due to emergencies

Title: "Great Workplace"
Pros: Free food, great company, get to play music in back
Cons: Get dirty working in back

Title: "Labor lovers"
Pros: Free food and decent pay
Cons: Labor intensive and labor intensive
Advice to Management: Mutual respect goes a longer way

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
Free Food on Break
Flexible hours
Cons: Management will schedule you on a day that you requested off sometimes

Title: "Great Place to Work"
Pros: Chipotle pays well and treats employees well. They only hire friendly people, so the atmosphere is always positive. The benefits are great. Discounted and free food are included. If you want to move up in management, it takes a little perseverance, but there are plenty of opportunities. They are good at letting workers balance school, life, and work.
Cons: It gets very busy, so if you are not quick, it may be a difficult job for you. Sometimes, the closing crew gets out later than expected if it has been a busy day.
Advice to Management: I think you're doing great!

Title: "10/10 recommend for students"
Pros: Great benefits & flexibility, energetic environment, emphasis put on customer service and experience.
Cons: I wouldn't say there are any cons

Title: "Alright"
Pros: Cool workplace, busy work, nice customers.
Cons: If the management sucks, you're doomed.
Advice to Management: Its everyone's job, not just yours. Don't hire 10 night staff teenagers and not give me hours.

Title: "The People"
Pros: The people make it. A shift full of "top performers" can make it fun to work there. The starting wage is high but don't expect significant wages and possible none at all unless you are promoted.
Cons: The people can also break it.
Advice to Management: To Corporate and Area Managers: Please don't expect crew members to know all the rules when they are constantly changing and managers can't even keep up with them (too busy trying to manage a restaurant), much less make sure its passed down to us crew members. The standards are ridiculous because there is no good method in place to maintain them as they change so frequently. That is what my experience has been. Don't yell at someone who's been there for 2 weeks because someone else didn't train them according to some new method that the trainer wasn't even taught. smh.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Great team environment, positive attitudes.
Cons: No cons , other than a very fast paced environment
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you are doing in terms of always wanting to see the best out of your employee's

Title: "Good first job"
Pros: Always hiring just apply online
Cons: Hard to get the job

Title: "Cashier-Crew"
Pros: Fast Paced , Freshly prepared delicious food daily , lively atmosphere , extraordinary customer experience.
Cons: Hat & direct contact with steam heat
Advice to Management: Continue doing a well job.

Title: "All Went Downhill"
Pros: If the managers are good the crew tends to be good because of how they hire. One free employee meal and 50% off when you're not working. Opportunity to grow and tuition assistance is the best.
Cons: Constantly fighting for hours and a different schedule every week posted way too late. Being understaffed puts so much pressure on everyone and we got criticized when it wasn't our fault. People being sent home just to save on labor and caused the aforementioned problem. No warning if you get fired, it just happens randomly. I hope you have a back-up plan if you decide to work for the company. Even though they got rid of me, I'm glad I am no longer a slave.
Advice to Management: Treat your crew with dignity, show them your appreciation for their hard work, and if you say it's going to be a full time job don't cut hours down to 20 or less. It's humiliating.

Title: "Service manager"
Pros: Great people and also food
Cons: Lots of work and sometimes not enough time.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: They have a great management program that allows to grow in the company
Cons: There is always a dilemma of extra hours that employees are in a way force to work more than they are scheduled.
Advice to Management: Be more consistent with the management of schedules.

Title: "Great Benefits, Incompetent Manager"
Pros: Free meal every time you worked that day, long hours, and good environment. People were really fun to work with, everyone except the manager.
Cons: Manager had no idea how to lead a team, cooks were a pain to work with. Scheduling was a pain in the butt, barely any sick days.
Advice to Management: Hire managers that actually have experience

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Friendly staff, flexible with schedule, and salary is good.
Cons: Demanding job, and very fast paced.

Title: "Chipotle experience"
Pros: Great atmosphere, crew and management were dedicated and passionate about obtaining store goals and standards
Cons: short staffed due to criteria of hiring

Title: "Chipotle sucks"
Pros: The free meals, and the interaction with other employees. You kinda feel like a big family
Cons: They expect too much, they want too much, and they work you too much, hard to get day off.
Advice to Management: Be a tad bit more smooth on your employees maybe they'll become better in what they do.

Title: "Good place"
Pros: Free lunch great management
Cons: People call of a lot

Title: "crew"
Pros: Had a great time with the crew. Things/days go by smoothly unless the crew works together and helps out each other
Cons: had bad times only because crew wasn't working together.

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Crew always works very hard together.
Cons: Being busy can be rough but its adjustable
Advice to Management: To give more feedback to crew members.

Title: "Never scheduled me or talked to me??? Why???"
Pros: Free food. Nice breaks. Good money.
Cons: I could never get in touch with my manager. I went weeks without being scheduled. The coworkers were antisocial.
Advice to Management: Learn to communicate with your staff better because I did not know why I wasn't being scheduled. I couldn't get a hold of you ever. It was very frustrating and I was constantly broke.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Fun work environment and good pay. Always opportunities to move up in the company
Cons: All it takes is one person to clog up the pipe line to upper management and it causes several people not to be able move up.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Great pay, amazing people. I've made friends that will last a life time. Tuition reimbursement for managers. Fun, encouraging work environment!
Cons: Company is slowly getting away from the culture and ideals that initially made it great. With Monty stepping down there has been a noticeable change even at the store level. Job has slowly became less enjoyable

Title: "Good environment and hard working people"
Pros:
Great work culture and managers are supportive.
Awesome manager
Free meal during break
Flexible schedule
Good Performance = fast promotion
Cons:
Expected to do well and a lot
Stressful
A lot of knowledge to know as you go up the chain
Advice to Management: Constantly encourage workers and motivate them! Work can be overwhelming

Title: "Not difficult, but hard work (and often underpaid)"
Pros:
Advancement opportunities
Better pay & benefits as you move up
Co-workers that care about the job and the team they work with
Cons:
Like anywhere else, you may end up in a bad situation with poor training or support, which can lead to unfairness in terms of advancement or promotion (taking longer than it should, being promised a reward when reaching a goal and not receiving the proper support to achieve it)
Being overworked (60+ hours minimum)
Advice to Management:
While I know that Chipotle's focus is still Food Safety, I've heard (and seen) too many people lose their job and/or leave the company because of how strict and complicated the procedures currently are. Yes, it's less complicated than when we first started, but it's still overwhelming at times (my restaurant always got 80+ on food safety from both corporate and an independent food safety evaluation company) especially when we don't have the proper support (such as staffing, enough managers/trainers to properly train the team or lack of those with great knowledge, etc.).

Another thing to note is that while we scream "Great guest experience" all day long, why we don't use more of our money to give hours to those that are really committed and wants overtime. I've seen so many people that were motivated to help out, and then we turned them down because we weren't allowed to give overtime. What's the point when we still can't accomplish what Steve said because we want to "save money on labor"?

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: The people, the food, the discount, the work
Cons: I have no downsides working here.

Title: "THEY SUCK!! 33rd street 2nd Ave"
Pros: The pay is great.
Cons: 33rd street 2nd Ave chipotle managers were HORRIBLE!! They were so racist and favoritism was also another problem!! I hated working there I am so happy I quit.
Advice to Management: THEY NEED NEW MANAGERS!! They need to fire Every last manager at 33rd street 2nd Ave, they used to let us smoke weed with the coworkers inside of chipotle bathrooms and also smoke with us.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
Flexible time schedule
Positive environment
Nice Co-workers
Cons:
Bad communication with new events happening in the store
No actually benefit

Title: "Line"
Pros:
- Free meal every shift
- Friendly coworkers
Cons:
- When it gets busy, IT GETS BUSY
- Sometimes they make you stay past your hours
- Closing is a very labor intensive task
Advice to Management: - Hire specific people to clean at the end of the night

Title: "Good environment, ambiguous termination policy"
Pros: Good people, free food per shift, growth opportunities for those talented in all areas needed (food preparation, cooking, personnel management, accounting, business management). Business plan and mission statement admirable. Expectations of employees suitable for up-and-coming employees seeking growth potential, with expectations this will not be considered nor treated as a dead-end job. Uninspired and apathetic need not apply.
Cons: Constant remote video monitoring awkward, ambiguous assessment criteria to define 'top performers' for both accolades and termination (I resigned, not fired; but employees / management duly terminated under immediate effect under this 'top performer' criteria not being met). Observed great demands with little consideration for work/life balance for management (not my role).
Advice to Management: Provide salaried positions greater flexibility and support; sole managers for locations observed to have remarkably long hours which appeared to affect their ability to provide leadership by example. Regional management appeared to provide little positive feedback, detracting from a positive environment for which this business is known. This is based purely on my observation, not communication / input from location management.

Title: "associate"
Pros: great food and clean environment
Cons: needy customers and poor expectations

Title: "Chipotle: Land of the Free Burritos"

-Teamwork

-50% discount in purchases
Cons:

Title: "Great job,"

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Free food. family atmosphere. Most customers are great
Cons: pushed beyond capacity. terrible pay for amount of work
Advice to Management: ease up on crew members. pay more for the amount of work that is expected.

Title: "My co workers make working at Chipotle fun, however it is a fast paced, demanding job."
Pros: Chipotle has good benefits, nice pay, and free food for employees on the days you work and half off for the days you don't work
Cons: The managers always leave and change constantly leaving no consistency in management. Some managers favor certain employees and they tend to promote men faster than women

Title: "Best company worked with so far"
Pros: The benefits are great. Paid breaks, paid sick days, free food on days you work, 50% off meals on days off, managers are understanding if you need days off as long as you let them know before. There's also pportunity to move up, receive a raise every 6 months depending on performance, tips are nice. Health and dental insurance. Hours are decent too.
Cons: It may get overwhelming to people that don't like dealing with other people. When it gets busy it is hectic..
Advice to Management: If you notice that there is an employee not performing well on something, or does not know how to carry out a task correctly. CORRECT them and help them get better, not fire them.

Title: "generally okay"
Pros: Good coworkers = an enjoyable environment
Cons: A lot of bureaucratic nonsense from corporate that's sometimes unintuitive

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Easy entry level position for applicants.
Cons: Flexible hours also means that there are situations in which you must work longer hours than previously described.
Advice to Management: Make work clear, proper training is a must.

Title: "A Hectic Mess..."
Pros: Free meal every time you worked, time goes fairly quickly, nice people environment, coworker can be nice/fun
Cons: Awful management, problematic scheduling, often disorganized, understaffed! When I got the job, I didn't receive a call, an email, or even a text from any of the managers or hirers; instead I received a vague automated email from their online company program saying "Welcome to Chipotle!" I followed all the instructions following that email on what I had to do to be in the system, then awaited a call from anyone about when I should start/come in. Six days later, I decided that it had been long enough and called the restaurant myself to get an update of any kind, to which a random employee said "looking at the schedule it looks like you start tomorrow..." The day I was supposed to do my paperwork, my manager said to come in at 6pm. I arrived at 5:45pm and notified someone I was there; the manager didn't come out from the back until 8pm and told me there were "printer issues" (I later found out she said this to everyone, even people who had been hired months before). This same kind of hour to hour and a half waiting thing happened the next three times I was there. I was told there would be a payed orientation where we we'd go over all of the ways to do things, food regulations, knife safety, etc but this orientation never happened and instead they threw me into the grill position (the position in charge of cooking literally evrything they serve on the menu) the first day I ever worked. It is an insane pace in there (I have worked at multiple restaurants before--this is unlike any others (at least in the grill position). On top of all of this, apparently their system has gone down so I still haven't been payed for half of my working weeks there! I've gone in and they say they can't find any other checks but I'm positive they are cutting me a good couple hundred dollars.
Advice to Management: Up the amount of organization, my god!

Title: "Crew Member"

Title: "Apprentice"

They really appreciate your hard work and make you feel good when you do something right (very empowering). When you make a mistake they will teach and elevate you on how to do it the right way.
Cons: If you are not under the right system, you can be overworked physically and mentally. The culture has changed recently where it has become all about #s rather than the people culture which was the very foundation that allowed the company to flourish and grow to an amazing place to work.
Advice to Management: Just because the culture has changed and it is all about the #s, doesn't mean you can treat people like #s (And I was in chipotle management for 4.5 years).

Advice to Management: They know what they're doing. "Meaningful prep." and "Respectful workplace." are fairly adhered to. Management needs to leave their personal baggage at the door sometimes, and not share their personal interests with impressionable younger staff. (Meaning DONT talk about your drug interests, do not talk about your sexual pursuits, and PLEASE stop with the double Entendres- Even poorly educated young staff know there's something inappropriate.

Clean, Fast Paced Environment

Cons:

Shifts are as long as 8 hours and are as late as Midnight

Advice to Management: Please respect employees' requests to ask off. Majority of the time. I'm scheduled days I've requested off, (this is excluding any short-staffed situations)

Cons: Sometimes as a kitchen manager you put in double the amount of work as service managers and it can be frustrating. Coupled with the fact that they get paid so much more than you.

Title: "its not bad"

upbeat
fast pasted

Title: "Decent place to work but not enough money"

Title: "Very fast paced and little room for errors"
Pros:
Tuition reimbursement (have to work at least a year)
401k plan
free meals + 50% purchases
tips
paid sick leave + vacation
dental and vision
Cons:
Very fast pace job ( would not recommend as a first job unless you're into that)
Hostile work culture (everyone is trying to outdo everyone else, lots of blame shifting)
Promoting too fast
Young mangers (like 19-23 sometimes)
Hours are sometimes cut
The schedule comes out two days before the work week starts
Lack of consistency (not all the rules are enforced)
Prep and grill get paid the same as everyone else ($9)
Advice to Management: Over all this job isn't worth the pay compared to the amount of work you have to put in. Management needs to have more experience managing employees rather than know the logistics of the restaurant. My Gm only worked at chipotle a year before becoming a GM at age 22. She and all the other mangers (under 22) lacked emotional maturity and moral responsibility. (one dropped me off in the middle of road at 2am 1/2 mile form my house.) Raise the hourly wage of prep and grill because they do so much more than line, cash etc. Working here was like becoming part of a cult. If you're not a "top performer" they will fire you. Chipotle needs to create a better working environment rather than having a dog eat dog work culture.

Title: "okay"
