Good hard work if you are into that sort of thing.

really fast past, especially in peak hours.

Good Team communication and friendly atmosphere. (different for everyone)

Nice pay for a starting job.
Cons:
Really fast past job, if you are at the line then its the customers, if at the grill then its making sure you don't run out of food. Prep is somewhat immune to this but they have their share of duties as well.

Prepared to get shafted at one point in your job if you are pm, by the am crew.

prepare to leave late if you are closing grill or prep.

I am note joking about those peek hours. Prepare ahead of time.

Be prepared to be short staffed a couple of times.
Advice to Management:
Don't be an.....

communicate better with team members.

Title: "Overall the money was good for a first job, but the amount of work you have to do is not worth it."
Pros: They give you free food, and 50% when you're not working, your coworkers are the best part (met my boyfriend and best friend here), flexible hours for the most part
Cons: Long hours, people are irresponsible and you have to pick up others' slack and make up for their shortcomings, not a lot of long staying employees, favoritism is shown, alot of pressure on a high school student
Advice to Management: Remember that life is not all about chipotle, we have other dreams and aspirations. Remember your employees

Title: "Great"
Pros: Fun place to work, great co-workers, easy job
Cons: Rush hour sucked but pushed you to work your hardest/fastest

Title: "thats some good eats"
Pros: employee meals are great and paid breaks are nice too
Cons: sad when the burrito rips
Advice to Management: play some new music in the lobby

Title: "Team Member Review"
Pros:
above min wage
good shifts
good managers
Cons:
competitive
constantly new workers
short breaks
payment issues
Advice to Management: nons

Title: "Good for a teen starting out but not too keep as long term"
Pros: tuition reimbursement, tips, high standards, employee meals/discounts
Cons: customers, not very flexible with hours, hectic when busy

Title: "Good place for first job"
Pros: Great benefits and discounts, feels like a team, prepares you for any other job out there
Cons: a lot of standards, not a con but some people might be unwilling to follow their high standards

Title: "Good company"
Pros: Serving amazing food, free employee meals, paid break
Cons: For the standards they require their employees to have, they should pay their employees more than McDonald's pays theirs because McDonald's has barely any standards. Steve Ells makes way too much money to be paying his top performers like they work at McDonalds.
Advice to Management: When you say you're doing raise reviews every six months, make sure you actually do raise reviews every six months.

Title: "Account Manager"
Pros: Nice campus, hardworking coworkers, genuine care for customers
Cons: Constantly changing in operations, works need to be done in growth

Title: "Opening Tortilla"
Pros: For me its the fast pace, the health ins. And flexibility in scheduling, and opportunity for advacement
Cons: Change of management, change in procedures

Title: "great"
Pros: fun easy great management staff
Cons: long hours rude people rude staff

Title: "Make good friends, but can be pushed to the limit."
Pros: Co-workers, Benefits, Advancement opportunities, Tips.
Cons: Managers, Productivity, Pay, Raises, Favoritism.
Advice to Management: Pay your employees what they're worth.

Title: "Part-Time Cashier at Chipotle"
Pros:
Good part-time benefits:
- Free meal (must be eaten in store) with each shift
- Flexible work hours (depending on location)

Lots of room to move up within ranks of company
Cons: $9.25 pay per hour. Within positions very little pay raises.

Title: "Would not recommend."
Pros: The people you work with are generally cool. The food is good until you work about 6+ months. The only thing that makes this job semi-worth it is that you have great coworkers including the service managers but that's where it ends. The general managers/restauranteurs think they're great to their employees but such is not the case.
Cons:
Micromanagement--the restaurateur at my location has a serious problem with micromanagement. Not only them, but also the corporate team leaders that come in do this as well. They treat you like a child and it's condescending.
The pay is terrible. I work nights to pay my rent while I'm in grad school but close to 90% of my income goes to paying my rent, and, I like to have some money to pay for oh I don't know... food, gas, or whatever. I've been promised a promotion, scheduled for 5 days of training and then nothing became of it. I asked about what happened and was told that "things were difficult right now." I asked for more hours and to my surprise, I received them, only to get yelled at when I get overtime because my boss wants to get his bonus. The management, general managers and above, care more about themselves and getting their bonuses while the rest of us struggle on the meager wages they give you. I've worked at two different stores and I've helped out a few times at another and this appears to be common, but I can only speak for myself.
Additionally, I've had a few customers say some racist things to me and I've been explicitly told not to defend myself which is ludicrous.
Advice to Management: Get new management.

Title: "Intense work. Good place to make friends but terrible management."
Pros: Free employee meal for every and any shift, 50% off meals and they promote from within. Good food at the most busiest locations.
Cons: Managers show favoritism and won't allow everyone to move up. A lot of workers work extremely hard but never get anything but negative comments from their managers.
Advice to Management: Try to find out what's going on in each and every one of your restaurants.

Title: "Best restaurant job ever"
Pros: Coworkers and supervisors are incredibly friendly. We were like family! The culture and standards ensured that the team was closely knit. It was fun to make food. The pipeline of getting promoted was clear. Hours were fantastic.
Cons: Some mangers are just not great managers. It can really make or break the job depending on who the restaurant/service/kitchen is and how well they do the job.
Advice to Management: Please continue to keep the Chipotle culture. It is truly what makes a great team.

Title: "IT"
Pros: Relaxed environment with fun people
Cons: Broken culture, stifling work environment, terrible management. They grossly under pay in corporate because of their name.

Title: "Great opportunity"
Pros: Fun and hardworking team atmosphere, advancement opportunities, learn skills that will take you far in any occupation.
Cons: Some managers are still learning how to do their jobs. People skills are sometimes lacking.
Advice to Management: Ask about how employees feel about other employees after each quarter. An anonymous review will give management an idea of what kind of training is needed for Service and Kitchen managers.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: I was working with a lot of fun and interesting people. They did their jobs well and we had a great work environment.
Cons: Sometimes disorganized, high turnover of managers

Title: "Fun place to work, Great staff"
Pros:
Free food on your lunch
Always busy so the day goes fast
Working with fresh food and ingredients
Upward mobility
Cons:
NO job stability
scheduled NOT flexible
Advice to Management: Value the employees a little more.

Title: "chipotle review"
Pros:
flexible with hours
free food
high starting wage for fast food
Cons:
tasks are done in a fast pace
time pressure

Title: "Take Out Specialist"
Pros: Free food when you work, fast paced environment, focuses on achieving your best
Cons: Very little recognition for a job well done
Advice to Management: Praise your employees more

Title: "Chipotle Review"
Pros: Good money, great environment, great food
Cons: Long hours , on feet all day

Title: "Chipotle Crew Member Review-Full Time"
Pros: Great atmosphere and free food on breaks. Great working with a group of people every day.
Cons: Poor management at times. Prep was a nightmare. Too often I would come in at 4 and the morning crew had not caught up on their tasks and would leave them for me to do.

Title: "line cook"
Pros: good kitchen experience in addition to prep experience aswell
Cons: store can be very busy but there is only ever supposed to be one line cook.

Title: "Definitely has potential"
Pros: Meet good people, good starter job, company has good message
Cons: Constructive criticism is encouraged but just ended up with a lot of employees putting each other down

Title: "Ehh"
Pros: Nice people free food chill
Cons: Too much work closing lot

Title: "Chipotle Review"
Pros: Great team of people to work with, amazing food and flexible hours.
Cons: Chipotle can be busy for hours on end but that just makes the time go faster, so it's not that bad.

Title: "good"
Pros: great customer service all day every day
Cons: the very long lasting lines

Title: "okay"
Pros: What was probably my favorite positive aspect from working here would have to be the free food that you are open to getting
Cons: I am really not a fan of the fact that it is so busy all of the time and there is no down time ever which I guess is something to be expected
Advice to Management: pay cashiers a bit more, they do a lot of work and deserve so much more money than one might realize at first

Title: "Employment"
Pros: cool environment with lots of friendly co workers
Cons: Definitely a very hard job for how little you make

Title: "Previous General Manager"
Pros: An opportunity to learn a lot about P&L, financial analysis, operations, and people development if it's your first rodeo; you make make great connections with co-workers and mentors; healthy culture that breeds positive results if executed properly; Steve Ells (CEO) is an admirable and enthusiastic man - his passion runs down through the company and fuels it; General Manager's get flexibility in particular aspects of running the business (and no flexibility in others)
Cons: Extremely overworked (paid for 40 hrs, work about 55-65) - it's hard to overcome this even in an A/B store (however, this is the nature of the industry); very poor work-life balance - GM's are "never not" working.. I understand some don't mind this, but I did; spontaneous and sometimes under thought hires/promotions from hourly managers all the way to directors.. I've seen it all; your success ultimately depends on your field leader regardless of your individual performance so a glass ceiling is very possible
Advice to Management: Some of your ATL's/Area Managers are not qualified to be in their positions... halt the outside hiring of field leaders and continue to promote R+'s who know how to develop people... I've seen the culture disintegrate in areas with multiple outside hired leaders (GM's included); take some more time between roll outs if plausible; focus on high performing store leaders and get them to a multi-unit managing position.. the company needs it

Title: "A great company cares about its people. Commitment to integrity."
Pros: Free food. Great people. Open environment. You Learn culinary skills that will carry through life. Responsible for feeding a dedicated fan base.
Cons: It can be long hours and the prep amount is a lot. You may struggle if you can't learn to move fast and finish on time.

Title: "Line worker usually serving food"
Pros: Free meals every time you work, tuition reimbursement 5.5k per year, start everyone out at at least $9/hour, tips, paid half hour breaks when opening or closing.
Cons: constantly on your feet and there is usually never a time without serving a customer. Expected to become a master very quickly & are treated badly by workers & managers if you cannot keep up.
Advice to Management: Remember that workers need to sleep & "clopens" (closing then opening the next morning) are not a good idea.

Title: "Too much Work, not enough pay"
Pros: Free chipotle when eating, fast paced environment
Cons: Expected to go above and beyond pay grade
Advice to Management: Treat workers like people, and not as expandable pawns

Title: "Review"
Pros: People friendly, Room for advancement
Cons: Everyone tries to empower each other

Title: "Solid place to work"
Pros: If you love working hard chipotle is great. Time flies by in the back of the house and time management is key. Starting 10 an hour. Tips for closers. Listen to personal music in the back.
Cons: Closers can stay till midnight sometimes. Under staffed. Sometimes super hard work if people call off that day. Can be a little stressful.

Title: "It was a good place for somebody with no experience."
Pros:
Free meal during break, 50% off on your days off.
Amazing employees, at least at my location.
Cons:
Can only use 50% in the store you work in.
Managers can sometimes be unprofessional, doesn't talk to their employees to identify and correct issues.

Title: "Problematic corporate and hiring practices. Decent job otherwise."
Pros:
Fast paced and interesting
generally good people
free food
benefits for students
Cons:
They promoted someone who they were informed had a history of sexual assault.
Underpaid for the intense work
Often expects people to stay late or come early
Overworks GMs and wastes time on numbers BS

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Helps develop great customer experience, takes extreme measurements of care for cleanliness and sanitation, all food non GMO, FREE meals on days you work- 1/2 of days you don't. Tips. Co-workers meet with you during interviews so you catch a feeling of what it will be like working with them, great working experience. More often than not guaranteed days off when asked ahead of time(2 weeks at least).
Cons: Occasionally you'll stay after your shift is over, extensive cleanliness and safety measures can be tedious, use empowerment to do things you aren't trained or qualified to do.

Title: "My experience"
Pros: You get free meals every time you work, it gets nasty after a while. You get 18 sick hours where you could use them into 3 days with 6 hours each day. You could get a lot of hours but thats common for any fast food place.
Cons: They make you work like slaves and care more about customers than employees

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Pay is good, You are always busy, The food is great, Customers are usually nice, and you get a meal every time you work
Cons: Not much down time, very busy with customers which causes late nights sometimes, some customers are dissatisfied frequently.
Advice to Management: Pay more attention to workers doing things wrong, and train new hires correctly to avoid problems later.

Title: "Chipotle crew member"
Pros: free meals, cool people to work with
Cons: lots of moving around and physical labor, also managers try to take advantage and over schedule you

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: The location that I worked for was very informative of their expectations. The manager was willing to really train me and help me with anything that I needed.
Cons: You will have to deal with many rude customers and face difficult situations.

Title: "Food Prep"
Pros: Very good in training people!
Cons: High volume of work in the kitchen!
Advice to Management: Never give up!

Title: "Worked there for 4 months got no where. I was working the 2nd busiest chipotle in Arizona and couldn' get over 16 hours."
Pros: I was very busy all the time and took a lot of skill and if you are slow and you can not catch up they throw you behind to do the dishes.
Cons: There was harassment from mangers and not a very happy vibe if your sad or having a bad day.
Advice to Management: I would advise the management to allow mangers to become promoted faster and also to have different pay for different employees

Title: "Good Place to Work"
Pros: It is very organized, the people are friendly, and there is very little drama. There is room for promotion if you have the ability to work there full-time and I greatly appreciate the free meals.
Cons: It doesn't pay as much as I would like (as a broke college student with an Associate's degree and 5 years of food service experience), the hours aren't the best for someone who lives 30 minutes away, and sometimes the schedule doesn't come out until a day before it begins.
Advice to Management: I would very much appreciate to have more of the one-on-ones that were promised when I accepted the position as well as a small raise every six months or so.

Title: "I wouldn't make this my career but it's a good part time job"
Pros: Great people, easy work most of the time
Cons: Customer Service, work hours are never the same

Title: "Cashier/ crew member, dealt with customers and store cleaning"
Pros: Good staff/co workers: friendly and supportive; clear directions and training; decent hours and opportunity to advance if desired; good with scheduling around school/classes
Cons: Management was not great with scheduling: schedule was only posted 1 or 2 days before the start of the week, not good with honoring requested days off (less than 75% was it granted); initially signed up to only work part time but usually was given 35+ hours a week; there were not enough people trained to be cashiers making it harder on scheduling
Advice to Management: Ask employees about their least favorite part of the job or working - maybe it's something that can be changed or improved before the person wants to quit/leave. Be more consistent with rules about calling-out.

Title: "Good Place to Work"
Pros: My pay is good compared to other fast food jobs; they accomodate my schedule and I consistently get 30 - 35 hours.
Cons: They can change your schedule at any time
Advice to Management: Try not to hire all people who know each other; then there is low accountability

Title: "Hard work, Rewarding short term"
Pros: It's hard work, it's rewarding at first, but it'll burn you out if you let it over the course of time
Cons:
Very busy; fast-pace
All about speed and time management
Top performer culture can be empowering, yet toxic
Advice to Management: Do more to help employees achieve higher standards instead of forcing them upon them with little help

Title: "Too much work, not enough reward"
Pros: Free lunch/dinner. Flexible hours.
Cons: Not much support from leadership. Work 100-hour weeks without being acknowledged. No incentive for store doing well.
Advice to Management: Need more leaders in the field supporting restaurants.

Title: "HONEST"
Pros: Great first job. Very flexible work schedules.
Cons: You smell like food afterwork. Must have a sense of urgency. Must be patient.
Advice to Management: Have more open communication with your employees.

Title: "Great place for individuals with unique and outgoing personalities."
Pros: The product is something that you can believe in.
Cons: Honestly, i have no cons!

Title: "A culture in a class of its own!"
Pros: Strive towards great culture, amazing people, good benefits, very rapid advancement opportunities, team members get free meals and full benefits day 1
Cons: High pressure environment, people promoted before ready at times
Advice to Management: Don't lose sight of all the things that make us different than other businesses

Title: "Difficult job, the perk is free food."
Pros: Free food was one of the best perks of the job. Definitely my favorite part. This was such a good benefit.
Cons: We didn't always get our breaks and it was frequently understaffed at points. I did like the job though about 50% of the time.

Title: "it was good"
Pros: money , hours, nice, location
Cons: busy, work alot , hard,

Title: "cashier"
Pros:
free food when on the clock
Great benefits
Cons:
not enough pay for the amount of work expected.
managers are unfair
they became restaurant tour for lying. they only worked that good and hard when the bigger bosses were there.
Advice to Management: be around your restaurants more. show up more unexpectedly.

Title: "Busy bodies!!"
Pros: The pay and hours are great for fast food working.
Cons:
The work can be a lot.
No time is allowed to be taken off.

Title: "Fun if ran right"
Pros: Easy job, great base pay
Cons: Poorly managed and stressful at times
Advice to Management: Swallow your pride and let your employees help you when offered

Title: "I Love It"
Pros:
Fun Co-Workers
Free food
Discounted food
Good pay
Cons:
Lots of work
Annoying customers
Lots of pressure

Title: "No flexibility"
Pros: good pay, free meals, good perks as you make your way up.
Cons:
no time for personal life, total disregard for free time.
constantly had to close and open the next day.

Title: "Great Work Culture"
Pros: Comped meals, limited menu to prepare, no freezers or microwaves, easy and open layouts
Cons:
Little flexibility on hours
Very demanding

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Free food 50 percent off employee meals when your not working.
Cons: Constantly changing standards. Upper management is not supportive. Terrible business practices and standards. Did not truly change after food scare.
Advice to Management: You pride yourself in how you empower leaders but your actions do not speak what your saying. You need to actually develop leaders and help them to grow.

Title: "General manager"
Pros: There is no glass ceiling. Moving up is not not an option. You grow or get out.
Cons: Work an average of 70 hrs weeks. Min. Pay
Advice to Management: Work less

Title: "Chipotle Cashier/line prep"
Pros: Free food, decent hours, cool co-workers
Cons: Managers hire promote their friends, not who works the hardest or best fulfills job responsibilities, low starting pay
Advice to Management: The workplace nepotism needs to stop

Title: "Good experiences but awful upper management"
Pros: Opportunity to move up. Awesome people. Great food quality.
Cons: Horrible area managers and team directors. People get fired and quit like crazy. Get transferred whether you want to go or not.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Not comparable to fast food. The food is made fresh every day
Cons: When corporate visits they don't take the time to get to know the story of your store they just point out the things you are doing wrong and pretry much tell you you are doing a horrible job and should quit
Advice to Management: Rely on your crew more!

Title: "Chipotle Grill"
Pros: You get free food every shift you work and if you stay with the company the benefits add up
Cons: Not really and good tip money for how hard you work. (if youre a hard worker) Never get more than a 7 hour shift
Advice to Management: Plan the preparation for the days food better. Bring in more help in the AM to help prep food for the day

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Hardworking individuals, nice owner and competitive pay
Cons: Would have like to be in a better location
Advice to Management: Well done

Title: "It was okay"
Pros: I loved chipotle because of the pay and because I am naturally quick on my feet so the job was easy for me.
Cons: I was treated unfairly. Managers would pick on me about what I wore but when other people wore it, it was no issue. I was in highschool so I was only supposed to be working part time. Instead, they had me working 9.5-10 hour shifts at least 5 days out the week.

Title: "decent job"
Pros: they have good benefits for you long term
Cons: the jobs are in high demand
Advice to Management: more organized

Title: "Review"
Pros: Great co-workers, lovely management.
Cons: Long lines during rush hours, can be a bit hectic
Advice to Management: none. keep up good work.

Title: "Opportunities On The Horizon"
Pros: Benefits, flexible schedules, competitive pay.
Cons: Uniform policies and not a log of hours

Title: "Finance Intern"
Pros: Creates an atmosphere of people focused culture, and collaboration. Easy to reach out to other departments and adopt projects that might interest you. Team work oriented, both in the restaurants and in corporate.
Cons: As an intern in the Finance department, work experience is not very finance based. The internship program is not very established, and is very open, which can be a great thing, but can also fail to provide a sense of direction.

Title: "Prep"
Pros: Free food, great company ethics and respectful co-workers. i liked the fact that we made a better food option for people while the price of food was similar to the Standard American Diet (SAD).
Cons: Working at chipotle is not a great long term option for any one who does not see themselves as a general manager and making chipotle their whole life. you are expected to work very hard to move up in the company and the pay scale increase could be better between positions.
Advice to Management: i would let management know to ensure that all employees are treated fairly and are in a position that they are happy and proud to serve.

Title: "Great learning experience."
Pros: Great benefits! Awesome food that tastes great and is truly fresh and animal friendly. Great areas for growth. Training systems are good.
Cons: Corporate constantly changes direction. Corporate tries to uniform all restaurants in aspects where they're completely different (like dinner rushes all being from 6pm to 7pm). Pay is mediocre.
Advice to Management: Each store is like a child, no two are the same, so don't make each store follow same labor matrices, schedules, rush hours, etc.

Title: "Great Company took a Turn"
Pros: Team Building, Commitment to vision, Promote from within
Cons: Company "politics" , lack of consistent compensation between employees of same position.
Advice to Management: Stop forcing the pressure of growth on solely to the General Managers. This has caused a collapse of the company culture. Take a further look at the practices of some who have major leadership roles.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Free food & hard working employees.
Cons: From being a former GM at other well respected major chain food/ retail establishments this was by far the worst experience I have ever had in a workplace setting. The Patch manager using foul language in every other sentence they use, horrible work-life balance, only rewards for people who kiss up to upper level managers and harassment from fellow Gm's. It was the longest year of my life and couldn't get out fast enough.
Advice to Management: Teach your Patch managers proper HR policies. They are clueless on harassing behavior and state laws. Hire more competent people who can cater to a more enjoyable workplace setting.

Title: "Every Chipotle location is different"
Pros: The work is easy and the people are generally fun. You get free food basically the entire shift and managers are usually very accommodating to schedules.
Cons: If you have poor management, it can be very frustrating. There are many food safety policies that managers will be crazy about but will not follow themselves.
Advice to Management: Recognize employee potential and do not abuse quality employees.

Title: "Store Manager"
Pros: Great Atmosphere and good working experience.
Cons: Lower benefits, not a long term career path

Title: "Food Service Manager"
Pros: Great place to work!! Positive environment!!
Cons: I don't have any complaints.

Title: "Pretty good"
Pros:
good salary
great atmosphere
good people
Really nice customers
Great people
Cons:
Hard work
Stringent rules
Always busy
Not the best pay
Expect you to learn fast
Advice to Management: Keep it up

Title: "great"
Pros: nice happy fun exciting great
Cons: none not at all could not think of any
Advice to Management: stay the same continue good work

Title: "I love this place!"
Pros: Great work environment, fun, overall just awesome
Cons: I cant think of a downside of working here
Advice to Management: N/a

Title: "Crew Manager"
Pros: Teaches you how to be fast on your feet. Great food, free meals per shift
Cons: Managers expect too much of you. Some unreasonable expectations.

Title: "Crew Memeber"
Pros: The crew team is uplifting, and empowering, free food per shift is great.
Cons: A lot of work and depending on your opinion, I believe you get underpaid for the work you do.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: It was really fun to work here
Cons: Boss was very mean and rude

Title: "Hardest, but most rewarding job I've ever worked."
Pros: Plenty of opportunity to move up if working under the right leader(s), amazingly good medical benefits, good pay and bonuses, amazing people culture, laid back when it comes to dress, music, etc.
Cons:
Not possible to ever feel a sense of accomplishment, because it's not possible to meet the company's ever-increasing expectations to fulfill mostly arbitrary duties. There is a time-consuming tool for everything, and they change constantly. Everyone knows they can get the job done as well or better without these "tools", but you will get in trouble for not using them.
Required to be "deployed" working a position, even as a GM, for 6 hours per day. Leaving very little time to do the things that you need to get done.
Advice to Management: Listen to the people telling you they do not have time to do the things you're asking of them. Give more labor hours, or continue to watch good people leave this company.

Title: "Unprofessional Communication"
Pros: Empoyee meals and discounts. Friendly environment.
Cons: Long hard hours, dishes cut your hands, tortilla press can burn your arms and hands.
Advice to Management:
I was told by one manager I had mastered the line, the next manager told me I was struggling. I was trained to communicate when on the line by saying, "heard", while my manager
would not do the same. I was notified of my termination through a phone call rather than in person.

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Everyone is there to help you learn and make you feel like a big family.
Cons: None I could think of.

Title: "It's OK"
Pros: Once you're trained it's not too bad
Cons: No training, too much work for the money, too many managers/managers-in-traing
Advice to Management: When it's busy don't take a break

Title: "Good Side Gig"
Pros: Flexible schedule for hourly crew. Free food.
Cons: Ungodly hours once salary and unrealistic business goals.
Advice to Management: Invent a burrito rolling machine.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Fun environment to work in
Cons: Extremely high expectations of employees

Title: "Fast, Hard, Fun (usually)"
Pros: Everyone usually has a great attitude, the food and ingredients are GREAT, the free meals are GREAT, fast-pace food service environment makes you always busy; time flies and an 8hr day is nothing
Cons: Really is hard work, wear you down over time.

Title: "Fun Environment, Unfortunate Sexism"
Pros: The people with whom I work are wonderful. We try to keep things fun and lighthearted, even in the midst of a difficult shift. Chipotle offers opportunities to advance and wants its employees to move up, whether within the company or without. It offers scholarships to students who have been employed for over a year.
Cons: Even with prior restaurant experience, it is far easier to move to the back-of-house if you are male. I have witnessed this under tow different general managers. They seem to interview men and think "You would be a great fit in the back-of-house!" when the standard is that each employee must be validated on both line and cash before moving to prep and grill. It is unfair to see that the men never even work a day on the line.

Title: "Company is great, but work is surprisingly taxing"
Pros: Friendly Staff. Genuinely feel a love for the company and food while there.
Cons: its pretty rigorous. Working the line can be awful depending on customers and times of day, but the food prep in the back is extremely taxing.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros:
.Gain culinary skills
.Start out pay is okay for fast food
.Make sure all employees know proper sanitation procedures
.Flexible schedule
Cons:
. Communication can be better
.Sometimes put into a position where you can't succeed
Advice to Management: Improve communication

Title: "Good"
Pros: Free lunch everyday. Very friendly workplace. Several benefits such as the guild program-which helps you pay for school while working.
Cons: Stressful environment for newbies. A little experience in customer service and restaurant work recommended.
Advice to Management: More intensive training for employees and a longer training window

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Love the people I work with! We all work together in a fast pace. Managers are great about getting and giving hours. Love the food I even come in on my days off.. Its just SOOO good!
Cons: hard work, when someone calls in sick we have their back but work twice as hard

Title: "Chiptole Part Time"
Pros: They allow you to get free food, which is awesome. They have goof health insurance options.
Cons: I liked working at Chipotle at first, but they do not treat their employees who have been working there for a longtime very well. They are slow to give promotions and raises. They have a high employee turn over rate.

Title: "It's a job."
Pros: Free lunch and a friendly atmosphere
Cons: Hard work and low pay
Advice to Management: Be patient and specific with training.

Title: "Highschool Student Part Time at Chipotle"
Pros:
Free Lunch break Meals
50% Discount off shift

Title: "No bad"
Pros: Free Meals Flexible schedule 401k
Cons: A lot of work if other crew members dont work as fast as you do it

Title: "Made me a better person but at a cost."
Pros: Made me learn a lot and over time, gained experience. I was inspired to think that there is no where else better to work at. Had good team members and management.
Cons:
It takes a toll on you whether you've been there for months or years. Company is always changing. They say it's for the better which should be a good thing but whether you're a crew or GM, you are getting underpaid for the hours you do and your responsibility. Raises are twice a year. But it's up to management how much they can give you. And they can BS you and give you a reason why you didn't get one.
Make you feel guilty for not completing work. They turn their heads when they see you working off the clock because you wanna help out. Picky about labor and standards.

Since ecoli outbreak. Company was not the same. Lots of management and crew have left. Really understaffed because people are tried of it and new people don't want to put up with it.

My Pros about Chipotle have changed because basically the company did.
Advice to Management: Leave while you can or keep slowly moving up and become hypocritical of what you preach and who you are.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great work environment, amazing coworkers, fun, fast-paced, able to cross-train and learn a lot
Cons: Can get exhausting because of constant busyness and being on your feet
Advice to Management: Nothing to mention

Title: "Experiences at chipotle"
Pros: Friendly and uplifting environment, learn a lot about working efficiently, alongside paying attention to detail.
Cons: No cons I love working here.

Title: "meh"
Pros: free food i guess haha
Cons: very short staffed, lots of hour cut backs, way too stressful work environment for just minimum wage pay

Title: "Loved the energy working here!"
Pros: The atmosphere at my store in Columbus, OH was extremely positive and energetic. The general manager was so sweet and considerate, and everyone was really fun to be around. I don't know if that's true of all Chipotle stores have that same vibe, but it seems like the combination of the busy environment and the Chipotle business model make it fun. The management trains everyone extremely well, and the environment is empowering - after just a few weeks you feel confident enough to help other employees with their work.
Cons: The work can be HARD. Opening and closing the restaurant are especially taxing, since there's a lot of prep work and cleaning up. And most Chipotle stores are busy. Expect to be on your feet for your entire shift (usually 8 hours), and be ready to work quickly and efficiently in a short amount of time.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work in motivating everyone! Make sure that your store crew knows the pillars and knows how to be a top performer!

Title: "Nothing Surprising"
Pros:
Friendly crew members and boss.
A lot of over time and double time, if you're are willing to work over 8 hour shifts.
Cons: Tough physical work, requires you to be fast paced

Title: "Lots of work"
Pros: Free Food. with 50 % discount on anything on the menu to go
Cons: Lots of work if you are in the grill position, Working on the line can be annoying, and working prep you have way too many things to do on your own. Managers expect everything to be done perfectly. The job has become way too corporate and everything has to be done by the book there is no freedom while working. Scheduling hours are a hassle because most shifts have to be 6+ hours. Very picky with how you do things. Pay is absurd with the amount of stuff you have to do.And if you work harder/multiple positions you still get paid the same amount.
Advice to Management: Try not push around your employees too much because that will lead to people disliking you in the future

Title: "Short time at Chipotle"
Pros: Great co workers, Free Food
Cons: Scheduling, Managers were sorta rude
Advice to Management: Communication needs to be improved when putting employees on the schedule

Title: "Good Job"
Pros: Free meal every shift. Chance for advancement.
Cons: A lot of work for the pay.

Title: "Pretty good company, pretty terrible management."
Pros: Free meal for each shift; Great benefits, even for hourly non-management; Room for advancement within the company
Cons: Management very bad at scheduling - didn't put out the schedule for the week until Saturday or Sunday. Did not honor requests for time off, schedule changes, etc. Minor labor laws frequently broken. Management clearly had favorites, and was mean and unfair to those who weren't their favorites. Homophobic comments by one manager towards crew members. Management talking about employees to other employees and managers behind their backs. Being forced to come in to work when it is unsafe due to snowy/icy roads that have yet to be treated, and other restaurants and businesses in the area are closed. Not paid enough for the work expected of employees, especially in one of the busier stores in the region.
Advice to Management: Listen to your employees. Listen to their requests for schedule changes. Don't have favorites. Don't single out certain crew members or talk about them behind their backs. And obey the state minor labor laws.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Many locations for a person to look for employment in NYC.
Cons: Food prep stations were not clean. Produce should be washed thoroughly. Lots of complaints.
Advice to Management: They should be able to clean their stuff more often and give more coupons to customers.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Great culture, Depending on your location and management team there is great training.
Cons: Not a very structured company as of right now, they have a lot changing.
Advice to Management: Put your crew first. Always put your crew first.

Title: "Trash"
Pros: you are able to make some good friends
Cons:
working on the grill
always trying to achieve to be restauranteur
new policies almost every day
Advice to Management: don't make people work of the clock

Title: "Great Idea, Poorly Executed"
Pros:
The Opportunities
The Environment
The People
The Expirence
Cons: The management will blow a lot of smoke, telling you how important you are. They will push you to be a better person than you ever thought you could be, which is great, but they never follow through with giving you the raise in pay or position.
Advice to Management: Listen to Your people!

Title: "Great company"
Pros: Have great values and so good to employees
Cons: Managers really matter on how good work is. I worked at two locations and how they ran was black and white
Advice to Management: Only promote people who are ready to be managers

Title: "Not too shabby"
Pros: I enjoyed the flexible hours and laid back environment.
Cons: I didn't enjoy the lack of communication between managers
Advice to Management: Get schedules out on time.

Title: "I loved working at Chipotle it gave me a whole new experience."
Pros: We all work as a team and get everything we have to do to get things done. Communication skills are one of your biggest priorities. Having a safe,neat, and clean environment is key.
Cons: Getting transfers are a hassle. Sadly, sometimes working at Chipotle may be difficult and it will test your patience but, it's on you whether or not you act out of character.
Advice to Management: Try to be a little more open and flexible with peoples schedules. Understand that some people need transfers in order to go about there daily lives

Title: "Great place."
Pros:
Easy work
The shifts are reasonable
Room to move up
They listen to scheduling concerns
Wonderful management
Cons:
It's more of an inbetween job
Staring pay is just above minimum wage
Physically wearing
Advice to Management: Keep putting the employees first, I liked that about the business!

Title: "management wasn't respectful"
Pros: opportunity for advancement in the company, good training program
Cons: high turnover rate, poor management, and hard to keep job with academics

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Can't say since I never worked a day for them! I was hired in December, however, I was never scheduled for any shifts. Store management did not make any effort whatsoever to communicate with me regarding my employment status. As a result of not working any hours, I lost my medical benefits and was eventually terminated by human resources. Way to go team Chipotle!!! What a fantastic company to have never worked for!
Cons: No integrity whatsoever exhibited by anyone at the store level or corporate level.
Advice to Management: Aquire some ethics, employ your company's values; be straightforward, truthful and direct with your newhires. Don't be deliberately irresponsible-show some character.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: opportunity is there for everyone.
Cons: long hours if operation isn't perfect

Title: "Pretty Okay."
Pros: Coworkers and customers very friendly and easygoing, simple techniques and duties
Cons: Constantly hiring and having to find new people, cuts hours for part time

Title: "Great Place to Work"
Pros: The interview was cool. it wasnt very hard. the crew was friendly i was hired on the spot. if you really are a people oriented person youll be fine.
Cons: you have to make sure the crew can get along with you which is weird because theyre not paying me. Also they should adopt some christian core values.
Advice to Management: please dont be so selective as to who may work for you it truly discourages some people.. Also i think you guys should pay more we work hard.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Advancement possibility. Good benefits.
Cons: Highly corporately regulated and managed. Hard work and long hours for less than great pay.

Title: "Cashier/Crew"
Pros: Great environment and pay, fun coworkers, easy interview.
Cons: Scheduled for hours I had prearranged to not work, like closing on weeknights as a high school student. Wasn't really trained, just kind of tossed in on my first shift (Halloween which is one of the busiest nights of the year) and then thrown into cashier next shift without any idea on how to do cash.
Advice to Management: Properly train new team members please and help them get acquainted better with other coworkers. I didn't feel like I was good friends with my coworkers until my last few shifts.

Title: "Grilling for Chipotle"
Pros: Really great management and I had an awesome trainer.
Cons: Working at the grill station was so demanding and hard on my body. Hated closing grill, got burned so many times, etc.

Title: "Don't do it, and plan to get out early if you do HAVE to."
Pros: Free food even though you do get tired of it.
Cons: Pay is pretty bad/managers are terrible/inconsistent goals and standards from upper management constantly shifting/the culture of the restaurant is terrible/terribly cliquish and will give promotions just based on outside relationships/massive examples of the peter principle (everyone I met there had no idea how to do the actual job they were placed in, but could do the job underneath them pretty well). You also never get your "paid lunch" where I was unless your a new guy then they make sure you get it for the first couple months.
Advice to Management:
Don't give promotions to people based on solely on their current performance, actually consider if they are able to do the position you are promoting them to and demote them if they don't work out.

From top to bottom the store I worked at had the laziest middle management ever who constantly put their work on the grill/prep, and spent the whole shift doing basically nothing.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: free meal during each shift

Advice to Management: fix the manager system

Title: "What to know"

Title: "love it"

Title: "Chipotle Mexican Grill"

Title: "Crew Member"

-One Free meal once per shift, 50% discount on a meal off-shift
-Medical, Dental and Vision Benefits and Tuition Reimbursement
-Opportunities to advance if you wish
Cons:

Advice to Management: Encourage building in places that have enough space to make the kitchen less crowded. Also hire more people. You can have better division of labor and decrease the amount of turnover.

Title: "Pretty Good Benefits for students"

Title: "Best job ever"

Cons: Would be nice to have a schedule that's more readily available to the workers. I only work the weekends, so I don't get to see any schedule changes that are made, if any, unless I go into the store and check out the printed paper.
Advice to Management: Management is great! They're very helpful and are always elevating coworkers and pushing to meet high standards.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Free food, learn a lot for personal development through corporate training.
Cons: Overworked, underpaid. They set unrealistic goals and cut your hours if it was not met. Very petty work environment. I wouldn't recommend it to any. Go be waitress.
Advice to Management: Stop setting such unrealistic goals.

Title: "Service manager"
Pros: Loved the crew I worked with, learned a lot about food there
Cons: Rude customers, long shifts, work most weekends
Advice to Management: Take care of your crew. They will take care of you

Title: "They will ruin your life"
Pros: free food, promotion opportunities, cute uniform
Cons: insane hours, rigid work roles, militant environment. Signing on as a part time student will not guarantee that they will give you the part time hours you ask for. If short staffed, you will be working full time (if you can't work and they schedule you anyway it's your problem, not theirs) and if doing so is dangerous to your health and you need to take time off, you will be let go or simply bullied into resigning due to being "lazy".
Advice to Management: allow people to train in various roles, not just being on cash, just on line or just on grill. address employee problems directly.

Title: "Treats employees bad"

Cons: Work you like you are a slave to the company

Title: "A good job for high school students."
Pros:

+ Above average pay (9.10 oer hour)
+ Free lunches
+ Good work ethic
+ Once you learn all the ropes, the job becomes cake, Until things get busy. Then again that is easy too, just dont fall behind when things ramp up.

Title: "A Wonderful Experience So Far"
Pros: Wonderful people full of dedication and passion to achieve a better guest experience, while still being competitive with each other and connecting as well.
Cons: Not enough employee meals ! I kid, there isn't many negative things I can say about this company.
Advice to Management: Keep an eye out and be a bit more attentive to give credit where its due at times.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: This is a great starting job.
Cons: At my particular store the end of shift cleaning could last for hours.
Advice to Management: n/a

Title: "Decent opportunity for a careerist, but otherwise not fun"
Pros: Food is very good, people are pretty cool overall, you learn a lot of real kitchen skills. If you can mesh well with the culture there is plenty of room for advancement.
Cons: You are essentially required to do all the jobs of a full service kitchen at fast food speeds and for fast food pay. Given the promote from within culture you're also expected to have a great deal of enthusiasm for the company which must be shown in regular meetings with supervisors. Those looking for simple part time or short term work tend to be very out of step with management/those who are clearly looking to advance.
Advice to Management: Realize that this isn't a career for a lot of your employees, and be more relaxed in running the kitchen.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: co-workers are great people. Free food. decent pay for a first job
Cons: its busy all the time, understaffed, over stressed, the store creates an employee vs. customer environment.
Advice to Management: easy to advance as long as you have good kitchen skills

Title: "Busy"
Pros:
- Free Food
- Amazing Coworkers
Cons:
- High Expectations
- Low tips
Advice to Management: Focus on empowering, not belittling

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Free food, flexible schedule, great team
Cons: Bad management due to favoritism
Advice to Management: Train people better

Title: "Management & Crew"
Pros:
Get really close with coworkers and make real friends and lasting relationships
Positive energy most of the time
Used to get really good hours
flexible scheduling
decent pay
Cons:
ever since the sick thing we lost business so everyones hours got cut
SO MUCH FAVORITISM in management
less hours
can get super busy and tiring
sometimes we get our breaks for 7 hours shifts right before or after shift is over
Advice to Management:
treat everyone equally
plan out your day and think about all your coworkers skills before throwing together a schedule

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Love on working with food.
Cons: It close counter of going shopping or district nearby.
Advice to Management: Would like to know the salaries of team member.

Title: "General manager"
Pros: Working with fresh food learning a lot about leadership, business and cooking skills.
Cons: They cannot pick a direction and stay with it. Highest levels and important support roles in the company often seem unorganized.
Advice to Management: Have patience and surround yourself with great people. Set a great example.

Title: "6 months"
Pros:
I like that in order for someone to get hired the entire crew has to meet them and agree to hire them.
The pay is pretty good compared to my old job.
You awls have friends at work and that you can hang out with outside of work.
Cons: Sometimes you do not get out on time due to sometimes being short people in the morning for prep or we just get so busy that there is no one to do prep because everyone is on the line or on grill.
Advice to Management:
Sometimes the way management talks to people makes it seem like they are talking down to you/other people and its not empowering so possible when employees sat something about that they could listen better?
When people need to change their availability because of school or something else that comes up its not always easy to get it switched.

Title: "Chipotle Crew Member"
Pros: There are paid breaks and the staff really treats you like a family.
Cons: Working at Chipotle and earning minimum wage is difficult because there is a lot of work to be done, but, costumer satisfaction makes it so fulfilling.
Advice to Management: Management doesn't necessarily slack, but can be all over the place. Consistency is something that needs to be worked on.

Title: "Wonderful crew"
Pros: Everyone is so friendly and encouraging and really want the best for you. Meeting new coworkers and cool customers is great.
Cons: At first, it's hard work. It's demanding and of course there's frustrating customers.
Advice to Management: Keeping hours consistent is important to your employees.

Title: "Great place to created your dream"
Pros: If you hard worker and have 13 caraterristict this place the perfect place to created your further dream.
Cons: I am glad being part of Chipotle family, now I been working for one year, I don't believe it ! Time go so fast, because I have so much fun, I enjoy every bit of what I did at work, and always make me work a lot harder if I seen smile in my customer face and when I heard great compliment about how great our food or how nice we greet them, and I always encourage my friend to keep doing awesome jobs everyday to created smile on my costumer.
Advice to Management: Bit advice from me, keep build great people of course when you select of KM or SM choose the quality people and hard worker not base who is nice and know talk only. Because one of the day that person will hold rensponsible to created new leader.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: The people were amazing at one point, the employee's themselves.
Cons: Its a lot of work for not enough pay, its nice to use chipolte on applications though it opens a lot of doors.
Advice to Management: Pay more or lower your standards, you cant have high standards and pay low. You cant work people super hard for pennies.

Title: "Team member"
Pros: Free food! Good pay, and good benifits.
Cons: Almost everything. In my time (4 months) of working there I had 5 different managers, the rudest customers, all of my employees would get high and be rude. If you have anxiety please don't work here.
Advice to Management: Learn to train better

Title: "Good food, not culture"
Pros: The food is great, you get a free meal every day you work (as opposed to lots of chains which just give you a discount on a meal), and the work is fast paced but not unreasonably demanding.
Cons: The corporate culture was not something I liked at all

Title: "Mind over Matter"
Pros: I love the people I work with, my manager rocks, it's okay to make mistakes, we strive to become better each day.
Cons: A lot of procedures, washing dishes, night shift you stay an extra hour or two just closing.
Advice to Management: Keep on communicating, motivating, encouraging employees. Need more hours

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: The best reasons to work at chipotle is because st chipotle they give you sick time, vacation time and lots of hours . At least mine does because of all the customers we get
Cons: You don't get vacation time after a year of working there sometimes they promise you things and never do it. So don't you get your hopes out to be a big shot
Advice to Management: Not all the managers are fit to be managers they promote people to fast. And the ones who really should be managers aren't

Title: "Working at Chipotle"
Pros: Great Food, Great Pay, Fast Paced Environment, Great Co-Workers, Great Management, Great Hours, Awesome Job
Cons: Sometimes Rude and Difficult Customers

Title: "Challenging but worth it"
Pros: Your team becomes your family. You all have each others backs and no one is above the other. My managers do everything that the crew members do with little to no fuss. It can be difficult at times, but in the end it's worth it.
Cons: "full-time" isn't really a thing they allow, which kinda sucks, but other than that, it's usually smooth slaying.
Advice to Management: Cut your people some slack sometimes, they're only human. But otherwise, keep up the amazing work.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Always willing to listen to employee needs/wants.
Cons: As always, the pay was too low.

Title: "Pretty nice jump into the restaurant business."
Pros: Really nice atmosphere, great employees, fun place to work.
Cons: Some of the management take themselves a little too seriously.

Title: "Chipotlayyy"
Pros:
Straight forward
Fast paced
Fair pay
Cons:
Long hours
On feet constantly moving

Title: "Cree"

Cons: Limited space. Work crowded and the technology isn't up to date to the new world
Advice to Management: Add just a little more technology in the store to make things a little easy.

Title: "Good"
Pros: Nice community environment, camaraderie on the staff, lots of opportunities for job growth and promotion within the company itself. Free food too!
Cons: Standing for long hours at a time, working conditions could get pretty hot owing to the instruments used. Work is pretty difficult on the whole depending on shift.
Advice to Management: Continue the spirit of leadership and staff support that defines the company, and continue to make yourselves available as you see fit

Title: "Take out specialist"

Title: "Fun place to work!"

Free meal during shift and 50% off once a day if off shift.

Title: "They work youhard"

Cons: ALOT of work, not enough time to complete tasks, rarely catch a break

Title: "Crew member"

Cons: The pay is subject to change and is always changing based on where you're working for the day
Advice to Management: Schedule correctly. When booking people from the schedule

Title: "Great Employer"
Pros: Excellent work environment, people are nice and the whole system is very well organized.
Cons: No cons from me, everything was as great as I possibly could have hoped for.
Advice to Management: My advice is to keep going exactly as you are now. Everything was perfect and I would work there again if I wanted an entry level job.

Title: "Warm/competetive culture"
Pros: There is so much support from management to reach your personal career goals- very impressed with the family-style culture that has been maintained as the company has grown.
Cons: Open spots are few and far between, and every spot that does become available is highly competitive to get in to.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work! The culture is empowering and the people have genuinely grown to feel like family.

Title: "Service Manager"

Advice to Management: Lead by example

Title: "Finance Group"

Cons: Uncertain future, constant budget cuts.

Title: "its an ok job"

Cons: rude customers, sometimes stressful environment, a lot of regulation for corporate.
Advice to Management: listen to employees more, not to leave everything for the last minute

Title: "Busy Restaurants, Unorganized Staff"
Pros: Free Meal, Discount, Free Uniforms, Employee Benefits
Cons: Unorganized management, Not enough pay, Inadequate training, Sometimes don't give employees breaks when they need them and then they are hungry and exhausted to the point of physical harm.
Advice to Management: Allot more time for training. When you don't train efficiently and thoroughly you end up having frustrated and inexperienced employees working in a high traffic location servicing customers who could care less about how confident they feel about their job.

Title: "IT support"
Pros: Good benefits, salaries, employees who care
Cons: Management can be hard to work with depending on team

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: The coworkers make it fun. Depending what store you work at will determine the amount of work. Restauranteur stores are aloooot of work. Overall still a decent job.
Cons: (depending on store) not flexible with hours/time off, closing sucks, don't get out till like 12 sometimes one, managers show favoritism

Title: "Best work experience!!!!"
Pros: Great people. Great business model. The company does actually care about their employees.
Cons: Hard fulltime work for practically Minimum wage until you get into upper management.

Title: "A great company, but not perfect"
Pros:
-Decent starting pay
-Opportunity to move up in the company
-Will work with you schedule and give you the hours you want
-Free meal each shift/50% off when not on the clock
-Paid breaks
-Paid sick days
-Free employee uniforms
Cons: I really enjoy working at Chipotle, but lately I've felt things are unfair and not worth the hardship. To keep it brief, its a lot of work and those who learn multiple positions don't get paid more. The fact that I can work any position in the restaurant and get paid the same as a new hire is completely unfair. Yes there are opportunities to advance with the company but the pay grade isn't that great (only a dollar higher) and it doesn't justify how much harder you'll be working.
Advice to Management: My advice would be to reward those who keep the store running. Senior crew members and new hires shouldn't be making the same.

Title: "Nice company to work for"
Pros: I liked working there because they pay their employees more than other food industry places.
Cons: None. They seemed to know how to make me happy.

Title: "Good if you love food"
Pros:
They pay you okay (cashier)
Free food when your work
1/2 off when you don't
The company has a goal and a vision (not like most companies I've worked for, especially food).
They want to make you grow and be better than you were before
It's a good day only when you're working with positive, nice people.
Cons:
Some managers have bad attitudes toward workers and plays favorites
Drama
Coworkers talk a lot of smack about others
Advice to Management: Tell the managers under you to be nicer and less condescending. And before they complain about the workers not doing their job, make sure they're correct first rather than making the workers look like they're wrong.

Title: "NO BREAK!!?!"
Pros: Honestly the only thing I can think of is frre food.
Cons:
Where do I start!
FIRST of all, I'm a cashier I work Mon-Fri at one of the busiest Chipotles in Houston. The line will literally be from the beginning of the line(where you order) to the door for 3 hours! and it even wraps around the store a couple times throughout my shift. Now normally there should be a line backer that takes care of the lobby FOR the cashier but 3 out of the 5 days I work I have to do the lobby,ice, restock the drink station,(sometimes bag chips) and check people out. This is an insane amount of work for 9.25 an hour. Once the chaos cools down the lobby is a dump the trash is overflowed and I have to clean it all alone while my manager tells me to do other things. I usually work from 10:15-5pm The slowest time of the day is around 3:30. We get about 3-10 customers around that time, therefore I attempt to take a break. I always ask my manager at around 4 for a break but she always says no. I have to clean the lobby first and refill the ice again and then i can eat. BUT WHILE I EAT I HAVE TO CHECK PEOPLE OUT AT THE SAME TIME!? I literally have to take like 3 bites then run to register and check people out and run back to my food. And my final con? I always get off late. I'm not talking 15 mins or 30 mins an HOUR someties close to two hours. My manager takes forever to count my drawer and to put in the other drawer for the next cashier. Not only that but they always count my money wrong and say im short $40 or $100 and they have to count it 6 times to realize I'm not short -_-
BOTTOM LINE: DON'T WORK HERE

Title: "Great place for a first job, they take themselves very seriously"
Pros: Free food, benefits, paid breaks, tuition reimbursement. Great place to really learn proper work place procedures. Really makes sure their employees understand what they want from them and that costumer service is opptomized
Cons: Strict rules and culture. Although they have a specific way and reason for doing everything it can be come a bit tedious and stressful at times
Advice to Management: Communicate

Title: "KMIT (Kitchen Manager in Training)"
Pros:
Free food (Leniency in amount depends on location - mine probably adds a good $2/hour worth in food)
High Quality and Standards (Food w/Integrity is a real thing, and they really value those standards)
Opportunities to grow in the company
Cons:
High Turnover (Poor treatment by managers is most common)
Good management at expense of poor leadership (tasks seem to have higher value than person)
Training Structure, meant to be active, intentional, consistent and paid - often is not.
Advice to Management: The values and systems are there. I'm only KMIT, and I completely understand the pressure that falls on the restaurant daily, but to see the gap between the tools and ideals set by the company and the lack of implementation is disheartening. How can this company find a way to develop people without every potential feeling forced to work and train off the clock?

Title: "The Job"
Pros: Nice people and environment. Everything is great.
Cons: None. Nothing is bad except they give too little hours.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: You get paid for your lunch
Cons: Management are lies to your face
Advice to Management: Tell the truth.

Title: "Difficult yet rewarding"
Pros:
Internal promotions are the focus.
Great vision.
Clear comminication.
Great training tools.
The teams are great.
Delicious food and Free food.
Cons:
50+ hour work week.
Repeatative.
Things from corporate move too fast and then change again because it hasnt been thoroughly tested.
All the pressure is on Ops.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: The opportunities are there for whoever wants to put the work in. The faster and more you learn the culture the faster you will get to the top. I love the friendships and fun times we all had
Cons: They wait till things aint going well to then have a conversation. Field leaders micro manage so much it makes you feel like your not even the GM. If you disagree with them it becomes a long term problem. I feel as if your going to promote from within please take the time out to really teach people how to be an effective leader or at least a manager.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Great flexible hours. Paid food during break. Well maintained, and good work ethic with team. Great solutions with upset customers.
Cons: Hmm sometimes can be tiring but other than that it's a great place to start working.

Title: "Terrible"
Pros: The only pro was that they did call after my application was submitted and set up an interview
Cons: They hired me, then never called me with my schedule and wouldn't answer when I called them
Advice to Management: Don't hire people unless you actually want them

Title: "Chef"
Pros: Great! I highly recommend. Success guaranteed.
Cons: None. Excellent above all else.

Title: "Financial Accountant"
Pros: Great co-workers, people culture is outstanding
Cons: Communication is not the best; loses top performers

Title: "Fantastic company"
Pros: Great Atmosphere, everyone is very friendly, great coworkers and managers, free food, the company treats you very well and makes you really respect Chipotle and all they do to keep everything clean and organic.
Cons: There is a lot of work and you do not get enough pay once you start learning all the positions.
Advice to Management: I feel that you should be paid more when you start learning more than one position. I have learned every position and constantly switch to different areas through out a shift and do way more work than people who only know 1 position. Not fair that someone who is only doing cash is getting paid the same as me, who is constantly going to different positions and helping out wherever needed and doing much more. There should be incentives to learn all the positions, not everyone can become a manager and get the pay raise. The store I work at hasn't had a manager opening for 5 months.

Title: "Great Start"
Pros: Opportunity is definitely there, just have to be motivated. Culture and rules aren't complicated, fairly easy to follow. Take the job serious, move through the ranks.
Cons: Work, work, work! Hard to even find time to take breaks. Tons of cleaning among other tedious work.
Advice to Management: Motivate your team better! Get creative and don't give up on everybody so soon.

Title: "I never see my family anymore :("
Pros: Good pay and cooking skills
Cons: long hours and exhausting work

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Great benefits, lots of opportunity, decent pay for the industry; Some bosses invested in your success; employee discount was awesome
Cons: Long and tough hours; unreasonable time expectations; confusing standards; mandates from corporate that made no sense had they been in a restaurant
Advice to Management: Listen to what your hourly managers have to say; make the job easier Be succsssful and you will fix your super high turnover rate. Pay those managers what they deserve because they have the toughest job in food service that I've ever experienced

Title: "Prep/slave"
Pros: I can't see any .
Cons: To many tasks for one person. Covering for the grill would be OK if they didn't leave for break right when you are just starting prep.
Advice to Management: Stop making people take breaks right after they start their shift. Breaks are for when your tired. 2 hrs after shift starts. Not 15 mins after it starts.

Title: "Fun, but Intense"
Pros: Excellent benefits, supportive staff, and fun work atmosphere. I feel genuinely like I am part of a larger family at Chipotle and am encouraged to do my best every day. The management is willing to work around my life, which involves a wife, an infant, and a toddler. This is a Godsend to me.
Cons:
Work at Chipotle is intense. There is no time to recollect your thoughts or take a mental break during the day. Most of the time, we don't get a full break in the morning so we have to choke down a burrito and quickly open the store. We are expected to go at full speed all the time, regardless of what we are doing. It can be mentally and emotionally draining most days. You need stamina of all types to work here.

Turnover rate is high not only for crew members, but managers as well. At my store, I had a span of three months in which my kitchen manager, service managers, apprentice, GM, and restauranteur all quit their jobs with little to no notice because they were getting burned out from having to work fifty plus hours a week. When I saw this, I decided never to become a manager. The amount of stress you are required to bear at that level is too much for me.
Advice to Management: Please stop talking about becoming a Restauranteur store. While it is the ideal goal, not everyone can reach it. It becomes discouraging to insist on that level of perfection, build up hope with three Restauranteur commitment dates, and then fail to get evaluated all three times. Settle for a store that runs well, instead of perfectly. The Chipotle vision can't solve all work-related problems and it's not the only way to make a work environment great. It's also not the end of the world if one small part of the vision falls short in an otherwise great rest of the day.

Title: "average"
Pros: they give you free meals which is pretty nice. Other than that there is not a whole lot I can say about this company. My store was not very good would not work there again
Cons: the management of my store was very poor. Other than that there is not a whole lot I can say about this company. My store was not very good would not work there again

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: The customers are, for the most part really awesome people. Hours are good
Cons: I have never seen such lack of training. Many new hires are at their first job, they need guidance. Unfortunately the manager at my store just is not able to provide that. And somehow it's o. K.
Advice to Management: Find managers that want to help people grow

Title: "Chipotle GM"
Pros: Room for advancement, good wages.
Cons: Upper management does not care about employees work life balance.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great, nice, people are ok, alright pay
Cons: mediocre food, little room to grow
Advice to Management: treat people better

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Good benefits, met a lot of great people through working there.
Cons: Upper management cared very little for employee quality of life, repeatedly talked down to employees in front of other employees, very unprofessional. Very hypocritical management.
Advice to Management: Stop expecting General managers to work 90 hours a week for a 50 hour week salary. Treat people with respect.

Title: "i LOVE my job"
Pros: Everyone gives respect and chipotle has standards and they dont mess around if you cant keep up they arent shy of letting you know or just letting you go. I respect my job, its really changed me into a better person i believe.
Cons: If you cant handle fast pace and elevation then don't bother

Title: "Unprofessional"
Pros: Free food, sometimes nice coworkers, meet new people, build friendships with customers as well as coworkers
Cons: Bad management, rude customers, underpaid to do slave work, no breaks in the morning because you don't finish fast enough
Advice to Management: Be more professional because it's very unprofessional, if you want your crew to get on break or get work done get off your lazy butt in the office please

Title: "Cash register, made food"
Pros:
great people
great food
great customer service
Cons:
late nights
tired
annoying customers
standing a lot
temptation
Advice to Management: n/a

Title: "crew"
Pros: Make your own borittos 5
Cons: Minimum wage scrub lord 5
Advice to Management: lol

Title: "A good place to start"
Pros:
- Excellent pay for an entry food service position
- High hiring standards helps to ensure that coworkers are very good to work with
- Very flexible to other schedules (school, activities, etc.)
Cons:
- Very faced paced and requires multi-tasking, sometimes past reasonable limits
- Pushes for efficiency can make the job seem like all business sometimes.

Title: "Great company but not too great with people"
Pros: Good pay, good benefits just for GM and apprentices
Cons: Not life, working 10 plus hrs every day no OT not weekends not time for family.
Advice to Management: Great people is leaving and not one take the time to say thank you

Title: "Poor Management"
Pros: Free meal card, central location to transportation, & great company values.
Cons: Very poor Management with little oversight and therefore high turnover, management was embarrassingly unprofessional, & promotion was based on popularity contest.
Advice to Management: If you have one manager who is responsible for the turnover of sixteen employees, perhaps it would be in your best interest to investigate this manager. Manager was extremely unprofessional, did not know how to do the job he was managing, and played the popularity game. It's really sad because the culture of the company is so great but how blind can you be to ignore the money you are losing from outstanding items due to the high turnover of one crummy manager?

Title: "Area manager - Not the brightest outlook"
Pros: The company has an amazing vision. They have done a great job of connecting the vision into operations which helps everyone go after the same goal. It's something that isn't easy to do, but Chipotle did a great job getting everyone to go after this one goal. The food is also delicious. Free food can't be beat.
Cons: The vision is great, but once Chipotle was hit with the food safety outbreak, the vision was pushed to the side. Many people left because it wasn't about the people anymore. To make matters worse, the CEOs and upper management had no idea what they were doing. They did not know how to fix the problem yet expected everyone else to follow everything they rolled out. It was complete chaos and no end in sight.
Advice to Management: Focus on what made this company the Golden egg. Happy employees lead to happy customers. Happy customers lead to more sales. The focus went straight to food safety without even thinking about the repercussions. Get customers back by focusing on your employees. They're all stressed out and the company isn't doing much about it.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Get to meet a lot of cool people, free food/50% discount.
Cons: Must have a doctors note when calling in sick, strict managers, hard work especially for grill, smell really gross after work, low pay, call you in frequently on your days off.
Advice to Management: Work on connecting with your crew members and help them improve.

Title: "Its ok"
Pros:
The crew
The environment
The vision
Cons: It's like a high school movie
Advice to Management: Be more professional

Title: "Team member"
Pros: Good for someone with no food industry skills.
Cons: Will learn some knife skills, but will gain little culinary experience.

Title: "Good job but a lot of work."
Pros: Easy advancement, flexible hours, consistent raises, able to relocate for convenience.
Cons: Very team oriented, if one person calls out the entire day can turn into shambles.

Title: "Good pay"
Pros: Good family place to work.
Cons: You have to work very hard to move up, if you slack off you won't go anywhere.
Advice to Management: Nothing, Jillian and Joshua are amazing.

Title: "Decent company to work for"
Pros: The training process is great! They put you through a series of 4 days with your trainer for your position then you're on your own. For the most part everyone you work with is great to be around and caring.
Cons: The management isn't that good. Not everyone is caring or great to be around. They don't exactlycare" about the employees as much as they claim to when being hired or interviewed.

Title: "Corporate Employee"
Pros: Food with Integrity mission, people-focused, young company. Food is delicious, and some amazing people work for the company. Lot's of potential within the corporate office; unfortunately the company is bleeding talent.
Cons: Disorganized, political, poor executive team, not transparent, not open to new ideas- promotes the same people expecting different results. No professional development for corporate staff- only Operations. No resources ($) for high level projects that will make the company better.
Advice to Management: Treasure your corporate office staff, not only Operations. Re-evaluate Ops management from the top down and make drastic changes.

Title: "not the same"
Pros: Great people to work with
Cons: Don't give 2nd chances to good employees

Title: "A company that could be fun to work for"
Pros: The best parts of working for chipotle all boil down to the free meals and discounted meals employees get for working there. They have great food and are a fun atmosphere with the customers
Cons: Lack of structural organization makes it very easy for management to destroy a store systematically and encourages theft, often letting lower level crew members get blamed.
Advice to Management: Tighten up your management methods, and increase the checks and balances to ensure that management can't put blame on employees for thefts they can be behind.

Title: "Corporate"
Pros: They celebrate small successes and their focus is on getting the job done. Very open and supportive to developing their internal staff and promoting within.
Cons: can become very rigid when you challenge the wrong person although they encourage it. Claims its apart of development but truth be told it is your death sentence. if you want to be successful here don't grow a brain and know your place if your in leadership.
Advice to Management: Recognize that you don't know everything that goes on in the outside word. Be more open and do exit interviews vs. reading Glassdoor. Take the responses to your meetings and truly look at how you may have miss the bar a few times THEN make steps toward getting better. Acknowledge you don't have all the answers inside the CHIP. Your ex-employee list is getting bigger than your employee list....that's not always good.

Title: "Chipotle-Natick"
Pros:
All you can eat during working hours without having to pay
The values are in the right place, not sure if I would consider them "carried out" in their stores.
Cons:
Most fellow employees did not care at all
Poor management
Dirty building
Poor cleaning
Would run out of everything all the time
Unhappy employees
Advice to Management:
Hire people who actually care
Hire people who know how to be professional
Make sure that training is properly done

Title: "Crew"
Pros: Excellent people. Opportunities to move to up to corporate
