Cons: None. Unless you don't have great leaders
Advice to Management: Take care of your people and they will take care of you

Title: "Great kickstarter job!"
Pros:
The atmosphere is fast paced (if you like that)
Friendly coworkers
Free meal during shift !
Fifty percent off when not on shift
Cons: The manager could be sometimes a hassle to deal with , and the job is tiring. Time does go by fast though!
Advice to Management: Keep it up !

Title: "Thanks but no thanks"
Pros:
Crew members were great and supportive.
You get discounted meals.
Cons:
You only get one shirt.
I had to use my own hat.
They give you one day to train, sometimes not even.
The mid-tier manager at my store was unsupportive and negative.
I told them that I had certain disabilities and they put me on the hardest job with heavy lifting and bending over.
They don't schedule in breaks so if you work more than 5 hours and if its busy, you don't get a break.
For washing dishes, there's no rubber gloves or plastic aprons, so you'll get soaked by the end of the day.
Advice to Management:
If a future employee tells you they're disabled, think about where you're putting them.
Also, if you have an employee thats bleeding, don't tell them to just "be more careful" and have that person prepare all the food for everyone and wash the dishes with open wounds. That's how people get diseases.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Fun environment, good food, was appreciated by coworkers and never felt belittled; always felt like an integral part of the company
Cons: management at store was poorly trained and stealing food then blaming it on everyone else in the store so that was pretty awful

Title: "great job"
Pros:
-Coworkers are great
-Working as a team makes the job smoother and more fun for the workers and makes the customers experience better
-Pays well
-fast paced job (for those who like that)
Cons:
-It makes everyones job harder when people don't show up to work
-little space to work in
-loud on the line so it can be hard to hear customers
Advice to Management: -try and schedule maybe an extra person each shift incase people call off

Title: "Have to know everything"
Pros: Good benifits and the hours are good if you ask for them
Cons: The schedule is changed every weeek
Advice to Management: At least be able to make sure we take hour lunch properly and not make us close the store and leave at 11pm and then open the store the next say at 8a am

Title: "OK place to work!"
Pros: Free food, free uniforms and 3 days sick leave from the start.
Cons: Stressful, lots of work and no break if you don't finish your job in the time they think you should be finished!

Title: "Easy"
Pros: The crew members are friendly.
Cons: It is just a lot of work.
Advice to Management: Responsible

Title: "I love it!"
Pros: They are incredibly flexible with scheduling, as well as innovative in their ways of making our store better. Everyone is always upbeat, and we are like a family.
Cons: Anytime something that could be considered a con pops up, everyone is already working to fix it. So there really isn't anything bad about our store. We are clean, happy, encouraging, and everyone fits the 13 characteristics Chipotle is known for.
Advice to Management: Keep being great. I couldn't ask for a better GM or management. I hear people complain at other jobs about management, and I know I'm lucky to not have such problems.

Title: "Team member"
Pros: Great place to work. Friendly team members and you guys get the job done.... Good for entry level as well
Cons: Poor communication between the managers and the team at times....
Advice to Management: better communication

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Pleasant people to work with. Organized and responsible. Well run team.
Cons: Low pay for the amount of work to be done. Food industry not for everyone but good learning experience.
Advice to Management: No advice to management. Very hard from the start but seems like there is incentive to stay and move upward on the ladder through time spent there.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros:
-The people were fantastic to work with! After leaving I still remain good friends with a lot of them. -It pays pretty well
-High quality food standards is definitely respectable.
-Free food during shift
Cons:
-Stressful doesn't even begin to describe. When the team works well it's great, but if even one person is falling behind it's a nightmare with long lines of frustrated customers.
-At least the location I worked at, too much drama among crew and management. Felt like a Spanish soap opera at times.
-Pays well, but for the amount of work it could be more since literally everything is made by the crew. You feel it the most during a rush.
-Some people were promoted who were not fit to be promoted and it hurt morale and productivity.
Advice to Management: Take more time training those you'd like to promote. While it's important to move the pipeline along, just because someone's good in their current position doesn't mean they automatically qualify for the next.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Room to move up in the business
Cons: A lot of work for little pay

Title: "Experience"
Pros: Nice environment, clean and functional. Very great place for a first job.
Cons: Extremely busy on days, can be stressful too
Advice to Management: None, I guess

Title: "Discrimination"
Pros: I can run the place and they will stop cross contamination with all their food
Cons: The crew is slow ,they are suppose to open at 10:00am and the only good they had in line was beans pinto and they had 5people there and they opened at 11:00am not on my shift that would never happen I hire the crew not the crew hire me
Advice to Management: Poor hiring techniques

Title: "No work/life balance"
Pros: Passion for high quality food
Cons: Be prepared to work minimum 11 hours a day, likely more. Employees do NOT care for outside hires so be prepared to face a lot of backlash and negativity.

Title: "Not worth it"
Pros:
Free food
Some customers leave tips
Cons:
Passive agressive management
Managers do not take your schedule into consideration
Unorganized

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Free food every shift over a certain amt of hrs. Awesome fresh food. Opportunity for moving up. Great culture. The training materials are awesome and clear.
Cons: Very fast paced. Sometimes managers are not interested in helping you move up further and you just have to fight your way through that. I think it's against the culture they're trying to create.
Advice to Management: Give people breaks, whether they're fast enough or not. Either help them through it, or let them go.

Title: "crew member"
Pros: flexibility, great for being a student
Cons:
stressful but can be rewarding at the same time.
management can be an issue if they're not on the same page
Advice to Management: chipolte will give you the opportunity to move and educate the message of food with integrity.

Title: "Work at chipotle"
Pros: Good place to grow, good food, easier than most places to move up the corporate ladder. Experience at chipotle helps instill good traits that promote a better lifestyle.
Cons: Pay isn't reflective of the work, dry and hot work environment (not too hard to get used to thought), lead-footed management (above the restaurant level)
Advice to Management: Take time to understand each store and work with them, even though performance and efficiency is the no. 1 priority. Meaning sometimes make performance and efficiency second priority to the needs of the restaurant in certain cases.

Title: "Great company!"
Pros:
Free food
Great culture
Lots of fun events
Strong management philosophy
Cons:
Unpredictable time for the company right now
Difficult to get promoted

Title: "line worker"
Pros: nice breaks, management was nice
Cons: intense during busy times, work can be tricky

Title: "Crew"
Pros: Good team atmosphere, fair pay
Cons: low job growth, slow turnover

Title: "Chipotle is life"
Pros: Its so fun you will find amazing people there to work with everyone is nice and funny.its a fast pace job
Cons: Alot customers will be rude to u and customers are sooo picky
Advice to Management: Work hard and help your team to be the best chipotle restaurant and care for your team and have meetings everyday or once a week and be hard on your team

Title: "I love my job!"
Pros: My boss cares about each and every one of us. Co-workers care and are willing to help out when someone has a hard day. I was in a car wreck a few weeks ago and everyone wanted to make sure that I was okay before I came back to work. They are like a second family.
Cons: At chipotle, we have to work as a team. Which is wonderful for the most part. However, there are somedays that you can be stuck cleaning up after a lazy worker. Thankfully, management is pretty quick about firing all lazy employees.
Advice to Management: Give us another worker per-shift. We need to be able to train the crew better.

Title: "Great job"
Pros: A strong family like environment, everyone puts in their all or they're let go, we support each other
Cons: Sometimes the stress can get to you, like days where the shifts are short one or two people and there's a line out the door
Advice to Management: Sometimes some managers pay more attention to the shift and the people instead of their own personal lives

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: The atmosphere is so positive. It's very fast-paced and there is always room to improve. Ifor you love constantly striving to be better, this job is perfect. Plus, you get a lot of free food when you're working and if you're not, 50% off.
Cons: Sometimes it can be very stressful to be at your top performance all the time. At times you feel like you're running around trying to get everything done all at once and it's hard to handle at times.
Advice to Management: So far management has done everything they're supposed to do. I've never had problem but if there is one thing I would change is that I feel as though the cashiers literally do everything. There should be someone delegated to the upkeep of the bathrooms and patio so the cashier isn't always frantically running back and forth. Also, the schedules. I hate how everything is with a pencil and paper, you should be able to check your schedule electronically.

Title: "Chipotle experience"
Pros: High energy, fast pace working enviornment, busy always have something to do
Cons: Low salary pay, unfair working hours, required to fulfill task ourside of job description
Advice to Management: Be fair to all crew members, no matter the age or experience

Title: "My opinion on Chipotle"
Pros: Chipotle always hires great people, fun working environment, the company truly does care about your well being
Cons: Repetitive job assignments, some managers aren't hard working/constantly telling you to pick up their slack
Advice to Management: Get more involved in every store, visit more often to hold managers accountable.

Title: "Work is okay, but asked for a lot more than being paid"
Pros: Free meal every shift. Half off when not working. Not too much time to move up positions. Crew interviews are nice because future coworkers will decide if they want you or not.
Cons: Managers can be unprofessional and favoritism is shown a lot even with upper management. They do not use the software for scheduling so have to wait for managers to print it out.
Advice to Management: Treat everyone with respect. Hours vary way to much. Cleaning procedures need to be updated. Ex: Scrubbing tortilla press or grill with a scot brite scrub or charcoal which you breath in.

Title: "This job is as good or bad as you make it"
Pros:
The crew is an extremely tight group of people.
We are usually so busy that we don't have time to complain during service hours, which actually helps us feel more positive, and after service hours or during downtime our conversation is never about the shift because it would just be the same conversation every night.
We all watch each other's backs and work together the best we can.
Our managers are very positive and straight forward with their input and expectations.
We have fun.
If you work hard you'll better yourself and get out faster.
Cons: More of a problem with the individual employees than the company as a whole, lots of employees leave and the hiring process is long enough that it creates very long weeks for other employees (for example, three employees left my establishment, two are moving and one was overwhelmed by school) and in that I wind up working 70 hours in a pay period while still in school.
Advice to Management: Hire more people in quick succession because many young new hire will flake out and decide to leave within the first two months. Try hiring 3-4 applicants at once and do orientation with 2 at a time.

Title: "Chipotle is good to work"
Pros: Good discount on food.
Cons: Have to look at the food and not eat it.
Advice to Management: Free food on lunch breaks

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Good hours, flexible schedules, good coworkers
Cons: Managers did not stay long, high turnover rate, long hours without breaks

Title: "Cashier/Line"
Pros: Free CHIPOTLEEEEE :D I could eat it every day anyway so getting double steak + guac & chips any shift I worked & half off on days I wasn't working was awesome!!!!!
Cons: We went thru a lot of different managers unfortunately so moving up the latter didn't quite happen in the time frame it should have due to the constant change of management -_-
Advice to Management: No matter what we're all a team and in order for the ship to sail correctly we ALL have to work together as a crew. Teach smiles, courtesy and effiency for our guest to new employees in a respectful manner. Chipotle is a great starter company to work for and if you end up moving up great just remember to work together always <3 :D!

Title: "cashier"
Pros: good working conditions with a lot of help. It's a great job right out of college. I would suggest any liberal arts major to give it a try.
Cons: sometimes during lunch there are too many customers. the customers are very picky and always want thing for free
Advice to Management: Give more time to setup before the doors open. Take a look at the stools...they need to be replaced

Title: "Prep/ Grill"
Pros: Flexible schedule, a decent pay with benefits, and fun to work with crew.
Cons: When people called off the work and you have to do extra work or come in to work on day off. It isn't good place to work if there isn't good crew without work ethic. So if you have right attitude and work ethic and everyone's job position will be easier.

Title: "Fair"
Pros: Great for a plan B career choice. Very lax environment . Everyone is very easy to connect with and you will also have a strong connection with your field leaders
Cons: Once you get promoted they don't care about your personal life it all becomes about the job , so not a good job for some one with a family
Advice to Management: Fair

Title: "Worth It, if you really need it"
Pros: It's an easy and fun job. You get a free meal every time you work, as well as a discount at your location.
Cons: Some customers are rude and don't respect your job serving food. Customers can be demanding and file useless complaints because you will not serve them extra portions of food. But management usually understands.
Advice to Management: Make sure all employees are notified of changes within the store.

Title: "Kitchen manager"
Pros: Working in a kitchen and getting experience working in that type of environment. Also learning how to handle certain situations.
Cons: Micromanaging and the procedures after the health outbreaks.
Advice to Management: Nothing

Title: "fun but stressful"
Pros: This job is definitely made for younger people. very fast environment. management isn't always consistent as people come and go. they are willing to work with you as long as you show interest and high skill in what you do here. speaking spanish is a huge plus if you want to get promoted quickly.
Cons: the hours can be hectic fo someone who has kids
Advice to Management: stay consistent and work on scheduling more effectivey,

Title: "Great team environment"
Pros: Great staff to work with together!
Cons: Fast paced, high output demanded.

Title: "hours sucked"
Pros: free food,nice uniform,very clean, sweet discounts
Cons: hours, unprofessional management, bad turn out rate
Advice to Management: dont gossip

Title: "Burritos"
Pros: Free burritos. And guac. Yum.
Cons: Asked questions like "White or brown rice?" about 50-gazillion times.

Title: "Hard Work"
Pros: Great benefits, fast pace, employee discounts on food which is an appeal for students seeking part time employment
Cons: A lot expected of you immediately, overwhelming workload at times, strict demand for obeying policy
Advice to Management: Be more patient with employees when they are first brought on, this will ease the transition as well as the stress that accompanies it.

Title: "Good Beginning Jon"
Pros: Great opportunities for upward mobility, friendly managers, very training oriented, and very upbeat.
Cons: Over work sometimes, can be understaffed at times. Can be a little too fast pace from time to time.
Advice to Management: Always make sure to have adequate staff on hand.

Title: "good"
Pros: Managers are really good, I work at a restauranteur Chipotle so they have really high standards, pretty hard, rewarding work, get trained on all positions( not full training, you just pick up the skills)
Cons: really hard work, hard to keep up sometimes,

Title: "Apprentice"
Pros:
Benefits
People Culture
Great Food
Fast paced
Career ladder
Cons:
Stressful
No time to complete work
Never recognized for hard work
Too little pay for all you do
Advice to Management: Treat your people with respect. They're people, not robots. Positive vibes will make for a great restaurant experience for all...customers and crew!

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: room for advancement, good pay, free meal, good discount
Cons: physically draining, using a knife all day everyday leads to carpal tunnel

Title: "Decent job; great company"
Pros:
Great atmosphere, management will teach you what you need to know
Better pay than most food jobs, customers are usually very pleasant
Simple processes that are easy to learn
Cons:
Scheduling is not great, but that's the nature of the business. Peak times are EXHAUSTING, and you will receive constant correction on how to keep the dining room clean, but it is to be expected.
It is fast paced and can be really hard if you are not used to that. A few times I was expected to be off an hour or more past my scheduled time.
Advice to Management: Always remember that you started at Crew and worked your way up. Don't negate what others are trying to do in the interest of bettering yourself.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Free meals, great management learning experience, advancement pipeline in place for those that want to advance.
Cons: Probably the same as any other food service job. Sometimes you get long hours and closing can take a long time due to the standards of cleanliness that Chipotle has.
Advice to Management: This would be more so to upper corporate management. All of the free food promotions simply put kill your employees enthusiasm and make them hate their jobs.

Title: "Overall, I learned a lot of things at Chipotle that I could use moving forward with my career. You meet great people."
Pros: Sometimes there is opportunity to grow. Learn alot about Food cost and such things that you probably go to school for.
Cons: Unstable schedule, if you're short people, you're short people. Stressful when in the wrong situations.
Advice to Management: Pay for the amount of work you assign your managers.

Title: "Good for a fast food job"
Pros: fun people, tasty food, flexible schedule
Cons: very stressful, low pay, managers can be awful!!
Advice to Management: Don't be so hard on people for not being perfect making burritos at a rapid pace making minimum wage!

Title: "Great place to work!"
Pros: The benefits for being a part-time employee are awesome. They will reimburse you for a large portion of your tuition costs. Free food when you work. Busy but fun atmosphere!
Cons: Customers can be horrible. Not enough pay for what you have to deal with (customers, labor). Not much to complain about!
Advice to Management: keep it up!

Title: "Working at Chipotle"
Pros:
-Good atmosphere
-Great team
-Serving healthy food
- better pay then average fast food resteraunts
Cons:
- Childishness in staff
- Sometimes unrealistic expectation
- grouchy customers
Advice to Management: Stay organized

Title: "Marketing Strategist"
Pros: Awesome people culture and training
Cons: Constant shifts in direction - frequently shifting focus

Title: "Hectic"
Pros:
paid breaks
one free meal
good hours
fun environment
Cons:
Short time expectations
don't always get full break
very busy all the time
Advice to Management: work on hiring more people and allowing more time to complete task.

Title: "Good as a First Job"
Pros: Great work environment. Free meal.
Cons: Very busy during peak hours.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
Fun
Free food
Eat while working
Cons:
Underpaid
Closing is a drag
Advice to Management: Provide grill 2's

Title: "Very tough but can be rewarding"
Pros: After a year of work, offers tuition reimbursement for students meeting certain criteria. Offers health, vision and dental insurance.
Cons: Depending on the store, can be very tough work. Will often have to work 2 peoples worth of work.
Advice to Management: Reconsider the business model so it's not so stressful for anyone at the store level to make things work.

Title: "Give it up."
Pros: Great place for high school kids to learn about work place etiquette.
Cons: Lack of commitment by leadership and defending a dirty company.
Advice to Management: Cease business.

Title: "General manager"
Pros: Great culture, what chipotle stands for is something you can apply in everyday life. They really care about the happiness of their employees
Cons: Constantly busy, very stressful an extreme amount of expectations that get over whelming at times. Crew members can get paid the same amount or more by doing something easier at neighboring chains. Hard to keep employees do to the constant changes.
Advice to Management: Your hard work will pay off, don't give up.

Title: "Chipotle Mexican Grill"
Pros: Food was good and employees get free or subsidized meals.
Cons: Working way too hard for low pay. Management was not great.
Advice to Management: It is more important to focus on individual store needs than general corporate ideals.

Title: "Not worth it"
Pros:
Pay
Free Chipotle
Learn kitchen skills
Tuition reimbursement
Cons:
Everything else
Poor upper management
The Restaurateur program everyone strives so much for is a scam
Advice to Management: Take a better look at who is running your stores.

Title: "crew member/ grill cook"
Pros: Great food and work environment. Industry leading food safety regulations. Great benefits and discount on food. A free meal ever shift.
Cons: A constant shortage of workers that are over 18 and reliable to help close restaurant. There are several key members missing from upper management to help run restaurant most effectively.
Advice to Management: Increase wages slightly higher to attract a better quality of workers to ensure all standards of Chipotle Mexican Grill are being met and upheld. This will help diminish the stress of all employees.

Title: "crew"
Pros: Great environment, everyone is friendly
Cons: constant schedule changes, makes it complicated

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros:
Friendly co-workers
Free meals every shift
Casual dress-code
Cons:
No real benefits unless you are upper management, and even then the benefits aren't anything to write home about
Upper-upper management is so far removed from the crew's job that they have unrealistic expectations of what can and should be done
The occasional miserable customer
Advice to Management: Please pay your crew more than what you do now. While the work is easy in that it doesn't take a lot of training, the work is difficult. By that I mean there is a LOT of work to be done, and really not enough people or time to get it done.

Title: "Chipotle Cashier and Crew"
Pros: Good co-workers, great management, nice tips.
Cons: Asked to stay all day or longer than your shift, night crew has to clean a lot more, cashier has too many responsibilities.
Advice to Management: Schedule part-timers only part-time, don't call them in a lot and have them work over 40 hrs a week.

Title: "Managment"
Pros: Great for developing people and ensuring that only knowledgeable people can get promoted. Definitely enjoyed working for the company
Cons: People can easily take advantage of promotion system an people who are not qualified but liked are put in line first regardless of crew opinion.
Advice to Management: If someone is in training for service or kitchen there should be a slight pay raise, especially because of all the extra work and effort put in.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros:
Move up quick
Family environment
Cons:
Over worked
Not properly trained

Title: "Chipotle Crew Member Review"
Pros: Free food is awesome you can get on each day you work. Good people and work culture. Tuition reimbursement came in handy- after one year of working you are eligible to receive up to around $5000 for your tuition, books, fees, etc.
Cons: It's a tough place to work if you work near a big city (eg NYC). Definitely need a sense of urgency if you want to work here and get tasks completed in a timely manner or your hours will be cut.
Advice to Management: Take time to thoroughly train employees and believe in everyone.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Excellent tuition reimbursement, 401k, health care, paid sick time, paid vacation time.
Cons: High turnover rate of employees and also low performing employees makes my job as a manager difficult and I am stressed often. I have not seen any potential for growth in the previous year from my position. Your success within the company depends on who your store manager is and how well they manage everyone. I have a GM who is a great hardworking person but does not create encouraging circumstances for development. I love this company and what they stand for but Ive been stuck in a hamster wheel for too long and am needing to find better opportunities.
Advice to Management: Sit down with your people and do 1 on 1's like you are supposed to do. When people have goals to work towards they have a plan and they feel part of something.

Title: "It was okay"
Pros:
Fun at first
Great free food
Active Job
Quick advancement
Cons: Everything depends on who you work with and who you serve meaning you get a ton of both good and terrible.
Advice to Management: Empowerment of good employees is important and don't be afraid to stand up to the bad ones.

Title: "General Manager-Area Manager"
Pros: Chipotle is ALL about the people. Great product starts with having great people. As a manager your most important duty is creating an empowered culture of top performers.
Cons: Slow growth potential. When I started I was told it would be easy for me to climb up the ladder into more important roles, which has proven to be more difficult than explained in interview and training process.
Advice to Management: Start with the people, make sure you continue to hire only the best people for the individual position. Only then will you be able to breed a truly beautiful empowered culture where every team member feels responsible for the restaurant as a whole.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great atmosphere and work ethic
Cons: not good enough pay for work done

Title: "Line cook job"
Pros: Free food, nice people, ok pay, lots to learn
Cons: off the clock work, highschool kids
Advice to Management: stop overworking the employees

Title: "Great place to work and opportunity for growth"
Pros: The companies business structure is great and they really care about the development of employees.
Cons: A lot of physical labor, naturally. Dealing with part-time employees can be tiresome at times and their could be delays in getting approvals for promotions.

Title: "Started off as a great atmosphere, but progressively became worse"
Pros:
-Good atmosphere and team environment
-They try to be flexible with your hours
-Good benefits for employees who work more
Cons:
-Very understaffed and a high turnover rate
-Stressful environment, especially if you run out of food on the line
-Managers do not adhere to schedule requirements
Advice to Management: -Focus more on training. Although we have books, you require us to do tasks never learned before and it harms the business as a whole. In addition, follow the schedules of the employees to reduce turnover rates.

Title: "Fun but can be stressful"
Pros: You get to learn how to work as a team and how to interact with customers. You also get to learn how to work in a very fast paced environment.
Cons: Sometimes the job can be very stressful especially when you have a line to the door, occasionally you may run out of food an customers can be very impatient and get angry at you. Expect to always work at least 10 minutes past the time you're scheduled to get off and at night time never expect to close on time.
Advice to Management: Get more people to work at one time, it can be too overwhelming only having a few team members to close up the restaurant or deal with lines for two hours.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Great People, excellent benefits, competitive pay, and impressive growth opportunities. Chipotle is a good choice for entry level candidates to progress and gain leadership skills as well as food and customer service skills.
Cons: Finding a balance between work and home life can be difficult, depending on your market. This is particularly tough once you reach a salary level.
Advice to Management: During tough company transitions, your people are the most important element in the company. If they aren't happy, it is vitally important to diagnose and treat this symptom, for the sake of the culture. Otherwise, keep on keeping on

Title: "Crew"
Pros: Free meal every shift.
Cons: Took a month after hiring to actually have hours. Did not respect the hours requested. Got way too many for being full time student, complained and dropped to five hours. Did not care about disabilities or allergies.
Advice to Management: Communication between manager and employee needs work. Be understanding and actually train your employees fully and not just throw them somewhere new and get mad when they do not know how.

Title: "Working at chipotle"
Pros: Family enviornment, friendly, flexible hours
Cons: Fast paced, confusing, angry customers

Title: "Interesting company to work for"
Pros: The management and other staff were very attentive and understanding of training, and made every effort to make this job easier to learn.
Cons: The hours were not as good in my case they had me coming at 6:00 PM- 12:00 AM only to go in at 7:00 am next day
Advice to Management: Fix employment hours!

Title: "Great"
Pros: It was great. The crew was awesome to work with. Great working environment and great food. Overall fun time. Learned a lot there
Cons: Not enough opportunities for advancement. Pay isnt great. Work is very hard and leaves you coming home sore.
Advice to Management: Keep up the great work. Try to spice things up a bit more and try to not be so quick to place too much work on people.

Title: "Great place to work."
Pros: I worked with good people. It was a relaxed atmosphere. They have a system that works well. You can gain a lot from working here. The food is also really good quality!
Cons: The starting out pay is too low, but they also have fast advancment oppertunities.
Advice to Management: Use more positove reinforcements. Rather than scolding. Verbaly let your employees know what areas they are succeeding in.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: flexible hours, clean environment, good team atmosphere
Cons: No real cons at this time

Title: "They don't pay for overtime"
Pros: Free burrito every shift worked.
Cons: It's a work mill and they don't really care about people despite the image portrayed.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "cashier"
Pros: Free food, paid lunches, 50% off if you want to take food home.
Cons: Very immature bosses, not good with scheduling, demand that you put chipotle before everything else.

Title: "Part-Time Crew Member"
Pros: The food would have to be one of the most convenient perks, but of course they have personal benefits as well. Those include the health insurance and the tuition reimbursement, which was the initial reason I applied for the restaurant.
Cons: Perhaps it is my store and managers, but the work environment is very corporate. If you're taking time to help customers on the line during rush, you're slowing throughput, yet they want you to "not be robot." Those are words they used. Sometimes you'll get ridiculous time constraints for prepping stuff or making certain items, or even dishes. I understand it's a fast-paced environment, and I've had my previous experience in that, but nothing needs to be that fast. I don't believe it's slowing down or speeding up the overall pace.
Advice to Management: Understand that your employees are human.

Title: "A great work environment, lacking employee support"
Pros:
- Worked with an amazing team, reason I was able to stay for as long as I did (almost 2 years)
- Working the line is great and easy (if you don't mind monotonous work, difficult to hear customers, and occasional glass touching-finger pointing)
- Teaches a great work ethic and life skills
- Great system: organized, detailed (lots of training material available), benefits
- Great "culture": Top Performers Empowered to achieve High Standards (look it up before applying)
- Ample amount of supplies
- Provided work shirts, flexibility to bottoms (jeans, shorts, leggings, whatever)
- BENEFITS: free meal (including guac) every shift/or 30 min. break, tuition reimbursement (accessible after a year of employment?), and health benefits (which I did not take advantage of, but has a reputation of being one the best in industry)
- Employees (Including line workers) help with the hiring process
THE STANDARDS
"Opportunities"

- Worked under 2 great GM's
Cons:
The hats, the lingering after shift smells
Aesthetic of SHOES FOR CREWS.
Either extremely slow, or extremely busy
- Not given enough time to train, even on down times
Holiday Hours: arriving earlier/staying past midnight

THE STANDARDS
Almost UNREASONABLE work demands
- Once you leave the line, be expected to work like a horse
- Closing in general sucked, but BACK HOUSE is WORST HOUSE (deep clean, dishes, wipedown, trash, etc. all on you)
- Having assistance from your team is great, but when you don't is horrible/expect to solo close
- As a closer, expected to close down your station practically by yourself; including "deep cleans" every night
- As an opener, expected to prep a ridiculous amount of work by yourself and finish before your break
- Dishes, dishes, and dishes (Youll be a pro by the time youre finished)

-We were always understaffed (which led to some schedule strictness)
-Difficulty getting shifts covered once you move up, even as an opener/closer
-Promotions: Was promoted to KMIT- more responsibilities and work, ONLY $1 raise
"Opportunities"/LIES- system that encourages employees to move up, but once there, nothing happens; told that theyd be given a store to GM, store never opens; locked in the manager position they want you at, even if you are more than competent

GREAT GMs, HORRIBLE UPPER MANAGEMENT; BEWARE THE AREA MANAGER and changes
- Not only pathetic sincerity, really didn't give a damn about employees
- Would move managers store to store, without given a choice
- If disliked, you get shafted into the worst store and stuck there without any chance of promotion
Advice to Management:
Youve heard the spiel before:

Get your act together, actually care about the employees, better pay for that ridiculous amount of work, actually create a culture and environment that nurtures Top Performers who feel Empowered.

Title: "Love it but.."
Pros:
1. coworkers are a blast
2. sometimes there are very nice customers which is rewarding
3. free food during shifts
4. paid breaks
5. can be fun when everyones in a great mood
Cons:
1. scheduling SUCKS (past 3 weeks ive been getting 8 hours)
2. work 15-30 min past when shift is supposed to end
3. managers give more hours to their favorites
4. stressful
5. 4 hour shifts no breaks
6. for me ive been at chipotle for 4 months and haven't moved up at all (only work on line and rarely expo)
Advice to Management:
figure out scheduling in a better way
stop w the favoritism especially those who work hard and get no recognition
cut your crew some slack were stressed

Title: "Hard Work"
Pros: Free food. You learn how to manage a small restaurant with an equally small crew yet have the ability to accommodate crowds of customers.
Cons: Hours are long and clean up is a little tough especially in the kitchen or grill area. The team is small so if someone calls off and cannot be covered, all the extra work is laid on the rest of the team.
Advice to Management: Managers need to lead by example and inspire individuals to work hard. They must show employees that they can do the work cook/clean etc. just as good if not better. If workers are discouraged especially from lack of movement in the company, then culture and food with integrity suffers.

Title: "Take Out Specialist"
Pros: great environment, decent pay, awesome food, and cool coworkers/friends. they have benefits too.
Cons: fast-paced. get plenty of hours.

Title: "Service Manager, Training Coordinator"
Pros: The people are fantastic and we can have a lot of fun on shift. I've seriously met some really cool and hardworking individuals here at both store and corporate levels.
Cons: Stressful, labor intensive, corporate always breathing down your neck. Company works from an idealistic view rather than a realistic one and that puts too much pressure on management and crew.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: The people are amazing and you get to learn all aspects of restaurant operations
Cons: Very hard work, can sometimes be stressful when you are behind on prep and the store is full with people
Advice to Management: Keep elevating employees

Title: "Time keeps getting edited"
Pros:
Great people
Decent pay
Tuition reimbursement opportunity for those willing to hang around
Free food every day
Cons:
Not getting paid for overtime (ahem)
Healthcare benefits under Preventative Plus PPO don't cover much
MUST to bring in doctor's note if you call out even if it's for a cold (good luck affording that)
Advice to Management:
Pay your workers and stop editing their time so they don't get full-time benefits.
If you work them that long, give them the pay and benefits they worked for.

Title: "Great place, very strict."
Pros: Chipotle cares very much about it's employees and it's culture. It was a great place for me to work and it set my standards for fast food environments high.
Cons: If you do not work well under fast paced environments that require you to learn very quickly, your will not enjoy working for Chipotle
Advice to Management: I understand that Chipotle is very time constrained, however, it is important to allow time for growth for new employees, especially if Chipotle is their first job.

Title: "Great Opportunities that sometimes fall flat"
Pros:
-great team environment
-growth is possible if you work hard
- upper management that is easy to talk to and who cares for one another.
Cons:
-so much more work than what you are payed.
-long hours
-growth stops at a certain point.
Advice to Management: Listen to managers sometimes when they say they understand the changes and let them implement changes in the way that works for their restaurant. No two restauarants are the same so don't treat it that way.

Title: "Find a slower location"
Pros: Staff members are all very friendly.
Cons: The Chipotle in Walnut, CA is crazy busy.

Title: "Worst place I have ever worked at"
Pros: Free food during your lunch hour and discounts
Cons: pay was to low and they treat their employees bD

Title: "Chipotle.."
Pros: Chipotle was good to work for in the beginning because during the hiring process they stated they didn't mind my inexperience (my first real job).
Cons: Chipotle had negative things about it, such as more than one manager working during a shift and it was miscommunication. One manager telling you don't do this, the other saying yes, do that.
Advice to Management: Have a stronger chain of communication among managers and employees.

Title: "Meh"
Pros: Free Chipotle per shift. Generally nice coworkers. Great ideals and company plans.
Cons: Hard work and the food industry is terrible as are the customers and sometimes the employees get mad at each other due to stress. Not fun.
Advice to Management: Need happier and more encouraging management. I would have stayed longer if every kitchen manager was as great as this one who was so upbeat and encouraging all the time.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Great Leaders, Great Values, Great Opportunities
Cons: Not all that many other than typical restaurant scheduling.

Title: "Great place and people, terrible manager"
Pros:
Benefits
Good vibes
Great work place and enviro,net
Cons:
Manager competition
Lack of consideration from manager

Title: "First Job"
Pros: Teaches you how to work hard and fast. One of the only companies that I know that still gives out a free meal when you work. Learn plenty of kitchen skills if you work in prep or grill.
Cons: You will go through plenty of managers. They always try to promote from the bottom of the company, but most people they hire do not have what it takes to make it to the top.

Title: "Line worker"
Pros:
good environment
nice people
well known
upbeat
cool
Cons:
busy
really hot
rude people
little work room
horrible schedules
Advice to Management: be more friendly

Title: "Basic fast food job"
Pros: Free lunch meals and paid 30 min breaks
Cons: Hard work and u smell like burrito everyday

Title: "3 years a slave"
Pros: Treats the animals that they kill for their customers to eat with great respect.
Cons: Treats their employees like slaves.
Advice to Management: You need to care more for your employees and stop expecting them to "act as if you own the place." You started this saying so that when things go wrong, the employees are at fault. At $9 an hour, I can't be expected to do my job and yours too corporate. Chipotle really need to do better. Stop being so greedy and invest in your employees, because there are some great people that work in your restaurants that could and should find better jobs.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros:
Benefits
Pay
Free Chipotle
Good entry level management position
Busy
Cons:
Management
Fast Paced
Manage Dining Room and Cash station by yourself
Advice to Management: Treat your employees with respect.

Title: "Area Manager"
Pros: Great Experience! Literally met My Boss and His Boss and then His Boss in the interview process,
Cons: haven't found anything out of the ordinary
Advice to Management: Patient

Title: "Crew"
Pros:
<ul>
<li>Fellow crew members are great to work with</li>
<li>Free shift meals</li>
</ul>
Cons:
<ul>
<li>Management doesn't care about employees</li>
</ul>
Advice to Management: Listen more, pay attention to who you promote

Title: "I am currently working at.."
Pros: Helping others and making others around you is always rewarding. The tuition reimbursement, health insurance, dental, vision as soon as you get hired on board.
Cons: Long hours as a GM. Hiring the right people. No support from other restaurant whenever we run short handed.
Advice to Management: There are some markets that really has a hard time hiring the right people. It makes it really hard have sustain employee levels. We need to pay our people more based on the market we are in.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Very easy to learn instruction, fast enviorment
Cons: Cashier doesnt have enough time to clean or stock dining area for customers so customers complain
Advice to Management: Better organizing, more sense of urgency, i understand that you are trying to serve your customers quickly but make sure you give the cashier a moment to clean up so there will be less complaints

Title: "Working Experience"
Pros: The other employees are extremely helpful especially with new workers in training. They whole experience working there is so much fun especially on busy days.
Cons: The face pace of the job makes it hard to grasp all concepts but it's not that bad. Having to deal with rude customers.
Advice to Management: Continue keeping up the good work with your employees allowing them to learn great social skills and working habits.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Management is uneducated and are full of themselves
Cons: Promotion works like a pyramid scheme

Title: "Could have been worse"
Pros: The other employees were wonderful and easy to get along with. Pay was good for a starting position in the food industry. Got a free meal every time you worked over 4 hours.
Cons: Poor management. My store had 3 separate managers in 6 months. Too much is expected out of certain positions like grill or cashier. They are one person trying to do 1 1/2 peoples jobs.
Advice to Management: Don't only promote from within. It turns away people with valuable experience and thrust people into positions they are not entirely ready for.

Title: "Awful Experience, looking back."
Pros: You do get a hearty meal during each shift and the culture invites your coworkers to care about making the store better. Workers do lean on each other and there is potential to have a good working environment. If you have absolutely nothing or out of high school, you could potentially move fast within this company. But you could do that at other places with about half the workload...
Cons:
Where to begin. First, the ratio of amount of work to compensation is an utterly cruel joke. You will come home and hurt all over from repetitive motions, stressful customers, and difficult time expectations. Your managers will expect you to do more every day, survive being shorthanded every day from team members who don't show up, and maintain Excessive and often non-sensical health standards that change almost every day now. You will have stressful audits, be blamed for failing equipment, be blamed for small infractions on dishes that you spend hours hand-washing. You will watch others get incredibly easy tasks like Expo while you struggle by yourself on Grill cooking 11 things at once and maintaining perfect cleanliness.

You may even get carpal tunnel from repetitive knife-work or poor training, since Chipotle completely ignores that this issue exists. Symptoms affected at least 4 of my co-workers during my year at the store.

You may get told to go pick up things from other stores in your free time, and also get talked out of receiving overtime because it hurts your store. There's an outstanding lawsuit about this issue right now and I definitely saw and experienced this firsthand myself.

You will not get bonuses or perks like in many other jobs, just food and the opportunity for hard work. Buy your own shoes, Pay for your healthcare, take the bus because you can't afford a car or apartment. Or if you convince every one on your team that you are nice, you can get promoted if they all vote for you regardless of your ability to actually handle the work.

You might have to put all the food away in sub-freezing temperatures without any PPE because your store doesn't have the budget or doesn't care.

Oh, and about the food, you can watch the quality degrade in real-time if you work there. The steak is genuinely concerning after the recent changes, everything gets blanched for some reason, probably so that workers can potentially burn themselves and things taste different. Ingredients get removed because they are unsafe, yet it's okay to reheat dry old meat and beans for the employees and first customers of the day. Things come prepackaged or in mysterious boxes, and then they don't, and then they do again, and rice preparation is inconsistent and awful. Workers spend so much time making the food safe that learning and training to making sure it's also delicious is of such less importance to getting everything completed.

You may not even learn to roll a burrito in your first month. The biggest crime.
Advice to Management: Fix the food quality as it was in 2005 when people liked your restaurant. Stop cutting corners, stop cutting back, and stop building so many restaurants when you clearly cannot control what is happening to your core brand or the message you are sending.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Great environment to work in
Cons: Closing is terrible because requires cleaning bathrooms and dining area

Title: "Great company"
Pros: Promotes from within. Actively works on improving employees
Cons: Long hours. Incredibly hard to move past Kitchen Manager

Title: "Work atmosphere"
Pros: Lots of positive reinforcement. Everyone has each other's back. Everyone is working towards a common goal.
Cons: Lots of multitasking. Expectations are high and sometimes seem unrealistic. Fast paced, often short staffed making crew members feel overwhelmed.
Advice to Management: Try to be more consistent when delegating tasks. Have a game plan set up ahead of time so crew knows what each station is responsible for. Make sure tasks have been completed and hold crew member accountable.

Title: "crew"
Pros: good hours, not really much to say
Cons: not enough pay for amount of work, worked 9-10 hour days without breaks. say they want you to advance but have favorites instead who receive promotions

Title: "cheepotley"
Pros: the pay, the people, the culture
Cons: the chemicals, getting burnt "sometimes", long hours of standing
Advice to Management: they're good

Title: "Fast and Furious"
Pros: So much fun when everyone is in a good mood, good perks, good pay
Cons: When we are short staffed it is insane and we were often short staffed
Advice to Management: Make sure to hire enough people to keep a store running

Title: "terribe"
Pros: free food during work hours
Cons: slave like enviorment and sweat shop like enviorment no pay
Advice to Management: unify

Title: "Restaurateur"
Pros: Great food and people culture. Opportunities, pay, and benefits.
Cons: Misdirection, poor leadership, and lost company values.
Advice to Management: Remember how you each got to where you are.

Title: "Decent Company"
Pros:
Good Work Schedule
Decent Pay
Fun environment
Cons: No room for advancement or raises
Advice to Management: Treat your employees better

Title: "Ups and Downs"
Pros: The aspects of work (I.E. empowerment, daily responsibilities) grow through time like every job and promoting from within is a very apparent part of this company.
Cons: The work becomes monotonous, high turnover, the pay that crew gets is not enough to keep anyone around, constant rule changes creates a confusing work environment
Advice to Management: Field leaders and TD'S need to be more understanding when it comes to adjusting to changes in rules inside the company.

Title: "Benefits are ok, job is not"
Pros:
Paid break
free employee meal
Some good benefits
Cons:
Pretty much everything else
Super busy
Lack of support
Advice to Management: Be more reasonable

Title: "Prep"
Pros: You get to eat free
Cons: You're overworked and underpaid for it
Advice to Management: Train your employees better instead of worrying about sales

Title: "Stressful and rarely rewarding"
Pros: Friendly coworkers for most part, good food, and they focus on moving up from within.
Cons: Stressful, loud, practically impossible expectations.
Advice to Management: Ease up on the memorization of all the 13 characteristics stuff and all the other company "scripts".

Title: "It's a no for me"
Pros: Employee benefits and free food are always a plus
Cons: They'd always have me working closing shifts that no one else wanted. It'd be super busy at the register and instead of helping the manager would simply come up to me and ask why the tables weren't wiped down, meanwhile I had 30 people waiting to get rung up in front of me.
Advice to Management: Help the crew members and stop talking about them in Spanish right in front of them :)

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Good benefits fun environment
Cons: Work to hard for little pay

Title: "The work environment is great."
Pros: Very flexible hours. The work environment is great. It feels like you're at home. Everyone is always helping always moving around. Perfect fast face work environment
Cons: Sometimes we have to work more than what were supposed to. Example: Deep cleaning when we have a very special visit.
Advice to Management: We need more staff

Title: "Great summer job where I was kept busy and had a demanding workload"
Pros: Free food every shift, upbeat and fast past environment where you're encouraged to improve, team members become like a family, customers are usually very positive
Cons: Tips are bad, heavy workload, busy nonstop so you have no time to take a break usually, physically demanding, people are constantly giving you constructive criticism so you must remain positive despite that
Advice to Management: N/a

Title: "Fam"
Pros: Our crew works together and cares for each other like a family. Lots of opportunity for growth in the chain and they work well with hours. You'll learn to do a variety of jobs between grill, line, cashier, etc.
Cons: It's high stress! Being at "restaurateur" Chipotle, the standards are even more high than normal Chipotle restaurants.

Title: "Hard Work but Decent Program"
Pros:
1. You learn how to cook and prepare food
2. Established program to become kitchen manager, service manager, and etc.
3. Plenty of free food and discounts
Cons:
1. High expectations, there's a time you're expected to finish all cooking by and it's not very lenient
2. Managers will call you out in front of the team
3. A lot of stress -- often my restaurant was understaffed so everybody was running around
Advice to Management: Sometimes paying for more labor hours is worth it. Customers shouldn't have to suffer if the restaurant is missing a couple employees.

Title: "Life at Chipotle."
Pros: The co-workers there are very friendly and fun to work with! The breaks are paid and you get free food on the days you work and good discounts on a regular day of not working. The vibe is great
Cons: The manager doesn't really work with you.

Title: "Great coworkers, horribly mismanaged."
Pros:
Great coworkers
Free meal per shift
Inexpensive benefits
Cons:
Horribly mismanaged
Took MONTHS to get through the "hiring" process
Very low hours for "full-time" employees
Advice to Management: Simple management basics could go a long way. Don't over hire employees!

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
Great work environment
Cleanest restaurant I've ever worked at
Managers were kind and empowering
Good hours
Cons: Hard work if you're a small girl
Advice to Management: Management was great. They always worked around my school schedule and gave me hours whenever I needed them.

Title: "A fun cult"
Pros: chipotle is a fun cult. if you believe in all the stuff they drill into your head, and you have a good crew, and your store isn't falling behind expectations, it's fun.
Cons: if your managers or crew are manipulative like many are shaped to be through the chipotle system, it will not be fun
Advice to Management: focus more on your people and less on the culture definitions that don't do anything

Title: "Pretty decent"
Pros: Flexible schedule, a lot of hours can be given to you if you work hard. Benefits are also good.
Cons: Can be overwhelming sometimes, especially during peak period.
Advice to Management: Focus on making people more efficient in their tasks.

Title: "If you are up to the challenge"
Pros:
Satisfaction
Free Shift meal
50% when not working
Flexible Schedule
50 minutes of break for 6 hours and above
Small tips
Awesome CCo-workers
Caring and Understanding Management
Cons:
Fast Pace
Tiring
NON STOP labor
Food becomes boring
Occasional ssniping
Annoying Customers
Misinformation
A lot of rresponsibilites
A little under paid
Advice to Management: Be a little less intimidating

Title: "Dont work there"
Pros: A free meal every shift you work. You cam eat anything off the menu
Cons: They overwork you for a very low wage. They act like they care about you but their actions show they really dont.
Advice to Management: Give more hours to your employees. And stop forcing codes to act like robots cause it is a failure

Title: "i hated it"
Pros: the team members were okay
Cons: some people are far too ocd about what to do, you didn't get paid enough for what you had to do, some managers are hypocrites

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: The values are great. And the people I worked with were awesome.
Cons: The pay isn't what it should be.

Title: "Favorite so far"
Pros:
Causal dressing
Good pay
Flexible hours
Great atmosphere
Good food
Cons: Some team members can be mean

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Wonderful Co- workers, decent pay however.
Cons: Scheduling is very unorganized. Constantly understaffed due to high level of quitting makes remaining co-workers work twice as hard for the same pay.
Advice to Management: Have a set schedule so employees can know when they're working the following week.

Title: "Good company system, but doesn't pay what we deserve."
Pros:
Good friendly environment
Empower us
Evaluate us
Learn how a good successful company actually function
Learn to become a fast pace person
Learn how to multitask
Cons:
Salary is too low for all the things we have to do
Specific chores that I do daily starts hurting my wrist in long run, wake up having numb fingers and palm from frying chips twice a day
Advice to Management: Give us a raise for the hard work we have done. Lots of good employee leave after working for a year because of the pay. Train people well, but after a lot of people learn how to work well, they usually leave, all because of the low pay high labor work.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Free Food, Awesome Staff, good benifts
Cons: Poor Management, Overworked! too busy and not enough staff

Title: "Great place"
Pros: Fast paced environment, always something that needs to be done. Great food too.
Cons: Competition can get rough sometimes but it's just because there's a lot of motivated individuals

Title: "Eh..."
Pros: Free food, tips, flexible hours, paid breaks, scholarships
Cons: Coworkers, customers, poor management, little space to move
Advice to Management: Better training for all employees, hiring process needs work (don't hire just anybody)

Title: "Cashier, Line Worker"
Pros: I have no pros for this place
Cons: Work you like dirty slave, zero positive reinforcement, yelling instead of managing, new workers every month
Advice to Management: Figure out how to build managers instead of replacing workers every other day

Title: "Messy messy! STAY AWAY!"
Pros:
Free food
Cash tips after every shift
Reasonable hours considering I was in school
Uniform isn't too crazy
Cons:
Favoritism
Gossip/drama
Late hours
Snooty customers
Language barrier. (If you didn't speak Spanish you were basically talked about & ignored by management)
Poor pay rate
Advice to Management: Get it together. Y'all are so petty it's ridiculous. & Telling someone to write in their development journal for personal growth to turn around & use that as ammo to FIRE them for it is a very unethical & just pathetic business practice. Grow up!

Title: "Fun team, but a lot is asked"
Pros: It's usually fun to work with the crew, because the hiring managers are supposed to look for positive people.
Cons: The company can have contradicting policies. You are held responsible to get A LOT done with very little time. My store hasn't focused on advancing people up the management chain a single bit.
Advice to Management: Try to progress your workers further, and recognize that 100% efficiency isn't always possible.

Title: "Great place"
Pros: Free food paid breaks 50% off discount
Cons: Long hours, constant standing, a lot of pressure
Advice to Management: Don't over work your employees because that's why they quit

Title: "Was good, got bad."
Pros:
Pre-2014: Great travel perks, team building trips to places like NYC, Denver, San Diego, etc. Got to go to AMC in Vegas every two years. Overtime was nice. Got rated on job performance, not "culture" and "empowerment".

Free company car was nice.

Got to create your own schedule most of the time.
Cons:
New IT director in 2014. Brought on other high-up IT people who were personal friends, but poor fits. Travel limitations, OT restrictions, poorly managed help desk. Rated on "making others better" instead of measurable job performance. Hard to do since closest IT coworker is over 100 miles away.

Very, very limited career growth. Pretty much have to relocate to Denver to take another position within IT.

Work/life balance poor. Late shifts to cover under-staffed help desk.

Due to lack of career growth, position got stale and boring after a few years.
Advice to Management:
Cool it with the "empowerment" and "culture" horse apples. There's a huge joke that almost everyone is in on that 85% of the culture of Chipotle is being able to talk about how important the culture is. No one really knows what it is. No one really knows what "empowerment" is. They just know that if they talk about it they get brownie points for it.

Focus on people's measurable work performance, not vague notions of 'making others better'.

Create career path that doesn't require relocation.

Title: "chipotle"
Pros: it was a good job
Cons: the hours are long and require standing

Title: "Great enviornment"
Pros: Everyone is passionate about their job
Cons:
hard work
always short staffed
long days
Advice to Management: hire more

Title: "over the top mission statements that will have you believe that rolling burritos is like saving lives"
Pros: Free burritos and Soda. Learn some knife skills. Fast pace work if your into that kind of stuff. Did I mention free burritos?
Cons: Little to no benefits unless you make it to general manager. Low pay. Low tips. This a great job for students.
Advice to Management: You will be expected to do a lot with very little but don't wear yourself to thin. Use your people.

Title: "Great company with excellent care for their employees!"
Pros: Great people, great food, great company. Chipotle stands for a lot of great ideals, and they take great care of their employees. They have a lot of benefits (like tuition reimbursement), and give free food! I survive on my free entree a shift, and 50% off anytime. Amazing company.
Cons: This job is fast paced and high stress. This job requires patience because many people can be rude or slow.
Advice to Management: Continue to invest in your employees! We will invest more in Chipotle in response. Thank you for your care for your crew.

Title: "Not too bad"
Pros:
- Great people
- Upbeat atmosphere
- Customers are usually nice, probably because they're about to eat Chipotle
Cons:
- No way to earn above minimum wage unless you get promoted (from my experience), which takes at least a year on average
- Redundant work
- At my particular location, you usually wouldn't know your schedule for the following work week until the day before, making it difficult to schedule other plans (main reason I quit)

Title: "Great place to work!"
Pros: Leadership takes time to connect, flexibility with schedule, ability to build your own strategy, inclusive decision making, the company values you for who you are.
Cons: Ever changing processes and lack of standardization. If you do not like constant change then this is probably not a good environment for you.
Advice to Management: Continue to connect with your teams and making them feel valued!

Title: "Service Mamager"
Pros: Great people, clean environment, good pay. Strict hiring if management does their job properly. Free food. Management systems (computer work)are very easy to understand and use.
Cons:
Ridiculous standards to achieve considering the time frame given (in one shift (8 hrs)Must be Mod and :check hiring, call two people, call two marketing 2 times, manage labor to 13% all while being only manager on duty and serving customers. In a week: full inventory 3 times a week, manager meeting (cuts out time from night shift and consumes labor), do 4 development journals a week, develop towards apprentice.
Other cons
Low labor matrix. Good crew is very hard to find, good Grill and prep is even harder to find.
Main work force under 21 yrs old.
Advice to Management: To cooperate: raise labor matrix to allow expectations to be achievable or raise minimum wage to allow hiring more competitive employees other than high schoolers

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: They seriously make you learn the fundamentals of being a top performer and learn how to work as a team. Great skills that are useful in any other type of work field.
Cons: If store is one of the busiest in the area than eventhough they promise you a higher position with a better pay ofcourse, you will not get it. They push you so much but dont give you anything back. There is favoritism so try to have your GM in your good side. Also, they give you the most a .25$ raise every 6 months but if the minimum waige raises than forget about your raise. It will be like if nothing happened.
Advice to Management: Stop having favorites and start keeping your word. If youre making someone work really hard have the rest of rhe crew members follow the example. Dont let just someone do everybody else's job.

Title: "Real Leadership?"
Pros: The people in the field, running and supporting the restaurants, are some of the most caring, genuine and hardest-working people around.
Cons: The corporate offices are another story. No commitment to leadership development, and many people in leadership positions obtained them from having subject matter expertise and or opportunistic scope expansion, and not necessarily for making those around them better (as the company claims should be the basis for promotion) nor are in tuned to restaurant operations and people that truly drive the business.
Advice to Management: Bring in some independent, outside resources to help assess and implement changes to ensure that the tenets of the restaurant people culture truly and consistently exist in all the office environments.

Title: "Honestly--it all depends."
Pros:
I worked at Chipotle for almost 4 months. Started in June of 2016, quit a couple months later in September. I'm going to try my best and layout the entire experience for you.

When you first get there, you'll be either interviewed once or twice, perhaps with other people. I was interviewed once and talked to three different managers and was hired on the spot. (This is my first job) I came in a few days later for my orientation and basically shook a few hands of the other team members and then spent my few first days sitting in the small cramped closet they called an office watching training videos.

I guess it depends on your experience or it might even be the manager's choice to find the perfect position for you. You're really either on the line making orders, switching foods out, and taking people's crap or you're in the kitchen taken the people on the line's crap. I was given the position of being on the line. I was mainly Tortilla 1 (the person who starts your order). The videos didn't help- me as much as my co-workers did. That's kind've what they do. At least at Chipotle, it's your job's job to make you feel comfortable to work at such a great speed. They want you to do better and they SHOULD correct you and help you rather than discipline you. This is where my review title kicks in. It honestly, all depends.

Not only does it depend on your employees and how you interact, it also depends on you and your energy/motivation to get you through the day. It also depends on your managers and your relationship with them.

You see, it was my first job. I didn't know many people--a lot of my co-workers had already known each other so being the new one was equivalent of being the irrelevant one.

The actual job itself depends too. On where you're located. If you want more of a laidback job---and somehow still want to work Chipotle, I'd recommend finding an area in which that Chipotle is not so busy. That way, you're dealing with too many crappy people in a single filed line heading out the door like my job did.

The training is kind of bad at this job. Your co-workers basically train you by telling you what you should be doing and how you should do it. If they don't and you're confused, you should seriously speak up and ask.

The customers at Chipotle can either be super simple or super complex. For example, I had a customer that came in and each time, he would order a double-wrapped burrito with two scoops of both rices, two scoops of both beans, fajitas, sofritas, and every salsa. Yeah, thank god the training was so bad that I didn't have to worry about doing his salsa (there's another person for salsa) and rolling his burrito.

Not only is each customer a surprise (but, when aren't they?), your managers are going to be watching you. They'll be taking into account of how well your work, how fast you're working (and trust me, you'll learn to get fast the sooner you learn how to do everything so ASK if you need help.), and how well your attitude is. Trust me, customers WILL complain.

Anyway, not only do you have to keep a smiley face on with a good pace going, but you have to also touch the hot food and tables and tortillas. Yeah nobody mentions how HOT everything is and how easy it is to burn yourself here. You get used to it. Yep, there's no other way around it. Sometimes, you'll have days when you are going as fast as you can and there'll still be a line. You'll eventually come across a customer with 6 complicated orders. Oh and maybe another customer who needs you to change your gloves because they're vegetarian. Then your manager will tell you to hurry it up but you have a customer who doesn't know what they want or has never been there. You have to keep your stress levels down during busy hours.

When it's not busy, you'll probably be making foils which was my favorite task tbh, or making kids meals or taco shell baskets, etc. I rarely got to do dishes but I thought dishes were fun. You get pretty wet tho no lie it's kinda gross.

This job was great. I just hated my managers. They were SUCH hypocrites. They would tell me I can clock in a few minutes early and then once I did they'd yell at me and tell me that it's not allowed. Sometimes they would call me 10 minutes before my shift starts asking me where I am and that I need to call 15 minutes ahead if I'm going to be late. Yeah. They're clingy. I got written up for that once. I clocked in 1 minute after my shift and didn't call 15 minutes ahead. I was right around the corner. She said my lateness throws everyone else off because it can get busy. I got there and only 2 people were in line and one was already paying. Yeah.

The breaks tho are amazing. You always get a 10 minute break. I worked part time from 11:00-3 or 11:30-4:30. (I made 11.25 an hour) Sometimes I worked a full shift. (when you work full shift you get a share of the tips. I made like $2 in change somtimes) I started getting a lot of full shifts up until I quit. The longer shifts for me were 11:45-7PM. Still, I always got a ten minute break. On those tens, you can go to cash and grab a receipt paper. You write want you want to eat, give it to someone on the line and wait for them to make it. I never had Chipotle until I worked there. I like the barbacoa tacos. Just gotta drown them in lemon juice bc the corn tortillas are dry. I also like the kid's size barbacoa quesadilla. Always get a bag of chips and a fountain drink. The drinks behind the glass like the Izzies and chocolate milk are not free. They're like 50% off tho. When you work full shifts you get a 20, and a 30 minute break I think. I know you get two longer breaks. You can get a free meal during your 30 too. When you're not working, you get a 50% discount but only on one item. So let's say you go with your family or friends and you want to use your discount. You don't get the 50% off on the whole order. just on YOUR meal. Yeah, it's not all that great.
Cons:
Anyway, if you don't get along with your co-workers or managers, it's not going to be a very nice environment. if you live in a nice neighborhood with a low crime rate and everything, you'll be good. Hopefully you don't have picky customers. If you want the job, google the chipotle 13 characteristics and memorize them. Mention in the interview that you have them or most of them. Trust me. You'll be at the top of their list. Know the vision. Not only the "change the way people think and eat fast food" or whatever but the only one too. There's legit a quizlet somewhere about Chipotle questions so google that and you'll be okay. Act very happy.

And also I'll mention that the music in Chipotle will get annoying. Some of it's good. They have two Broken Bells songs I mean like Holding On For Life, yo. So good. But anyway, the music is on repeat. You'll get a song stuck in your head if you get the chance to hear it playing. They play Sandman A LOT. Good luck people!
Advice to Management: Build up the confidence in your employees. Do not constantly tell them what they're doing wrong. Seriously. A few words go a long way.

Title: "Fine experience"
Pros: Everybody who was a part of the staff at Chipotle was very friendly, and I got a good working experience in the real world, outside the class setting
Cons: During some of the less popular hours when Chipotle was more empty, things could get rather slow and boring. The job is more productive in more busy hours.
Advice to Management: From speaking with friends who worked at Chipotle longer than I have, people would like to see more opportunities for upwards mobility within the company. Some people would like to work for the company long-term.

Title: "Agony at Chipotle (specially the Delmar loop location in Missouri)"
Pros: You learn alot of culinary skills you wouldnt learn at any other restaurant.
Cons:
They don't have a training program that works.
There isn't any room to grow for management.
I came in with 3+ plus years of shift supervisor experience, and my starting pay was 9.00. Which was a $3 deficit from what i was making as manager.
Scheduling sucks. The location i was at didnt really believe in scheduling people properly per shift.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Free food, horrible treatment"
Pros:
Free food
Paid 10/hr
Worked with school schedule
Cons:
Didnt care about workers
Management Shakey
Broken promises by management.
Overworked team members
No teamwork
Advice to Management: If your employee has severe burns on ankle please listen.

Title: "Chipotle worker"
Pros: Fast paced environment requiring great focus and dedication
Cons: Customers are often difficult to please
Advice to Management: Provide more training and guidance to employees

Title: "Hard work"
Pros: Flexible schedule, good pay .
Cons: Hardly any time , constant schedule change .

Title: "Get it together. Please!"
Pros: Free tasty lunch each shift worked (at least 6 hours), cool customers, some (and I do mean SOME) nice co-workers, above minimum wage pay.
Cons: Weasel-liars among the team members, incompetent GM, Respectful Workplace line is a joke, termination with no due notice or discussion, illogical expectations after only a short time in the restaurant.
Advice to Management: Please take more care for training your Apprentices and General Managers, as this location was completely reprehensible. And I do believe termination without notice is illegal? I'll be following up with that. No one ever answers the Respectful Workplace line, and when someone does get around to reaching back out to you, nothing gets done still. It's completely hilarious that the GM running this location thinks he should be at Restaurateur by next month! Funny how this company boasts "Food with integrity" but its employees' integrity is nonexistent. I felt welcomed during orientation and the first couple of days there. After that, I distinctly felt the vibes of my team members resemble that of them not really wanting me there anymore, so I guess it was a team effort to get me out of the door with reporting untruths to the incompetent GM. Congrats! I also won't be returning to eat here either. The food tastes inconsistent now, probably because they can't keep anyone in there, save for the Weasel-liars. Whole lot of work needing to be done at this location!

Title: "good,the bad of working at chipotle"
Pros: i love my team at chipotle. came into work at 8 and ended my shift at 4.
Cons: they will stress a lot on becoming restaurateur. the schedule was constantly changed. the time worked was changed by higher ups. and i dint know till i received my paycheck
Advice to Management: don't stress so much about becoming restaurateur.

Title: "AVOID AT ALL COSTS"
Pros: You got a free shift meal.
Cons: EVERYTHING else besides the free meal.
Advice to Management: Don't throw your employees under the bus. The words please and Thank You go a long way.

Title: "Great job for a beginner"
Pros: Grea friendlybpeople worker great things
Cons: Nothing really it was aweomsee

Title: "Depends On Situation"
Pros: great people, great values, free food
Cons: have strayed from company principles
Advice to Management: make sure field leaders aren't playing politics and are choosing the right people to lead, or else things will continue to spiral downward.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: good atmosphere, free meal per shift, good management
Cons: long hours and low pay

Title: "It was good"
Pros: Pay was good. Got a lot of hours. At the start everything was great.
Cons: My first couple months there I worked over time. I was working 50+ hours. I had gone through THREE gm's in the year that I was there and the store has gone majorly down hill. I got fired because a coworker overheard me talking to another coworker about how I was thinking about looking for another job and that I didn't agree with who the general manage rasa promoting. In the same breath I was fired I was told I was one of the best workers.
Advice to Management: Make sure your GM's are chosen wisely and that favorites aren't being played. People who no nothing about cut sizes and making rice are getting promoted to KM.

Title: "Line work"
Pros: Makes you faster pased and edges you to be your best at all times, learning to work with other and being able to depend on them.
Cons: You may have to work with others who are slower than you and might weight you down, making you pick up their slack as well as keeping up your own pace.
Advice to Management: Not many complaints, just wish they were more liberal with letting people go and having new, better crew members have a shot.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Great pay. Even I'm not a manager or something like that I still have a great pay because I've been there for many years now. Good discount and fun work.
Cons: Nothing wrong till now. I know sometimes it gets hard in the rush hours but with a great attitude everything is possible.
Advice to Management: They've been great to me. Keep it up.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: They Really Care about you as a person and want to see you develop. Chance to move up fast and start a career as a GM in 1-2 years.
Cons: Constantly will be losing employees and training new ones. Can be a stressful work environment depending on what team you have.
