Advice to Management: Continue To inspire with the vision and actually care about your employees. DJ's and One on Ones are way more important then you will ever imagine. They can literally inspire and motivate a crew member and they will work extremely hard.

Title: "My year at Chipotle"
Pros: Fast-paced, moved around a lot, fun during peak hour because the frequency of customers helped time go by faster
Cons:
Management was insufficient

Training was pushed to the side in favor of "learning to do it yourself"

Kind of like a cult, emphasizing the vision, and making us memorize definitions of words involved
with the culture- empowerment, top performer, & high standards.

If the GM is weak, it trickles down to the lower managers and employees.

My store was extremely short-staffed, I began working 6 sometimes 7 day weeks, and our managers were unable to hire people sufficiently. Those that were hired were not trained well because the employees responsible for training were not properly trained.
Advice to Management: Put a focus on training, and make sure your managers actually have consequences for those that do not perform up to the supposed standards.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Free meals when you work, 50% off at your home store any other time. Pay starts at $9 an hour for crew, tuition assistance, sick pay and benefits offered to part time employees.
Cons: Really high expectations, knowledge of weird chipotle culture, giving customers whatever they want to try and bounce back from the bad press from ecoli.
Advice to Management: Don't expect so much out of your crew when we're understaffed and stretched to the maximum.

Title: "Team Member"
Pros:
Being able to eat Chipotle for free certainly has to be a pro.
Majority college aged employees made for fun, like-minded co-workers.
Cons: Certainly over-worked and under-paid. Working at a popular college location translated to an extremely busy rush hour. The line would be nonstop and we were constantly harassed to go faster.
Advice to Management: Your employees are your company. Value them.

Title: "Overall an okay experience."
Pros: I loved working with such friendly people & free meals are always a plus!
Cons: Management isn't all that great, rude and played favorites.

Title: "Part-time cashier"
Pros: Benefits are great you get medical, dental and vision. Depending on where you work, you'll have amazing coworkers.
Cons:
Health benefits come out of check.
Part-time pretty much forced to work full-time because they don't care about your schedule.
Advice to Management: Respect your employees schedule. Be fair, if I can't come in late then others shouldn't be able too come in late. Properly train employees, whether it be a full day or a week, make sure the employee knows what they are doing.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Great place to grow from crew to manager. Allows for mistakes to shape experiences to become a top performer.
Cons: I did not receive full training for any position. Up from crew to management. I was a "thrown in the deep end" philosophy and I was one of the lucky ones that swam.
Advice to Management: Listen to crew from below. Empowerment is one of the building blocks for the companies success.

Title: "Not a bad job"
Pros: Fun crew, great benefits for full-time employees
Cons: None really. Some of the lateral management moves can disrupt workplace culture and flow.
Advice to Management: Keep the strong crew happy, and balance work evenly.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: Fun, you learn a lot of stuff
Cons: They tell you about some great opportunities but its like they don't help you get there. They just keep you in a couple stations

Title: "Apprentice"
Pros: Decent pay in a liberal organization
Cons: Hit and miss on who your superiors are, most of them will straight lie to your face or mislead you with false promises of promotions.
Advice to Management: Stop promoting managers who are not ready.

Title: "Awesome for teens/young adults"
Location: Santa Fe Springs, Los Angeles, CA
Pros: Chipotle encourages their workers to move up and allows the opportunity for whoever wanted it.
Cons: Schedule always fluctuates, there are never set days for when you ask off. But I suppose that goes for all restaurants
Advice to Management: Keep it up

Title: "Hard work but great company."
Pros: Fast paced. A lot of emphasis on moving up in the company. Very possible to do well with them.
Cons: Crazy hard work with little breaks.
Advice to Management: Listen to the need of the employees.

Title: "Awesome."
Pros: Really fast paced. You alwaya have something to do! Plus you get 50% off when you are off & free meals during shift.
Cons: Manager is nit the nicest.
Advice to Management: Teacher managers to manage and be nice at the same time. You don't have to go around biting everyones head.. People will like the job but hate management in which they wont want to work there.

Title: "It's a great job"
Pros: Friendly team members, very nice managers that help you when they can, good benefits, and they are willing to work with your college schedule.
Cons: Things get really hectic around lunch hour, things are very rushed in opening and closing, and it can get stressful fast.

Title: "Chipotle Crew Worker"
Pros: The food is very ethical and all the ingredients are fresh and as local as possible. High starting pay.
Cons: Constantly being expected to stay an hour after you were supposed to get off, and if you don't you aren't a "top performer". In the morning, never getting longer than a 10 minute break, even on a 9 hour shift. The concept of elevation is passive aggressive.

Title: "Potential for success, but at what cost?"
Pros:
College credits for mgmt training
Great benefits
You really can go from crew to manager (I went from crew to GM in 3 years with no former experience or degree)
Lots of knowledge to be gained
Cons:
Expectations are sometimes unrealistic
Things have changed and it's hard to stay inspired
It can be a very hard job
Finding the right people can be very difficult
Depending on your position, this job will consume your life
Your experience completely depends on upper management in your area
Advice to Management: Stop opening new stores and focus on the older ones that are understaffed and falling apart but making 3 times as much money than the new stores

Title: "Wouldn't Work Here If You're a College Student"
Pros: Teaches you great customer service, organization, free meal any shift you work
Cons: Horrible for student workers, don't work with you, constantly called in, fire a lot of people
Advice to Management: Quit playing favorites and being lazy

Title: "It's okay"
Pros: It's like family there. They really do care about their employees.
Cons: The hours can get really brutal. And of course it can get ridiculously crowded.
Advice to Management: Make bigger stores to accommodate for the crowds and hire more workers so that you don't run the ones you have into the ground.

Title: "CMG"
Pros: you get free meals every time you work
Cons: It is tedious and very fast paced

Title: "A great learning experience"
Pros: Great learning experience, a great way to learn how to market and build people culture with your team. The company work with local farmers and is doing things the right way, chipotle goes that extra mile for they customer rather then any other fast food place !
Cons: If they wrong people are on your team it makes the job harder, there's no cons to this place everything we do we are doing to better the future and our children

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Free food during your shift, lenient hours that worked very well with my class schedule. They will also reimburse some of your tuition but you have to work for a full year first.
Cons: Management always had something to criticize, to the point where they started contradicting one another. One manager would tell me one thing, I'd start performing the way that manager wanted me to, and another would come and tell me it's all wrong. Some of them are VERY serious about scooping too, which got to be ridiculous.
Advice to Management: Communicate one another more to get rid of discrepancies in training styles. It's more frustrating on the employees to be repeatedly corrected or criticized.

Title: "Its fun"
Pros: Its a fast paced environment, you get a free meal everyday, full benefits, vacations also you can get 401k...
Cons:
Its changing alot constantly so ull have to adapt fast, they promise a lot and deliver short.
It can be stressful sometimes

Title: "Fair pay, good work"
Pros: They pay their employees above minimum wage. Management at my branch was excellent, good training, and free food was a nice perk.
Cons: Management isn't always consistent, have worked at other branches that weren't run as well as this one.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros:
- connection between coworkers
- free food on shift, 50% off , off shift
Cons: - if fired, you cant apply to anny other chipotle ever
Advice to Management: One of the 13 characteristics are " Honesty" therefore dont lead people on during an interview making them believe they have such a good shot and pull the line " well contact you " if you say so, then be a person of your word and do so, even if its someone simple as a " were sorry but we cannot hire you" .

Title: "Cashier"
Pros:
-Meeting new people.
-Food is good.
-Room to grow within the company.
Cons:
-Having to stay hours later after your scheduled shift.
-People leave the company often.
Advice to Management: Try to get more help and not worry so much about budget. That seems to be why people leave.

Title: "so bad, but too good"
Pros: I make 13 an hour, and I get unlimited food a shift.
Cons: co-workers are so mean! messing up is the end of the world and will make you feel like you have no talent, good for nothing etc
Advice to Management: wanting to do things right is awesome, but do not let others be mean to your new hires.

Title: "Best company"
Pros: People culture is what chipotle is all about. They care for their employees and they show it with actions.
Cons: No cons at all! Best company ever

Title: "crew"
Pros:
Free food. Possibility to move up and build a career. Great crew at least at my location.
Manager are good but depends on your location as well not every chipotle is the same.
good food safety procedures for high quality. Great experience and team work.
Cons: people from the back of the house don't get paid extra online on management position and others. But overall is a good corporation that has its little problems like any other places would.

Title: "Area Manager"
Pros: Great people with strong work ethics.
Cons: Long hours for salaried employees.
Advice to Management: You must be passionate about food.

Title: "Apprentice Review"
Pros: great benefits, pay, opportunities to grow and advance in the company. one free meal per shift.
Cons: be expected to work 60 plus hours a week. The company heavily relies on you to stay with the company. too much expectation from the higher ups.

Title: "Good"
Pros: The work environment is really good and people are willing to help you learn and grow
Cons:
Too much work to do
You must be very fast, you can't even take a 5 minutes break

Title: "Chipotle experience"
Pros: Free meals, meet new people, gain work experience, learn a little bit of everything
Cons: No Union, employees tend to be nit-picky, very negative place to work at, advancement is more so random and predicated off social position , and 40% work ethic.

Title: "Cook/crew member"
Pros: Free food on paid break and 50% off when not working. Incredible environment and no feeling of guilt when serving their non-gmo food in generous portions.
Cons: Limited menu and the only stain on an otherwise perfect history of phenomenal health and safety standards is over-amplified by it's critics.
Advice to Management: Recommend that new recipes be created and menu items be added. Also, allow more lime and salt to be added to the chips.

Title: "Overall great work experience but not for long term"
Pros: They're incredible about teaching people new skills, treating their employees with respect, and having a team-based environment.
Cons: The pay is fairly lacking, like most chain restaurants. There's also an unrealistic expectation to work off the clock or unpaid overtime.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Some of the best reasons to work at Chipotle are because of the challenging work environment. You and your co-workers challenge and make one another better on a daily basis making it an environment the betters you mentally.
Cons: Some downside are having a different schedule every week. Closing can also result in nights that go as long as 2am. Also 9 times out of 10 you never get off on time because of certain inconveniences and the overall quality of the team. Hard workers have to take the load of what others may lack on quote on quote team environments.
Advice to Management: Management may need to put their selves in the shoes of the workers in order to understand how to best help their workers be in the best position to fulfill and carry out their daily duties. Almost everyone I know is afraid to lose their jobs no matter how far they get. It doesn't seem like a job individuals can be in for the long term.

Title: "High Expectations, High Rewards."
Pros: -The culture is supportive, expects you to grow, and to become the best you can be.
Cons: -The work they expect from you out of the gate is more than I expected at first, but this is a very subjective con.

Title: "Waste of time"
Pros: Free food, hat, and shirt
Cons: 13 characteristic don't even apply. They are not happy, respectful, polite, smart, and also a team player. They work you long hours and demand more . Two faces, they are nice in the beginning then they end up being your boss.
Advice to Management: Be supportive and a team player. Have the 13 characteristic when working. It seems like they forgot when they are working.

Title: "Kitchen manager"
Pros: Running the shift, office work, food orders, being in charge of your shift, training and teaching others, challenging your crew.
Cons: Pressure is on you if something go's wrong, short staffed means working even harder to get things done. Cristal items is your responsibility and if there off you need to diagnose and fix.
Advice to Management: Proper training is a must, hands on helps everyone learn. Feedback on what you should work on before you fail

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Nice people. Great co-workers. The food is great.
Cons: Long lines. Management hiring is pretty terrible.

Title: "OK experience"
Pros: Pretty nice coworkers, hard workers
Cons: Not very many, good experience

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Great sense of community among the workers, caring and close manager relationships. Plenty of opportunity for advancement.
Cons: Grueling, mind-numbing work for hours while being on your feet all day. Constant interaction with sometimes unfavorable customers.
Advice to Management: Maintain a good amount of employees so the same ones arent scheduled all the time/ arent as heavily relied on to do every task

Title: "Crew"
Pros: They pay for your break and school
Cons: Don't have times for nothing

Title: "Not Great for Non-Spanish Speakers"
Pros: The starting pay was $9/hr which was nice for an entry level job. I got to interact with customers and see regulars which always brightened my day. I was always happy when someone left smiling and satisfied.
Cons:
I was told during the interview it would pay $9.50/hr, learning into the job that the "company policy had changed" and my starting wage would be $9/hr.
The portion sizes are so small that as an employee it makes it hard to tell customers that they can't get more meat without paying much more. My Chipotle was very strict on portion sizes, particularly with guac and meat.
If you don't speak Spanish and you have a lot of Hispanic employees you're probably going to feel like a bit of an outsider. I always felt like I was being talked about (and I probably was) as a result of the communication difference--esp since they're always speaking Spanish.
The hours were erratic. I requested up to 30 hours a week and my schedule ranged from 4 hours a week to 27.
Advice to Management: Do not offer an hourly wage that a potential employee will not receive during the interview.

Title: "Okay"
Pros:
•others who work there are in the same boat as you, normally- most have a great personality
•crew becomes close
•seems like they care
•You can get great benefits, even part time employees
• no drug test (if you are wondering)
Cons:
Chipotle loves to try to get the most work out of one employee as they can.
The management at first seems like they care about their employees and what they are going through but the longer you work there the more you realize they don't.
This job can take a lot out of you. It wears me down so much I just want to sleep all of the hours I'm not working. No friends or fun just sleep please.
This job isn't for everyone so people find out they aren't cut out for it pretty quickly. We get a lot of people who are in and out in two weeks time.
Advice to Management: My advice to management would be to pay attention to their employees more. Most of the people at my store are college students. With classes only a few days a week we still need time for studying and extracurriculars, but my store is dead set on getting people to turn in schedules so they can give us the hours they want to give us. I think if you set your availability for certain days and hours then that should be it. Of course we each have our own agendas.

Title: "Great career advancements"
Pros: Free meals when working, 50% off all the time, easy to move up to manager, raises every 6 months
Cons: Not a lot of hours

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Great place to work as long as you get along with coworkers
Cons: Favoritism amongst the managers was common

Title: "A lot of work, but good starting pay"
Pros: Free food after shift, manager is understanding, benefits
Cons: A LOT OF WORK for one person,

Title: "Overall Healthy First Experience"
Pros: Both the managers and crew members are enthusiastic about you joining a "team" environment. They say that they work is tough stuff but a good time if you get done in a diligent manner.
Cons: Sometimes the management can get swept away by a slower store, in which they'll proceed to do most of the prep.
Advice to Management: Do not forget about the vision, and lead through empowerment. you are 90% of the vision.

Title: "Love the job, love the people, just not my co-workers"
Pros: I love my benefits and payment on my job - I began at $10.55 an hour! Major improvement from everywhere else I've worked started, which all simply started me at minimum wage. Not to mention the benefits and the food are both great. And it's easy to rise up if you're a hard worker. If you want to go beyond being a simple crew member, and you put in the hard work, management will make sure you get the time and tools to do so.
Cons: No downsides come from the company itself. The only problem I have is the people who don't work as hard as they should. My location in particular has met with problems on a regular basis only because there are people that don't show up on a regular basis, many fired due to this. But I guess that's what you get when you work with high school / college students.
Advice to Management: Nothing to say other than keep up the good work guys! Hopefully you'll find some good people actually worth having around soon.

Title: "Everything"
Pros: Time is very flexible for me
Cons: So much work and so little pay.
Advice to Management: Raise salaries because it's really heavy work.

Title: "Best company I've worked for"
Pros: The atmosphere is very friendly, your team members are happy and helpful and the fast paced day to day makes the days go by fast, there is always something to do but it's not tedious or boring.
Cons: It can get very hectic, you'll find yourself with so much to do and not enough time to do it.. but that's something you figure out with time.
Advice to Management: More time for one on one training during time periods that aren't rushed would be amazing.. I found myself teaching myself most of the stuff I learned

Title: "Is it really worth it?"
Pros: Fun place to work at. Very diverse.
Cons: It becomes your life, but fun either way

Title: "not as good as advertice"
Pros: free lunch,vision and dental care.
Cons: they are like 4 managers per shift for very small place,and the majority young kids who only wana impress their boss,when you are new all of then are just watching and waitting for the minimal mistake to tell you off,they said that they pay for your lunch time,but they dont tell you that,that is if you get a break,most of the time you get a break after you finish your shift thats when you eat,yes AFTER YOU CLOCK OUT.,one more thing is that if you are on the line you are not allowed to use the bathroom,wich i think is not human so go figure.
Advice to Management: put more attention to those new managers,how they are couching your new staff.some of then dont even know how to talk to you with respect.

Pros:
Tips I guess
1 free burrito per day
?
Cons:
Very repetitive movement
Mundane
Horrific
Bloody (marinating raw chicken/ steak )
Advice to Management:
Not as great as its choked up to be
unless you're into cults,

Title: "No Training"
Pros: I was always scheduled for at least 20 hours a week.
Cons: I was not properly trained, the manager was difficult to talk to and never present.

Title: "Too much work"
Pros:
Free food
Diversity of people
Make cool friends
Cons:
Too much work
Gets extremely busy
All they care about is becoming restauranteur

Title: "It's not as great as they make it sound"
Pros: The people are my favorite part about working here. They are like a second family.
Cons: You can't really focus on anything in your life other than Chipotle.
Advice to Management: Focus on Validating and Empowering rather than getting stuff done.

Title: "Really great place to work"
Pros:
-Free lunch every day you work
-50% off one meal every day
-Really chill place to work
Cons:
-Hours can be somewhat sporadic
-Can get very hectic
-Really great management
Advice to Management: Stop making changes every other day and stick to what is working now.

Title: "Great to Work for, easy to move up!"
Pros: Staff was always very friendly to work with, it is very easy to move up in the company, most of my co-workers were in the running for management within a year of employment.
Cons: Very strict and sometimes cumbersome procedures slowed the process down at times. Some restaurants had very little room for the prep cooks to move around.
Advice to Management: Keep adapting and changing with the times. Keep promoting from within your stores. It gives employees a goal and keeps them motivated to keep improving,

Title: "better than most fast food/minimum wage jobs even though the work is a bit harder/fast paced"
Pros:
free meal every shift
can do line tasting (snacks) through out the day
laid back atmosphere
different managers, not just one
accommodate student schedule
health insurance benefits
power to move up if thats what you want to do
Cons:
cliques in the workplace
teenage drama in the workplace
employees can be lazy depending on location
hours can frequently take up all of social life (weekends 4-10)
a lot of days you wont be able to leave at your scheduled leaving time
peak hours can be really stressful if youre tired

Title: "GREAT"
Pros: Free food and easy going atmosphere
Cons: pay not enough hours and underpaid
Advice to Management: improve pay and hours

Title: "Great"
Pros: People culture, free food - learn culinary skills
Cons: The restaurant industry is hard.

Title: "Former Restaurateur 2 - quit."
Pros: Food with Integrity is incredible and has truly sparked a food revolution. The job itself at any level is not difficult. I do not regret anything about my time here but I'm very glad I left when I did. The customers are upstanding citizens for the most part and the days go by very quickly. Salaried managers receive great benefits like stock options, company cars, and frequent paid business trips. Hourly level employees have a chance to make a career if they're willing to fully devote themselves to Chipotle.
Cons: Company is going downhill and fast. As a Restaurateur 2 (GM of my own restaurant while also mentoring a GM I developed), I was operating as a TL while my TL was on sabbatical with no extra pay. The company does not care about Restaurateur cultures or how restaurant level employees feel anymore and are only focus on micromanaging meticulous food safety practices that take away from the guest and crew experience. For some reason they're trying to double in size and open new restaurant concepts while also instructing their Restaurateurs to terminate solid veteran managers because they "haven't adapted quickly" to the companies new priorities. You will see a lot of illegal practices like Salaried Managers being told to make hourly employees work off the clock and edit time punches so nobody gets overtime, 80 hour work weeks for salaried managers because we're told not to fully staff our restaurants. The company was great and was focused on the right thing before the foodbourne illness outbreaks but now the company has changed for the worse. It will just be a regular fast food restaurant eventually because they will always prioritize strict constantly changing food procedures over taking care of employees.
Advice to Management: Get your priorities in order and go back to the start like you've always preached. Caring about human beings is what made Chipotle great.. Not strict assembly line like procedures and protocols. The company does not need to grow in restaurant count or make burger joints or change the way we cut a bell pepper. The company needs to listen to how restaurant level employees feel and ensure that Field Leaders are leading and not micromanaging and forcing their Salaried Managers to do illegal things.

Title: "Interesting place to work."
Pros: Teamwork between employees is fantastic and allows for a very stimulating environment.
Cons: Very busy at times. Not everyone can handle the fast paced work environment.

Title: "working!"
Pros: learned a lot in a short amount of time if you kiss up you'll be a manger.
Cons: Managers can get very over themselves.

Title: "Chipotle takes care of its employees better than any other company of similar caliber!"
Pros: Free food, tuition reimbursement, great culture, team setting, caring people, good pay, great opportunity for growth, great benefits
Cons: You often do not get off when you ate scheduled depending on your location
Advice to Management: Management succeeds and excels most when they work asking side their employees and set an example for high standards! Keep up the great work!

Title: "Schieße"
Pros: Nothing really other than The free food, but Even After a while You get tired of it.
Cons: This Company is terrible it. Is Based on The Popularity system. You can Be amazing at your Job but if You Are Not "in" with The Crew Thats The end for You.
Advice to Management: Be more involved with what goes on in your store. This is Not Kindergarten or middle School this is a Job.

Title: "Line.."
Pros: Management was rude and unprofessional. . They have favorites and discrimination was a huge problem they had.
Cons:
Un organized
Unprofessional
Rude to employees
Selfish
Un considerate
Managers were lazy ..sat in the bk office eating and drinking beers and margaritas instead of helping employees learn
Advice to Management:
Stop being
Un organized
Unprofessional
Rude to employees
Selfish
Un considerate
Managers were lazy ..sat in the bk office eating and drinking beers and margaritas instead of helping employees learn

Title: "Terrible work experience"
Pros: Only "pro" I can think of is free food, ONLY if you work a 6 hour shift or more. Which hardly happens.
Cons:
Terrible scheduling- told them I had a commitment at 8:30 they would schedule me until 8 but wouldn't let me leave until there were no customers, everything was stocked, and everything was perfect.
The pressure to maintain the "culture" and keep the line clean is insane. Employees I worked with who had been there a long time got fired for not "promoting the culture". AKA, they got fired for no reason.
It's incredibly stressful with little breaks. Do NOT recommend.
Advice to Management: Stop putting so much pressure on promoting the culture and create a better work environment for your employees. We deal with so much criticism from managers and customers and get written up for stupid issues.

Title: "It was sh*t"
Pros: 9.00/hr is pretty decent for not having a college degree and still being in high school
Cons: Unprofessional work environment, employees smoked in front of the business which grossed out the customers, expected workers to be unnaturally and uncomfortably enthusiastic, and we were constantly understaffed, making everyone have to work 1000x harder than necessary.
Advice to Management: Stop firing people for not smiling like a cocaine addict.

Title: "GREAT!!!"
Pros: Great people to work with
Cons: none to share ! :)
Advice to Management: keep it up

Title: "Cook"
Pros: The food is good and free during your break and can get whatever you want
Cons: They're extra af for a minimum wage job, and they give very few hours

Title: "Chipotle? Nah fam"
Pros:
- Free Food
- $9/hr
- Room for moving up in the corporate latter
Cons:
- Management thinks they can control you just because you have the job.
- Stressful work-environment
- Everything is timed, which makes everything even more stressful.
- Managers can be rude.
- The job is both Physically & Mentally demanding. Dont take this job if you are a full time college student.
- The $9/hr dont really compensate the amount of stress you go through.
Advice to Management: Fix the way things are timed. Or at least dont pour too much pressure on new workers. I got tired of hearing from one manager how much faster I need to get, while other managers were telling me my speed was good. At the end, I ended up disliking that manager. I saw myself stressing out most of the time. Good food, but not a good place to work at.

Title: "Chipotle Crew Member Review"
Pros: The workplace culture is great and when you end up with an awesome team, it makes coming to work everyday worthwhile. You get one free meal a day which is awesome. It's also a really fast paced place to work depending on your location. Mine was in a mall so it was constantly busy on weekends. Helps you learn to work fast and efficiently while also catering to the customers needs.
Cons: Really bad management. My boss who had been restauranteur of my location for about ten years was randomly fired by the supervisor only to be replaced with a manager that had no idea what she was doing. She hired incompetent people and made no effort in regards to training. She also was constantly having crew members take on responsibilities that the management were meant to be in charge of. Such as running shifts and completing the monthly audits.
Advice to Management: Only move deserving people up to managerial positions. It's unfair to the crew members when they are stuck with a bad manager simply because the supervisors did not do their job in choosing a good leader.

Title: "Good Starting Place"
Pros: Good first Job, Will hire almost anyone, teaches you skills you may need to use in other jobs.
Cons: Management sometimes is the worse and doesn't know what they're doing.
Advice to Management: Please listen to your team and what they're trying to tell you.

Title: "Working at chipotle"
Pros: Great environment and caring company.
Cons: No amount of care and almost no pay can compensate for the fact that you still work in fastfood.
Advice to Management: Keep at it.

Title: "terrible, granted it was the one on the strip at harrahs"
Pros: Maybe cause it's on the strip? Thats not really a pro, but to some it might be. Food is kind of a plus even though I don't like chipotle to begin with.
Cons: Was really busy and rushed all the time. If you work here, you better hope they don't make you clean the tortilla press.

Title: "Chip"
Pros: Chipotle is great. Their vision is inspiring, food with integrity is heartening, and their high standards are difficult, but achievable. They're also very worth reaching. The job is hard and stressful, but very rewarding. This company has helped me grow a lot since I began there, as a person and an employee. They're great at building your confidence and team work abilities. It's a great place to have a job. Especially since their benefits are so great and starting pay is over minimum wage.
Cons:
Stressful, very hard. Only worth it if you go all the way. Everyone either grows with this company, or get fired/quits.
Also very hard to balance work and life if you're constantly closing.
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you're doing. Management at my store is great, I love them. I've heard some nightmare stories about some stores around us though that could use a lot of work.

Title: "It was a good job"
Pros: They gave you discounts on the foods
Cons: The store was always so much busy

Title: "More of a job for someone in college with no family"
Pros: 5 steps of empowerment, 13 characteristics of a top performer, great management, hire from within.
Cons: Low pay, every position has to do their own dishes.
Advice to Management: Be more professional

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Some pro's about working at chipotle is that the job comes with great benefits, and it's always a very busy company so it helped me build my confidence and customer service skills.
Cons: The con's about working at chipotle is basically standing up for long periods of time & not getting enfough hours.

Title: "Great but not really"
Pros: The companies mission is really great and real. The crew you have are always awesome. The food is amazing. You learn so much.
Cons: Your ATLs and TDs suck. They don't really want to help you, they look for any excuse in the book to throw you under the bus. They do it for the pay and not for the real reasons that chipotle has all of the standards they have. They are the reason I quit.
Advice to Management: Hold EVERYONE accountable for everything. Make sure you're always on your A-game and push yourself and your team.

Title: "Its basically what you expect"
Pros: Free Chipotle, decent minimum wage position relatively, room for advancement if you'd like to make a career out of it.
Cons: Possibility of outright incompetent managers and co-workers. Late nights of washing dishes since there are usually hundreds of them.

Title: "Not payed enough for the work load"
Pros:
Free food before shift & during break
50% off food when off the clock
Very friendly staff, at first
Small menu so memorizing prices was easy
Okay tips
Cons:
Short 10 minute break
Expected you to go on break right away even when in the middle of a task
Rude customers
You quickly start to hate your coworkers
Hours were getting cut due to salmonella rumors
Nit-picked every little thing you might have done wrong
Very condescending tone from most of the managers
Sometimes had to clean bathrooms & rush back & forth to the cash register to help a customer
Advice to Management:
Increase pay for cashiers
Care about your staff more

Title: "A good first job"
Pros: Illustrates the qualities of great customer service, that an employee can carry to other jobs. very fast paced shifts there fly by. Cool customer relations. Company has a beautiful message to spread to the world. Flexible schedule
Cons: A lot going on at times. Chipotle is always hiring so sometimes the training is not as thorough as desired.
Advice to Management: Management needs to focus on major foundational structure, like new crew members to assure the utmost quality of training.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: It is a really good company that I love work with, we are more that employees, we are a family
Cons: the pay it is not great
Advice to Management: provide more room of decision within stores, and also focus more in people, like used to be.

Title: "Houston Chipotle Review"
Pros: Some good reasons to work with Chipotle is that they promote from within the company. They have a roadmap for advancement in the workplace. If you are a dedicated individual you can move up and manage your own restaurant.
Cons: I don't really have much to say in this area. If you don't plan on following the roadmap to success at Chipotle, you could possibly be on the chopping block because they want highly motivated people who want a career and not just a job.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work at hiring the best people for the position. Don't be afraid to allow people a second chance. First-time managers sometimes make mistakes! Correct them about the mistake and how it could affect the compay first.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Good food at 50% employee discount
Cons: Horrible conditions. I'd stand for 9hrs without being allowed to eat or drink until my shift was up.
Advice to Management: Pay attention to employee concerns. Pennsylvania doesn't have strict employee laws, but people should always be treated with respect.

Title: "Eh"
Pros: Good food, good people, free meals, nice T-shirts. It was a good experience overall and I still like the company
Cons: Hot, cult like and manager was a meanie. Early morning meetings were pointless most of the time and they tried to force a family culture on all the employees. I'm just tryna work yo
Advice to Management: If I had to make up a short statement to say to the people who manage this establishment then I would say they should put in more fans

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Great business to work for, management cares about the people and the company, benefits are great as well.
Cons: Lots of turnover, new people very frequently, fast paced enviorment

Title: "Sales Associate"
Pros: If you work at a good store you can build yourself up and get ahead in the company.
Cons: The managers in my store constantly change so I would say the fact that with every manager there was suddenly a "new" Chipotle way when really it was just their way.
Advice to Management: Learn how to empathize with the employees and how to acknowledge when you did something wrong.

Title: "Front-of-house"
Pros: Great atmosphere and people, got to prep food
Cons: low number of hours, poor management
Advice to Management: Disburse hours better

Title: "Worst job i ever had"
Pros: The only good thing about chipotle is their food. The company really needs to consider new practices with their employees.
Cons: Everything such as tasks, coworkers, customers, procedures, etc. Pressure from management to work faster and harder. Stress level over the roof.
Advice to Management: They need to be more organized and have patience with new hires, they expect them to know everything in one day or training. It is so stressful and the pressure is so high.

Title: "yay"
Pros: its fun and not too complicated and everyone is ncie
Cons: they have very high expectations
Advice to Management: youre great

Title: "Chipotle is good"
Pros: Love working here with good people
Cons: Customers can be a little off-putting
Advice to Management: Continue valuing the true operators in our stores

Title: "Very nice place to work"
Pros:
Friendly, hardworking team members
Collaborative environment
Cons: Super busy lunch hours, but worth it
Advice to Management:
Keep doing an excellent job
Pay more attention to workers at times

Title: "Cool summer job"
Pros: Young crowd, easy enough most days, you kept busy enough, train you on everything, no experience needed, good for a summer job wouldn't stay very long
Cons: They had cliques, and I swear one manager was out to get me, assumed i knew a lot of protocol, didn't practice what they preached , peak hours will kick your butt
Advice to Management: Care about new employees, be realistic with expectations, don't roll your eyes when we ask questions, a couple of the managers were really cool and were super friendly. Keep your crew in line drama starts really quick and a lot of the managers instigate things

Title: "Could be better"
Pros: Great coworkers, opportunities to advance, great benefits, free food
Cons: Management needs to improve, never leave on time, did not allow us to request days off, quick to fire employees, under lots of pressure and stress most of the time

Title: "The Truth"
Pros: Free food every day you work, 50% off on meals when you don't work. If you're in a good location with genuinely good people, you'll have a great experience. Very easy to move up.
Cons: Lots of physical, tedious work. Must always work fast paced and keep a smile on your face when customers want to strangle you.
Advice to Management: Stay focused. Have patience. Lead with integrity. Teach and develop as many as you can.

Title: "Upbeat culture"
Pros:
There are plenty of opportunities to move up in the hierarchy.
Upper management cares and treats you as an equal.
Leadership opportunities, even for non-management.
Free meals when working.
Don't have to pay for uniform.
Cons:
You really need to be committed 100% to the Chipotle mission.
Manual labor and service can be tiring.

Title: "Good work here"
Pros: Friendly crew members they were very nice and told me about there experience
Cons: You have to start from the bottom and work your way up
Advice to Management: Don't let the interviewer talk more than the interviewees

Title: "GM"
Pros: Growth within the company, development bonus, stocks.
Cons: Can be hard to balance work/life working here. Depends on your restaurant staffing and development growth.

Title: "Bad Management"
Pros:
Free Lunch
Fast Paced so time goes by
Cons:
Not a lot of room to grow
Manager doesn't care
Bad at scheduling
Advice to Management: Hire better Management

Title: "Pretty awesome company"
Pros: Great for high school or college students.
Cons: Constant policy changes, and you have to wear a stupid hat.
Advice to Management: Have every location adhere to the same position task. I work prep but have to do grill task too.

Title: "Chipolte Review"
Pros: The managers are great, everyone is there to help you out and encourage you to get better. After a year they have tuition reimbursements.
Cons: It's a lot of work and you have to do it the correct way to meet chipotle standards but once you learn it it's pretty simple

Title: "LOVE IT!"
Pros: Chipotle has a great environment, good pay, amazing coworkers and customers.
Cons: I really have nothing bad to say about Chipotle.
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you're doing guys.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Awesome place to move up!
Cons: What even are cons here!
Advice to Management: Hire Top Performers!

Title: "Things Have Changed"
Pros: The environment is very team oriented, with all stores trying to attain "Restaurateur" status. This essentially means the store is lead by an elite GM. Though this mostly creates a great environment, it often overshadows the actual responsibility of running the restaurant.
Cons: Since the e. coli outbreak Chipotle has gone crazy trying to win customers back and create a safer kitchen. Unfortunately, this has created a lot more work for employees and made simple tasks very tedious. Upon starting a shift, you have to be examined for 'symptoms' and constantly have to show people how to properly wash your hands. It is often more like working in a doctor's office than a restaurant.
Advice to Management: Create a food safety program that is not changing so frequently and allow time for changes to properly be implemented

Title: "Great Opportunities"
Pros: Flexible Schedule, Advancement Opportunities, Salary
Cons: High Stress Environment, Travel, Work Life Balance suffers.

Title: "Wast of food"
Pros: Some of the people there made it fun
Cons: They would rather throwaway there food from theday than give it to an employee who needed it 4 family..
Advice to Management: Stop being so greedy with your food and give it to your employees if needed dont be wastful

Title: "Crew"
Pros:
Free lunch
Great environment
Work as a team so your never working alone
Cons:
Can get pretty busy.
Fast pace environment
Clean the back on slow days
Advice to Management: Need to be more efficient with supervising employees

Title: "Cook- Grill"
Pros: Great position where you grill the steak and chicken. It is great because you can actually do taste testing!
Cons: It may get pretty hot working in this position.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: The people are amazing to work with!
Cons: Customers can be at times ignorant.

Title: "Take Out Specialist"
Pros:
- Free Chipotle For Lunch
- Fun Working with the team
- Can learn about fast cash handling skills
- You can have opportunity for improvement if you continue to always work hard and improve
- You can meet the awesome customers and connect with them, they will always want to come back for more Chipotle
Cons:
- Can get really busy and you will end up getting really sweaty
- Sometimes you will end up having to clean the back of the house when the days are slow
- Things can get pretty hectic if the the grill is working slow
- Sometimes customers can be pretty rude
Advice to Management: Continue to take care of your crew and to not forget how you got to management. Everyone starts at the bottom and sometimes things get rough when the days get busy. Always remember to respect each worker and always make each other better. Continue to empower others even though you accomplished a management position.

Title: "Former Crew Member"
Pros: Chipotle was a great company to work for. It was a clean environment, flexible,, and the food was good. I was able to move up in position in very little time.
Cons: The cons of working for Chipotle were there was a high turnover rate with employees and management. There were also limited hours per week for employees because of the high number of employees.

Title: "Great food, I really enjoyed it"
Pros: I really want to show people that chipotle food is rocking. And that anything is possible to prove that. I love Chipotle!
Cons: Some challenges are working with the employee and how fast you can be. Also show appreciation. Also trying to make people comfortable eating.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work.

Title: "Good company"
Pros: I really like the fact that the company was always growing. It felt that there's lots of room for advancement.
Cons: Like any big company, it seems like they play favorites. The growth also meant that your boss changed quite often.
Advice to Management: I get the focus on internal development. But it doesn't seem like there's always enough focus on maintaining the operating standards in the stores. And I think sometimes bringing in people from the outside can be helpful.

Title: "GEneral Manager"
Pros: chipotle has quick upward mobility if you live somewhere they are expanding. Decent health benefits and 401K
Cons: Downsides are Fifty hour work weeks without compensation sometimes even more, not a whole lot of support from the district managers.
Advice to Management: Continue to support your Store managers and maybe create better incentives when goals are reached, more opportunities without have to relocate.

Title: "Great First Job"
Pros:
-Good pay - they start you out at 9.50 an hour and give raises based on how long you work there. You get your first raise after just 6 months.
-Opportunities for overtime and added hours
-Good Hours- I was part time, and usually worked a good 30-35 hours a week. On a good week, when I was asked to cover or do overtime, I would actually clock in over 45 hours.
-Discounts- You get a free meal when you work a shift and 50% off when you're off the clock.
-Great coworkers
-Great customers
-Great training process
-They encourage your progress and 100% feel that the goal is to get you to management
-Never drug tests
-No policy against tattoos/piercings
Cons:
-Hard f-ing work- physically demanding if you are not young and in good health. You're on your feet the whole time regardless of what position. If you work on the line or on grill, the heat can suck.
-You can only use discount at your location.
-HARD to get a job there. There are a total of THREE interviews, which I feel is a bit much. They want the best though, so it makes sense.

Title: "good for people who want a long term career w/ chipotle (not college students)"
Pros: great people who care about the vision, free food, 50% off when not working
Cons: felt like a cult, don't staff enough, experienced people get tired of job
Advice to Management: At small Chipotle locations, staff an extra person to help with shift change.

Title: "Crew / cashier"
Pros: Health insurance is in expensive for one person. Fun working environment. Free food, paid breaks.
Cons: Getting out late as a closer sometimes. Customers wanting "more" food all the time.

Title: "Don't work here."
Pros: The food is great, you get free food when you work and a 50% discount when you aren't working.
Cons: Management was more worried about social aspects amongst the crew than they were about the actual job.
Advice to Management: Get your crap together, seriously. You're grown men and women hanging out and drinking with underage teens.

Title: "Long and stressful work hours"
Pros:
-Free meals for lunch.
-Management pushes you to move up.
-Learn teamwork skills.
Cons:
-Work schedule can be inconsistent.
-Peek or rush hours can be pretty stressful.
Advice to Management: Give more attention to everyone's work ethics.

Title: "Chipotle is a good choice"
Pros:
Good pay, Good hours, Pretty easy work. Fun environment.
50% off discount. Free meal every shift!
Cons: Dont really have anything negative to say.
Advice to Management: none.

Title: "Chipotle Crew"
Pros:
Free food
Easy promotion
Health, vision and dental
Learn how to do everything
Cons:
Sucks if you have a bad team and managers
They expect you to be fast right away
Can be pretty tedious until you get used to portions

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Free food and decent tips
Cons: You get paid little for the amount of effort put in.
Advice to Management: Keep your standards in mind when deciding pay

Title: "Fair work"
Pros: Fast work environment with friendly management and coworkers
Cons: Can be overwhelming due to lack of necessary fundamentals if restaurantism

Title: "Best fast food place you can work at"
Pros: You get free food during your break. Also the working environment is nice, from the policies to the open kitchen.
Cons: Your break is only 10 mins if you work a 6 hour shift or 20 if you work longer than that.
Advice to Management: N/A

Title: "Manager In Training"
Pros: HA HA HA! This place is a joke, the only pro in this company was getting out of it!
Cons:
It was a terrible work place and wasted my time just like everyone else says. They do not care about their employees, they have gotten way to big to fast and just like every company, they STOP CARING. Corporate doesn't understand anything about what goes on in their stores, how extremely bad the work conditions are, and stressful it is.
Their strategy is to hire young employees because they are inexperienced, will work hard and can be brain washed into the stupid made up culture they try to instill in you. Everything is in place to BLIND YOU from the truth. They want to keep you striving hard to keep production flowing, but underneath it all, is nothing but an empty heartless company looking after every penny without a thought about the backbone of the company, IT'S WORKERS!
Ha Ha Ha and you know the company is in trouble when they give out tons of discounts and free food and no one cares.....Good!
Advice to Management: It doesn't matter, Management won't take the advice, they don't have the power to change it nor do they have a clue what really goes on in their stores. It's to big of a company and only the very Top cats can do anything really, and we know they won't....You don't understand why E.coli is happening? Really, have you looked at the kind of workers your hiring, ALL KIDS, EVEN THE MANAGERS! & THE CRAZY WORK CONDITIONS, WHILE ALWAYS BEING UNDERSTAFFED LEADS TO A CESSPOOL OF HEALTH VIOLATIONS! Stupid dumb retarded company just like everyone else, just making money off the underpaid hard workers keeping your ridiculous made up culture alive until it all crumbles just like Rome.

Title: "Not Bad."
Pros: They generally only hire friendly people, so that's cool. The work is pretty easy, too, once you get used to the lines going out the door.
Cons: They put a lot of pressure on you to be perfect, and there's a bit much over the shoulder training.
Advice to Management: practice what you preach

Title: "Cook"
Pros: Fun job keeps you on your feet
Cons: Says they're family orented but once I was having issues with my pregnancy and with my husband deployed they fired me
Advice to Management: Keep a good eye on your Gms a lot of them suck unless they're boss is there watching them

Title: "General Manager"
Pros:
Good benefits
Good pay
Fun work environment
Cons: Demanding schedule for salary managers
Advice to Management: I would suggest not putting such specifications on exact shifts, to allow for a better work life balance

Title: "Cash register"
Pros: Good team environment, understanding and easy to work with, managers treat each individual with respect. Overall good place to work and build work ethic
Cons: Sometimes it can be hard to keep up with the lines, peak hours you have to stay on the line without moving or going out to clean tables, give out a lot of free stuff, sometimes would ask you to clock out and keep working

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Team commitment, goal oriented, great positive attitude thought out all the staff
Cons: Tough to move up, lost to memorize, a lot of pressure for expectations
Advice to Management: Compliment before critique

Title: "Kitchen manager"
Pros: Free meals, culture, location,good food
Cons: Very tedious work, cheap equipment, rude customers, high employee turnover
Advice to Management: Work on leadership

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Friendly co-workers. Management worked well with flexible scheduling. Free food while working.
Cons: Prep work was hard to finish on time. Sometimes was made to work off the clock to start Prep work before scheduling.
Advice to Management: Barry Sutter was an awesome GM.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros:
A common theme here: free food, but that's about it.

I do believe that the leadership at the corporate level believes in the mission of empowering top performers to achieve high standards, but it's so lost in the day to day operations of the store. Conceptually great, but not being executed.
Cons:
My TL only has 6 stores yet somehow managed to only find his way into our store for 10-15 mins per week. My previous TL was a rockstar prior to her promotion/focus on ShopHouse.

Every min of every day is planned out. You can't breath, forget develop a team. There's NO work life balance regardless or role, or respect for the crew's time/what's scheduled. The schedule is posted, at best, 72 hrs prior to being live which is staggering. It's a great place to work if you have no friends or family or outside interests. It's all or nothing here.
Advice to Management: It'll fall on deaf ears. My advice is to eat here because it is safe and delicious food, just don't work here.

Title: "Great atmosphere!"
Pros: People are great, vision for the company is innovative, real potential to move up within the company if interested.
Cons: Personally dont enjoy working in the food industry, unprofessional co-workers at times.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "It's ok"
Pros: the schedule can be really fleible
Cons: the pay is really low

Title: "hard work, mostly nice people"
Pros: Mostly friendly empowering environment. Casual and easy to catch on.
Cons: occasionally unsavory characters on the crew. It's not unbearable. The work itself can get mundane but making burritos isn't that hard. Getting time off or a schedule takes a bit of persistence and reminding but it's not impossible.
Advice to Management: Pay more attention to schedule organization

Title: "Love The Culture!"
Pros:
- love love love the environment
- strong belief in team work
- great opportunity for growth
- stand by values and morals
- genuinely cares about their customer's, company, product AND employees
Cons: - You do have to buy a special kind of shoe as part of your uniform, so that is a little annoying but all in all it's for your's and other's safety so it's not all that bad.
Advice to Management: KEEP DOING WHAT YOU ARE DOIN!G! You guys are really the only mainstream fast food establishment that I know of the really cares, and shows that you care. change nothing, and keep your integrity and you will be fine.

Title: "N/A"
Pros: good customers, fast-paced environment, challenging, good team work, fast
Cons: non-negotiable, mistreatment, unfair, biased, slow

Title: "crew member"
Pros:
Amazing co-workers
Everyone is kind and supportive
Great first job
Fun environment
Cons: You will be sore 95% of the time

Title: "Hard work for little pay"
Pros: Free meals (on the rare occasions when you actually get a break)
Cons: I don't know about other stores, but for a majority of the days at mine the managers would stay in the back gossiping do God knows what, then get mad at the short staffed crew team for not getting everything done. They expect everybody to cover multiple stations so they can keep their hours down, and expects everybody to stay after their scheduled hours on a daily basis.
Advice to Management: Get down in the trenches with your crew members. If we don't see you working hard for half the day what makes you think I want to for what amounts to minimum wage.

Title: "GM-Over it."
Pros:
Management at your own pace (if your liked and do well with people)
50k salary
Tuition Reimbursement of 90%
Cons: Since ecoli break out there has been a definit change in the priorities of the company,as to be expected, but the employees are being put very last. Development has been put on hold, store visits from upper management are less frequent and if you are not favored you will not make it out of a crew level. When questions are asked they are answered indirectly (as if they are trying to not incriminate themselves by doing the simplest thing of saying yes or no)
Advice to Management: Just because you make people feel warm and fuzzy does not mean that you aren't actually stabbing them with the short end of the stick (making 11 hours shift mandatory, but be expected to stay for 13..and off days..hmmm, no. You are salary and salary is always on the clock so forget that) TREAT PEOPLE WITH DIGNITY AND BE HONEST WITH YOURSELF (anyone associated with this place has been told by family that they put this business first before themselves and it's the truth.)

Title: "Kdmfkdkd"
Pros: Good pay, paid break, free food.
Cons: Not enough hours, busy all the time.
Advice to Management: More hours, give more training.

Title: "Strict, but good quality"
Pros: Upholds company standards of cleanliness and food quality
Cons: always busy, less leniency

Title: "Regional Support Specialist"
Pros:
People culture is second to none.
Perks are above average related to industry standard.
Flexibility of schedule and quality of work/life balance.
Cons: Salary may be slightly lower than other companies.

Title: "Cree"
Pros: Fun work place, good benefits
Cons: Never honored days off that were approved before working there due to school.
Advice to Management: Keep your word

Title: "Great Culture"
Pros: Culture, flexible hours, fast paced, free/discounted food
Cons: There were very few downsides. High turnover, difficult customers, no overtime

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Free food, Paid breaks, Flexible Schedule
Cons: Unqualified managers, inconsistent standards, lack of training,

Title: "overworked and underpaid"
Pros: company has great intentions. Food is truly gmo free and the main goal is to change the way people see fast food. Environment allows for you to really bond with your co workers and it truly is like a family. Monty. Monty is a pro. love that guy.
Cons: everyone below apprentice level is underpaid. Almost a cult like mentality that leads you to push yourself way past the breaking point. most people quit for that reason. Never been at a store where someone below GM level was happy with how things are run which makes sense since they make 60,000+.Most people who work for chipotle have cried at least once if not more than once while working for the company.
Advice to Management: listen to your people. pay us properly. and make all managers salaried. really stupid to expect managers to control labor and get the store clean between shifts if we have to clock out because were not salaried. main reason why your managers quit and your apprentices suck.

Title: "good"
Pros: Amazing team of people, they really do hire based on the 13 key characteristics. Realistic opportunities for advancement.
Cons: It's hard work, it was a rewarding experience but every day you come home sore and smelling like peppers. Unless you like that sort of thing.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Learned how to operate a scaleable restaurant. Good systems in place to move up if you want to.
Cons: Long hours if you have incompetent management. Efficiency and common sense come second place to doing things the "Chipotle Way". Being on the grill in a busy location is hell.

Title: "Kitchen manager"
Pros:
Great hours
Great environment to work
Cons:
Pay
Lack Opportunities
Work load
Advice to Management: Pay your kitchen managers more.

Title: "If you're interested in restaurant employment, Chipotle is a great company to work for."
Pros: Very strong ethics within the company, and the only restaurant that I've worked at where I haven't felt disposable. They pay very well in comparison to competition.
Cons: There isn't much in the way of "moving up" at a restaurant. There is a clearly defined ladder to climb, but it takes a while to move up and the pay isn't the best around.

Title: "Chipotle Review"
Pros: Great team connections among employees. Very friendly staff members. Staff willing to work with your schedule.
Cons: Having to deal with unhappy customers, and provide excellent service regardless of their attitude.
Advice to Management: Continue to make it a great employee environment. Allow the employees to work with the staff to make it a fun place to work.

Title: "hated it"
Pros:
great co-workers
free meal every shift
good opportunity for growth in the company
Cons:
Inconsistent Expectations
Fast track to management leaves people unprepared
Expect you to be a top performer from day 1 with no learning curve. Very little patience.
Never acknowledged for good work, only for mistakes.
Advice to Management:
Better communication between managers, please. One day I was told I was doing great by one manager only to be pulled aside the next day by another to be told I should be fired due to my "consistently poor performance". Which is it? It can't be both.
Also, please actually DO the performance reviews. I had no idea how I was actually doing because the manager never gave me a formal review. How can someone improve if they have no idea where they stand?

Title: "Loved the team"
Pros: Amazing team of people, they really do hire based on the 13 key characteristics. Realistic opportunities for advancement.
Cons: It's hard work, it was a rewarding experience but every day you come home sore and smelling like peppers. Unless you like that sort of thing.
Advice to Management: Continue doing an amazing job, oh and cut the pm prep guys some slack, especially in high volume locations.

Title: "Good Vibes"
Pros: Chipotle typically hires young people which keeps the atmosphere young and fresh. You don't need any experience to get hired, they train you and pay you for it. Paid breaks and free employee meal if you're on the clock but 50% off if you're not. They're super flexible with schedules so they will always cater to your needs. Overall, definitely a great place for a first job to pickup experience.
Cons: Sometimes they expect things to get done in an unreasonable amount of time. Low pay for the amount of work you do, especially if you work in the kitchen.
Advice to Management: Give better pay!

Title: "Crappy Crew"
Pros:
Nice coworkers, especially in crew
Customers are usually friendly enough
Free meals
Cons:
Poorly Managed
Lack of Leadership
Expect Crew to do everything
Managers would just be on their phone all the time
Would give schedule Sunday
Advice to Management: start working more, not just sitting in the office on your phone

Title: "chipotle is an okay job"
Pros: free chipotle , 50% off your second meal , 30 minute lunch breaks
Cons: cant take tips , there was a lot of favoritism
Advice to Management: stop it with the favoritism

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
You get free food when you work
11.15 an hour compared to minimum wage
Cons: A lot of work!! Your going to be doing things all over.

Title: "fired on 2nd day. they expect too much, too soon."
Pros:
Honest about where their food comes from

Admirable company vision and mission

Friendly environment
Cons:
If you're shy or have a naturally "sad" looking face, you have to SLAP on a smile. If you look sad for at least a day of work, you'll probably be fired. They expect 24/7 enthusiasm and smiles. Even if you're just deep-in-thought processing and absorbing all the information, put a smile or enthusiastic expression on your face.

You're expected to know everything after a day of training. If they say you can watch and listen or take a hands-on approach to learning, that is a lie. Absorb as much information as you can, and start diving in immediately.
Advice to Management: Maybe try not to fire new hires after a day of training. You hired these people for a reason and observing them for only a day will create a serious lack in proper judgment. They presumably held the 13 Characteristics you were looking for. Give it a week or two before you decide to fire them. Some people don't get a hold of things right off the bat. Give them a PROPER chance.

Title: "N/A"
Pros: Chipotle Mexican Grill is a good place to work at for multiple reasons. Good wages, makes good food on location, promotes internally.
Cons: Some of the reasons you might not want to work at Chipotle Mexican Grill are, long training period, Early mornings, late nights.
Advice to Management: The interview process is wildly inconsistent from location to location, making it nearly impossible to prepare. Please have a somewhat standardized interview process which changes mildly based on the needs of the restaurant.

Title: "Good company to work at"
Pros: People were really nice, managers were strict but in a good way, helped me grow a lot as an employee
Cons: No benefits, pay was a little below what I expected

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Offer good starting wage, does reviews for raises very often, everyone is really nice, the training was done very well at that location
Cons: management did not really address issues as well as they could have at times, you have to be very fast paced and able to multi-task
Advice to Management: I'm sure at other locations it's different but this location had an issue with resolving issues as well as they should.

Title: "More than a Fast Food Restaurant"
Pros:
Company stayed committed to their values, culture, and vision.
Co-workers had fun and were motivated to be empowered
Cons: District manager, also known as Apprentice Team Leader was an extreme jerk that contributed to three managers, including the GM, resigning their position.
Advice to Management: Keep it up! Empower your team, don't discourage them!

Title: "Chipotle sucks"
Pros: The pay is pretty decent for part time
Cons: Inconsiderate management & unstable employment retention

Title: "IF YOU'RE IN HS STAY AWAY!!!"
Pros:
Free food thats if you work a minimum of 5 hours or more this shift..
Good hours.
Cons:
Low pay for the amount of work.
Terrible management.
Managers would constantly argue with each other.
I would stay an 1-2 hours after they have clocked me out to finish my station, WITHOUT GETTING PAID.
They give you false hope and dreams of moving up in the company, you wouldn't want to anyway, unless you haven't even finished high school.
I would get home at 2am from work every night and have to wake up in 3 hours for school.

I was hired as crew member to a brand new chipotle. In less than 4 months from being opened everyone from the original crew has quit. Slave work for slave pay...
Advice to Management: Stop fighting with each other, and actually care for your employees.

Title: "Not for the Faint of Heart"
Pros: Fresh ingredients, high stands, good people culture, fast-paced
Cons: Long hours, hard work, disorganized management

Title: "Decent"
Pros: Pay is pretty good
Cons: Promotional options are really not there
Advice to Management:
Bring more talent from
Outside

Title: "Gm"
Pros: Great food great people it's pretty awesome working for this company don't trust the upper management as a GM they always want to fire someone
Cons: The upper management was bogus always wanted me to fire someone for no reason they have really bad people skills
Advice to Management: Don't be tricked in not being a top performer they will tell you anything to make you feel like your not doing a great job

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: working as a team is great
Cons: when it gets busy, it stinks

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Great, fun environment. Lots of opportunity for development. Lots of knowledge and builds a string work ethic for those with little job experience.
Cons: Long days sometimes, high turnover rate. Minimum age for hire is 16 so some maturity issues from time to time.
Advice to Management: Just openly communicate with you people and don't allow employees to work.off the clock. Not only is it illegal, but it isn't very encouraging.

Title: "Great working environment"
Pros: for starters free food is always a positive. when I worked there the working environment was great, the managers do try their best to create an environment where you feel empowered. they are also flexible on hours, just speak to the manager and they try their best to accommodate your circumstance
Cons: it is a physically exhausting job. you are often given several tasks at once and they need to be done efficiently and most importantly done quickly which can overwhelm you.
Advice to Management: nothing really comes to mind.

Title: "Not awesome, but not terrible."
Pros: You can have a laugh with both customers and your fellow employees while serving great food. Great for people who like fast paced environments. Great if your a college student. Free Food (50% off when not working).
Cons: Management. Although some problems have been mitigated, problems such as constant changes to the schedule and people not getting time off requests honored stick around. GM constantly micromanages. People give you a hard time because of the EColi breakout last year TO THIS DAY. Closing can be tiring, especially when SSR (Food Safety people) rolls into town. Understaffed a lot (Managers>Crew)
Advice to Management: Focus more on managerial work rather than micromanaging employees with anything to their work, life, etc. Also, give your SMs and Apprentice a chance to share their opinions rather than making decisions without checking with them. Prep shouldn't be given a hard time as often, their job is tough.

Title: "Crew Memeber"
Pros: Benefits, Teamwork, Helping others, Talking to Customers, Opportunity
Cons: If you are not a fast worker, you will be behind when the store is PACKED.
Advice to Management: None, they do it right.

Title: "Sucks!!"
Pros:
Free food
Short shifts
Fast paced
Cons:
Lack of hours
Cleaning the entire front of store alone

Title: "Good"
Pros: people you work with and they give you career opportunities
Cons: sometimes the work gets overwhelmed and customers

Title: "This is an extremely fulfilling place to work with great people and excellent benefits"
Pros: You will enjoy your time here because you'll actually feel like you have a purpose, very meaningful job with a lot of flexibility!
Cons: Extremely fast-paced environment, they will not accept any slacking off. Frequent performance reviews are to be expected, and your peers will be evaluating you as well!

Title: "fired for nothing"
Pros: They hours they gave were okay
Cons: Horrible service .. They treated employees like trash
Advice to Management: Don't fire great workers

Title: "Great to kill time, but is it really worth it?"
Pros: Free food, 30 Min paid break, awesome crew members
Cons: Too much work for the pay, the amount of hours given too your were not negotiable. Sometime you would have to put in overtime. It would put stress onto your body. Not recommend for students
Advice to Management: Please be flexible with the crew member when it comes to certain events

Title: "Too good to be true"
Pros: Good pay, free food and paid breaks!
Cons: HORRIBLE upper management. Will make a lot of promises that never happen and prepare to be a slave!

Title: "Terrible"
Pros: I interviewed with one of their new locations and they were prompt about calling me in for an interview, which was easy and only lasted about 5 minutes before they offered me a position with them. The pay was well about minimum wage.
Cons: I already have another part time job, which they knew at the time of hire. The training for it was supposed to be the day after but it was like pulling teeth trying to get all the paperwork and information from them, so I didn't find out until I had already filled out all of the legal stuff that the training started immediately the next day in a shift that overlapped my already scheduled shift. So I was only ever employed on paper and never actually got to work or anything. It was a complete waste of time. Only apply here if you're completely unemployed, otherwise they won't work with you at all.
Advice to Management: Be flexible with people, not everyone can survive on just one part time job with unguaranteed hours, especially when they're up front about already being employed.

Title: "Depends on Location"
Pros: Can be working with really fun people in a good environment, the people really make the job, if its fun youre in a good mood, if its not you are looking at the clock every 10 minutes, lots of free food I never get sick of, really cool management structure
Cons: long shifts most of the time, mine are 7.5 only with a break before open if I finish prep work before we open,

Title: "I hate it"
Pros: It's a great first job. It pays over minimum wage.
Cons: Not the best environment. Management does not care about your plans. Threatened to fire anyone that calls out at my location understaffed
Advice to Management: Hire more people. Promote more people. Show people respect.

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Friendly, hard working people; fun manager
Cons: It's a lot harder than it looks

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Very good management and lots of room to grow. Promote from within. Works very well with school schedules.
Cons: Can be a little too much work for amount compensated.

Title: "Kitchen manager"
Pros: Good pay. Free food. Laid back atmosphere.
Cons: Over worked. Under valued. Lots of back breaking work.
Advice to Management: Have enough employees so we don't have to do the work of multiple people.

Title: "Pretty Good"
Pros:
Honestly, for 9.50/hr just starting in Brooklyn is pretty great. I was a student and with limited experience this was the best paying job.
They are super flexible on what hours you can/can't work. They worked around my school schedule and when I got a second job for the winter, they worked around that as well.
Cons:
It's a bit all over the place. You're never going to be assigned to one place for a long time.
No real training, they just throw you in and expect you to get everything

Title: "Not Bad"
Pros: In the east Pembroke pines location great management worked with my schedule very well ... great people to work with
Cons: REALLY hard work fast paced , always have to be doing something
Advice to Management: GREAT JOB

Title: "It's not for everyone"
Pros: Strong family environment amongst the crew, and once you've worked and excelled here, working anywhere else will seem like a walk in the park.
Cons: Very demanding job, and has a lot of competition for promotions. If you're not ready to work your butt off for every moment of your shift, then you should look somewhere else.
Advice to Management: Your crew is human; therefore, they will make mistakes, and they will not work if you don't; so, I advise you not hide away in the office.

Title: "Overall pretty great place."
Pros: Besides being pretty flexible with their crew members schedules you get free food! In addition they are pretty good about selecting who works there so everyone tends to get along well.
Cons: Some parts of the job can be very physically demanding and on occasion customers can be less than agreeable with employees.

Title: "Prep Chef"
Pros: Developed my knife skills and speed
Cons: Because business is slow not getting the hours I want (forty hours or more)
Advice to Management: I'm passionate, driven and focused. Would welcome a change and have visited your store and have met your inspiring staff would love to be a part of that team.

Title: "A Love, Hate Relationship"
Pros: Many Benefits, Great Culture, Awesome People (Overall), Growth Opportunity
Cons: False Promises, Upper Management Plays Favorites, People Form Into Clicks
Advice to Management: KEEP YOUR WORD! If you say you're going to do something, do it. It's that simple.

Title: "Don't listen to the hype"
Pros: Interesting coworkers. Free meal with every shift. 50% off meals if you've already had your employee meal. Plus you learn how to make some killer guac
Cons: You'll have to work off the clock. If you don't hit your break in time you don't get a break. If you're not happy enough they fire you. Without warning. They promise promotions to 3 people at once and turn them against each other.
Advice to Management: Communicate. Honestly. Stop promising promotions. Y'all act like you're trying to change fast food then turn around and pull the same McDonald's BS you find everywhere else. Don't blame your crew members for you setting them up for failure. Ditch the "no excuses" attitude. Oh yeah, and don't fire people for being mentally ill.

Title: "Very comfortable working space"
Pros: College loans and good pay
Cons: Gets very busy, very hot
Advice to Management: Keep doing what your doing

Title: "Manager"
Pros:
Free food
Plenty of hours
Cons:
No breaks
Too much work
Schedule always changes

Title: "Empty Promises and long days"
Pros: When things are going well, its a great place to work. Employees receive a free meal every time they work and dress code is casual.
Cons: Extremely disorganized with managers that should definitely not be there. High turnover rate due to lack of leadership. Chipotle has started trying to force their "vision" on people all the while not appreciating their employees.
Advice to Management: Make an effort to lead your employees. Show them the right way to do things and set the example. Make sure customers are satisfied and the line is moving quickly.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great vibe and people. Learn the reason they are in business and food is great. Really fresh. My management were really open to my schedule while i was at school.
Cons: Pay isnt the best for the amount of work you do. Needs to have more incentives to keep employees or a lot of turnover and not enough employees because of long interview process.
