Advice to Management: Keep improving employees and have them move around instead of just keeping them in one place.

Title: "Chipotle Review"
Pros: No experience is required to work at Chipotle, it doesn't take long to become familiar with the restaurant's mission and responsibilities of the job
Cons: Poor management, at my specific location the entire team had only been there less than a year besides the managers, schedule was too frequently changed w/o much of a notice
Advice to Management: Improve policies for workers and keep schedules consistent to be considerate of workers. Also, be more selective in the hire process to obtain substantial and long term employees.

Title: "If you want to build yourself up."
Pros: If you have no experience, you can build path with Chipotle. They're all about training their employees who started with nothing, all it takes is effort. Great environment to work in.
Cons: A main con I would say about the company is that they have really high expectations of high performers, and if you don't meet that expectation, you are considered a low performer, which is really demotivating.

Title: "Cashier review"
Pros: Positive environment. Empowerment by crew member and through the managers. Free food when you work is the biggest plus at chipotle. Making fresh food is rewarding as well.
Cons: It's a very demanding job when it comes to customer needs and wants. We try to give fast food a different name when people walk into chipotle, but we are very well underplayed for the amount of labor we do.
Advice to Management: I believe the minimum wage for chipotle needs to be raised honestly. I don't feel like we get paid enough for the amount of work we do for the restaurant. We are a very reliable and dependable crew and as well as high standards are always in our best interest. Chipotle is not just another job it's an investment and a great work environment therefore I think the employees at chipotle should be considered more valuable than most food places.

Title: "It's been an ok experience at Chipotle but there's alot of room for improvement"
Pros: Great work environment, friendly staff, no previous experienced required to work here,free lunch and great food!
Cons: Extremely fast paced work most times, work schedules can get a little hectic, when it's slow workers get sent home earlier without compensation on missing hours,work hours may vary, wages need to be a little higher, you're always expected to work faster, kitchen and dish washer need to be better equipped for workers by providing better safety items such as heavy duty rubber gloves to wash dishes and insulated gloves to prevent burns in the kitchen. Also, a emergency eye wash area would be appropriate.
Advice to Management: Appreciate your workers a little more especially those that have worked at Chipotle for quite a while. If possible offer them a raise, because they work very hard for you everyday. Its hard work!

Title: "Chipotle Corporate"
Pros: Wear what you what to work, fun people to work with, flexible workplace, exposure to many sides of the company, work-life balance is encouraged, good bonus (when the stock price is doing well), and free burritos!
Cons: Vague standards for a promotion, high turnover rate, hard to know where you stand with management, cutthroat environment, review techniques are not well done, positive reinforcement is a concept that is mythical at the company, gossip-filled work place from the director down, pay does not match occupation, not much vacation time, overall toxic workplace at times.

Title: "It was amazing."
Pros: I worked with amazing coworkers who made me look forward to going to work everyday. I had an awesome GM who understood and validated each and everyone of his employees. Overall, I felt it wasn't a job; it was a second home.
Cons: I really can't think of any cons working for Chipotle.

Title: "AMAZING"
Pros: Free meal when you work, 50%off meals when you don't work
Cons: There are none everything's great
Advice to Management: Nothing to be done everything's great

Title: "Line"
Pros: You get to eat burritos
Cons: You will no longer like burritos
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Ehhh"
Pros: Fast work environment, promotion opportunities, decent pay in low cost of living areas
Cons: Poor poor management, the opportunities aren't really that plentiful and you have to kill yourself to get them
Advice to Management: Not everything is about you, when you don't help your employees they leave, imagine that

Title: "If you're looking for lots of stress and no work/life balance, this is the place for you!"
Pros:
- Corporate employees get $100 in free Chipotle every month.
- Casual office environment and no dress code. You can literally wear your bathrobe to work if you wanted to.
- Annual teambuilding trips (i.e. Las Vegas, Chicago, Denver)
- Free chips and Salsa every Thursday.
- Benefits are ok and comparable to what’s being offered at other companies.
- Sabbatical offered after every 10 years of employment.
Cons:
- No work/life balance. Literally, zero. The store managers are expected to work a minimum of 50 hours each week; it’s the same type of mentality in the corporate office. Very lean workforce. This would be a very difficult place to work if you have small children and it would be virtually impossible if you happened to be a single parent.

- You’ll work primarily with entry level college students who lack work experience. There’s something to be said for bringing in new and fresh ideas but if you’re over 25, you probably aren’t going to be hired. The office has a very juvenile, high school feel to it.

- Not many advancement opportunities within the Columbus office unless you’re willing to move to the Denver HQ.

- The company is very focused on their vision of “being top performers empowered to achieve high standards.” This sentence will be stuffed down your throat from day one and you will hear it ALL THE TIME. What they mean by this is that "just" doing your job and excelling at it is not enough to receive an above average review at the end of the year. In fact, it’s the equivalent to being one step away from being fired. In order to be considered a “Top Performer”, you not only have to excel at your job but you also have to come up with projects and efficiencies that will save the company massive amounts of time and money. You likely won’t have time to work on these projects during the day so this is one of the things you’d need to work overtime for.

- The company offers paid holidays but you’ll only have the day off if the workload allows. When I was there, we worked from home part of the day on Thanksgiving, Christmas Eve and Christmas and we worked in the office on Memorial Day and Labor Day. This will vary by department.

- Pay is very low when compared to the extremely high expectations that they have.

- Paid time off is not competitve when compared to other companies.
Advice to Management: The officers really need to take a closer look at the Columbus Accounting Center and examine why the turnover rate is so high in a corporate setting.

Title: "Overall Great Attitude and Company"
Pros: The atmosphere is very upbeat and happy, everyone's excited to be there and good at handling conflict with customers, etc. Management really involves the crew in everything as they used to be one of the "little guys" and it's great to see how excited everyone is to be there.
Cons: Other than a lengthy hiring process, I don't think there are any cons to this company.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work! Chipotle is a great company that's been expanding like crazy for the past few years and I think there's a solid reason for that that starts with its employees and its mission.

Title: "DO NOT APPLY"
Pros: free food; There are no other pros honestly. I do not think anyone should be in a place that tolerates so much abuse.
Cons: Manager is a bully! No regard for human beings. Treat people like dirt.
Advice to Management: Managers need to learn about organizational behavior

Title: "I would never work there again."
Pros: I guess the only pro is free food and paid breaks when they allow you to take them.
Cons: Managers, employees, no guaranteed breaks, un paid wages and many more. I signes on part time and was forced to become fulltime.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros:
Really wonderful opportunities
Great pay
Friendly People
Cons:
A lot of work
Changes a lot
No social life
Advice to Management: COMMUNICATE. Don't be mean or a boss, be a leader.

Title: "I liked working there but..."
Pros: Paid breaks. Most employees are easy to work with. Free food when you work and 50% off when you aren't working.
Cons:
When closing if you finish your part before everyone else you cannot leave.
Also they won't raise your pay even if the entire company increases for new employees. For example I referred my best friend to work and she had no work experience (I had multiple years of work experience) and she was making almost a dollar more than me.

Title: "Good first job for serious employees"
Pros:
-Great people to work with
-Ethical food
-Free meal for a full shift
-Flexible hours
-Personal growth under high pressure but happy enviroments
Cons:
-often had problems with consistency, managers are tough and the small but complex system caused issues
-Quick turnover for those who aren't put into management
Advice to Management: Managers need to understand their hierarchy better and keep consistent work flow

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: It's easy and fun to work at
Cons: Pay isn't that great when you have college and bills

Title: "Chipotle experience"
Pros: I liked the morning schedule with everyone completing their job duties and eating together 30 mins. before open. I also liked the fact Chipotle had a communication journal for every employee. This allowed meeting and communication to happen between the manager for further training, goal setting, and promotion.
Cons: I would have liked to receive more thorough training with take home info. and a description/title of all the employees I would be working with...
Advice to Management: I would have liked a better schedule of daily/weekly/monthly tasks to perform in my job role.

Title: "If Only, If Only.."
Pros: Coworkers are so nice and friendly. not a bad job for a teenager trying to get by. they don't care about tattoos or crazy hair colors!
Cons: the managers were all young so they were very "selfish". those who were best friends with the managers outside of work got special treatment.
Advice to Management: Stop thinking that you're better than the rest. You were in our shoes at one point and know how we feel so why continue with the jerk attitude. and be more understanding to your pregnant employees; every pregnancy is different so you can never say you understand what they're actually dealing with trying to keep up with everyone..

Title: "crew Memebr"
Pros:
payment is above minimum wage
good benefits if you stay with them long enough
Cons:
customers tend to be rude but if your able to deal with is youll be fine
very busy and very fast paced
Advice to Management: N/a

Title: "Grill Cook"
Pros: Great employees, hardworking and friendly.
Cons: Nothing I can think of
Advice to Management: Be involved with advancement opportunities

Title: "Chipotle Crew MEMBER"
Pros: Chipotle is a popular restaurant that will hire minors. I'm 17 years old still in high school and was offered a position as crew member and cashier. The benefits are amazing and you also get a free meal every shift! You can also get promoted after a year and you get bonuses.
Cons: Chipotle is a fast paced environment which means u need to work fast and might stay a few hours after u clock out.
Advice to Management: Be more diverse with who u hire !!

Title: "It's ok"
Pros:
Good benefits
 Free food and free uniforms
Cons: Never have enough people scheduled so you're always short and having to work harder because of it . The managers more the GM doesn't care about their crew members as much as they should and lack of respect from the general manager. If you have one bad day you can get fired for it.
Advice to Management: I'm a manager and I work too hard for what I get paid for and I always have to do other managers work when I shouldn't have to. And the general manager should have more respect for the employees and managers that work there butts off every single day.

Title: "yay"
Pros: Awesome atmosphere, cool people, were popular ! Theres like a bunch of vines about us. We are the best at serving .
Cons:
We give you a pound of rice and beans, but a table spoon of chicken.
Your feet will hurt when you leave.
Advice to Management: Give people less rice and beans and more chicken !

Title: "Meh."
Pros: Fast paced, friendly coworkers
Cons: Really hot you get sweaty fast, rude customers wanting their food faster than you can serve it.

Title: "Chipotle Crew Member"
Pros:
Fun environment
Happy employees
Never a boring moment
Cons:
Lots of standing
You smell like Mexican food when you get off work

Title: "Nice"
Pros: The coworkers were nice to talk to. You form a bond with all of them.
Cons: The cons are the same for other jobs

Title: "okay"
Pros: the food is good and the pay is good for a teenager's first job
Cons:
management is rude
aren't open to requests
Advice to Management: Help the cashier out, they have too much work

Title: "Not what I expected"
Pros: Great atmosphere and great teamwork with other employees. During night shift you can work more time. Daily. Just tips from customers that are divided with the crew. Only a few bucks with coins.
Cons: They told me it was an 8 hours per day. I only work twice per week, or 4 but just 4 hours. It has been more than a month and I asked for what I've been told: A Full time work. They said business is low, and that's the only hours they can offer me. I don't understand what do they win doing this. I guess that is why the employees leave this job.
Advice to Management: Keep your word. If you contract an employee telling them they will be working full time, do it. Same as part time. This is not a real job.

Title: "Chipotle Management"
Pros: Great company, great benefits, great ideas. The systems and training they have in place work very well and are effective when used properly.
Cons: Management is inconsistent. New area managers every year, young children getting promoted too quickly without earning it causing long-term people to leave.
Advice to Management: Follow your own procedures on promoting. An 18 year old should not bypass holding a certain management role that has a specified time length. I've seen children get promoted from crew to GM in less than two months and they don't run their stores properly.

Title: "Crew working to be manager"
Pros: Great team to work for. FAMILY ORIENTED!!!
Cons: Available to move forward an in a better position.
Advice to Management: keep up the great work.

Title: "Really nice place to work"
Pros: Room to grow, good free food, %50 off when not working, upbeat environment, a place you can feel good about feeding people and supporting.
Cons: Sometimes people got TOO close at work. Doing it over, I would have stayed in professional relationships, rather than made friends. Good learning experience.
Advice to Management: Maybe look to see who is a good leader, and who will be fair and mature in the role of management. I really liked it there, overall though.

Title: "Horrible!!"
Pros: there are no pros because its a racist environment and i would not recommend anybody of any race who believe in equality to work there
Cons: they see you as a lesser being for working there, they cut your hours and give to their favorite employees. they skim on food for customers of black race. disturbing environment to work in.

Title: "Service manager"
Pros: It was a good company to developing skills needed out side from work such as people, understand office work and development of potential leaders.
Cons: Too much conflict of interests.
Advice to Management: Better selection of head managers.

Title: "Terrible"
Pros: Free food only if you work 5+hr shift and half off if off duty. Health/dental/eye insurance if you need them(taken out of base salary)
Cons: Constant criticism over minute details that have no regard to anything actually important(they just need to complain about anything) co workers were sexist and raucous, horrible head manager, and the customers never stopped coming.
Advice to Management: Be nicer, and stop nit-picking over unimportant things when you are bored just so you can complain. Don't be so rude. Join the military instead, Chipotle isn't the place for that behavior.

Title: "Great"
Pros: It was a good experience
Cons: A lot of work little pay
Advice to Management: None

Title: "OK place"
Pros: free food was always a plus
Cons: too anal about everything to be honest
Advice to Management: Ease up for only minimum wage payment

Title: "Great place to be!"
Pros: Great environment, Opportunity, Rewarding, Managers are brought up from crew so they understand.
Cons:
Compensation isnt amazing, but they do have benefits, PTO, and help pay for school, even for regular crew members.

Development is part of the job. Its not a great place for someone that doesnt care to do a little homework.

Title: "Great experience for good people"
Pros:
You get to pick who's on your crew and in doing so you help build a team who is trying to accomplish the same goal.
Management has always been flexible with my schedule (as I was a student and worked 2 jobs). The discount is 50% when you're not working and free when you do work. Good steady hours. There's always the ability to move up. My GM was 21 years old and had only been working for the company for a few years.
Cons: There's a huge push on getting things done by a certain time. Many of the full time employees worked off the clock - whether you are trying to support your team or not that is never okay. There's a lot of pressure on trying to getting the R status. High turn over because it's food service. You can always expect to get called in.
Advice to Management: Don't let employees work off the clock. Let culture happen naturally.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: The vision. Being able to believe in people. It is okay to care about your employees here.
Cons: Sometimes it feels as though if you are a GM, not an R, you are not good enough. You MUST have the right ATL or AM to truly feel inspired by the vision. As a GM, your life is expected to revolve around the company, whether you are working or not.
Advice to Management: Trust your team, and your support staff.

Title: "Associate"
Pros: Human interaction, good schedules, good benefits
Cons: Unsteady schedule, low salary,n ot enough.hours

Title: "on the fence"
Pros: i love most of the people i work with, pretty easy work. the pay is alright considering it is kind of a fast food joint.
Cons: the general manger doesnt seem to care about life problems. Have to stand in front of the register from 12-1 for peak hour (sometimes longer depending on how busy we are) on a hard concrete floor without a mat.
Advice to Management: Act like you care a little bit more about personal issues. Life happens nothing we can do about it.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
- Relatively simple job duties
- Negotiable pay
- Plethora of things to do and choose from, but you're generally confined to what you choose until you master it
- Scheduling around your availability
- Chipotle really stands by its "food with integrity" adage
- Great people (at least at my Chipotle)
- Employee meals!
- Discounted Chipotle is always good
Cons:
- Very fast paced with limited downtime
- Expected to maintain throughput despite the number of people you may have helping you
- Shift changes and oftentimes shoddy scheduling mean if you're scheduled to leave at 3:00 you probably won't leave until 3:30
- Good luck trying to call off, as if you can't find a cover, you'll be expected to be there.
- Closing, from what I hear, is disastrous

Title: "Chipotle Review"
Pros: Chipotle takes good care of their employees by offering free meals and benefits as well as a competitive hourly wage. All of my coworkers loved their jobs.
Cons: The high-paced environment can be stressful and as always dealing with customers can be a pain. The shifts either start early or end late.
Advice to Management: Make sure to make your employees aware of upward mobility opportunities. Continue to promote people from within the company. Maintain high standards.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
Flexible Hours
Competitive Pay
Ease of access to supplies needed to maintain core values
Cons: No incentives to work if below management level
Advice to Management: Make sure your crew is up to par, and that they know all of the needed information to work at Chipotle.

Title: "kitchen staff"
Pros: love the food, the salary is above the minimum, fun working environment and lots of room to grow professionally.
Cons: the hours are not that flexible and sometimes i only get 20 hours/week.

Title: "Chipotle Crew Member"
Pros: They teach you responsibility skills that will benefit you through out your career life, even once you leave chipotle. They're also very passionate about empowering their employees, so your team feels like your second family. The free meals aren't bad, either.
Cons: Not very flexible hours depending on which chipotle you work at.
Advice to Management: One-on-ones with your employees are very very important!

Title: "Salary"
Pros: Fun place to work because you get free food
Cons: bad management, bad policies, bad customers, bad culture
Advice to Management: listen to workers

Title: "Great Work Environment"
Pros: Employees were fun to be around, everything was clean, and you know that you work with good people. Regulars are fun.
Cons: There was some work tension between employees that never seemed to get resolved.
Advice to Management: Make sure you're keeping an eye on your employees. Things happen that you're not aware of.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Free shift meals, great people
Cons: Only one meal 50% off as employee discount

Title: "Alright Place for Students"
Pros:
Free food
Good environment
Good benefits for people who stay with the company
Cons:
Long hours
Can get really busy at times
Very low pay

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: When I needed to work 50 hours a week I could. The coworkers were pretty decent.
Cons: I requested being dropped to less than 20 hours a week during school and the manager consistently assigned me more than 30 hours a week and would attempt to schedule shifts while I was in class. I had a panic attack at work from the stress of being asked to do too much at once. Schedules were done less than 3 days before the week began.
Advice to Management: Get the scheduling figured out better. Seriously, 60% of my problems working there boiled down to scheduling errors.

Title: "Chipotle Review"
Pros:
-Starts at $9/hr
-Mostly pleasant co-workers
-Good hours
-Potential to be promoted
Cons: -Location by Mall of GA meant customers essentially never stopped

Title: "Happy Here"
Pros:
-great people
-real strive to do well
-flexible hours
-competitive pay
-free meal
-tuition reimbursement
-hourly worker benefits
Cons:
-hard and tiring work
-hard to qualify for some benefits
-transferring from home to school locations as a college student SUCKS
Advice to Management:
-work harder to transfuser people quickly
-don't accidentally fire people.....

Title: "long shifts, closing is miserable"
Pros: okay pay, great people, fast paced
Cons: closing takes forever and you dont leave until almost midnight, managers are bad at scheduling, employees dont show up for their shift
Advice to Management: get scheduling figured out ASAP and be flexible for college students

Title: "Pretty Standard Fast Food Job"
Pros:
Friendly staff
Goal driven environment
Opportunities to grow with company and build career
Cons:
Hours can be long, 40+ at times
Work can be boring at times
Constant responsibilities, little to no downtime

Title: "Not bad for fast food"
Pros:
- Good company culture
- Surprisingly good benefits for a fast food employee
- Management hired from within company
Cons:
- Managers were at times contradicting each other when training new employees
- Hours were inconsistent at times(However this could have been due to my student status)

Title: "Great Complany"
Pros: Good management. Great opportunity to advance.
Cons: Coworkers can be sketchy. Hard work.

Title: "mmmmmmm"
Pros: great food, fast paces environment and room to grow if you play up to the manager
Cons: We had very disfuctional hours and i was forced to wash dishes with no help at all and I was in high school and that meant that i got out at 11 pm

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: It's a great environment with friendly people. Everyone works together as a team in order to get the job done.
Cons: It can be a stressful place to work when you first start, trying to figure out where everything is and what needs to be done.
Advice to Management: Make sure you keep your employee's happy. Do what you can in order to boost moral within the team to make sure everyone feels welcome.

Title: "Chipot(s)l(av)e"
Pros:
-Awesome crew and culture
-Fun atmosphere
-Pays more than minimum wage
-Free food on breaks and discounted food at your store
-Tips
Cons:
-Overworked
-Expected to do the job o multiple workers
-Managers with unrealistic expectations
-Never getting off on time. Seriously!
Advice to Management: -Hire more staff

Title: "Great if there is nothing else going on for you"
Pros: Best part about Chipotle is the amount of knowledge and training provided to you. There is no hierarchy, and everyone is expected to treat the business like it's theirs. I learned so much about running a business, being a part of an amazing "family" of a team, and the opportunity is almost limitless. You work really hard and enjoy a great atmosphere if you're under the right management. Also, you have good benefits and tuition reimbursment
Cons: Chipotle is a lot of hard work. I've worked for quite a few restaurants and no matter what anyone says, Chipotle will be the hardest job you've ever had. A lot of working off the clock is expected of you. And lately, Chipotle is changing what's important to them. They cant handle the amount of growth and are losing their culture. It used to be all about the employees and creating an amazing culture, but now more and more people are being hired from the outside and it's becoming all about the numbers. They don't even do a lot of fresh prep in house anymore. I've also seen too many people work 80+ hours a week, be rushed into positions they aren't prepared for, and then be fired. Chipotle does not have their heart in the right place these days, which is why I left.
Advice to Management: Stick to the core values of this company. The numbers were doing fine when that was the focus. Now it's just becoming another chain. Believe in the 13, or go somewhere else. Stop ruining the vision and only caring about yourselves. #ThePepperTillDeath

Title: "A lot of stuff do. Especially if your management team isn't on point."
Pros: Free chipotle each shift. Get close to people. challenging and constantly changing. You can love it if you try. But still
Cons: A lot of labor. Physical labor. You seem to be making up for other people and sometime those other people are the ones above you.
Advice to Management: Get better gms

Title: "Top Performer Culture"
Pros: The work environment is really friendly and family like, you will feel like you fit in well with all your co workers, and managers. You will have many opportunities to grow and expand beyond being a crew member marking the difference between that and a dead end job. They also offer free meals and tuition reimbursement .
Cons: The resturaunt culture will not be comfortable at all. Very high pressure, and constant effort and consistent dedication is non-negotiable , even if you're not feeling well (emotionally or mentally) they will not tolerate the breakage of the chipper happy atmosphere and work environment. Managers are on you like a hawk to constantly remind you to smile and to create an extraordinary customer experience .
Advice to Management: If someone works a 4.5 hour shift especially through a brutal peak and or a really busy day they deserve their 15 minute break. Closers and openers aren't the only people that deserve to be able to grab something to eat . Employees short shift or not especially grill people or people on the line have their work cut out for them and to face that without the opportunity to eat is crazy.

Title: "Good company overall"
Pros: Great pay and great work environment
Cons: Don't tell you when you need improvement and will fire you out of the blue
Advice to Management: Better communication

Title: "Managers Forced to act a certain way by store owners"
Pros:
free food
brag about chipotle
unlimited drinks
can be fun
felt like a family
Cons:
long lines
rude customers
rude managers
rude coworkers
Advice to Management: When you fire people, give them an actual reason to why they are being fired, dont suspend them of pay for a week and then not give them a call.

Title: "How I could still love a company I no longer work for."
Pros: The vision, mentoring, leadership skills and the food. The transparent way that the store is set up.
Cons: The way that people's egos corrupt the vision and get in the way of real progress.
Advice to Management: Look closer at the Field Leaders and make it possible for people to speak up without the fear of reprisals.

Title: "Very high pressure for minimum wage"
Pros: Owners are serious about good healthy food.
Cons: Very young staff and managers who make big mistakes when communicating with staff. In addition to crazy low pay for expectations.
Advice to Management: Realize that you are very young and learning how to support and communicate with you staff. Being over critical helps no one.

Title: "Terrible training"
Pros: better pay then most fast food restaurants
Cons: the lack of proper training

Title: "Terrible job"
Pros: Okay pay ,you get raises pretty fast so I couldn't complain about that.
Cons: Where I worked was horrible ! Everyone always had a attitude, they didn't treat everyone equal .

Title: "Okay job...expected more."
Pros: Awesome coworkers, great food discounts
Cons: Didn't get properly trained, Manger wasn't very helpful
Advice to Management: Work with employees before simply letting go.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: Fast paced, fun people, free meals, they were always pretty good about working with you if you needed a day off.
Cons: I had already been working there for a few years and they told me they couldn't give me any more of a raise even though people were being hired in at $1.50-2.00 more.
Advice to Management: I don't know how management is now, but there were several managers I had that really let it get to their head and used it as an opportunity to just tell others what to do.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: The pros are the hours, the managers are great, you become close with your co-workers, free employee meal. Opportunity to advance
Cons: long lines, customers can be rude, overworked

Title: "Service manager"
Pros: The food and the envierment that you get to work in is amazing I love making people better each and everyday
Cons: There is not a con that I can think of if you work and come in everyday with an amazing attitude then everything will be amazing
Advice to Management: Smile and make your people better a happy ship is a lasting ship if you start out training correctly and stick to it it will be self sufficient

Title: "Fast paced job but is good for a first job"
Pros:
Good pay
Benefits
Free meals
Easy promotions
Friendly staff
Most customers
Discounts
Paid vacation
Paid break
Tuition reimbursement
Stock privileges
Cons:
Everything has to be on point( clean line, lobby, ice filled, sweep, stock drinks, fork, knives, napkins) when the restaurant is busy it's hard to do.
Peak time you can't move for an hour for those who can't stand standing in one place

Title: "Too many chiefs, not enough Indians..."
Pros: Chipotles small burrito based menu is delicious, and easy to cook.
Cons: We would do decent volume and would never have enough labor it would seem. Everything just seemed to barely come together....
Advice to Management: Provide the appropriate amount of time to employees to not feel rushed every single minute of the day. Being efficient is one thing, burning out employees is another.

Title: "Wasn't terrible"
Pros: The hours are flexible, they work with students. The employee meals were amazing, There is a chance to move up within the company if the effort is put forward.
Cons: The Restaurateur program is extremely impossible to maintain and is heartbreaking to gain. I was a kitchen manager and i put countless hours into my store to make it the best possible restaurant. I worked too many hours off the clock for our store to gain that status. I couldn't handle the stress and the time it took to make a restaurant as busy as ours perfect.
Advice to Management: Talking down to employees isn't the best way of elevating people, and instead of transferring a manager to a different store just fire them don't burden other restaurants.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: There were no pros
Cons: The scheduling I only had one day off the whole week. Plus, I still haven't received my 1st check. (I quit) and it's been 2 months. Manager had an attitude with me the whole time I workerd their. They care more about the customers which is I get customers go first. But they barely paid attention to us of how we're feeling.
Advice to Management: Be Responsible.

Title: "Good environment to work at."
Pros: Getting free meal every shift, breaks, felxible when it comes to scheduling, and great co-workers and managers.
Cons: Being the grill guy, it get really hot and it takes a lot of time when you have to close. Cleaning can get tough.
Advice to Management: Thanks for being flexible and supportive!

Title: "Management"
Pros: The Desire to Be a PowerHouse Company Or Resutrant While Working was Inspiring
Cons: Too many Managers In Select Stores To Make it Impossible to Do What One Wants While the Next Supervisor Says "NO" Do it Like this.
Advice to Management: More Experience And Communication Rather Than Managers

Title: "manager"
Pros: they will promote you from crew
Cons: you work extremely long hours and make WAY less money than others in the restaurant industry
Advice to Management: none

Title: "Nice"
Pros: It is fun to work here. Everyone is so nice.
Cons: No cons here just pros okay? ok
Advice to Management: Make sure everyone does their part.

Title: "Don't feed into the hype! It's not as great as they attempt to make it seem in orientation."
Pros: Excellent benefits & perks, decent pay, Free food when working, paid breaks & 50 percent off.
Cons: Exhausting work, part time hrs., bad management, poor attitudes, uncomfortable environment.
Advice to Management: If your going to try & sell the hype that you all "LOVE" your jobs. Follow through with action & effort not just smoke & mirrors. Treat "ALL" your employees with respect, humility, integrity & friendliness. Especially new employees but not limited to just new. Actions speak louder than word's & you "Lead" by example only!

Title: "Good job"
Pros: You got tips after work and free food before work and an easy job. Jehevdkunhhnn hhgfhn hhgfhn high but hhgfhn ugly jinn
Cons: Irate customers wanting more meat when there is an portion size. It make work hard hit jhel jhel khejegen jehevdkunhhnn hhgfhn

Title: "wonderful"
Pros: great food, great employees great service
Cons: major break out on the news

Title: "More Cons than Pros"
Pros: They give you a free meal every time you work! They work with my school schedule.
Cons: At lot of locations are run by a bunch of Hispanics and they speak nothing but Spanish and I do not understand so it can become annoying. Also my manager coaches employees on what to say when upper management comes to visit which is really dislike.
Advice to Management: Trust you employees and treat them with respect and do not alter their hours which has happened multiple times.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Excellent management with Great coworkers andFree drinks
Cons: Very little hours and management shows a lot of Favoritism
Advice to Management: Discuss raises and promotions amongst just the managers instead of gossiping with employees

Title: "Chipotle tos"
Pros:
Good team
Flexible hours
Lots of room to grow

Overall i enjoy the job, it's very easy to move around and see the consistency between restaurants
Cons: I don't really have any. As a part timer I'm not hit with a lot of the burden that full timers might get. Still, it isn't too bad for them either
Advice to Management: Always have the ability to step back and evaluate the situation dispassionately, the only time situations deteriorated were when people try to do too much by themselves.

Title: "No"
Pros: Nothing is good here like legit.
Cons: Everything I'm not kidding with you.
Advice to Management: Just don't even try to work here

Title: "Wayyy to much work"
Pros: Free food, flexible on time. I like the free food, but its usually cold
Cons: they work you like a donkey, they purposely give you 4.5 hours instead of 5, so that you dont get a break

Title: "Free meal every shift"
Pros: Tended to have a great atmosphere most days working there, mostly college students. Most shared the 13 characteristics. The free meal every shift was a huge bonus.
Cons: Head manager does not have the experience at this moment that it takes to lead the store, however is working towards becoming better at that.

Title: "Good part-time jpb"
Pros: Free meals on days worked, 1/2 off at your store only, good & healthy food that you know is cooked right there or cooked yourself
Cons: Redundant work, not really any other cons besides finding good people who want to work an easy job

Title: "cashier,line"
Pros: free food-double up on meat and guac...
Cons: extremely hard work-very physical-running around. Don't have many breaks and constantly on your feet.

Title: "Great job chipolte"
Pros: Great environment great atmosphere great coworkers awesome management
Cons: There are no cons only good things

Title: "Great company"
Pros: Love love working for Chipotle. They really care about its employees and it felt like a family atmosphere. They also care about the quality of food they serve to their customers
Cons: Not too many opportunities to move up. Hours can also be brutal. Other than that they are a really wonderful company and I am sure they will keep growing.
Advice to Management: Despite recent issues with people getting sick, I am confident they will overcome it and people will reward Chipotle when crow are back.

Title: "Server"
Pros:
-Great company values
-Lots of room to grow
-Interactive work environment
Cons:
-Too fast paced
-High stress
-Very minimal training
Advice to Management: Since there is minimal training, it would be great if the management would show you how to do things as you go or at least give you grace as you're going through the learning process. My management expected me to know how to do everything and seemed annoyed with me when I asked questions or needed assistance.

Title: "team member"
Pros: Great learning and experience overall.
Cons: Depending on location can cause extreme workload.
Advice to Management: optimize teammate chemistry.

Title: "crew member"
Pros: free meals, fun environment, flexible schedule, good tips on busy days.
Cons: too much unnecessary requirements like constantly doing your daily development journal to see what you need to work on so you can improve yourself and stand out!
Advice to Management: focus on doing the important stuff.

Title: "Great"
Pros: Great job to work at with a great team of people surrounding you. You can't fail. There's always opportunities as well.
Cons: Sometimes the job can be stressful and you will see that, but everyone works together in the end to make it the best situation as possible.
Advice to Management: Managing is not an easy job, but service managers are always on top of their A game. They make work a lot easier overall for everyone. Always connect with the crew though because the crew makes you.

Title: "upper management"
Pros:
friendly environment.
lots of opportunity for promotion
Cons: upper management. field leaders dont seem to care about anyone but the business and thier own growth.

Title: "Its a good company... Don't get stuck"
Pros: Good connection with coworker's. Fun and laid back work environment
Cons: Very young and sometimes immature coworker's.
Advice to Management: Don't let teenagers be GM's. They're too immature.

Title: "It's all a sham"
Pros: lots of free food. cool team members. got to gain a lot of experience in the food service world. pretty laid back work environment. so so benefits, but at least they offered benefits
Cons: ok, this place touts itself as using the best ingredients, but it does not. it's the same slop you see at a lot of other places and there is a lot of big talk from the ad agencies and the ads you see on tv. It's just GMO food with nice packaging. plus 2015 is when they went through all the ecoli outbreaks and health scares. Do you realize what that does to traffic in the stores? deads-ville. no one coming to eat. ghost town. I had to quit because there was literally no one coming in to buy stuff.
Advice to Management: not sure if they'll be able to recover from the food safety stuff. you gotta keep your kitchens clean, and frankly there is no safe food handling skills going on in this place. it was scary how they handled meat and fish and did not check temps etc. glad I'm done and on to something else.

Title: "Its an awesome job, the district manager just makes you hate working there."
Pros: Costumers were really nice and would usually make my day ten times better.
Cons: The work load can strenuous at times, it comes with a lot of work.
Advice to Management: District manager needs to be nice.

Title: "Worked here as a Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Good Corporate company to work for. Good food. Easy to work your way up in the style of management that they offer.
Cons: Very disorganized when it comes to management. My particular location would promote people who did not need to be promoted. Favoritism.
Advice to Management: I would tell the upper management to come to the stores more often to see what is going on. I would also have more training for your management. Empower and train your people to better develop their skills.

Title: "Overworked"
Pros: free food, flexible, good bonuses
Cons: lack of professionalism ,double standards
Advice to Management: be responsible

Title: "Come Apply!"
Pros: The crew members and managers are some of the nicest people I have met and worked with. Also I love the fact that they encourage constructive advice and to share your knowledge with others to not only make them better but you as well.
Cons: Your can only use your discount at the Chipotle you work at and its only on one item.

Title: "Depends on location"
Pros: Great team, room for advancement, positive attitude, great costumers, ok training
Cons: Poor hours, certain locations have awful teams, they churn through employees quickly

Title: "Meh"
Pros:
- free food
- you can look however you want
Cons:
- too high of standards and work load but not appreciated nearly enough
- hungry people are never fun to be around all day
- hours have been cut significantly since all of the bad press. I've worked 4 hour work weeks when I previously worked 20-25 hour weeks. How does that cover anyone's rent?

Title: "Chipotle Review"
Pros:
-very respectable workers, affable customers
-good wages
Cons:
-high stress, especially during rush hour
-long shifts

Title: "Amazing"
Pros: there are a lot of perks to working here. free food. the crew is your family. health insurance. scholarships. discounts. bonuses. etc.
Cons: there are not a lot of cons for working here. you just can't give food discounts to family members or friends.
Advice to Management: don't slack.

Title: "Relatively great place to work"
Pros: Team atmosphere, learned amazing cooking skills, generally enjoyed the work
Cons: Shifts are long and it can be hard to move forward in the company
Advice to Management: Make sure the GM is doing their job (one on ones are important!)

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: The hours were usually great and the shifts were flexible if you asked for them to be. Some of the management worked shoulder to shoulder with the crew members, whether it be on the line, on the grill, or on prep. It was fairly easy to get time off.
Cons: It was hard to transition from part-time to full-time. I asked right before the part-time seasonal employees left and before they began to interview for the open positions, but it took about two months for me to finally get more hours.
Advice to Management: Sometimes, depending on the location, the restaurant can be wasteful with the food thrown away at the end of the day. If the management could find shelters or some organization that might accept the food, that would be great.

Title: "Great for teens and school aged children"
Pros: if you work hard you will get rewarded with hours also you get free meals and uniform shirts and hat
Cons: back breaking work sometimes I would have to close which means getting off at 11pm at night just to have to be back at 8am also sometimes I would get stuck at work for 12hrs bc people would call out or not show
Advice to Management: my manager was great I just do not prefer hospitality

Title: "Very Understanding"
Pros: very kind and helpful management
Cons: a bit of a superiority complex because people love the work they do

Title: "You can get burned out easily"
Pros: Working here can be very rewarding, and I've made some very good friendships. The benefits are good, even for entry level part time employees. Also you are trained in actual kitchen skills, although not as much since the food safety issues.
Cons: Chipotle is much more complicated than your average fast food places, which can make having an incompetent manager that much worse. When there's a special free promotion you can find yourself giving away 1000 dollars of food with a constant line to the door all day. It runs like a commercial kitchen rather than a fast food joint, so may God help you if you get put on grill for the lunch or dinner rush. Also depending on the store, they might blatantly lie straight to your face about being able to be moved up in company. Ex: I've been an employee for the past year and I've been told that I'm going to be "moved up" since May 2015. Still not even close to happening.
Advice to Management: Hold your managers to higher standards. Its very difficult to achieve your "vision" when a general manager is clueless when it comes to forming a schedule and decides to schedule 2 people to leave an hour before close on a Saturday night, and leaving the crew with no cash or line closer. And when you bring this up with the fellow managers, all you get is a shrug.

Title: "beware"
Pros: chips and guac free on Thursdays. casual dress code
Cons: such long hours! management don't care if you need a break
Advice to Management: give your employees a break!

Title: "Full Time Crew"
Pros: Tuition Reimbursement, Health Benefits, 9.00 start salary, Supposed to get a raise every 6 months (or you're fired, basically), lengthy interview process so SHOULD hire great, empowered people
Cons: My store hasn't given any evals or raises to anybody, low staffed, no GM, get out of work at 1 am most of the time, poor closes and too busy
Advice to Management: A lot of management has history of being narcissistic at many stores. Learn to lead and help hand and hand and the store will be successful. Chipotle's corporate has great values and ideas for the company, but it goes downhill depending on which store you work

Title: "Decent"
Pros:
Pay is much better than most places
The people
Cons:
The noise. Can't hear anything the person is ordering.
Lack of explanation. People often come in not knowing what everything is or how it works, and I would often have a hard time explaining exactly what they wanted to know.
The customers, seem to think they can treat you anyway or say anything to you.

Title: "Mediocre"
Pros: Free meal for every 5 hours worked, always something to do, always customers coming in to the store so staff is always needed
Cons: They don't let you take come the rest of your meal if you don't finish it, must be thrown away. Kept late after work to close, almost til 1 am sometimes.

Title: "Awesome coworkers and management, great job!"
Pros: I love the environment. I came into this job while they were doing a lot of hiring, so not being the only new member was encouraging. The other coworkers who had been there for a while were so motivated and gave me a lot of pointers to be successful. I love my management team as well. I'm so thankful to have found a job that I love going to everyday. Its like a family, I've only been there four weeks but I've been accepted as one of them and it's great. There are also good benefits and paid breaks, etc.
Cons: Long hours, can get stressful due to high sales volumes especially when there are coupons out.
Advice to Management: None! I love all my managers at my store. They look to make personal connections and help you move up if that's what you want.

Title: "Good seasonal job"
Pros: friendly staff, fair, good to work for
Cons: work dwindled in the winter season - but it was a each area

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great people, upbeat environment, awesome managers
Cons: Low pay, very high standards
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Not good"
Pros: Free food making chips off time
Cons: Longer than expected hours smelling like chipotle
Advice to Management: Have people show up on time

Title: "Great Food in a Fast-Paced Environment"
Pros: Depending on which one you work at, the team will make or break your experience. It's all about the initial training, how you're introduced to the culture, and how well you work with the others on your team. The one I work at has an amazing, dedicated team that is chock full of top performers. You also get free food on the days you work and 50% off otherwise. If your restaurant makes it to Restaurateur, then all sorts of opportunities open up not only for your manager, but for you and your entire team.
Cons: You have to be generally good at working under pressure. It gets incredibly stressful at times as occasionally the food sells faster than we can cook it. Closing the restaurant can run excessively long as well. But if you're patient, dedicated, and work well with others, then this place can work wonders for you.
Advice to Management: The best advice I can give is to ensure that you're connecting with your team and you're providing an encouraging work environment for everyone.

Title: "It can be stressful"
Pros: free food, really cool co workers, room to advance with the company and strong ethics concerning food safety.
Cons: management is a little disorganized, understaffed so some work days can be very very stressful and some favoritism
Advice to Management: Stronger training for newer management and hire more employees

Title: "Chipotle Crew Member"
Pros: coworkers can make positive experience, focus on positivity among management
Cons: expected to do managerial work at crew member pay, typical stresses of fast paced corporate food service

Title: "Excellent first job experience"

Free meal during break, 50% off on food.
Good benefits.
Excellent training.
A really good culture to promote.
Cons:
Short breaks.
Hated making the chips.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work. I felt very welcomed even though I had zero experiences.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Competitive Pay. Lots of promotions and ways to get paid more. Great crew members.
Cons: Empty promises. Sometimes it is taken too seriously.
Advice to Management: Remember it is just a party not life or death.

Title: "Decent"
Pros: Free food and good staff for a part time job
Cons: To much work for little pay

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Fun place to work. You can eat there for free on your lunch break. Loved the customers for the most part. The team was awesome.
Cons: Unfortunately the E.Coli virus that broke out recently linking affected Chipotle sales and my hours were cut tremendously.
Advice to Management: One of the general managers is very unprofessional with the employees. All the other managers, kitchen and service, are awesome.

Title: "Love this career"
Pros: Moving up through management at an excellent pace. The job is self rewarding but has competitive pay.
Cons: Lower level employees come and go often, however that is done specifically to create a good team.

Title: "great first job"
Pros: plenty of hours, welcoming and fun people, and encouraging environments to make and fix mistakes
Cons: very very fast work environment(during rush hours), 6 months you get a raise of 10 cents, managers definitely play favorites

Title: "Crew Member/Prep"
Pros: Great environment,great customer,great managers,great coworkers,easy to get along,great food. As a crew member/prep I wash dishes,blanch avocados and onions,sweep,mop,take out trash,break down boxes,clean stations,peel and cut onions,cut and box peppers into fajita strips.
Cons: Little hours,gets very messy,sometimes people are rude and complain about stuff.
Advice to Management: Great,people are all awesome?

Title: "It's Okay"
Pros:
- The people you work with are amazing
- you get free food and tuition money
- the hours are somewhat flexible
Cons:
- management is terrible/ no communication
- you are stuck at one station for too long
- they do not give you hours if you are not grill or cashier
Advice to Management: Please talk to one another because there are three managers and no one communicates effecitively

Title: "Chipotle crew member"
Pros: Paid breaks, Good pay, Great place to grow and learn, Company has some great benefits including a college scholarship
Cons: Very busy job, requires alot of movement, stressful at times, shifts are long and usually you will stay a little later after your shift has ended do to work load

Title: "Good job"
Pros: Good job, a lot of benefits, great people work there. A lot of opportunity to move up in the company
Cons: Very busy environment, can be hectic, not too many cons

Title: "Area Manager"
Pros: Ability to help others move up, job security, and local workers
Cons: Corporate culture disconnect from what's happening in the field, low pay scale

Title: "Loved it while it last"
Pros:
-Great coworkers/managers
-Great food
-Great benefits for part time
-Good hours if you get good managers
Cons:
-Upper management can be hard to get through to
-Managers can be uncaring
-Hard to move up even though they pride their selves on it.
Advice to Management: Look closely at the kind of people you put into management positions, they don't always have crew member's best interest at heart.

Title: "Good College Job"
Pros:
Managers spent plenty of time training employees.
Organized processes
Fair pay
Fast-pace environment
Flexible schedule
Tips
Free meal each day
Cons:
Promotions not accompanied by significant pay raise
Poor benefits
If one person doesn't show up, it can mess up the whole line
Can be a stressful work environment
The deep-cleaning every night can cause excessive overtime
Advice to Management:
Keep doing what you're doing.
Keep hiring people who are reliable and actually show up for work

Title: "Crew"
Pros: Better than most fast food jobs. The store hours 11 am to 10 pm means you won't have to work too early or too late.
Cons: If you're looking for empowerment you won't find it here. Management is the problem. Fix management and it could be a decent fast food job.
Advice to Management: Management is poorly trained, does not follow corporate policy, is immature, and does a poor job of keeping employees and training them. Being a top performer will not be rewarded.

Title: "Bruh. F***ing love this place. <3"
Pros:
Awesome people to work with.
Super flexible with time.
Benefits.
Free food.
Paid breaks.
Paid vacations and sick days.
Pays for some schooling.
Moving up with the company is quick.

Honestly, if it weren't for chipotle, i wouldn't be anything and probably would still be out in the world not accomplishing much. Everyone here believed and believes in me and because of this, it has made me a better person. I love my crew, love my work, love it all, working here is cake since i enjoy it so much.
Cons:
Super meticulous work.
Can be stressful at times.
Customers are difficult sometimes. el oh el
Advice to Management: Here at east pasadena, we're killing it. Just keep killing it so we can get restaurateur.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Flexible hours, free food, friendly staff.
Cons: Low pay for amount of work

Title: "Chipotle review"
Pros: It is pretty laid back, you can't get in trouble really, once you get used to it it is easy and you get into the swing of it.
Cons: It is very fast pace, people are rude to you when they are hungry so have a thick skin, and the employees do not know how to communicate the proper way
Advice to Management: They need to learn to communicate better with the whole staff and learn to be nicer.

Title: "Everybody's got Choices"
Pros: Great growth opportunities. Fun fast paced environment. Great building block for people skills. One free meal for every shift worked. Side note: even though I was technically part time, I still received full time hours plus overtime and benefits.
Cons: Depending on the store you choose and how effective the managers management style is depicts the outcome of this con. I was at a store where the manager was not stern about daily operations. Manager was more of a friend than a manager and crew members took advantage of that. This created a lack of respect, unprofessional environment, and poor customer experience. Like I said for me it solely depends on the store and the manager.

Title: "It's chipotle"
Pros:
Discounts were the best thing .
Coworkers
Environment
Your pay automatically increases every 6 months which was great .
Benefits
Cons:
Never get off on time
Terrible management
Advice to Management: get new management.

Title: "Free food was cool"
Pros: Free food. I got a burrito bowl with triple chicken and guac every single day.
Cons: Literally no off or even dull periods and no incentive to work
Advice to Management: if i dont speak spanish stop ordering me around in spanish and then getting frustrated that im not doing the right thing.

Title: "view from crew"
Pros: Learning new prep and cooking techniques everyday - crew members are friendly
Cons: some things are lost from the AM - PM shifts .... problems, concerns, procedures are not passed right away.
Advice to Management: more commutation between shift leaders and crew

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Co-workers- other crew members- and management were nice and understanding. The people you end up working an entire shift make all the difference. Really Awesome co-workers can make time fly by.
Cons: The management can we strict about taking days off. You need to ask way in advance and even then they might not grant you the days you need/want.
Advice to Management: Take care and respect your crew. They know when you genuinely are interested in their well-being. you will be thankful if you do this because your employees will work harder and faster.

Title: "Busy, bad management, great idea but poor execution."
Pros: Pay. Free food. Health insurance, good coworkers sometimes. Yep yep yep yep yep yep I have to write 20 words.
Cons:
Working the job of 3 people
This is annoying how I have to write 20 words. I'm not looking to write a damn novel.
Advice to Management: Listen to your employees

Title: "Great perks, high stress."
Pros: Good pay and benefits. I was able to work my way up from crew to GM in 2 years with no previous experience--meaning of you are smart and responsible, you can make it here. Lots of great people in the company. Great employee development program (if implemented properly).
Cons: Lots of mixed signals from corporate and constantly changing goals can cause a lot of stress and confusion--I would meet my goals and feel accomplished only to be told from on high that "we are now focusing on this" so my recent triumph was meaningless, and now had to start from scratch in another area. From speaking with and observing GMs of other stores, it seemed that success and praise only came to those who cut corners and broke all the rules in practice but put on a good face for a visit--I attempted to adhere to all guidelines as far as labor laws, training procedures, store maintenance, etc, and regularly got reprimanded for using too many labor hours or resources to do so. I was told if I had "inspired" my people enough, everything would be fine.
Advice to Management: Would not recommend working in a "remote" Chipotle--i.e. where you are more than 50 miles from other Chipotles. I worked in 3 such stores and we were often "on our own" with field leaders visiting only enough to ream us out for problems but not really help with solutions other than telling us to "get to know your people" better and "inspire them to greatness." Sometimes these field leaders were themselves newly-hired from outside the company and thus inexperienced at their particular job, so probably didn't really know how to help anyway.

Title: ""Chipotle is my life""
Pros: Free food on breaks, pretty good pay and benefits
Cons: They want you to be super invested in the company.

Title: "Growing too fast"
Pros: Great food, some great people working in the restaurants. Fun atmosphere when staffed properly
Cons: Growing too fast. I was in management training and saw many managers pulled from different locations to help at other stores where they lost people to open new stores. Rough cycle, no teamwork.
Advice to Management: Slow down and plan ahead. Let the teams build something in the store before you yank them out to go help someone else.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: free food when you work
Cons: I don't have any cons for Chipotle.

Title: "Ehh"
Pros: Free food is the best benefit. Rushes make the time fly by
Cons: Little training butt off. You have to make more then 50 items for the line while cleaning your dishes. And take your break. Ridiculous to think you could get all this done in two hours. You also never get a chance to relax. Rushes are literal murder and you get yelled at for not moving fast enough. Also ridiculous to make the crew memorize word for word definitions that honestly don't even matter.
Advice to Management: Work around crews strengths. If you're bad at opening salsa, train them in a different area.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: amazing mission and message and huge focus on people development.
Cons: Huge pressure to be Restaurateur, if you haven't achieved it after a year you begin to fear not achieving it rather than be inspired to.
Advice to Management: Continue your focused commitment to the message and goal of Chipotle but take a step back and don't rely 100% on fresh young blood.

Title: "Company culture"
Pros:
all coworkers are your genuine friends
flexible schedule
free food when working
company values and views
Cons:
have to be hardworking 100% of the time
have to be able to take criticism
Advice to Management: none

Title: "Chipotle Crew Member"
Pros: Chipotle was a fast paced job to work at, it definitely helps you work under pressure. You always have the opportunity to work overtime, and you always get free food during your work hours.
Cons: Sometimes overtime is not optional and they sort of force you to stay for longer because they're short of employees, the girls bathroom has a tampon box without a plastic bag in it so cleaning out the bathrooms is disgusting, and sometimes they expect you to do more than what should be expected of you due to lack of employees that day.
Advice to Management: Chipotle should learn to treat their employees with a little more respect, be a little more considerate, and definitely more sanitary regarding their bathrooms.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Fun environment, great crowd of people all friendly to work with
Cons: Management is good until you realize they cycle through employees like water so the always have the best. You're constantly judged on your work abilities and are expected to keep up with peak hours all the time.
Advice to Management: I think they are doing a good job with their company but from an employee perspective why dont you let your employees go home at the end of their scheduled shift. Its rediculous to keep them hours after they are scheduled to leave.

Title: "Could've been better"
Pros:
- FREE FOOD!!!
- Fun to serve customers especially since the food is soo good
Cons:
- VERY high stress and low pay!
- You get stationed at one area and they don't move you around much once you've mastered that area... I still have burns from the fryer! (I made chips and taco shells!)
Advice to Management: PAY YOUR EMPLOYEES BETTER!!!!!! They literally make everything from scratch and it's unfair to them to do so much and earn so little.

Title: "Good place"
Pros: fun free meal everytime you work, 50% off
Cons: can get very packed/busy. other than that nothing

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great atmosphere. Good pay for entry level.
Cons: Very physically strenuous (I promise)

Title: "Amazing company- Empowering!"
Pros: I have never worked at a place where I actually loved coming to work! Chipotle is a fun, fast-paced environment, where quality is key. You as a worker are empowered to be a leader. There is real synergy and teamwork!
Cons: The standards are extremely high, and it can be difficult getting onboard and caught up with what is expected.
Advice to Management: Keep up the great work! The hands-on learning and encouragement makes this working environment one of the best!

Title: "The company of the oportunities"
Pros: The good thing about Chipotle is that everyone has the oportunity to grow in the company
Cons: Being a restaurant your hours of work can be cut if the sells decrease.
Advice to Management: be more comunicative with your crew

Title: "decent fast food job"

- free meal every full shift

- managers often delay breaks

Title: "Best Starter Job"
Pros: A fast paced environment that will test you mentally and physically.
Cons: There really is nothing bad to say.

Title: "Solid"
Pros: Good, positive environment. Great ownership pushed success and wanted everyone to rise in the company
Cons: not too many, aside from working with food if you don't like that.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "It's Okay, Love the people"
Pros: Great people, free food when you work, good benefits, positive atmosphere
Cons: inconsistent hours, sometimes was made to work off the clock, long and inflexible hours
Advice to Management: Be up front with crew members about their performance

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: It's definitely a fun place to be at. Everyone working there seems to be full of life and they try to be really nice.
Cons: Because of the fact that they want people to move up to manager, they allow everyone to act like managers and it get's frustrating because just about everyone tells you to do something at the same time. It gets very overwhelming and if you don't seem like you like the job they will fire you.
Advice to Management: Make it a bit more clear whose really in charge. Be a bit more considerate when someone gets flustered because 20 different people are telling them to do 20 different things.

Title: "manager"
Pros: Best job ever. they are my family
Cons: that I quit. should have stayed and worked my way up.

Title: "Good Exp"
Pros:
opportunity for growth
plenty to learn
overall good people to work with
proud of product
Cons:
very political atmosphere (may vary by location)
overwhelming at times
favoritism
Advice to Management:
more consistent scheduling
more detailed training

Title: "Good"
Pros: Great benefits plus after a year they reimburse you for your college books up to $5,500 that's awesome
Cons: No negative things great team and great service plus they give a meal a shift thats great
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you do your awesome great food great service

Title: "Best Job Ever"

Cons: Can't think of any! I know I can't speak for every store but mine is so wonderful and I'm so glad I decided to work for this company.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Good team, competitive wage, and great benefits considering you would be eating Chipotle every time you worked.
Cons: Nice, sweaty, and smelly after work.

Title: "Fun Year"

Cons: The management didn't take the thoughts of the crew into full consideration and would plan on using the crew in any way they needed rather then respecting the thoughts of the entire team.
Advice to Management: I would like to see the manager hiring process be with the consent of the entire team rather then the general manager doing all the hiring decisions.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: They feed you well. There are always opportunity to move up. If the right management sees you working hard, you can move up the ladder easily.
Cons: Hard work. They will work you to your bone. You're expected to work as fast as possible.
Advice to Management: Don't play favorites.

Title: "Family restaurant"
Pros: Feels like a family, everyone is your friends there. I met some good friends there
Cons: They don't give you hours if you wanna make more money

Title: "used and abused"
Pros:
great concept (if it was actually followed)
fresh food
can be fun
opportunity for overtime
Cons:
you never get off on your scheduled time
always getting called in on your days off
management does not appreciate your hard work
company does not follow the concept that they are portraying to customers
no personal life

Title: "It changed me in a way that I still live its vision on making the world a better place."
Pros: Out standing career training with a passion and a key focus on a mission with a focus to food with integrity.
Cons: To many turn overs and not enough focus on the good workers. Dont keep the bad guy cuz they will just work for a check. Keep the good guys that will sustain your culture.
Advice to Management: Focus on turning over the people rather than the money to keep the business open.

Title: "alright i guess"
Pros: its a job, they pay you
Cons: do way more work than it's worth, expect you to not have a life
Advice to Management: respect your employees, stop penny-pinching

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Family oriented team work. Fun sometimes but there is a learning curve.
Cons: Managers can be overbearing, worked like a work horse. If you mess up once or twice they lower your hours.

Title: "Great Experience!"
Pros: Positive environment, great pay, and free meals!
Cons: Hard work and lots of standing.

Title: "Line worker"
Pros:
- Good pay and hours
- Great environment to work in
Cons: - early mornings for prep work

Title: "Cult"
Pros: Good pay, free food, hipster atmosphere, 50℅ off food when not working, grill was fun sometimes, does not open too early
Cons:
Management used up and burned out all of us.
The best employees had their limit and were treating like absolute garbage.
Thy were more than willing to steal your time and schedule you when they were fully aware of your requests to take off were made prior to the schedule being made.
When they schedule you incorrectly (for instance, a former coworker got fired because he had told the GM that he had a doctor appointment a week before the schedule was made, and the GM scheduled him at that exact time, but couldn't get the shift covered) they say it's "your responsibility to get it covered" or, "you have to work with chipotles schedule".
They would schedule students to close during weekdays.

Title: "Great Stepping Stone"
Pros:
-Really Positive Work Space
-Good Salaries
-Open to all levels of experience
Cons:
-Very Tiring
-Tough to move up

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Lots of cross training and tools that management provides for crew members. Friendly environment.
Cons: High turn out rate and prospects can be limited.

Title: "Why you should work at Chipotle!"
Pros: The people you work with are amazing and it's like a family every time you work. They are very flexible with scheduling, and you get free food when you work.
Cons: It gets too busy sometimes and you might get overwhelmed if you can't handle it.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros:
Great Training
Potential for a great team environment.
Opportunities to really have your voice heard
Fun work Environment
Very challenging
Cons:
I was not fired but saw the loss of great employees with very little reason other than "not fitting in".
Employees can vote to not hire someone based on the fact that they feel their hours would be cut.
Quite a few questionable employees hired based on their relationships with other team members, not whether they were actually right for the position.
Personal relationships are encouraged to overdevelop between management and crew, sometimes causing unprofessional relationships that harm the team.
Due to company/public issues, opportunities are decreasing.
Advice to Management: Make it clear what is considered acceptable interactions between crew and managers. Do not allow friendships to affect a team, and when they are reported, make sure everyone's voice is heard, not just the person with the most personal relationships to back it up.

Title: "Not the best place to work at"
Pros:
Free food,
They are SOMETIMES flexible with hours but not really. I have nothing positive to say sorry NOT sorry
Cons:
rude managers, favoritism
Always pointing out what you do wrong
Rude co workers
Stealing your tips
No hours
Dishes
They expect you to do other people's tasks
Horrible management
Bull crap hours
VERY RUDE morning managers
Horrible horrible place don't work here
Advice to Management: Be nice to new employees!!!!! Don't have favorites treat new crew like old crew. I am very dissatisfied don't work here! University oaks is a horrible place!!

Title: "Apprentice"
Pros: Chipotle is a very good company to work for although at times I felt that a lot of the companies principals were only for show and didn't really seem to matter.
Cons: A lot of extra hours here and there but mostly just having somebody constantly monitoring your every move regardless of how far you made it into the company

Title: "It's lit"
Pros: good hours, great pay, friendly coworkers
Cons: hard work, hectic rushes, fast paced

Title: "Fun place to work"
Pros: It was fun working there and there was a lot of great coworkers, the sad thing in my last 2 weeks working there, was that were a change of managers and everybody was disappointed because of that, but there was nothing to do, how ever I liked working there :D
Cons: that store was far away from my home that's why I quit, its a really busy store but i don't think its a bad thing

Title: "Crew Members"
Pros: Easy Fun Going and Energetic group interview with two managers great company to move up in to becoming a manager
Cons: Interviewer picks who to focus on mainly during the interview best chance is to know someone already working there for support to get the job

Title: "Kitchen Manager"

Advice to Management: Higher pay or bonus incentives to ALL crew to attract and keep the best talent

Title: "Server"
Pros: good place to work at
Cons: very heavy nature of job
Advice to Management: NA

Title: "It was an okay experience"
Pros: The pay is great and depending on how the staff is the hours can be good as well. You get a free meal while on clock.
Cons: They expect you to be someone your not. The free meal you get you can not take it home with you. A lot of times they are short of staff.
Advice to Management: People need a job so they pretend to be those 7 characteristics you need to get the job.

Title: "They were a joke!!"
Pros: Interacting with very friendly customers, free meal after each shift.
Cons: They didn't work to get things done, very dirty work area, management didn't know how to manage, always understaffed because they hired people who weren't fit for the job then they ended up getting fired.
Advice to Management: Think about situations first before getting stressed and not making the right decisions.

Title: "ok"
Pros: good job, lots of good people but some customers are mean
Cons: nonstop work work all the time because always busy
Advice to Management: more money

Title: "Not bad"
Pros: Treated well and not too difficult.
Cons: Can be a little exhausting at times.
Advice to Management: Maybe an extra break would be good for workers.

Title: "chipotle"
Pros: Wonderful place. Great people. Great company values.
Cons: a lot of rules to memorize. long shifts.

Title: "Upper management leads through fear."
Pros: There really is no upside. Long hours, minimum pay, upper management is horrible. Expected to work off the clock as a manager.
Cons: Seriously everytjing. Do yourself a favor and don't work here. It's not worth it. You're expected to work off the clock

Title: "Analyst"
Pros: Lots of great smart people, food is great
Cons: Management is unqualified and leads with fear and the illusion of culture. Just because you are intelligent does not mean you are a leader, especially if you are not going to make any strides to connect and understand your people. They say people are not a "culture fit" if they disagree or don't respond well to negativity or power. None of them realize that most corporate employees hate their jobs and are too scared to speak up. Being smart and hard working does not work here if you have your own opinions or a different way of doing things. I am sure Chipotle used to be great but everyone who disagreed either got pushed out or let go. This company says they want people to come as they are, but if you are outgoing and a people person you are deemed a low performer. The one on one culture is really just a gossip culture, and managers get each other riled up about people they don't even know or work with. All in all, very very very dissapointed with this supposedly cool company.
Advice to Management: Take a step back and think about why you have such high turnover. Saying "this is an intense place" isn't good enough. How is this approach working? No one is happy other than the people who somehow made it to the top. It's going to be surprising when everyone leaves but it shouldn't be. Think about what makes chipotle great and appreciate the people who want to be there. Then perhaps you will have the culture you preach about yet don't have (hence never being considered a top place to work)

Title: "Great employer"
Pros: staff was great, hours were flexible
Cons: can get very busy and difficult
Advice to Management: don't rush the workers

Title: "It's the best job I've had"
Pros: Where do I start. I started working for Chipotle in my second semester at college. I had already made the decision to drop out prior to the job offer and actually had an alternate plan in place but wanted the extra money. I had worked in the food service industry for a few years leading up to the job offer so I had very low expectations. Between the trial by fire training (a preference of mine) and the competitive yet cohesive atmosphere I was hooked. To this day I can't explain the joy I feel when completing a task ahead of my deployment or grilling a perfect batch of chicken and steak. My managers made me feel important, loved, and needed and regularly put effort towards helping me achieve my goals. I'm excited to see what the future holds for me and how they will continue to be a part of my life now that my original plan has changed.
