Cons: As stated by everyone else the work is hard and the hours are long but I wouldn't have it any other way.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work not many other companies are able to handle an e coli outbreak with the same level of scrutiny.

Title: "prep cook"
Pros: this job was fun and you actually get a lot of free food and i loved it so much i could have died
Cons: the only thing i have to say about working here that was a con was having to deal with some of the people there
Advice to Management: please don't be rude because it makes me want to punch you in the face with our burritos but i wouldn't do that cause im nice

Title: "Ok"
Pros: Free food, great employees, opportunities to move up in the company.
Cons: Favoritism played by upper management, get blamed for everything, never good enough.
Advice to Management: Value your management team more.

Title: "Great company"
Pros: Good benefits, flexible hours.
Cons: Closing gets late at times.

Title: "Worst company that I've had the displeasure of working for"
Pros: Honestly the only perk to working here is the fact that you get free meals. Another perk I guess is learning costumer service and how to prepare food.
Cons: My managers at the store that I worked at didn't know how to properly run a functioning business and would take their stress out on the employees. Management often discriminated against other employees of different races and backgrounds
Advice to Management: Learn to work well with people of any background and suppress pre-existing prejudices on people of different ages, race, financial background, etc.

Title: "Arrogant"
Pros: fun, busy, avocados, yummy yummy
Cons: leaders were squares - way too much kool aide

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: The discount was great, 50% off. Also, scheduling and switching with employees was easy. The food was fantastic and you always got a free meal when you worked.
Cons: The expectations are a little ridiculous. Also, they really work you for your time. I had little time to just relax, even for a minute.
Advice to Management: Don't over work the employees. Listen to their concerns. I've worked at a busy store where they couldn't hold on to one person for over a month because of overworking them.

Title: "analyst"
Pros: great laid back environment, downtown location, great perks, free chipotle,
Cons: management is horrible. no direction, no trust
Advice to Management: get rid of them all and start over

Title: "Loved it"
Employee Title: Back of the House Team Member
Pros: It's a fast paced job with friendly co workers and a steady schedule
Cons: If u don't have reliable transportation you need to be there 15 early so you don't lose your job.
Advice to Management: For those you see making the effort to succeed in the company should not be looked down upon just because the use public transportation

Title: "sanitation required"
Pros: very profitable for the boss
Cons: mgmt seems too busy to keep the environment sanitazed

Title: "Rewarding hard work, great first job."
Pros: probably the best first job you could have, you learn great work skills and team building skills, time management, and are held at a high standard which is rewarding in the end.
Cons: You can be overworked at times. Since the ecoli breakout the work load has only gotten larger, sometimes frustrating for a minimum wage job.
Advice to Management: Notice when someone is stressed out, don't be annoyed or rude, help them out, stressful job, empower employees.

Title: "Decent place, awesome coworkers,"
Pros: Good coworkers, decent managers, great ethics
Cons: Always busy, initial movement to management is very hard to achieve.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Great place to work.... If you're just starting to work
Cons: High turnover ratio. Management gets replaced every other three months or so.
Advice to Management: Work Cohesively

Title: "Crew member"
Pros:
Free food and good benefits
Friendly coworkers
Fast paced
Cons:
Management takes job too serious
Overly stressful
Get fired really easy
Advice to Management:
Keep your promises with working up
Don't fire people when they are sick and can't make work

Title: "Great Food Service Experience"
Pros:
• Felt valued by the company, and felt my colleagues were more family than simply fellow coworkers
• Worked with a lot of great people, formed lasting friendships
• Offered many opportunities to explore other roles within the company, and never felt restricted to my current role
• Pleasantly surprised by the authenticity of the company's claims to excellence in quality
Cons: • Corporate seemed a separate world from the restaurant, which I understand is quite common
Advice to Management: Keep hiring the best and the brightest you can find. It really does make for a great work environment, and I think it shows from the perspective of the customer as well

Title: "Crew"
Pros: there was Free Food while you worked
Cons: Bad Management, particular manager at my location was more interested un drama

Title: "Straightforward job alongside driven people."
Pros: As a member of the crew, you get a fairly solid jumping-off point for skilled work in food. Not only are you exposed to the planning and preparation, but also the execution and customer interfacing necessary for advanced work in food service. The pay is good (for a food service job), as are the people, and the perk of a free burrito with every shift isn't overlooked. Advancement is available, and in most stores, if you're willing to put in the work, opportunities for success come up often.
Cons: The company itself has a bit of a cult-like presence. Lingo and rhetoric is everywhere, and while it's not at "sandwich artist" level, it's still easy to forget that a 'restauranteur' is more or less a general manager, and that those above you in the ladder are still your bosses. Regional managers, in my experience, weren't friendly or personable, and seemed to deify themselves rather than relate to their employees.
Advice to Management: Be more selective in those that are promoted to regional manager positions and beyond, especially in regards to the 13 values that the company stands for. Morale drops significantly whenever your manager seems less like a person and more like an enemy.

Title: "Fun"
Pros:
Good hours
Room for growth
Great culture and values
Team environment
Cons:
Too many racial cliques
Stressful at times
Some locations have bad service
Advice to Management: Care more for employees

Title: "Cashier work experience"
Pros: Great work environment and friendly staff.
Cons: Late hours depending on schedule.
Advice to Management: Good job!

Title: "crew member"
Pros: good, fast paced, fun, great coworkers
Cons: low pay for the amount of work

Title: "Not a good high school job"
Pros:
-pay was better than most fast food places
-company really emphasized relationships with co-workers
-it's a good job if you want to make it your career or if you want to work in the restaurant business
-there are many opportunities to advance if you make this your career (not many for part-time workers)
-free meal every time you work
-50% anytime you're not working
Cons:
-the schedule was never posted in time
-It gets really hot on the line in the summer
-you can't leave your position during peak (12-1 & 6-7)
-the managers yell at you when you're standing around not doing anything but then they all go in the back and chill
-you get lots of burns
-even when you ask for a day off in advance you almost never get it off
-they expect you to know a lot of their "knowledge" and make it your top priority, but as a student my part-time job was not worth that much
-they don't give a lot of hours to students
Advice to Management:
-Chill on all the knowledge
-be nicer to high schoolers
-check more with your managers
-do more frequent/unexpected visits

Title: "Great Experience"
Pros: Met some amazing people that I am still really close with now.
Cons: Because I am currently in school will not be able to experience managing a restaurant.

Title: "Service"
Pros: Fun , always busy but no more,everyone you work with is family
Cons: For all the responsibilities that we have , the pay should be higher
Advice to Management: Be fair in promotions

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: The ability to learn, grow, and become better as a person.
Cons: None to be noted here.

Title: "Great enviorment heavily focused on crew members working as a team."
Pros: Great starting pay. Overall good attitude from crew members and management. Excellent opportunity for advancement.
Cons: Constantly on feet/moving. Potential for burns. Some heavy lifting. Closing shift ends fairly late. Fast paced environment that frequently changes/updates.
Advice to Management: If a manager that "black lists" an employee is fired, I believe that the decision to not rehire should be reviewed.

Title: "Line worker review"
Pros: The majority of the employess are friendly, outgoing and energetic. This job is not for shy people. You need to have a sense of humor!
Cons:
Very strict no-call no show policy, will fire you the second time no question. I quit because they didn't want to work with my hours, but this is a fun job for a high school student.
I worked there before the E Coli scare.

Title: "Friendly staff"
Pros: If you work hard you can move up in this ever expanding company. Your coworkers decide if you are ready to move up in the company. They have strong values that they want every customer to experience when they come in. Management is qualified and well trained through moving up in the company and do not hire from outside the company.
Cons: You are expected to become best friends with everyone you work with, just getting along with them doesn't cut it. So if you have different views, hobbies, taste in music, no time outside of work to hang out with them, then you are not really cut out for that team. They want you to be fast and efficient right away, it takes time of being efficient to get the speed down.
Advice to Management: Don't forget that every person is an individual, they are not required to like everything their other coworkers like, and are not necessarily going to be best friends with their coworkers.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: The people and the food are great. Good benefits. Fun place to work, in a good atmosphere.
Cons: Some politics in upper management. Nearly impossible to reach goals. Very long hours. Hard work for okay pay. Expectations through the roof.

Title: "Ok"
Pros:
interacting, speed, organization.Paid breaks and free meals. Constantly learning, relearning, and expanding. I enjoyed working here a lot; I grew comradery with my co-workers. Starting off on grill was not easy, and a complete challenge. Striving each day for perfect cut sizes, ensuring all food is up to temperature and delicious, constantly maintaining a clean station, and never running out of food.The fast pace environment is not for everyone, but as you go your realize everyones there to help and I also enjoyed coming in everyday and seeing smiling faces! Great times
Beware of the heat and a sore arm!
Cons: media, competition, customers, burns. Short breaks. Running short on people. Estressful
Advice to Management: t is a fun job for those who like to be constantly on the move. I like that everything is fresh and wholesome within the restaurant. The safety standards are the most up kept and detailed that i have ever seen. I am proud to be apart of the company.

Title: "Review"
Pros: The atmosphere is really great, overall the workers are very welcoming.
Cons: Even though the food is great and your coworkers are excellent as well. They should should raise the pay for their employes.
Advice to Management: I advise the management to raise the pay for their employes. To really encourage people to work at chipotle.

Title: "Not worth it"
Pros: Motivated Crew with welcoming environment
Cons: Quick employee turnover and little training

Title: "General manager"
Pros: Fast growing company, high standards,connect with crew, salary manager,develope future leaders, write schedule,
Cons: Being a salary manager you are paid for 40 hours a week and mandatory must schedule yourself for 50 hours a week. That's fine it's when your management team is unavailable to work you will also have to cover hourly managers schedule. Working over 50+hours a week can become overwhelming
Advice to Management: I believe chipotle is a great company. Before making a commitment to the company understand that as a salary manager mandatory 50 hours a week is required and sometimes even more hours in a single week can be your responsibility. Prepare your family and beware that being a manager is time consuming.

Title: "Staff"
Pros: High paying considering its my first job. Good people to work with and lots of room to grow
Cons: Limited working hours, short breaks and not on time. They want you to work after hours also without pay.
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Okay Job...."
Pros: You get a free meal after your shift, get to make Margaritas as Cashier and make tips besides minimum wage
Cons: Not being able to attend a shift due to illness or health emergency is a huge issue as finding a replacement due to scheduling is locked in stone, the first three months of the job can be stressful especially with lunch or diner rush while learning responsibilities, management/shift leaders can be unresponsive to needs for food supplies or dining room issues
Advice to Management: Be more responsive to when a worker cannot attend work due to a health or emergency issue

Title: "It's okay"
Pros: Good food, schedule flexibility, good values and inspirational back story
Cons: Childish management, judgmental staff, favoritism
Advice to Management: Pay attention to management and how they treat employees

Title: "Part-Time Restaurant Crew"
Pros: Free food, there are advancement opportunities, the company has many respectable values and ideals. Great teaching and mentor-ship by employees
Cons: Shift times were never "enforced" many times expected to stay later, very difficult to get schedule that works for everyone, very high expectation of company knowledge

Title: "First job as teen"
Pros: free food which was pretty awesome, learning all the tips of the trade. first job yay
Cons: initially like it but then realized i could have been doing better things with my time, so i quit
Advice to Management: i would suggest you stop playing favorites and wathcing your staff like as if they're rats

Title: "Loved working there!"
Pros: Love the people, manager helped me get the hours l needed around my class schedule, fine pay for a part time job while in school, promote from within
Cons: I didn't like the late nights having to clean up or the pressure to learn more. I was comfortable as a line cook but they want you to move up and learn to cook and other positions (it's a pro if you want to move up in the company, I just wanted an easy job while at school)

Title: "Houston (river oaks cashier)"
Pros: Love my job. We work as a team. I love all of my managers.
Cons: Rush hour standing. Messy customers.

Title: "Main Office in Denver"
Pros: Great to work for a hot company that is changing the way the world thinks about and eats fast food. The whole idea of food with integrity is amazing. Most of the people are smart and fun to work with.
Cons: Working in the Denver office is like high school all over again. There is no incentive to do the right thing - you just have to be in the right group and say yes. And the stress due to the backstabbing is intolerable.
Advice to Management: Wake up! Hold your support staff to the same standards as the restaurant staff - the Restaurateur culture does not exist in the Denver office.

Title: "Not bad for a first job"
Pros: Free food. Our managers do care about our success and our performance. They are willing to work around your life. If we work for over a year, we get tuition reimbursement. Everyone has a say on just about anything.
Cons: Really fast paced job which was hard for me to get used to. No tips. Lots of repetition.
Advice to Management: More Communication. The culture that Chipotle wants should be there and managers have to be honest and open minded.

Title: "It Depends"
Pros: Free food, move up fast, flexible schedule, team work, cross training. Make friends, your crew cares about you. BTW, it all depends on the area and restaurant you are in. Not all Chipotles are the same.
Cons: not enough training, higher management outside of restaurant not the best in this area. Plays favorites. Not enough effort goes to seeing why and when someone should be promoted. Seems like if you threaten to quit they will promote you. BTW, I'm talking about the area I'm in. I was in another state with Chipotle before, and that was the best restaurant I've been in. No complaints from them.
Advice to Management: Advice to upper management, like GMs, ATLs, and area managers. If you're going to promote someone to Apprentice, make sure they know their stuff. Just because one of them is the girlfriend of another GM in another store doesn't mean she deserves to be in that position. Honestly, she shouldn't even be a part of the team. It's frustrating when someone in another store gets promoted because she is basically a relative, and you know you at least deserve to be started on training for the next position but nothing happens.

Title: "Nice"
Pros: PAY, nice people, hard working crew because of the high standards, Halloween is fun to work, uplifting environment to be in
Cons: Occasional awful customer who treats you badly, the tips suck, online orders get annoying, and also I'm allergic to metal
Advice to Management: Give people more time to adjust to The work. It's a different job from any Other. Don't talk down to employees please

Title: ""A lot of culinary physical work" food, food, food."
Pros: Benefits, free food, decent pay. Always busy.
Cons: Pay can be higher for managers for how much they are expected to do. Lots of constant corporate changes.
Advice to Management: Don't drift away to much from the vision

Title: "Almost no training"
Pros:
Young coworkers
Free food and drink
Healthy meals
Good pay ($11hr starting pay)
Cons:
Short 15 minute lunch
Constant stress of juggling 3 duties at once
Co workers gossip about other co workers
Advice to Management: Train your employees and do not become mad when they make a mistake. They are human and are not being trained well so will make mistakes soemtimes. If an employee states this is their first job expect for mistakes to happen and be kind.

Title: "Great first time job"
Pros:
- opportunity for growth and advancement
- great as a first job / still a student
- learn a lot about teamwork
- teaches good work ethic
- hours can be flexible
- corporate visits every single store they open consistently
Cons:
- job can be tedious and repetitive
- micromanagement can be a problem even though they stress on being leaders instead
- a lot of false promises in terms of my experience

Title: "Great Place"
Pros: benefits, Food, Environment, The managers expectations was always great
Cons: the rush hours. It was important for the company to hire less people in order to save money.
Advice to Management: Hire more people and give the students less hours to focus on school. This can be overwhelming

Title: "Get better"
Pros: Great company to grow and learn new things .meet amazing people and become a great leader.the food is great and free
Cons: Feeling overwhelmed stressed out from long lines hasty customers and slow employees.favoritism. Hazing long hours short breaks could be fired without reason
Advice to Management: Choose better leaders stronger standards think about employee feelings actually promote more benefits for the crew and managers more days off

Title: "Kitchen"
Pros: Great food everything is hands on
Cons: Time management for the crew
Advice to Management: More communication

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: free meals, opportunity for advancement, different jobs, perfect for those who want a career in food
Cons: schedule is not flexible whether part time or not. will stay late hours and meetings sometimes 6 in the morning right before a shift.

Title: "Gave me the run around"
Pros: The people there are generally good in a successful restaurant, there is a lot of support if the GM knows what they are doing
Cons: They make a lot of empty promises about advancement, the recent changes in policy were poorly executed.

Title: "kitchen manager"
Pros: Environment was amazing and customers
Cons: working off the clock a lot

Title: "Line"
Pros: You don't clock out on your break and you get a free meal in your break. Lots of young people usually work here.
Cons: Tips are about 1-10 a night. They don't do a good job at getting you started they expect you to learn by watching others while you work and know how to make everything because they have recepi cards. Only give you discounts not family and friends.
Advice to Management: Do a better job at training and introducing the journal, have a one on one when someone gets hirred.

Title: "Server"
Pros: Amazing people and environment! Very easy to move up in positions if you put in the work and show that you are dedicated to the cause.
Cons: I do not have any negative comments.

Title: "you should try the corn salsa. seriously."
Pros: Very good place for upward mobility, can become promoted quickly, great team and management members, promotions from within, very flexible and understanding management.
Cons: Some people don't like Mexican food. What a shame.

Title: "Line Worker"
Pros: Free chipotle meal every shift, clean kitchen, good company values, opportunites to work up in the company, make customers happy in every shift
Cons: Very inconsiderate of schedules, automatically punched out at midnight even if you were still working, unpaid nightly chat with team about "thorn" and rose" of the day, never got out on time
Advice to Management: Have better respect for employees. My schedule was never respected and I felt over worked and under paid. Some managers need to look up the word "empower" because they do not articulate that well to lower level employees.

Title: "Tortilla #1"
Pros:
Coworkers were awesome
Flexible hours & Manager worked well with schedule
Pay was roughly 9.50, which is above minimum wage (7.25$)
Cons: There wasn't any major cons that I came across

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: This is a great place to work where you can lay a foundation for the future.
Cons: Best place I have worked no cons.

Title: "Not a good first job"
Pros:
Salary
Free food
Clean environment
Nice general manager
Easy to move up in positions
The general manager was nice and understanding.
Cons:
Hours
Unfriendly Crew members
Mean bosses
Lack of training.
I use to get sent home after 1 hour of working and I lived 30 minutes away.
Advice to Management: Please make sure you properly TRAIN your employees before you throw them in the fire and then get mad when when they do something wrong. Also don't hire so many people that you can only give 2 hours to certain employees.

Title: "My Favorite Job So Far"
Pros: We get a daily 50% off and an employee every day we work, regardless of how long (or short) the shift was. The company sponsored health/vision/dental is great and the starting rate is slightly above minimum with raises distributed during quarterly reviews based on performance. There's a great amount of potential for upward mobility within the store and within the company. My coworkers are my second family. Everyone's opinion is valued, and everyone can have the opportunity to be involved with hiring and training.
Cons: Every store has its quirks, triumphs, and struggles. My store happens to have a great leader, cohesive management, and a well developed store culture. Some other stores, not so much. This is a job where your experience is entirely determined by the people around you and heavily reliant on the GM's skills. An ineffective GM causes unrest among the crew and the overall quality of the store suffers.

Title: "Over worked"
Pros: Great team to work for. You always feel like your around family. A good first job to start off with.
Cons: Seriously over worked. Always under staffed. Never get enough hours but when you do work they keep you majorly overtime.

Title: "Fun times filled with slight regret"
Pros: One of the best reasons to work at Chipotle is the people. Fellow workers are all very upbeat and love their job every single day. It's also great working for a company that is looking to change the fast food industry by receiving food from local sources and having higher standards
Cons: Some downsides of working at Chipotle are that it is a fast food restaurant, so there is pressure to work as quickly and correctly as possible. Another downside is that since it is a fast food restaurant, there are some customers who can be overly rude at times. However, most of the customers know what to expect when going to Chipotle and are generally very friendly
Advice to Management: Be more open with feedback. I was let go for not being a top performer, but I was never once notified that I was at risk of losing my job.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
Fun job
Good hours
Good pay
Flexible
Good relation with staff
Cons: Weird Emlpyoment process, other than that its good
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Take Out Specialist"
Pros: fast-paced environment, friendly, welcoming, team-oriented, abundant opportunities to learn
Cons: somewhat uncoordinated, long hours, early mornings, late nights
Advice to Management: Stop drastic expansion. It kills the brand and puts lots of stress on store managers.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
- Great Staff
- Flexibility
- Pay increases based on performance
- Fun work environment
- Free food
- Good employee benefits
Cons:
- Work hours are dependent on sales
- Inconsistency w/ management styles
- Can belaborious at times
Advice to Management: - No favoritism among crew members

Title: "Not for everyone"
Pros: Working with other crew members feels like family.
Cons: Working on the grill for 9.25 was way too much work for that pay. Other stations seemed like less work for the same rate of pay.
Advice to Management: Move crew members around a bit more and quicker. Staying in a specific station for a while is dreadful.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Easy job great staff and managment
Cons: I love every minute of working here

Title: "Micro managed"
Pros: It was a enjoyable place to work and the training was very good however it was seriously micromanaged.
Cons: I asked for $35 but received only 20 to 25. I had to fight for hours

Title: "Chipotle is a cult"
Pros: None. This company is a brainwashing cult.
Cons: This company is structured like a cult. They make you memorize mindless verbiage that pushes your own thoughts to the side and hinders your ability to think critically. They threaten you constantly in order to turn you into a obedient, subservient robot. In essence, their message is "sell me your soul for nine dollars an hour" They worship their CEOs like members of The People's Temple worshipped Jim Jones.
Advice to Management: Get real jobs

Title: "Cashier"
Pros:
Something that a lot of restaurants don't teach you nowadays is the true value of teamwork and elevating others within your workplace and I would totally commend Chipotle for teaching their employees such things.

Opportunities to move up quickly in management!

Flexible scheduling!
Cons:
There are a lot of inconsistencies as far as policies in food handling go. Due to the recent E Coli scares, an email was sent to management suggesting that we do not wear our work gloves over our cutting gloves (which is something that we've never done before) while cutting meats and veggies and about a week later, another email was sent to management suggesting that we PUT ON our work gloves over our cutting gloves. So many new and unnecessary polices have risen recently.

Some procedures for tasks are performed differently by each manager (that are, may I add, NOT taught by Chipotle) and therefore crew members are left confused and not properly trained. Don't bother mentioning that fact to the managers because they will not take ownership of their poor training and will be dishonest about your training to their managers (lack of 'Honesty', which is one of their 13 Characteristics) and make you feel like they tried their best with you and that it's all your fault.
Advice to Management: Be on the same page with each other AND with corporate when it comes to running your store and your crew members!

Title: "Not A Bad Job"
Pros: Free food every shift. 50% off on days off. Flexible scheduling. Fun environment. Opportunity for growth. Learning skills applicable in other settings. Tip jar.
Cons: Sometimes they take things far too seriously. There is a lot of opportunity for growth but there can be some politics involved. You have to memorize definitions which isn't a huge deal but it can be annoying.
Advice to Management: Be consistent, be consistent, be consistent. If you want something done you have to make sure everyone is following protocol every day. Stop being lazy and respect your workers

Title: "not a completely terrible place to work"
Pros: The starting pay is better than most fast food places, the benefits are nice, and it's the perfect job for fast-paced people.
Cons: It can get pretty chaotic during peak hours, it's very disorganized and the already established cliques can make the environment unsettling to work in.
Advice to Management: Be on top of everything that you do, try not to show favoritism to certain workers. Also, make it a priority to get to know the people you hire.

Title: "Service manager"
Pros: Tuition reimbursement, people culture, paid time off
Cons: Hard work, remembering food culture terms, management may not be experienced.

Title: "Get in and get out."
Pros: The training could be good.
Cons: Employees are very disposable to the company. Hard work isn't what they want.

Title: "Hard work, long hours, little pay"
Pros: I worked in a college town, so I met lots of great people. Gained lots of restaurant skills. Performance reviews were mandatory and helped me get my promotions. Opportunities to move up (easier for corporate positions than lower positions).
Cons:
It was just understood that if you were told you were on track for a promotion, that you probably weren't. Management was a lot of talk, and had a hard time making promotions happen. Corporate is constantly promoting regional managers, so it was hard to get uppers to listen when they were always going through a learning curve. In my year and a half there, I went through 2 uppers (directly above our Restaurateur), and we were constantly having to fight to be heard. Our store was the only one in our college town, and we were surrounded by very small towns. We were the only chipotle with that kind of customer base and traffic. Our rushes were different and harder than the stores in our region, but uppers wouldn't listen to our needs and forced us into practices that were not effective to our store's needs.

Lots of drama with management and employees.
Advice to Management: Pay employees better, offer more in raises, be more efficient and honest about promotion plans, listen to the lower employees. The views and opinions of In-store management does not always reflect the rest of the store. Take time to be invested in your current position and don't just skate by for the next corporate promotion.

Title: "Hard yet rewarding"
Pros: People culture, goal-oriented, high standards
Cons: Be prepared to work. The bar is set high.

Title: "Line cook"
Pros: Friendly staff, free lunch and uniforms
Cons: Very unorganized in hiring process

Title: "Take-Out Specialist"
Pros: Good morals, fun co-workers mostly clean work environment.
Cons: Can be competitive, really hard work for not much pay, job is repetitive

Title: "grill"
Pros: The crew are always the best they can find
Cons: They find the best crew then pay them minimum wage

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros:
Great people
Great pay
Time goes by so fast and yea it's work and sometimes work is hard, but that's life.
The managers really do care, I talk to my higher up managers and they treat you like a real person and actually care about your life and what you are doing. Get a job here and you won't regret it.
Cons:
None! Work hard and you will move up fast they need leaders and there is soo much opportunity!!!
I started at chipotle a year ago and I love it, the people you meet will be your friends for life.I'm about to get my second promotion to Service manager and I'm about to open a store as well in a few months, only after one year of working here.

Title: "Like any other "high school job""
Pros:
Free Food

They have a set up where it allows employees to learn quick. I never felt overwhelmed as a new employee.
Cons:
Gets really busy and the environment becomes tense. People I worked for would SNAP- managers too. There was a lot of apologized after shifts- gets old after awhile.

Lots of gossip

Pay sucks.
Advice to Management: Get your damn selves together. Don't be dating employees, and freaking out. It makes Cipotle seem sleazy.

Title: "Okay Part-Time gig"
Pros:
Decent part-time wage
Free food
Flexible scheduling
Cons:
Terrible restaurant management
Consistently working with terrible customers

Title: "I really liked this job except they were real harsh on how fast i had to work and didnt take my handicap in consideratio"
Pros: free meal every day and i liked helping people get the food they wanted.
Cons: they work the staff too hard for 9.00 the pay should be more like 11.50 as hard as they work the crew. and those young kids really think that this is good pay smh. theyre managers only make like 15 bucks an hour smh steve
Advice to Management: be better problem solvers

Title: "workin at chipotle"
Pros: free food good vibes and 50% off when not working
Cons: really long hours and sometimes heavy workload but if your used to hard work then it really shouldnt bother you that much so besides that great place

Title: "99% promote from within"
Pros:
Great Pay
Great Benefits
Vacations
Paid Training
Paid trips/Events
Challenging culture
Cons:
High Turnover rate
Upkeep of culture and values
Advice to Management: Make sure voids are filled as company expands to ensure development of future leaders

Title: "Lack of Human Capital"
Pros: Very customer oriented. The operation tasks are focused to deliver the most value. Communication is facilitated well. The food is fresh and maintained at appropriate temperatures
Cons: Management has trouble with worker retention. Workers leave consistently, making it difficult for other workers to keep up with none skilled workers, slowing the operation.
Advice to Management: Improve incentive system to retain workers. Provide more flexibility in hours. Make the wage more competitive, since the work is relatively more physical than other restaurants.

Title: "Coworkers are great"
Pros:
Coworkers really help you make it through any shift and are so nice and understanding for new employees.
Good discount
Cons:
Understaffed especially at peak times
So busy to get stuff done you might not get a break when working 7hr shifts.
Advice to Management: Communicate

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: I enjoy working in Public Relations.
Cons: I never worked at there

Title: "Awesome Place"
Pros: Team are considered family. Great communication.
Cons: Fast paced. You have to have the energy. Stressful

Title: "Emplyoment Review"
Pros: Work with some amazing coworkers that will help you in many ways to do your job.
Cons: Can be very stressful and busy when working

Title: "Do Not Work Here"
Pros: Learn how to make certain food from scratch and free food
Cons: A lot of work for minimum wage and you only get more of it, also since the ecoli scare the work has gotten a lot more technically almost to the point of unnecessary. They don't listen to there employees advice, as I did not want to make guac with rotten avacados I told them they were unsafe to serve but they went and did it anyway. And they wonder why they have had so many outbreaks? Since August 2025 to December 2015 they have had 4 outbreaks. Just don't work here or eat here please save yourself from getting sick
Advice to Management: Management is terrible a bunch of people who don't know what they are doing and who cannot control there staff. And who expect you do to things when you are not properly trained and then reprimand you for doing it wrong. Strangest place I have ever worked with good ethics but bad follow through. Stop worrying about profit and actually do the things your company is supposedly know for.

Title: "work"
Pros: you are able to get free food on the days that you work there, other than that you get discounts on days you dont.
Cons: some of the people bring negative energy to the workplace and sometimes passes it along to other workers and creates a bad environment
Advice to Management: They need to be better organized and try not to crumb everything all together and have people working different positions.

Title: "GM"
Pros: Great Company to work for
Cons: Leadership changes were always happening

Title: "Pay Rate"
Pros: i like how there is a live atmosphere, i am never bored because of all the customers we get
Cons: it gets tiring sometime standing up for 10+ hours
Advice to Management: get to know more about your employees and vice cersa

Title: "Restaurant General Manager"
Pros: Great people culture, great food vision, commitment to customers and team, big holidays off
Cons: Long hours, not a lot of time for family or friends. Important procedures were rolls out via phone call
Advice to Management: When you commit to you managers and team, mean it. When things get hard or rough don't abandon them. That only sets them up for failure.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: free food when working, 50% off when not. paid breaks
Cons: understaffed, not given enough hours

Title: "Service manager"
Pros: Opportunities for advancement. Great group of people. Training is top notch. High standards
Cons: Wages were capped. Flexible schedules for managers aren't always existent.
Advice to Management: Some managers need to be less Nazi like and look at the people you are working with as people and not just a number

Title: "Great work environment!"
Pros: Great atmosphere with a good sense of teamwork!
Cons: it is always very busy so it can get stressful at times.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: There was a great social vibe while at work.
Cons: Hard to balance personal life.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: The food is the best part about the job
Cons: lines are too long, short breaks, don't get to sit down at all and legs begin to hurt
Advice to Management: Pay more

Title: "Okay, but not for me"
Pros: Awesome people, good medical/dental/vision benefits. Also theres always room to move up and get promoted.
Cons: Be prepared to do EVERYTHING. Even if you're just applying to be a crew member for the front line, you will be expected to prepare barrels of salsas and cut vegetables, take out the trash, clean an entire area after your shift even if its a random shift in the middle of the day.

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: Free food fast case an awesome workers
Cons: very stressful at times but very exciting environment to begin
Advice to Management: don't stress out too much and let it show

Title: "All in all good experience"
Pros: Management works around student schedules well, opportunity for lateral and vertical movement within the company, chance to learn basic yet essential kitchen skills, respectable vision and culture for a fast food restaurant, fast paced work environment, helpful management and quality work is noticed by management.
Cons: If the crew your work with has a lot of weak links the job becomes stressful because top performing crew members and managers are relied upon to pick up the slack of others, which is difficult considering how much UO kids love Chipotle.
Advice to Management: Keep up the open communication between management and crew members, crew members respect the opportunity to be heard as well as noticed for their hard work. I'm impressed with Chipotle's willingness to recognize and develop its top performing crew members into management roles.

Title: "E.coli crisis"
Pros: While working here I learned a tremendous amount of cooking skills and speedy, precise actions to be a good worker wherever I go.
Cons: Workload was too much for the pay rate as a starting crew. When I would ask to be moved to another position they would dodge the question. I got laid off due to the e.coli crisis they are having since they were not making enough money to make hours for workers.
Advice to Management: You were a crew member once too. So stop acting all high and mighty.

Title: "Decent company to work for. Especially in the fast casual restaurant industry"
Pros: Great company wide vision (to change the way people think about fast food for the better. ie fresh ingredients, GMO free, etc). Good opportunity for growth and promotion withing the company. Great leadership training if selected by the crew to be trained. Great team environment. Good store wide incentive to better yourself and the people you work with.
Cons: Low pay, especially at the crew level. The company has a difficult time with scheduling and staffing in general.
Advice to Management: Stop growing so fast. Opening 2-3 restaurants a week nation wide is not sustainable and it is affecting many already existing restaurants negatively.

Title: "Trim the Fat from some ATL's, TL's and RD's"
Pros: Great Core Values. Promote from with-in. Great Leadership Skill Taught from day one. 13 Characteristics, Steve Ells Dream is Real farm to fork, Empowered fully, Teams of all High Performers, High Standards with everything not just food....plus Free lunch/dinner
Cons:
Steve Ells Dream is no longer followed to the T. They say remove low performers immeditly, yet the only problem is a lot of the low performers are the one on the board of directors or the Team Leaders already with power. Preach Family Values in the restaurant, but will turn there back and so called trim the fat with no remorse for the so called family.
I was even removed by my new team lead while she was telling me how good the P&L numbers looked and congratulated me on sitting down with all 41 crew members in just a week, of course she said all that ... WHILE she was handing me a blank Term Form and then jetted out of Starbucks so fast I still was in shock of what just happened. To top it off I had just won a throughput contest, sales projects contest, and was assistant Manager of the Jefferson City Missouri Restaurateur team and was featured in the All Managers Conference DVD that same year for Excellent Training and Development. Family ..??.. this was the second time my team lead and I had ever met and she didn't even know my full name while terming me, yet I knew her and even called people support to learn more about her so she was more like family....Ya my life and I will forever will have a void where this company was and I even lost my wife because of the depression caused from this event.
Advice to Management: If you have an Asset asking for guidance because they haven't seen a Team Lead or had a DJ in months and they are at the end of there current knowledge and development already recived and in direr need of knowledge... Help them or at least get to know them and the problems they are facing not just see it as a sign of weakness and fire a person who you haven't even taken the time to understand or help. I took that store from 2.1M/Yr to a 3.5M/Yr in sales in just under 13 months, lowered turnover by 80%, and throughput was from 98/Hr to 201/Hr, plus saving on average $2500 a month in M&R. The bottom line was a nice 12% incline and was still moving up. Cut a man a break... not Cut a mans Job.

Title: "Good team"
Pros: You always learning something even in the bad times.
Cons: Sometimes the people who works there forget the values of the company.
Advice to Management: Try to give more attention to the activities of all the crew...all are important.

Title: "Chipotle sucks"
Pros: Free food, hot guys to work with
Cons: Terribly rude management, must NEVER make a single mistake

Title: "Great Experience"
Pros:
Great pay for fast food industry.
Promotions are readily available
Benefits are offered to every employee
Cons:
Strict standards and procedures
Very high expectations for all employees
Advice to Management:
Remember to not tear down workers will reviewing their performance.
Be humans

Title: "A rocky year"
Pros: The pros of working with this company is that you develop a wonderful relationship with the people around you. Everyone becomes your family. The principles they promote in chipotle are also easily transferable to your every day life.
Cons: The cons of working here is that management can sometimes feel manipulative and unreliable. They give you a sense of security until they feel you are comfortable. Very little notice of performance status and can fire for little insignificant things/
Advice to Management: My advice to management would be to explore the human relations side of business and learn how to truly motivate and communicate with employees.

Title: "Good Company, Hard Work"
Pros: Great benefits for a basic food job. Good starting pay with ample opportunity to move up through hard work. Tuition reimbursement, health, dental, and vision. Great place to work for.
Cons: You will go crazy some days having to do a million things and being asked to do that simultaneously like you are 3 or 4 people. Even when it is not busy. Sometimes they have to cut hours cause of sales which sucks.
Advice to Management: Remember that your crew is only a single person and not three or four at a time.

Title: "Food with integrity for the win!"
Pros:
- Great hours/ lots of overtime
- flexible with schedule
- fast-paced, friendly environment
- professional advancement
- referral bonuses
Cons:
- favoritism between management and crew members
- constant over-turn of employees
Advice to Management: Treat all employees equally.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Good hours, great people, get tips, and free food
Cons: Constantly busy, non stop ordered, lots of cleaning up, and a lot of food preping
Advice to Management: Be able to work at a face pace, and have a great attitude because there will be plenty of rude customers. Have great customer service skills

Title: "Good Until Recently"
Pros:
Really friendly people and managers
You really do take part in making all the food, no microwaves or freezers in the entire store
Other employees are encouraged to work hard
My manager gives me flexible hours if given enough notice.
Cons:
Experience varies by location, not to be underestimated. I've heard of horrible stores that were filthy, and no one cared a whit about you even worked in one. By the by though, most of the people/managers I've met who work at chipotle are friendly

Corporate will take a LONG time to fix any problems
You are expected to basically run the store yourself. This means knowing all the things to clean in the store, how to fix the simpler things like grounded cables that are broke. How to handle basic manager tasks etc. They call it being a "top performer". Honestly though I didn't mind it, but it is something to keep in mind.
Advice to Management: Do what you say you are going to do. We notice when you procrastinate. We also notice who the managers are who always are on top of their game, and corporate will likely pick up on that when they do their visits.

Title: "Good oversll"
Pros: GOOD PAY , awesome environment really really really love the coworkers they are truly the best
Cons: Very hard work. Don't work there as your very first job. You will be EXHAUSTED . Multi tasking is very important
Advice to Management: Be polite to your employees. They are there to help you. If you are a good manager they will keep the company running smoothly

Title: "Good job to gain expirience for your future career"
Pros: They could care less about tattoos and piercings and you meet a lot of cool people
Cons: Managers aren't that great and don't pull there weight
Advice to Management: Focus more on customer service then restaurateur

Title: "Ok as a first job"
Pros: Teaches you the very basics of customer service. Gained a huge respect for those that work in the food industry. If you're in it for the long haul they hire most of their managers from the inside.
Cons: Little to no tipping, manager's can be overbearing at times (though I imagine this changes from location to location). As is with most part time jobs, you get little to no say on the hours you are assigned and that can be frustrating. There seems to be a rather high turnover rate which makes it difficult to get to know everyone.
Advice to Management: If an employee obviously needs to be retrained in something then please take the time to do so. Apart from that the base pay is barely above minimum, I feel that at least 9.50 per hour is deserved.

Title: "Chipotle crew/ take-out specialist"
Pros: Extensive hiring process means that if you are hired, you'll be working with people like you. You stay busy throughout pretty much the entire shift, making the shifts go pretty fast. Opportunities for quick promotions. Paid breaks! Every 6 months, opportunity for a raise based on performance review.
Cons: High volume of customers can sometimes be a bit overwhelming. Often stuck in one position in the store for a full shift.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: Great vision. They really push for a positive atmosphere, where delivering the best customer service and food is key to success.
Cons: Very political system of management. It is more of a popularity contest, as you get your promotions based on how everyone else rates you.
Advice to Management: Develop everyone better to enhance the overall atmosphere, and to believe in all crew members even though they don't meet "your" version of the 13.

Title: "Line worker"
Pros: Great people to work with and great benefits and ok pay.
Cons: It can get crazy and busy.
Advice to Management: Get more people on the working during rush hour so that people may get though the line easer.

Title: "Have to Put in the work"
Pros:
the co-workers are like my family
free food when on break
I good place to learn new things
Cons:
it gets really busy
very late nights
always have to be moving

Title: "Great depending on the location"
Pros:
Room for advancement
Great company values
Cons:
Value of upper management varies depending on location
Get loaded with hours once put on salary
OT strongly discouraged
Advice to Management: Work harder to find more valuable management that understand who would make a good Chipotle employee.

Title: "Crew mem"
Pros: Decent place to work. The experience is highly dependent on the people you work with.
Cons: Busy. Cranky customers. Sometimes you get so busy you don't take breaks. Then you get stuck taking them all at once. I skipped a lot of breaks.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Great benefits, fun atmosphere, and no glass ceiling.
Cons: No work life balance and empty promises

Title: "Good workplace, but bad manager structure"
Pros: Great food discount and great environment
Cons: a lot is asked of employees.
Advice to Management: Only one manager is allowed in the training pipeline. It is unfair when a store is under staffed and only one person is allowed to go through training. I was trying to be a manager, but because a KMIT was not completing his/her book I wasn't allowed to start. This obviously is on the manger's fault, but how can they focus on getting people through the manager training pipeline when they are already understaffed and a busy store. I saw 3 GM's go for this reason and personally I don't think it was right to fire them. So much is asked of them and they are only one person. It is a lot to carry on your shoulders.

Title: "restaurateur"
Pros: They allow you to grow into your own leader and management style with great direction. The people you work with are very genuine. Fast paced, fun environment in the restaurants.
Cons: Salary pays you for 40 hour work weeks, but once you get into higher levels of management you often work close to 60 hours.

Title: "Sucked"
Pros: -Got your meals paid when you went on break
Cons:
-Made you overworked
-Managers were never flexible with your schedules
-Most of the time managers left to go run errands to leave you in the midst of peak hour

Title: "good place to work"
Pros: The workers were cool and even the managers. They felt like they were your coworker because they worked with you and did everything that you did.
Cons: Some of the down side is that the pay wasn't too great. I did a lot of work for little.
Advice to Management: If the pay was better, I could've been a good place to work at and I'll still be there.

Title: "Apprentice"
Pros:
Usually the staff is pretty good.
Pay is decent.
Most managers are good people.
Promotion from within.
Training is good.
Cons:
Has definitely become more "corporate" over the years going from creating a cool culture to being focused just on profit at the expense of employees or the customer experience.
If you are an hourly employee the health plan is horrendous.
Advice to Management: Give the individual locations' GM's, etc, more responsibility and authority to create great experiences in their individual locations to grow the business.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Good pay for fast food industry, benefits offered to everyone, fast-paced work doesn't leave time to get bored
Cons: Extremely fast paced, a lot is expected of you. Understaffing at my location led to severe scheduling problems and overworked employees. The journal you had to keep made me feel like I was in elementary school all over again.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Wonderful atmosphere, great co workers. Ample opportunity to grow within the company. Transparent company, can talk to your superiors without any problem
Cons: Not too much to say negatively about Chipotle. When someone isn't fit for the company, they are let go

Title: "Horrible job, false hope"
Pros: There was good food and they pay above minimum. The shift meals were free. You can wear jeans too so the uniform isn't bad.
Cons: Management is a joke. They promote friends over the people who are qualified. They couldn't get my availability down so for a month scheduled me on the days where I had class all night.
Advice to Management: Cut the crap and start running the place with integrity instead of just preaching it.

Title: "Terrible Military Supporters"
Pros: Free food, not hard work
Cons: Fake fellow team members and managers...one manager likes you the other shift doesn't...equals no JOB...They sent me a email stating I couldn't get the job, the day before my second interview for them...???
Advice to Management: Get you stuff together, and pick better people to run the store...instead of those who just pick style and favorites before quality workers.

Title: "General manager"
Pros:
Closed 5 holidays.
Out by 11
No early mornings
Work 5 days a week
Cons: Long hours for minimal pay

Title: "Cool food"
Pros: Great work environment it's a life changing experience
Cons: Not every worker pushes themselves to better the team
Advice to Management: I have no advice to my managers there great

Title: "Customer care"
Pros: great place to work, good benefits and the schedule is great. they are very busy so the time flies by.
Cons: not a whole lot of chances for advancement. would like to see more training available to promote within the company
Advice to Management: Work on promoting from with in the company, and additional training opportunities. Some obvious favoritism from managers in certain areas.

Title: "It's an alright job if you can mutitask well"
Pros: Paid breaks, Free lunch Room for advancement, Chipotle promotes from within
Cons: If you don't fit in with the rest of your crew and management right away or if the rest of the crew doesn't like you management will fire you on the spot . You also need to be able to multitask really well and fast. Unfortunately Chipotle plays favorites.
Advice to Management: Stop playing favorites and give crew members more time to develop their skills and adapt to there surroundings. Two weeks isn't enough time to develop much of anything considering there is so much to learn at Chipotle.

Title: "Great Workplace"
Pros: It's a job where management actually cares about you. The team is great, even the field leader is an awesome dude. It's very transparent. Most of the crew members have an idea of what's going on in the store such as sales and new hires. It's super fun!
Cons: While a nice place to work, there are some downsides. Hours, if you're part-time can change dramatically, sometimes you'll see good people go for silly reasons.
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work! Just remember to do 1on 1s with your employees every two weeks.

Title: "My job is fairly easy I greet customers and prepare their food right in front of them."
Pros: This is a place where you can definitely move up and everyone has great attitudes and are willing to help you.
Cons: The only con is the language barrier, most of the time everyone is speaking Spanish to each other and I cannot understand what they are saying. But if you can learn Spanish or already speak it then its a great place to work.

Title: "General Review"
Pros: They pay better than the typical fast food joint and you get a free burrito every time you work there. Also, there are lots of opportunities for upward mobility and the company constantly tries to keep you excited about Chipotle and the mission. You feel valuable even as a lowly crew member.
Cons: Because of the restaurateur system, many restaurants are focused solely on fitting the standards for a restaurateur when they are evaluated. Also, people get extremely defensive about their burritos.
Advice to Management: Focus less on becoming a restaurateur and more on keeping your employees happy and running a good restaurant. Also, follow the Chipotle corporate management guidelines to the T; they rock.

Title: "Beware the high schoolers!"
Pros:
Near unlimited potential for growth.
Decent benefits and pay package, respective to the industry.
Strong culture.
High quality food--no exaggeration.
Cons: Jobs like this tend to attract bottom feeders and first timers. You may be subject to their whims at every level of employment.
Advice to Management: Check in more often with store-level employees to see things don't get carried away.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Happy, encouraging, elevating, hospitable environment. Move to management fast.
Cons: Can be really fast paced which can cause stress. MUST follow the company rules.

Title: "Chipotle Employment"
Pros:
Benefits
Good Food
Flexibility
Challenging
Fun Environment
If dedicated to the company (Relativity easy to move up in the company)
Cons:
Crew Members (Need to be more motivated)
Need to work on setting up team for success
Hard Work ( If crew has low performers)
Management needs to be more strike (To many call outs from crew members)
Advice to Management: Management is doing a great job! Having themes help us figure out what we need to improve on in order to become a Restaurant Tour.

Title: "Good while it lasts"
Pros: Great hardworking crew and team around you and free food once per shift and great environment to work in everyday
Cons: Don't really care about workers or effort you do put in, days can be long and hard and getting a lot of hours is pretty hard
Advice to Management: Motivate crew and understand what good work they do, focus more on the culture and let the crew grow together

Title: "Working there,"
Pros:
-Free Meal when on duty and 50% off(but only on one meal)
That's about it.
Cons: Most of the managers play favorites.When you first start the job,they throw you into it,dont really train you.They will say you need improvement but don't give you the chance to improve.You will never go home on time.You never get a real chance to show your skills because your new.
Advice to Management: Be Better.

Title: "its okay"
Pros: get payed $9 an hour
Cons: Very disorganized, they're very bad at scheduling people and usually don't care, it's not their problem apparently.
Advice to Management: Be more organized and professional

Title: "Great Company to work for"
Pros: I loved working at Chipotle. The location I worked at was new, but the managers were from other locations so they knew what they were doing. I worked with mostly very nice people who cared about the quality of service we delivered to the customers. It was like a family. If you are a good worker, and want to make a career in this type of setting, many career advancement opportunities. I was told I could be a kitchen manager in three months, but I wasn't interested.
Cons: Low pay, because it is a fast food like job, some of the people you work with are not dedicated, and cause drama in the workplace. A lot of cooperate HR junk initiatives you have to memorize.
Advice to Management: cut down on the fluff cooperate initiatives.

Title: "awesome experience"
Pros: awesome team work, and act like a family
Cons: long hours, and really theres nothing else there for me to day about it so far
Advice to Management: n/a

Title: "Apprentice"
Pros:
-Lots of opportunities for growth in the company
-Has a great concept of creating great cultures in restaurants
-great food, if cook properly
Cons:
-Under compensated for responsibility in the restaurant
-Most work a minimum of 49 hours as a salary manager, ended up working more.
Advice to Management: Advice for current and future employees, stay in school and their is better opportunities out there with better pay!

Title: "Decent Job"
Pros: Free Chipotle, Great Hours, Fast-Paced: Makes the shifts fly by
Cons: Sometimes too hectic, always busy

Title: "get ready..."
Pros: Fast paced, fun environment, opportunity to learn a lot
Cons: Not paid for all the work you do... need to speak Spanish to be promoted fast
Advice to Management: Remember your workers are ppl.

Title: "Good job"
Pros: Great chance to grow with company
Cons: hard work, dirty work environment

Title: "Horrible Place To work"
Pros: customers are friendly, one free meal a day
Cons: pay is low, managers show favoritism, scheduling is bad, no room for advancement

Title: "Awesome place :D"
Pros: free food while working, great managers, company with integrity and food/kitchen was always really clean!!
Cons: raises should be more often and more than 15 cents-25 cents...

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Free food, good training, people who believe in you.
Cons: Must work fast and accurately, can be stressful at times.

Title: "Too much"
Pros:
Support
Experience
Good benefits
Great Opportunity
Balance between personal life and work
A challenge
Cons:
Sexually harassed
Too much work for the pay
Discriminated
Didn't feel welcomed
Slow promotion
Don't apply if you're not emotionally and mentally ready for a lot of physical activity
Advice to Management: Don't touch or kiss your employees and don't promise promotion when you can't keep that promise

Title: "Great place to work (:"
Pros: They give you a place you can grow and meet great people!
Cons: The pay isn't the greatest and moving up is a constant popularity battle between the upper management and the other crew members.
Advice to Management: Quit changing the definitions or put someone in place that isn't going to word them incorrectly.

Title: "Very poor management"
Pros: Lots of opportunities to get free food and get my friends free or cheap food. When no ones in the store it's fun.
Cons: They require you to do a lot of work. You have to be fast and good under pressure to work at chipotle.

Title: "Absolutely amazing"
Pros: The company cares about employees and has quick paths to management positions, free meals with each shift, 50% off on off days, training process is one of the best
Cons: Extremely busy, no down time, expect to get calls on off days requesting to come in, managers get moved among branches way too often
Advice to Management: Instead of expanding faster then managers can be trained slow down and focus on making more current stores up to the restaurantor status

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Good food, friendly management and co-workers
Cons: over work for little pay

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Amazing people culture, endless opportunities, they really care about their people.
Cons: It's not for everyone. You have to be a real team player. If the right management team is not in place, it is easy for good people to be lost.
Advice to Management: Be empowering. Follow your developmental plan tools and set your teams up for success.

Title: "Chiptole"
Pros: There is the opportunity to eat their delicious food for free. You can mix and match and you also get really good discounts!
Cons: Depending on where you are located you could end up in a terrible place! Katy individuals who act like they’re in grade school. Working through breaks and lack of real management presence.
Advice to Management: Read a book and get some training!

Title: "Not much better than any other fast food place"
Pros: They make relatively good food and employees are nice.
Cons: Bad wages, they have a fake personalities in management and the whole company is a pr scam.

Title: "kitchen manager"
Pros: the crew. honestly i am just ring to reach the 20 word minimum right now and almost failing at it. wow that was short like 1 word
Cons: the customers, long hours again, i am just trying to reach that word minimum. side not the free food is great but you do eventually get tired of it.
Advice to Management: lol i am management. if you mean upper management then worry less about labor and let us do our thing.

Title: "Pretty good company, Current Crew Member"
Pros:
-Friendly work environment
-Decent Pay
-Opportunities to move up in company
-Insurance and Tuition Reimbursement
-Great training
Cons:
-Bad communication between high corporate and stores
-Some management are more of bosses than leaders
-Promises of moving up are constantly delayed
Advice to Management: When hiring people in High School, it would be wise to teach professionalism to them as this is a first job to a good percentage of them.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Get to work with other people that have the 13 characteristics. Get stuff done. Great team support because everybody wants you to succeed.
Cons: Some of the downsides would include having to tell a team member to pick up their pace if they aren't preforming at the pace they're capable.
Advice to Management: Make sure to hire those who share the same values as chipotle. Although that isn't obvious enough, it is much easier to not hire someone than to have to fire them later if they don't put work in.

Title: "Chipotle Part Time"
Pros: High starting pay, mostly friendly coworkers
Cons: Not much training, inconsistent scheduling, high turnover rate, wasn't able to communicate with management much

Title: "Apprentice Manager"
Pros: Good starting salary and benefits. Great training and opportunities for career growth always available. Free Cubs or Sox game every year.
Cons: Sometimes you were expected to work longer hours and extra days without any compensation at all and if you didn't then upper management would frown upon you and would consider you to be a Low Performer because of it.
Advice to Management: The "Restaurateur " concept has to stop. It's nothing more than a political Pyramid scheme driven by bonuses.

Title: "Take out specialist"
Pros:
Great co-workers
The company cares about their employees
One free meal per break while you're still on the clock, 50% off once you're off
Great part time job for students
They want people to go higher in the company, very good opportunities
Gain great experience because you are responsible of many things
Flexible schedule
Constant chip talks and one on ones with management to check your progress
They don't ask you to do anything they don't teach you how to do
Cons:
They constantly change your schedule
They pay minimum or close to minimum (as almost any restaurant or fast food restaurant)
As a TOS you work under a lot of presure during rush hour, sometimes you have a couple caterings to take care plus your to go orders
Advice to Management: Keep up with the good communication with the employees

Title: "Crew Member Review"
Pros: Free food after every shift, nice starting pay
Cons: Secret shoppers, Always have to be doing something
Advice to Management: Management should take less stress off of crew members

Title: "Good"
Pros: Free food. Good opportunity
Cons: Managment is hit or miss and different locations

Title: "Good experience"
Pros: First of all, I'd like to say it has been a great restaurant to work at. The members you work with become your best friend and the work environment makes you do your job comfortably without hesitation. Though, this is a fast-pace environment, you'll learn how to work under pressure.
Cons: Not much negativity to say but I will note that the customers have been rude to us when they're rushing to get to work and they blame us for having slow service when it becomes busy, especially on the weekends. Aside from that, salary is one of the highest ones from food chain. Highly recommended!!
Advice to Management: As a former employee, I've learned a lot being in this company that shares a commitment as "honest and integrity" status. Everyone has to know the 20 words of empowerment that we all strive to show each & everyday. Keep the motto, it serves good.

Title: "Customer service specialist"
Pros: great work environment, very nice management, always feel at home at work, the work is very simple, the pay compared to other fast food is reasonable.
Cons: some managers think they are CEOs and not kitchen managers, sometimes people take folding burritos way too seriously, some people are passive aggressive, pay sucks.
Advice to Management: evaluate managers who make the workplace toxic

Title: "cashier/team member"
Pros: its ok for a first part time job I guess.
Cons: Its an ok place to work but there are some issues with the management there. another thing is, it's not diverse it seems they like to pick only Hispanics more so than any other race.
Advice to Management: they need better communication when managing employees.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Fast pace always keeping you on your toes and testing you patience and skills.
Cons: low- pay, work can become overwhelming at times. Crew members can be young and arrogant
Advice to Management: better management

Title: "High turnover and low pay"
Pros: It's free food, everyone is friendly and kind, working for s company that doesn't hire managers right off that bat really fair because you have to work in order become a manager.
Cons: Tons and tons of work, if you don't like scrubbing dishes and mixing Adobe sauce into meat until your skin starts falling off your hands then you shouldn't work here. For $8 I felt like hell and was more angry leaving there than anything. Becoming a manager is just a highschool popularity contest so if you work hard and don't like talking to people your not making anymore. Also everyday they would fire 3 or 4 people then hire 1 or 2 to try to make up for it. It's a huge turnover which is horrible for people working hard enough
Advice to Management: Hire more people and stop firing people that need jobs. Or stop hiring high school kids

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: The collective atmosphere of this Chipotle restaurant is well organized, arranged, and exhibits an image of true care in customer satisfaction. Chipotle does not lace their meats with antibiotics, Does not raise their animals in captivity, and Chipotle uses the freshest produce available in preparing their meals.
Cons: This Chipotle restaurant is closed on the weekend.
Advice to Management: Please continue to respond decisively in all you do.

Title: "There is Better"
Pros:
Well Laid out succession plan(planning)
Great Vision and message
Quality people who care about quality products
Cons:
Poor Upper Management (Directors/Executive Directors) Dont lead by example, dont have leadership qualities
Too much Cronyism, too many buddies help buddies and leaving others out to dry
Too much projection of emotion over passion, its one thing to be a great leader, its another to lack skill at managing people
Advice to Management: Time to clean house, your labor and other metrics are so inflated because of the style of leadership you've fielded. They got Restaurateurs by cheating.

Title: "Changing the way people think about fast food"
Pros:
Great employee benefits
Amazing at teaching leadership and empowerment
Great people culture
Changing American food culture for the better
Free food
Cons:
Long hours
Extremely physical labor
You smell like meat a lot..
Advice to Management: Keep it up

Title: "Quick to fire for dumb reasons"
Pros:
free food if you work more than 5 hrs
experience will prepare you for just about any other entry level job
customers are usually very nice
quick to hire
Cons:
manager like to form a clique; if you can't join it, you get fired
a lot of work
very stressful
they expect you to be absolutely perfect at everything with no experience
breaks labour laws
you will almost inevitably be fired for no reason at some point
Advice to Management:
Chipotle is one of the hardest jobs someone can possibly have. You need to understand that, and give employees more of a chance to improve. MISTAKES WILL OCCUR, AND YOU CAN'T ALWAYS BE PERFECT, AND ACCUSING PEOPLE OF THINGS THEY HAVE NOT DONE IS NOT OKAY!!!
I was fired after six days as a cashier (this was my first job), for being "nervous".

Title: "Quite Possibly the worst experience I ever had"
Pros: Good Pay and Free Food, other than that I really don't think it was worth the hours wasted in my day
Cons:
No training
Thrown to the wolves
Rude coworkers
Favoritism
Rude managers
Condescension
Not as LGBT friendly as the company says
Advice to Management: Don't treat your new employees like feces

Title: "Awesome Company"
Pros: Engaging and encouraging work environment. Always a team-like atmosphere. Great perks and flexibility!
Cons: None really, maybe better employee perks for working there besides one free meal.
Advice to Management: Keep it up. Great place to work.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Very friendly environment, the pay is really good, you will meet so many new people, the work isn't really hard.
Cons: You have to work really fast, take orders pretty quickly, some unfriendly customers can make the job pretty difficult for you.
Advice to Management: You should make sure the employees are all well and make sure you make it a friendly environment for everyone.

Title: "Feels like a sweatshop"
Pros: The only pros I can think of is that they move people up very fast. They also offer benefits for hourly employees.
Cons: The training is absolutely awful and they throw you on the line and expect you to know how to do everything. They overwork their employees and you never leave at the time you're supposed to.
Advice to Management: Please understand that not everyone is perfect. Your employees will make mistakes. Stop firing people right away if they make one little mistake!

Title: "Great way to get myself into the customer service world"
Pros: Takes great pride in work ethic, takes pride in quality ingredients. Cares about Manger/crew development. Helps you learn time management and multitasking. Also teaches you how to deal with high-demanding customers.
Cons: Very fast paced and stressful but really pushes you to do the best you can. Can be very tiring but looking back it was worthwhile. High stress can lead to tension amongst workers. That can lead to problems if not handled carefully. But, that is in any job and I do not feel that reflects badly on the company.
Advice to Management: Take more time to get to know the crew and be considerate of how much effort we put into our work too. Schedule us for the time you ACTUALLY want us to work. But most of all, thank you for everything you do for us even when we don't appreciate it in the moment.

Title: "Prep/Grill"
Pros: Free Meals, good management, easy to move upward or become kitchen manager. Become skilled in cutting, grilling and especially cleaning.
Cons: Employees often quit after a few weeks because labor is difficult. Gets easier as time goes on. 9.00 Hourly.
Advice to Management: Hire better people. Stop drilling the vision and mission into our heads rather than the skills and fundamentals we will need to use.

Title: "beurocratic dictation"
Pros: You'll be surrounded by primarily happy, caring people. Free food when you work a shift, plus "taste testing", aka snack on the job, is mandatory.
Cons: You will be driven to insanity by the monotony that is bestowed upon you daily. Management highly frowns upon those who have a life outside of chipotle, as if one should commit every ounce of passion to a job that ultimately starts you with a salary of around $16k. If bending over to appeal to arbitrary rules while continuously working at a ridiculous pace for little pay is your cup of tea, i highly recommend pursuing chipotle as your next career.
Advice to Management: Understand that people will work hard if you give them a reason to. For most, their reason is profit potential. Why work hard for a company that wants everything from you but gives nothing in return? The company indirectly insinuates that It's best to talk behind one another's back instead of confronting people, which is evident in the way that the majority of internal issues are addressed.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Free food, employee friendly managers
Cons: long closing shifts on weekends

Title: "Not for everyone"
Pros:
The food
The culture (if done right)
Legitimately changing peoples lives
Payed breaks
Somewhat flexible hours
Cons:
Unreasonable expectations are a common theme
Overworked by hours
Underpayed
The culture (when done wrong)
Advice to Management: Spend time training people right and making sure they're right for chipotle before just throwing them in the gauntlet and expecting them to survive.

Title: "Manager"
Pros: Fun working environment serving quality food.
Cons: Typical corporate squeeze, not the same company it was in the early stages.

Title: "Cray"
Pros: Learn recipes and about where all their food comes from. Empowers all crew members not only managers.
Cons: Management played a lot of favorites in the store. Must be available 24/7 and will be getting called in a lot.
Advice to Management: ListeN more to you're crew please. Don't take things personal when u ask for the crews opinion. It's all business how u teach us to take criticism as constructive, you should do the same.

Title: "Nice job"
Pros: Well, if you want work hard and belong to a nice team this is your place.
Cons: You should be multitask in many ways, and the work is hard.
Advice to Management: You must recognize the great people who works every single day for build a great brand of food.

Title: "Has been great, going downhill"
Pros: The work environment at Chipotle can be AWESOME, as long as your managers are.
Cons: Everyone good is jumping ship because the work environment is getting more stressful and irritating than it used to be.
Advice to Management: Stop being so stuck up. Your top performers will leave.

Title: "Decent gig for supplementary income"
Pros: Flexible schedule, good opportunities to move up into management positions.
Cons: Training was sparse and inadequate
Advice to Management: Don't blame the employees for not performing to your standards when you hardly give them any training.

Title: "Love It"
