Pros: I love working at Chipotle and recomend working here to anyone who thinks that they are upbeat, positive and ready to have fun while at the same time working really hard. At Chipotle there is never a dull moment or any down time, so know that everyday you come in you need to be on your A game and ready to roll (in my case quite literally).
Cons: My only qualm is that I have braids and my employee hat does not fit on my head. It often falls off or gives me a headache from trying to keep it on. The only thong I ask for is a Chipotle bandanna for those of us who don't fit the hats.
Advice to Management: A Chipotle employee bandanna would be very benificial for those of us whos hair is braided, or in locks. The hat doesn't fit on my head and gives me quite a headache, or it just falls off.

Title: "Love this place!"
Pros: Amazing food with integrity, wonderful customer service.
Cons: The music is weird and I wish they'd play something more known.
Advice to Management: Change the music!

Title: "Okay for students/temporary employment"
Pros:
The free food as a poor college student, and learning how to make the guacamole. Room for growth if you want to sell your soul to the company.
Steady work schedule and flexible with my school schedule.
Cons:
Overworked the restaurant staff big time and took advantage of undocumented folks that need a job (welcome to the restaurant industry I guess). There were multiple cases of managers getting fired in the city I worked in, for making their crew members continue working off the clock so they could stay within budget; I would blame this on the pressure from the big guys at corporate.

They promote "food with integrity" but ironically treat their hardworking crew in such a disposable way.

Also they try to get all the crew to be interested in becoming an assistant manager and grow in Chipotle. My previous manager tried to convince me to quit school (lol) and pursue this because I had potential. Then I found out later that the GMs get a bonus every time they promote someone.
Advice to Management: Value your restaurant crew and restauranteur, more.

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: A great place to work. You can take pride in the work you do and the food that you serve. Able to develop the people around you to be successful leaders and be rewarded for doing it. Awesome benefits.
Cons: work/life balance could be better.

Title: "Great at first"
Pros: The people you work with are amazing!
Cons: Corporate really tries to push "Restauranteur", giving you a script with answers you need to know to certain questions. However, they don't want you to sound "scripted"??

Title: "DO NOT WORK HERE!"
Pros: Great pay starting out, coworkers are most times nice, you get a lot of hours, nothing else.
Cons: I do not recommend, you work way over your scheduled hours, only a 30 minute break, management sucks, high turnover rate
Advice to Management: Become more organized, and stop firing people just because they do not want to become a manager

Title: "Almost Excellent"
Pros: Good company values, faced paced, good working environment
Cons: Depending on management or employee's; work environment could be stressful at times
Advice to Management: Maintain a consistent positive and friendly environment to alleviate stress that may appear in the work place.

Title: "Restaurateur"
Pros: Tuition reimbursement, health coverage for salaried managers and stock options.
Cons: Absolutely no work/life balance and double standards for leadership versus operations personnel such as restaurant managers.

Title: "It's a typical fast food job"
Pros:
Free food
The first 2 Chipotle's I worked at they held up high standards aligning with their core values. I was trained to be a fast and friendly worker. When I transferred to other locations, they management held little to no standards however.
Cons: Almost impossible to take time off, management was unprofessional and caused drama.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: Great food there it's free
Cons: They work you a lot but it's worth it
Advice to Management: Great job at everything keep it friendly at all times

Title: "Stressful and memorable"
Pros: Work with some really great people, become very close with coworkers. Meet new people every day. Loved my customers. Lots of hours. Free meal if you work a full shift. You get tips, but be careful who splits them!
Cons:
-You smell terrible afterwards.
-Extreme favoritism. Favorites get all the time off they wish for and you have to work three double shifts in a row just to get a couple days off during the week that you requested months prior.
-Hard because they make it become your life. I asked to work 20hrs a week because I was doing school full time but never worked below 35hrs a week.
-Also, the free meal you get is great until you realize how much salt is in everything and that you have gained 35lbs over a few months without even noticing. Haha, that's on me though.
Advice to Management: Acknowledge hard work.

Title: "Not for everybody"
Pros:
Higher pay than most fast food places
Free chipotle during your lunch
Christmas Party
Cons:
Shifts
Hours
Upper Management
They treat you like you are in a school
Advice to Management: Stop with the whole restaurateur idea. It's annoying and a lot of people including managers get fired over this.

Title: "First job ever"
Pros: I have quit the skills in kitchen attire and can easily handle multi task items if requested
Cons: I don't do well under pressure and I can be a little to fast for certain objectives
Advice to Management: I am easy to get along with and I get around quit fast for my age.

Title: "So far so good"
Pros: Everyone is great that works there. The food is great as well. The working environment is also good.
Cons: Lack of pay for all the work that you do. Working at Chipotle requires a lot of work and sometimes patience.

Title: "Horrible mgmt"
Pros: Good schedule. Good co-workers. Nice music to listen to while opening and closing. Free employee meals.
Cons: Worst upper mgmt i have ever came across. Just rude and condescending. Very disappointing.
Advice to Management: Treat your employees as they are equal to you, not below you and put them down constantly.

Title: "Great experience but not enough paid"
Pros: Promotion if you show the right attitude and knowledge. Great work environment. Benefits after 6 month of work. Review on performance so you can get a raise.
Cons: Short time to do tasks . Bad pay . Constant stress and critique. Bad management . Lack of communication between crew and managment.
Advice to Management: Give opportunities to right people. Don't have preferences when giving promotions. More attitude and knowledge of managment.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
*great job for first time workers
*food with integrity: meaning that our food is GMO free and (almost) all natural
*free lunch and paid break
*employee discounts
*management starts from the bottom.. This company, as far as I'm aware, don't hire from outside the company
*easy to move up
*medical benefits are included
*everyone's a team, therefor coworkers are most likely the most helpful and encouraging people.you'll meet
*flexible hours for college students
Cons:
*too much is expected in such a short amount of time
*everything MUST be according to employee's training manual
*customers get too picky and greedy with food
Advice to Management:
*Be more understanding that some employees have school, whether it be high school or college, and cannot always work the days you need them to work
*employees will most likely fall behind if their not encourage to do their best, so make sure to give them a pat on the back or tell them "good job". TRUST ME, it'll motivate them to do their best
*help employees understand their mistakes without screaming or give unnecessary criticism
*encourage employees to help one another and do their best, NOT compete among each other

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Free food on shifts, breaks during work, Great Culture that asks for your input
Cons: As in any other food industry, the work is hectic when it comes to serving customers and with food prep.
Advice to Management: Thanks for everything. Always having high standards.

Title: "Good company, bad management."
Pros: Excellent company to work for. The beliefs they hold and their views are absolutely amazing. Good pay for the job.
Cons: Be careful who you put into management. Some people got rushed into it and screwed up an entire restaurant.
Advice to Management: Make sure you are ready to actually be a manager before you commit!

Title: "Don't"
Pros: Fair enough salary, nice coworkers
Cons: Long hard work, not good for my back
Advice to Management: Be more lenient, believe workers with disabilities

Title: "The Worst Place to work if you dont love Culinary"
Pros: Free Lunch , Understanding Managers when it comes to taking time off
Cons: Disorganization , Too much Commotion , Gossip, High School Drama All over again , You are not paid enough for all the work you complete in that store , Managers expect you to conform to the job in a week .
Advice to Management: Try dedicating more time to building up good employees as oppose to hiring and firing employees so rapidly

Title: "Chipotle line/ cashier"
Pros: You get a free meal each shift and 50% off one meal a day even if you don't work, everyone you work with is really cool and chill, pretty easy job, decent pay ($8/hr when minimum wage was $7.25/hr I believe)
Cons: The manager that did scheduling at my location wasn't the greatest so you usually didn't get off on time
Advice to Management: Work on scheduling but otherwise management was always really cool and easy to get along with

Title: "chipotle review"
Pros: good hours, the crew and managers are nice
Cons: overworked, it was always super busy and a little stressful

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Free food, got to deal with people.
Cons: Very few acknowledgements. You will feel under appreciated.
Advice to Management: Take care of your employees. Chipotle is not life.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Good work environment, amenable boss
Cons: It was a pretty mediocre job, and I would often get kept past my shift

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Lots of opportunity for moving up in management so long as you are dependable and work hard. Good company culture.
Cons: You will work harder here than any other fast food chain or even a normal restaurant. Unless you are looking at getting into management, the pay isn't good enough for the work.
Advice to Management: Increase pay for team members.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros:
Free food
You hit 40 hours usually every week
Fast promotion
Cons:
Shave hours
Overworked at only $12 an hour
GM favors people
Lied to and threatened by upper management
Advice to Management: Treat people how you wish to be treated

Title: "An absolute nightmare."
Pros: Free employee meal / discount
Cons:
Literally almost everything.
Most of my co-workers were so rude and nasty and ungrateful. management was a joke. They treated me like dirt because I was asked to ALWAYS clean the dining room no matter what my assigned position was, all I ever did was clean after everyone, nothing else.. It was fine at first, because they hired me to be a cashier and I understand that cleaning was part of my job. but then they started scheduling me for that and nothing else, while the managers sat in the office all of the time. I always did my job but barely got a thank you from anyone and whenever I would make the tiniest mistakes they got very mad and standoffish instead of helping me learn from them in a respectful and understanding manner. They expected me to know about everything after two weeks of working and would get annoyed and act arrogant towards me when I tried to ask questions. After two and a half months, they fired me for being a "low performer." Ungrateful co-workers, disrespectful and touchy, I mean what kind of workplace is this? Have some decency and stop putting nobodies who don't know what the heck they are doing in management positions... Never have I ever worked in such a stressful, disrespectful inconsiderate Work environment. Also, I've had multiple times where I went 9 hours without eating lunch.... Then they call me selfish for asking when my break is? I never left on time... always leaving at 11 or midnight when I was only scheduled at 10, etc.... Come on.... what a JOKE.
Advice to Management: Stop being so arrogant for God's sake, and push people to be better with respect and understanding, not all this nonsense about being a top performer. A true reflection of how the employee treats the customers is how the management treats its employees. Maybe take this into consideration. and stop making ANYONE become manager. Some of these people have absolutely no idea what they are doing.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Good people to work with, fast paced environment. High chance of upward mobility if you stick with the company. Good food on breaks and half off eating there otherwise.
Cons: A lot of work for similar easier jobs but I guess it makes the time go by faster.

Title: "Good"
Pros: The coworkers are awesome, free and delicious food. Extra tips at the end of the night and company events.
Cons: too much work for not enough pay. Disorganized. Not everyone was fully motivated to excel.Sometimes hard work went unrecognized.
Advice to Management: Be more critical on who you hire because then the whole restaurant suffers.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Everyone is very friendly. Working is always fun. You can easily get promoted and be on your way to make a big career out of a simple part-time job.
Cons: Sometime the pay may be too little for the amount of work. You might not leave when your shift is over, and there are many little breaks.
Advice to Management: Try to work better with students, especially high school students, who don't have almost any control over what their schedules are.

Title: "chipotle"
Pros: free food great work enviroment
Cons: don't get paid enough for the work you put in
Advice to Management: pay raises

Title: "Like the food... The job was 'alright'"
Pros: Free food, discount when not working, good hours
Cons: Free food, high turnover, inexperienced management.
Advice to Management: N/A

Title: "Chipoltle is an amazing restaurant to work for!"
Pros: Pros are Great pay, good hours, work around your schedule, very helpful, and plenty of opportunities to move up in the company
Cons: Some cons are they may not always be consistent with hours, may not always schedule enough people causing the store to run slow but this doesn't happen often
Advice to Management: Some advise to the management would be to make sure to over look the schedule before posting it

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great benefits, high wage, tuition reimbursement
Cons: Not too many downsides, just hours sometimes

Title: "Terrible atmosphere STRESSFUL"
Pros: Free food break, good benefits,
Cons: Terrible management too much expected too soon out of one person gets out of hands with too many customers not worth the 9 dollars they pay you
Advice to Management: Need more experienced and patient management don't expect somebody to be a all star in less than a month

Title: "Awesome"
Pros: Best people I have ever worked with. Fun and very great enviroment to work in. Managers are supportive and help you out
Cons: There are not really many cons about chipotle. One thing I dont like is that sometimes you have to close the store and then open the next day which sucks.
Advice to Management: Keep creating encouraging circumstances. From what i hear a lot of the crew doesnt feel the support needed in the restaurant. Have the crew care about their job and not just have them clock in and clock out

Title: "Awesome"
Pros: Benefits, opportunity to advance. Training is thorough and you truly get good at your job. Your set up for success.,
Cons: Can't think of any. It's s great company to work for. There are a ton of opportunities outside of the restaurant that chipotle offers.

Title: "Marketing Strategist"
Pros: You have an opportunity to travel and be a part of fun events. Interacting with all levels of employees. Great perks, such as a Macbook, food stipend, free swag, monthly employee perks, etc. Flexible schedule, paid holidays and good benefits.
Cons: They say feedback is so important, but it seemed more like gossip. Lots of talking behind backs. My manager didn't share feedback with me in a timely manner. If you didn't eat healthy, organic, shop at Farmer's Markets, go to a fancy gym 6 times a week or shop at Lululemon, you were frowned upon. Kind of like a mean girls cult. I had a lot of mixed signals on how I should be spending my time since it is unsupervised, out in the field work. Expected to work on weekends and plan several special events. There is an advantage and disadvantage to the flexible schedule.
Advice to Management: Practice what you preach. Share feedback, be supportive, have an open-mind and don't be judgmental.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: helps with people skills and also create a relaible worker out of most employees
Cons: put in very stressful situations
Advice to Management: Become more connected

Title: "Eh.."
Pros: Always something to do and the environment is very upbeat. The hiring process is very interesting, three interviews (2 with a manager and the last one with the whole team).
Cons: Do not work here if you are not good with stress. I think the management is poor and could use some (probably a lot) work.

Title: "crew member"
Pros: free food every day, get to have more experience with cash handling and customer service, etc. you also get better at your communication and networking skills (?)
Cons: it is a lot of work and sometimes they'll give you the morning shifts if necessary. you are going to do a lot of things that you'd normally see your mom doing
Advice to Management: I have nothing to say in this part but I am required to meet a 20 word minimum requirement so I'll just throw random words into this review: Potato, chair, statistics.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Worked for a year, best parts were the free meal during lunch. Was cross trained for different positions once I mastered the cash position.
Cons: Closing cleaning is difficult, but can be eventually mastered so don't give up hope! Until then, I have had coworkers stay till midnight cleaning, but that is rare.
Advice to Management: Let people train for manager, especially if the rest of the kitchen thinks they are fit for it.

Title: "I lead and inspire a team of top performers who are empowered to achieve high standards"
Pros: Great leadership and one on one experience creating a thriving competitive vigorous people culture. Opportunity to take with you and apply their vision beyond the company.
Cons: A lot of off the clock hours unpaid. As a GM there is so much going on not just with the business but creating a special people culture. You have to be committed. Unfortunately you are hourly and can not go over 50 hours weekly. In reality you sacrifice days off and most work days are 11-14 hr days. The amount of hours worked to create your culture and still meet deadlines is ridiculous and draining.
Advice to Management: GMs need to be salary bottom line. You can not expect us to work towards Restauranteur working a measly 9.5 hrs a day in a busy restaurant working lunch and dinner peak times. Every GM sacrifices days off and when we go over our 50 hrs a week for being committed we get forwarded an email from our ETD, TD frowning upon this bad business model. As a result, this puts pressure on our area managers to monitor our hours and we end up feeling pressure to work off the clock to bring our vision to life. I know for a fact I'm speaking for every single GM and those who have the elite title RT.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros:
-Free Food when you work
-50% off
Cons:
-Very hard work
-Stand on feet the whole shift

Title: "Hard Work"
Pros: Long hours equals bigger paycheck
Cons: Barely get a lunch break
Advice to Management: Chipotle is a very nice place to work for. If u are not a hard worker or fast paced...u will not succeed

Title: "The Worst of The Best"
Pros: The co-workers can be great at times.
Cons: Not all team members help out and do what they are supposed to. Its a crazy busy environment.
Advice to Management: Listen to your employees. You never know if the person you kept over someone else is stealing from your company by giving out discounted food.

Title: "Ok"
Pros: Ability to get more hours than scheduled
Cons: Can get very busy and hectic

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Paid employee meals, high-energy environment, increased advancement opportunities for myself and my peers. I was introduced to various aspects of the food industry.
Cons: inexperienced management team at various instances. Some junior employees may not have been trained adequately to perform their duties. But i enjoyed my tenure at the franchise.
Advice to Management: My advice to management is to continue on their current path of operation. I enjoyed my experience and would recommend working on training seminars to increase awareness of proper operation procedures.

Title: "Restaurateur"
Pros: Good People, Good Food, Steve Ells, Always Busy, Innovative
Cons: No Life, hard to find quality employees, no real mentoring system
Advice to Management: Help the restauranteurs by making sure their mentor has the ability to coach and mentor

Title: "Kitchen manager"
Pros: Quick to move up in the company. Great benefits. Great team to work with.
Cons: Have to really be a person to carry all 13 characteristics.
Advice to Management: Be more strict with crew and standards to ensure proper training and hiring process.

Title: "Restaurant Team Member Crew"
Pros: Free meal at each shift, fast-paced
Cons: Management was poor, didn't directly train

Title: "Chipotle benefits the young"
Pros: Food with integrity. The company cares about what they're serving and who they're serving it to. Promote their managers from within, as well as give benefits the the college students that work there.
Cons: Management and crew are sometimes underpaid and undervalued. New employees are not trained as they should be. Continuous and unnecessary changes in business practice.
Advice to Management: Value your employees, encourage and empower them. Consistently let them know that they are appreciated and mean a lot to them and the company. Do a better job communicating with other forms of management.

Title: "Okay Job"
Pros:
Free Lunch
High Pay
Cool Coworker
Great Organization
Cons:
Constantly Busy
Always on your Feet
Biweekly Pay

Title: "Part-Time Worker"
Pros: Food discounts, good team, customer service learning skills.
Cons: Irregular management, employee turnover, short training period, can be physically tiring. Managers were inconsistent.
Advice to Management: Have owners give stricter plans to managers and teach employees more.

Title: "Chipotle Culture"
Pros: This is a great place to get promoted from within the company. Your opinion is given value, and training is very focused and intentional. There's a really strong emphasis on building a team that really functions as a smooth unit, and development is prioritized. When the team culture is given proper weight, it's a really fun, encouraging place to work. You're often given time to sit down with the managers and give your opinion, and they'll give you specific goals and help you to achieve them, which is unusual and appreciated.
Cons: The work is really, really demanding. It's a good place to work, but expect to put in more time, effort, and mental/emotional commitment than at any other food service job you've ever worked. This is not necessarily a con, but it's one of the biggest reasons people leave Chipotle - they weren't expecting the workload/commitment level. The tasks themselves aren't difficult, but the emphasis on personal development can be exhausting.
Advice to Management: The team culture idea is great in theory, but in practice is often lacking. Connect more to your people, and practice differentiated leadership.

Title: "Part Time Worker"
Pros: The food, the team and co-workers, customer service skills.
Cons: Inconsistent Managers, physically demanding, short training time, high turnover.
Advice to Management: Keep managers consistent with each-other and give employees more training. Don't over hire and fire employees to save money.

Title: "Decent."
Pros: THE FOOD. I was able to eat there everyday I worked, I got a good discount and was there when they got the chips and guacamole deal.
Cons: The people :( I was basically fired because I didn't want to have a relationship with the other employees that worked there
Advice to Management: Don't let the employees run the business. Or at least for managers inside of individual chipotles, don't let the employees that have worked there the longest make all the newbies feel like they don't belong.

Title: "great"
Pros:
hours are flexible
scheduling is good
easy promotion
 great people to work with
alot of fun
 you get alot of hours
Cons:
tiring
 alot of work to do,
 besides that i believe every single thing was absolutley good about chipotle mexican grill
Advice to Management: managment is great vale your employees and work with them to get them to the next level they are all capable of good things coming

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Passionate executive leadership. High marks from independent watchdogs on food quality and integrity. Great opportunities for quick advancement.
Cons: Rapid growth leads to inconsistencies of execution on leadership's direction.

Title: "Good Place to Learn"
Pros: If you survive your probation period this can be a great opportunity for you to gain experience that will benefit you in any industry. The job is labor intensive and requires a lot of teamwork. If you cannot learn fast enough or fail to meet standards you will be cut as easily as that. Perks are the free meals and 50 percent discount. Managers are usually homegrown as in promoted from starting positions. Lots of opportunity for growth and raises.
Cons: Low retention rate. If you are one of two people hired, one of you will probably be let go. It can be stressful as it requires a lot from employees to meet customer volume needs. If you do not complete your tasks you will likely be fired if you don't clock out on time. Managers can constantly be changing so it is not a very steady workplace.
Advice to Management: Stop cutting prep times and forcing employees to lower standards. Consistency across different stores in required for the company to succeed. Install regional trainers at least for initial training so that every store has some sort of unity. Increase raises, as such small incremental raises offer little to no incentive for employees to work especially hard.

Title: "crew"
Pros: awesome crew and managers work here
Cons: no cons for me. awesome job

Title: "Great Culture"
Pros: Fun, fast paced, career oriented
Cons: Stress Level can be a bit high. But this should be expected especially if managing the business.

Title: "Cashier/Crew Member"
Pros: I loved my boss, working as a team, the shifts/hours were flexible, and I loved the locals who I now call my friends!
Cons: It got very overloaded during Red Sox games, and I did not like how higher management treated the staff when they would come for a "visit"

Title: "Grill Chef"
Pros: Fast pace environment, Good work procedure, good sanitation
Cons: sometimes not properly staffed. not bad if you like to work hard
Advice to Management: Being fair with all employees

Title: "How it really is"
Pros: You get experience from this job. It is fairly easy to become a manager. You just need to show that you want it.
Cons: It gets busy, I constantly work 9 hour shifts so it feels like I am there for ever. Slowly getting tired of it
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work, I know it is not easy to be a manager at Chipotle, especially by trying to achieve the vision

Title: "Fun,Fast Paced Kitchen"
Pros: Great opportunity to learn and become a Kitchen Manager. Plus,if you work full-time youre given a free meal for lunch on them.
Cons: If you have a seemingly unappreciative manager at your location,,you will be pushed to the limit.
Advice to Management: Develop,Develop,Develop.Many great potential future General Managers are there cooking now,JUST DEVELOP THEM.

Title: "sales"
Pros: Great Company to work for!
Cons: Lunchtime rush can be crazy!

Title: "Easy job, bad managers"
Pros: The job was easy and fun, I loved working with some of the other employees.
Cons: Long work, no breaks. Not enough hours a week. They scheduled me to work 3 hours a few times in a whole week. I asked was there a reason? They said "no there isn't, I am not mad or anything, just bear with me. We are cutting everybody's hours. Yet some people still had 40
Advice to Management: Stop showing favoritism!

Title: "I Love My Job"
Pros:
-50% off meals if you don't work and the free meal after you work.
- Great job experience because its such a fast paced environment, makes you quick on your feet
-the people and management is really great
- The ability to grow within the company
Cons:
-the fast paced environment gets overwhelming at times
-customers aren't the nicest but that's at any job.
Advice to Management: Communication is key, talking to crew members is essential to making a REAL team. Everyone must be on the same page

Title: "No support from ARL."
Pros: Great food and passionate people. Fun environment, don't have to worry about metrics because the company is currently in a growth stage. Sales will come in if you are choosing the right people.
Cons: As soon as you start to produce better results than the person above you. That will mean a termination.

Title: "Chipotle for life"
Pros: Chipotle has a fun atmosphere, teached you to work with fresh ingredients and recipes, You spend a lot of time prepping and learning to increase your cooking skills, free food on days you work and 50% on days off, flexible scheduling, managers treat employees with respect
Cons: Heavy lifting is a frequent part of the job, it is standing only for the entire shift with the exception of half hour break, difficult to be promoted because of the need to be validated by the crew, the general manager, and the district area manager, high turnover rate for employees not dedicated to hard work
Advice to Management: Desperately in need of more regional managers who can help promote kmit's and fix empowerment among the crew. Don't be afraid to let go of low performers, tons of people want the opportunity to work with chipotle and will put forth the effort if you'll drop the people who don't cut it.

Title: "Great Place to Work"
Pros: Managers are great and understanding. A fun environment that is extremely fast passed. Also, this job really care about your development. If you are doing something right, they will let you know with no problem, and if you are doing something wrong they take the time to work with you to get better.
Cons: The only negative aspect of this job (that is sometimes not even all that negative) is scheduling. There is often one person making the schedule, and a place that has many college students, the schedule can be a bit inconvenient at times.
Advice to Management: The management is phenomenal. Very approachable, friendly and personable. At chipotle, we have 13 characteristics that many people must posses and each manger truly demonstrates the qualities

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Decent pay for a temporary part time food industry job
Cons:
Poor management
Apprentice continued to mess up my hours

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Friendly Staff, fast paced, promotion always available
Cons: The work load can get extremely intense, new people always coming as more people on staff are either being fired or walking out. Management could be better.
Advice to Management:
Try to schedule enough people for the right shift
Try to give a routine and list of things to do so nothing is leftover for the next shift workers to have to make up for

Title: "Such a caring workplace"
Pros:
- Chipotle's vision is to change the way people think about fast food and they really do that by starting with their employees.
- They work around your schedule
- They believe that if you treat your employees with love and respect then they will treat you the same way back.
- You are constantly learning something new and always being challenged
- You are in control of your growth within the company and the management team is their to help you grow.
Cons: - Burns; typical working with anything hot in a fast-paced work place

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Fun crew and free food!
Cons: Working on the line gets a bit monotonous. "What type of rice, what type of beans, why type of meat?
Advice to Management: Just don't ever change the quality of the product

Title: "You're better off just buying your own burrito."
Pros:
Free meal every shift, half-off food when you're not working.
Your friends will definitely come visit you at work.
Even after working here, I still feel okay eating the food. Nothing too gross happening behind the scenes.
If you are really good and get along with management, you can actually move up pretty quickly. People get promoted out of the store all the time.
Cons: I'd never worked in food service before, and it was definitely harder than expected. They did a pretty terrible job in my initial training -- I was trained during lunch, so mostly all I did was put tortillas on the press. After training, all my shifts were on closing, which is fine but I didn't know how to do anything and they got irritated when I need help. I liked that they had us set goals for ourselves every two weeks, but there was never anyone else working the line to actually teach me new things. Also, I never really learned when to "call" items for the line, because business on closing shifts was so inconsistent. Sadly, I worked really hard at this job, but ultimately quit because the managers were so unhelpful.
Advice to Management: Make sure your management has compassion for new hires. Nobody wants to be bad at their job -- help trainees get better!

Title: "Not bad"
Pros: hard working people helping each other achieve like minded goals
Cons: Feel like there is always a competition going on
Advice to Management: Stop playing favorites

Title: "Grill"
Pros: The people they hire are great, I have made many good friends there.
Cons: Over work for grill position.
Advice to Management: Split resposibility more or increase pay for certain positions.

Title: "Great Job bad pay"
Pros: Working here is like being with family. We all care about each other and work well together. Everyone tackling whatever needs to be done.
Cons: The pay structure is horrible and raises don't get handed out very often. The work is extremely demanding. Schedules that are posted are always changed. Some times they are changed 2-4 times a week. And, of course, the "favorites" end up getting the benefits of schedule changes.
Advice to Management: Make the schedule and keep it. No one likes to find out the day after their day off that their schedule changed. And news flash, someone that has open availability should not have to work every weekend to get their hours.

Title: "The hours are weird, sometimes unreasonable"
Pros: Its a job better than none at all. Just to get me back in the working world.
Cons: Team work is partial. Sometimes the older worker dont communicate wait well.
Advice to Management: I think as long as we keep it respectful, and polite things with lower employees will be pleasurable

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: food and you move up faster depending on how much you know.
Cons: You have to stay till 12 am and clean and restock the front of the house bathrooms and outside
Advice to Management: you guys need to hire night people to clean. And good job of being able to help

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: fun, fast-paced, everyone does their part, responsibly raised food
Cons: always busy, nothing else i can think of

Title: "Cash"
Pros: Good people good food great
Cons: Not much a lot busy busy busy

Title: "Souds better than it is"
Pros: allways work, never short on hours
Cons: brain washing, most of all a big lie
Advice to Management: not that good as it sound

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Great employee benefits , and discounts. The company really cares about its people - the company is great , as far as individual management , it will differ everywhere . Overall great work experience. Great People, Great environment. Chipotles high standards tends to make you a better person .
Cons: Crazy busy, not a good job if you cant time manage and hussle, timing is everything with this job - or atleast my store it was . Getting things done good and getting them done fast.

Title: "Great job if Bilingual!"
Pros: Fast passed job it you like to get in and out. Always something to do.
Cons: Expected to do a lot of things even if you are a new hire. Training is only Three days. Training is done very fast and you are still expected to keep up even if you have a manager how you can't always understand because there first language is Spanish.
Advice to Management: Train at a slower pace for longer and speak english at work. For it is very rude to speak Spanish around others who don't know it!

Title: "Solid Job for the Summer"
Pros: Great company culture that made me enjoy work, many opportunities to be promoted and eventually become a manager
Cons: Poor management made this job unbearable at times. They brought drama to the workplace that should not be there. Promotions were questionable.
Advice to Management: Management with too young and brought drama to the workplace. All of the conflicts in the workplace were a result poor management.

Title: "chipotle"
Pros: good pay and good team
Cons: hard to keep good works or a full staff

Title: "Don't Care About Employees"
Pros:
-free employee meals and employee discounts
-uniform is casual
-coworkers are cool
Cons:
-there are no scheduled breaks. Your manager tells you when to take your break and it could be 30 min after you start working or 5 hours after you start working.
-management communication is poor. You tell one manager one thing and don't expect any of the others to know, even if it's important information
-disregard for personal schedule. Have to remind management every week that they've scheduled over prior commitments
Advice to Management:
-talk to each other!!!
-Chipotle puts on a huge show about acting like they care about their employees. "paid breaks" and all that. But in the store, they only do what's mandatory without real concern for employees. Hence the sporadic breaks and careless scheduling.

Title: "KM"
Pros: Moved up fast. There is so much opportunity to grow. Got promoted in 6 mo
Cons:
Soooooo much work
Wish people were more open minded

Title: "Good experience."
Pros: Friendly team, motivated, good pay, dedicated, compassionate, team driven. There was always something to smile about, there was always someone to help pick up the slack. Sort of family oriented, my team all stuck together.
Cons: Unorganized, some of the employees were rude and it appeared the management lacked authority or were too slack on what they allowed their employees to do. There were not enough people to pick up the slack when there was any that needed tending to.
Advice to Management: Organize what you expect from your employees, find a happy medium and refrain from the "mom said no, ask dad" situation that always appeared. Organize your schedule and organize your trainers. Training was always cut back and the new employees were thrown into a task they didn't understand when there was no time to understand. That led to customer complaints and the new employees being scolded for not doing what they don't know how to do.

Title: "You get what you give"
Pros:
- Food is made with integrity
- Everything is fresh
- Clean environment
- Unlimited free food when on breaks
- 50% off everything when not working
Cons: Alot of work is required out of you for the low pay. Super fast paced and can get stressful. Lots of learning by error.

Title: "ok"
Pros:
- a lot of hours
- free chipotle
Cons:
- can get really stressful
-take a while to get a raise

Title: "Wonderful Place to work!"
Pros: Great schedule flexibility, management is caring and helpful, and the pay is good.
Cons: Lots of hard work, long hours.

Title: "Don't work here!"
Pros: Free meal with every shift and 50% off when not working.
Cons: Poor management, sometimes don't get paid on time, schedules don't go up in a timely manner, stressful environment.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros:
-pay more than your average fast food chain
-fun workplace
Cons:
-hours vary depending on your performance
-harder than any fast food chain

Title: "Work hard no play"
Pros: Get to work with a lot of good people
Cons: Company is growing to fast a lot of inexperienced management

Title: "Great Place"
Pros: Very hands on and work in a team environment!
Cons: I had a great experience here!

Title: "Not a fun work environment"
Pros:
You start off making more than minimum wage.
There is a lot of opportunities for advancement.
You can make a career out of it if you choose.
It doesn't take long to get a raise or promotion.
Cons:
My Managers were obsessed with having the perfect store so they were extremely overbearing at times.
The work environment was more stressful than it needed to be. The work was already fast paced and stressful enough. Having managers curse at he entire staff is not helpful.
They don't want to let you quit, because it makes the store look bad.
Advice to Management: Talk to employees about how managers act behind the scenes. Some managers take short cuts to get their perfect store, like saying they fired people who actually quit.

Title: "Fun"
Pros: Face paced and upbeat crew family. Always willing to help you learn.
Cons: Wis I was able to transfer over okay, but it didn't work out.
Advice to Management: Overall very good manager.

Title: "Good times with good people. Many people were racist and rude towards you"
Pros: You got free food, reimbursement on classes, many don't know this but sign up for perkspot it gives you discounts on everything you can imagine, made friends I'll have forever
Cons: It's too busy, they expect too much from the crew when the managers are in the office having fun, the Hispanics can be very rude towards the white and black people, if you're not in a close group with the managers, it is very unlikely to get promoted
Advice to Management: Be nicer. Don't discriminate. Actually try to teach your workers things instead of forcing them a day before the area manager comes in to visit.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Friendly, hardworking, and down to earth.
Cons: Extremely busy at chipotle in mentor.

Title: "Working as a Top Performer"
Pros: It gives you great addition to the cooking field. I learned the proper way to slice organic fruits and vegetables, meats and such. I enjoyed the variety of customers that I've encountered also.
Cons: Working with individuals who will do what ever it takes to get on top, even screw you over. Snakes.
Advice to Management: Be careful who you hire verses who you fire.

Title: "LSM"
Pros: Great team environment overall within departments
Cons: Lots of turnover and travel
Advice to Management: none

Title: "Its okay"
Pros:
easy to move up to a certain point
Easy job
Lots of training
Cons:
80 hour work weeks are normal and encouraged
Management plays favorites
Advice to Management: don't promote your friends just because they are your friends. Don't forget to praise people for success instead of just pointing out failures. Don't use the phrase "everyone" if feedback doesn't apply to every one

Title: "Okay"
Pros:
30 minutes Breaks.
Unlimited free meals (as long as you're on duty)
Vibrant atmosphere.
High Energy.
Cons:
The work that you do can be a little too much at times.
High burn out.
New hires are not properly trained.
Management hires the wrong people.
Very little room for growth. Even climbing to management is not enough (little difference in pay).
Advice to Management: Be careful with who you hire. It can hinder the restaurant.

Title: "Definitely work, but not all bad"
Pros:
Free meal every shift + half off any other time (saves you money while also paying you)
Paid breaks
Most managers want to help cross-train and teach you new skills
Fun job because you get to see EVERY student (honestly...)
Great corporate culture and vision
Cons:
Shifts (especially opening or closing) can be seven+ hours
Most employees are great to work with, but some don't take it seriously (no call, no show)
Food service is what it is, y'all.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Free food, people culture, company vision, positive atmosphere, gmo free, organic, food with integrity
Cons: Management doesn't know what they're doing, long hours, poor home/work balance, pay rate, poor training, not set up for success
Advice to Management: Please send a restaurateur to your Louisiana stores. Make sure all of your employees are set up for success before blindly promoting them.

Title: "Good company... with the wrong people"
Pros: Company really cares about crew.
Cons: Crew doesn't care about crew.

Title: "New hire"
Employee Title: I Work He Line But Have Opportunities to Move Up Soon
Pros: The group I work with are amazing people who really care about you and motivating y to move up and feel confident,
Cons: It's very fast paced and intemendating.
Advice to Management: Please get to know your new hires more. I feel separated at times.

Title: "Ehh"
Pros:
Crew is like family
Decent pay for being able to be hired with no experience
Lean a lot about good customer service
Cons:
They shove their "vision" down your throat
Very picky with who they hire
Don't mention any other life goals, they want you with chipotle forever.
Customers treat you and treat you like crap

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Fun enviornment and easy to learn
Cons: More compensation should be required for the standards expected

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Teamwork-oriented environment. One person's success is everyone's success. You receive praise when you do something well or correctly, which motivates you to always do better. When you mess up, it is everyone's job to elevate you, not put you down, but to make you better. Pay is good for fast food. Company promotes within.
Cons: You smell like food, customers can be ridiculously rude. Each station can be strenuous on your body.

Title: "crew member"
Pros: Great people to work with, busy place to work, managers are mostly okay, working on the line is really easy
Cons: Gets really busy really quick, must be prepared and have everything you need in advance.
Advice to Management: Work a little harder to accommodate your employees schedules and availability.

Title: "it was a nice job i was a beast"
Pros: great benifits steady pay and hours
Cons: the manager kept me in one position and did not respect my asking for days off even if it was rare she treated some people well there was an unfair amount of favoritism i gave my two weeks and they still had nerve to tell me that even after leaving on good terms that they would not hire me back in the future because if i left once i would have probably left again
Advice to Management: treat your people right and they will actuallly want to come to work everyday advance peoples training and you too will advance

Title: "Good Employees & Opportunities / Unreasonable Expectations"
Pros: Almost all of my co-workers are intelligent, kind, caring, and have great work ethic. The workplace is team-oriented. Every single member of my restaurant began his or her career at the very bottom of the food-chain -- there is a realistic opportunity to advance rapidly if you are committed to Chipotle and your in-house supervisors are knowledgeable about the tasks and expectations they are setting for you. If you have any interest in managing an extraordinary franchise restaurant, consider taking an entry-level position at Chipotle.
Cons: Supervisors will run you ragged if they sense you are not wiling to commit all of your energy and effort to excelling as a Chipotle employee. I have been actively dissuaded from pursuing further education and volunteering for local organizations on my off-days. I'm capable of handling all front-of-house duties and I have found that by some coincidence we are understaffed every time I work. This means that we save on labor hours, but it also means that I'm severely overburdened with responsibilities -- however, the increased expectations are not met with increased pay.

Title: "Chipotle Area Manager"
Pros: Great benefits! Income potential is one of the best around in the market Great vision from CEO.l
Cons: Culture does not trickle down from CEO to restaurants. Perfection is expected at all times. Empowerment not real
Advice to Management: Ensure that your Team Directors understand what empowerment means. It doesn't match what CEO says. TD is saying it stops once you get to ATL or AM. Big disconnect!

Title: "Salaried Manager"
Pros: Great ideas and great vision, their food with integrity philosophy is the best thing the company has to offer.
Cons: From area managers to crew, it just seems that everyone is overworked. The restaurants are always understaffed by several people

Title: "Good company to work for"
Pros: They start you off above minimum wage, tips aren't great, about $3 per person per shift. Free food each time you work and a paid 30 minute lunch break. Now offering tuition reimbursement for students.
Cons: Slave shop. Non stop work hardly any down time.

Title: "Too much work for too little money - know what you're getting yourself into"
Pros:
Free food
Great environment, to a point
Great people
Easy to move up into management if willing to work for it
Cons:
Management forced to work off the clock
Higher ups (above GM) only value saving labor and not their employees
Low pay for the amount of work
Regularly called in for required but off the clock meetings
Workers Comp a joke, and can face severe consequences for trying to file a claim
Cult-like mentality
Advice to Management: If a business cannot afford to pay their employees (including restaurant managers KMs-GMs) a living wage that actually pays their expenses and is fitting to the amount of backbreaking work that they're required to, then that business is failing.

Title: "Love it"
Pros: There is a Family environment
Cons: There are no cons here
Advice to Management: None

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Good starting pay for new members
Cons:
Horrible crew team.
Not everyone has the same goals chipotle looks for.
Majority of crew I worked with always had an attitude. They would leave me on the line alone when several families would walk in
Advice to Management:
Interview stricter.
If an employee shows they are constantly slacking off they should be terminated.
Communicate better with your staff, especially if you want to become a restaurateur.

Title: "Chipotle Mexican Grill"
Pros: One of the pros for working at Chipotle is that you have the opportunity to go up in the company as fast as couple of years.
Cons: The shifts that the employees get are very long and limited compared to other restaurants.

Title: "Good people lousy management at different locations"
Pros: Coworkers are picked well. Hands on experience. Decent benefits but only if there for a year or if college major correct. Fair wage. Free food.
Cons: If not making chipotle your career many in management see you as expendable. Not flexible hours or consistent. Sort of cult mentality in the work environment. If major not in business marketing etc. Can't receive reimbursement for college loans. Not a living wage. Not a lot of communication between higher up and stores.

Title: "Great Job if you love food and people"
Pros: They have really great benefits including tuition reimbursement(after working for a year if crew). Met a lot of people that really get behind the company and what it stands for while working there, which makes it a really positive workplace environment.
Cons: The store I worked at had management issues because of an outside GM hire but from what I've heard this isn't a very common problem when they hire from within.
Advice to Management: Always hire from within the company. Even when an outside hire is qualified they're most likely not used to the high standards and empowerment necessary to lead a team of Chipotlians.

Title: "good place"
Pros: flexible hours, chance for advancement
Cons: dealing with all the rude customers

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
Great opportunity to learn fast food retail
Great Food
Health Benefits
Opportunity for advancement
Cons:
Low Pay
Lack of work life balance
Advice to Management: Offer employees more work life balance

Title: "maintain a clean & organized workplace, prepare salsas, shred cheese, dice tomatoes , and serve customers in line."
Pros:
50% off employee discount
Free meal for lunch when on the clock
Positive environment
Empowering company and team
Cons: There are not any cons that I can come up with, but how extremely busy the restaurant is EVERYDAY. But I don't consider it a con much. If you love people than it should be great.
Advice to Management: Develop those team leaders who are empowered to achieve high standards!

Title: "Company That Cares"
Pros: Invested in everything Chipotle stands for.
Cons: Stressful work environment and can be demanding hours.

Title: "My Review"
Pros: good food that i like to eat
Cons: long lines that take forever
Advice to Management: hire more people

Title: "Crew member (cross-trained)"
Pros: great people, clean efficient environment
Cons: limited work space, extremely fast paced, management wasn't smooth
Advice to Management: Managers need to get along and work together to be efficient, TRAIN YOUR CREW.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: As a manager for almost a year, I have a decent amount of paid vacation accumulated already.
Cons: Chipotle becomes life so you better be ready for that.

Title: "crew member"
Pros: Great company culture, caring managers and coworkers, free meals and paid lunches, flexible scheduling, if you had an issue you could easily access any of the supervisors in a professional manner. It felt like family when I started working.
Cons: You are expected the know the ins and outs of the restaurant and be on the move 24/7. Managers want too much from you for what you get paid. It gets exhausting after awhile and I was always tired. Customers can be super awesome and some can be really rude and self-entitled for no reason.
Advice to Management: You're doing everything right; just put a little less pressure on your crew.

Title: "Pretty Good"
Pros: Really good environment, free meals on breaks, crew feels like family, fast paced, get company, feel good selling good food
Cons:
First the scheduling needs improvement. If you request 3 days off you will most likely only work two days in the next week. Schedule is all over the place and not consistent.
Second they expect you to improve really fast but its hard to improve when you only work two days in the week for 4 hours
Sometimes it feels like the management doesn't really care about you, like they talk bad about you behind your back. Maybe if they sat down and got to know they're employees instead of playing favorites and shoving the others aside.
The main manager is a pain at this location, doesn't care about you and complains about everything and doesn't realize how hard the apprentice and gen. manager work.
Advice to Management:
Get to know your employees, act like you actually care that they are there working for you, schedule more consistently and try not to overstaff so your not trying to squeeze in other people to work one day.
teach your employees rather than telling them constantly what they're doing wrong. Get a better main manager who actually appreciates the employees and managers and apprentice and who doesn't play favorites on two people.otherwise this was a great summer job and the location was pretty good.

Title: "Fast-paced"
Pros: My crew were fun and interesting people to work with. A very fast-paced work environment that could be quite challenging during an under-staffed shift. The work is rewarding however and working grill in fun.
Cons: Understaffed shifts, high turnover rate, pay.

Title: "Great place to work"
Pros: It's a great environment to work in. Amazing crew members and some of the nicest managers. I've really enjoyed myself working here.
Cons: The pace can be pretty hectic at times. They really emphasize speed, so if you don't work well under those conditions, I wouldn't recommend working there.
Advice to Management: I really don't have anything to say. I've had a wonderful experience working there. The managers are super fun and easy going.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: easy going atmosphere and dress
Cons: very hard work, on feet all day
Advice to Management: be honest in terms of who can get promoted or not.

Title: "Not enough pay for work done."
Pros: Free meal and opportunity to rise. Fun environment and challenging.
Cons: It is fine if you only work in the front. If you work in the back than members should get paid much more.
Advice to Management: Distribute work for everyone evenly

Title: "Great Place to Start a Career"
Pros: Chipotle will promote the right top performers fast. Also, getting a free meal with each shift is a great perk.
Cons: If your store is really busy, it gets crazy fast. Also, some of the out-put expectations were not realistic.

Title: "Great place"

Cons: Dealing with customers can be difficult and the "customer is always right" policy that dominates the food service industry can really put you in a bad spot.

Title: "Crew/Kmit"

The years I was with the company I prescience many favoritism in all people a lot of romance going on in order for u to never up u have to be a kiss $&#% if u want to get promoted loop Chicago has the highest turnover and people don't live for the beliefs of the company they leave because the wrong directors in charge even if you call HR they don't do nothing about. In general if u apply u better grown if not u will be fire !!!! There is no Job security Managers from the outside are hire with the wrong perspective if U are a manager in chipotle u have to work as crew + run a great labor+ and develop in 10 hrs a day that can turn into 12-14 upper manager don't care about "people culture " that just care about their own good as long they continuo getting promote.
Bonus and salary are not promising u have to be a super man..... Most of the upper managers don't have the full knowledge of business !!!! Some doesn't even have HS diploma .....

Title: "It's ok"

Cons: They rush everything. The management isn't held to the same standards. You'll be told you're slow on daily basis

Title: "Good place to work"
Pros: Good place to work. Nice people. You get to interact with customers and do plenty of behind the scenes.
Cons: You have to like working in the food industry and so can't mind smelling like the food. Not too bad though.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: The way that the store sets you up for a successful career is great and it is a great way to keep the employees trying to advance in the store.
Cons: Since the 13 characteristics are very important to keep your job, people's real personalities tend to get confusing. With my experience it was difficult to find people who were actually friendly, happy, respectful, etc when not in front of a customer or supervisor.
Advice to Management: I would definitely advice management to be more careful of who they hire if you are looking for people with a considerable about of the 13 characteristics and if not to make sure that they are ACTUALLY willing to learn.

Title: "janitor"
Pros: nice facility treated fairly with respect

Title: "Chipotle is a great job if you enjoy hard labor for low wage."

Advice to Management: If you are the ones training your employees, do a proper job!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Title: "Was great...but..."

Title: "TERRIABLE"
Pros: Free Food and Flexible work schedule that's it!!!!!
Cons: well lets see I worked there close to a year and started on prep which most do or line. if you start on line your making free money because all you do is stand there and scoop food and flip pans for 8 hours, prep your constantly cleaning, cooking with grill for rush, cutting vegtables which really hurts your hand at the end of the day way more work than the 9 dollars an hour. I got moved to grill which is technically a higher position but of course chipotles cheap $$$ offers no compensation for the extra work of lift cooking and burning yourself and you will burn yourself because the one I was at is not osha certified and breaking your back lifting 60 pound rice pots over your chest...chipotle is so fake its comical they tell you $$$$ about being a top performer which means do everybodies job for them without using common sence and using chipotle methods..... You have to follow every rule to the T or youll get $$$$$ out and don't hope to get a rais cause that aint gonna happen. my coworkers were the only reason I stayed there so long. $$$$$$ chipotle and there greedy $$$ find out for yourself I gross and terriable this place is. I refuse to return there and will never buy food from them. Ps after a month youll start packing your own lunch cause everything you eat there taste the same from burrito to tacos to salad lol Yea putting a little bit of square cut lettuce at the bottom of a bowl with all the ingrediants that make up a burrito including sourcream and cheese doesn't make it a $$$$$$$ salad makes fat people feel better about themselves

Title: "working"

Cons: Being a cook is hard I didn't like it I got like 4 hours a week I really didn't enjoy it.

Title: "Cult mentality - Practice what you preach"

Cons: No quality of life. Cult mentality. Doesn't matter what you knew before or where you came from, learn their words and their way or find another job. Preach diversity and listening to their people but don't actually do it. Everyone starts at the bottom no matter what you know or where you come from.

Cons: There was a lot of favoritism from managers to employees. Certain managers will give you a hard time if they don't like you. And I'm not even going to lie, they overwork you.
Advice to Management: Get your heads out of your butts and up the pay because you have more than enough money to.

Title: "Great"

Title: "GREAT CULTURE"

CULTURE and environment
time goes by fast

NOT ENOUGH PAY
too much work since its always bussy

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Chipotle hires people with a certain 13 characteristics. If you don't match them, you rarely get hired! They are a fast paced working environment but ultimately really cares about their employees! Enjoyed working with my coworkers and loved seeing the same regular customers everyday.
Cons:
If you're working on a college campus, chances are you're dealing with college students. They're not going to be as flexible on your schedule as much as you'd like, and employee turnover rate is going to be extremely high if they hire the wrong people!
You will have your bad days but still must put on a face, as do any jobs in customer service!
Advice to Management: Management changes very often, you all should heavily consider who you promote to a higher up position! Those have worked first as a crew member may become biased to certain coworkers once they get promoted!

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Great people, easy to move up and if you work very hard you will be given more responsibilities.

Advice to Management: I wish there were more opportunities to get promotions, even if they're tiny. It would feel good to advance by baby steps.

Title: "Crew"

Title: "Experience at Chipotle"
Pros: I absolutely love working with a GM who is down to earth and truly cares about her employees and the restaurant. I am excited to go to work and am eager to learn new things on a regular basis because I know I have a team that will support me and help me grow.
Cons: You have your occasional rude customer, but you learn to work with them.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Free fooood free food free food free food. Workable schedules
Cons: They make you work too much. Make you work even when you are off. No breaks
Advice to Management: Give your employees better benefits and longer breaks. Do not make them work off the clock

Title: "Not a good summer job."
Pros: Reward system such as speed goals and gift cards encourages top performance from employees.
Cons: They told me their policy was that you could not request off in the summer. They expected you to be available anytime any day.
Advice to Management: Be more flexible.

Title: "Great culture, fun company! Can be stressful at times."
Pros:
-Free food on break
-50% off the clock
-Paid Breaks! ( Including lunch breaks)
-Fun employees, managers.
-You can get promoted easy if you show that you want it.
-Pretty simple, self-explanatory duties.
-Awesome benefits!!!!!!!!!!!!
Cons:
-Can be VERY busy
-Really have to be on your stuff!
-Sometimes chaotic.
-Customers can be annoying

Title: "A great place to work - most of the time!"
Pros: Chipotle almost always promotes from within, and, while I have heard differing reports from people from other stores, they were usually pretty good at providing raises to their staff based on merit and time worked there. They also will give plenty of hours if you want them - I was full-time within a month and trained to open 3 separate stations within a few more months. Plus free food when working and 50% discount when you're off!
Cons: Base pay is a bit lacking and your tips are pathetic (usually between $1 to $2 on an opening shift). Management often cut our breaks short - the rational being that they pay for your breaks, so they can end them whenever they want (hint: this isn't true or even legal on a full-time workload in my state). My store in general seemed very mismanaged; the entire upper-level team was replaced a couple times within 6 months.
Advice to Management: Just be fair to your employees and respect them more. It's a great work environment in almost every other way.

Title: "currently in the process of becoming a KMIT"
Pros: free meal , health care
Cons: at my location we don't get our 30 minute paid break

Title: "ok"
Pros: great place to work for me
Cons: ok sometimes very busy for me
Advice to Management: keep up good owrk

Title: "Pretty Cool"
Pros: It's a place that if you love to work fast paced and get a free meal too. They only hire the people who possess the goals that they want to have while working there.
Cons: Long hours that you may have to stand and you could potentially miss a break because of the long lines. I don't think it's a place to work at if you have to go to school and work at the same time.

Title: "interview questions"
Pros: make money and save up your money .
Cons: every thing jobs is hard to do it

Title: "Great learning experience"
Pros: Learned how to speak to customers & work in a very fast moving environment.
Cons: sometimes it can be hectic but overall its an amazing place to work

Title: "Great Place for Starting Job"
Pros: Getting free food is always good. Pay is meh, but the hours are good. Management is nice.
Cons: Pay is meh. Having to deal with some annoying customers. Can get really busy, so it can become stressful.
Advice to Management: Don't have much to say. All the managers were pretty good, but there was some preference towards employees.

Title: "Crew member."

Title: "only work here if you speak spanish"
Pros: paid lunch and breaks and you get a free meal for the day you work!
Cons: I had a schedule changed on me with out my knowledge and they told me it was never changed when I clearly had a picture of it. I do not speak Spanish and that is all they spoke, they would give me orders in Spanish and I told them over and over again that I didn't speak Spanish they never worked with me, its hard work if you open you have to prep all the food with in a curtain time, they are not very good at training on prep work I got left to do things the first time on my own and wasn't given much instruction.
Advice to Management: tell people applying that they need to speak Spanish to work there although I don't think the creator of chipotle ever intended it to be that way.

Title: "Its fun"
Pros: Very fun if you are responsible, fast-paced, and can multitask. If you are a patient person but can work very quickly, you are more than likely to enjoy working here.
Cons: The only downsides I can think of when working here is the customers' attitudes. Some customers yell at you over very little things. I got very mad at times but at the end of the day, the good customers made up for the others bad attitudes.
Advice to Management: Please give some kind of training to the people you hire before putting them on the line! I got very discouraged on my first day because my training was very rushed and I messed up a lot. It makes the restaurant look bad.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: One con is Free food, 50% percent off all beverages, flexibility, and ability to joke around. Encounter many different personalities.
Cons: The cons are that you wont always enjoy who you work with, but thats every job.
Advice to Management: Communicate with each other, be on the same page

Title: "It's ok"
Pros: The pay is pretty much ok
Cons: Work to hard for the amount of money you make

Title: "Great hours, great work"
Pros: If you're willing to put in a ton of work you could become KM in less than a year, more work more promotions! If you train and teach people that really helps too. Show initiative and you'll get good hours.
Cons: You have to be "on" all the time. Literally one of the 13 Characteristics is to be"infectiously enthusiastic" and that can be draining. The whole "chipotle culture" aspect takes away from the actual work. People forget we're just running a restaurant not trying to win a beauty pageant.
Advice to Management: Management differs from store to store. It really helps if you have someone who's passionate about it.

Title: "Meh"
Pros: Company has a good value system
Cons: Crew members do not follow value system because some managers do no enforce it. Managers get pushed to be promoted before they're ready. Lots of cocky attitudes anymore.
Advice to Management: Do your job and commit to your value system. You're not being paid to let your employees walk all over you. Don't pick favorites because you party with them

Title: "Great Company, but this store Has issues"
Pros: Free meals per shift, team environment
Cons: High turn over, low pay, high expectations with minimal training.
Advice to Management: Train your employees better and make sure the scheduling isn't always changin every 5 minutes.

Title: "Cashier/ Customer Service Rep"
Employee Title: Front Desk Supervisor/Lead Secretary, and Medical Biller
Pros: Learned how to use most POS systems. Processed all orders in an above timely manner. Refilled all necessary items ie: napkins, ice, utensils, hot sauce, soft drink mix, and make sure the front of house was spotless.
Cons: Management was very preferential to certain employees. Advancement happens to slow.
Advice to Management: To stop purpose dirtying the floor after an employee stays two hours past her shift to santize the front of house. It was actually caught on camera.

Title: "Chipotle Pros and Cons"
Pros: Good culture, great ingredients, quick promotions.
Cons: Everyone is overworked, poor availability, little vacation benefits.

Title: "Good part-time job or full time career"
Pros:
- Energetic work environment
- Lots of opportunities to be promoted through the company
- Free meal every time you work
Cons:
- The work is physically exhausting (can be a pro, depends on how you look at it)
- The people you work with will determine the kind of day you have.
Advice to Management: Keep your employee's happy and everyone will be happy

Title: "Great for college students"

BUSY
Tuition reimbursment after a year of employment!
Cons:
BUSY
Can feel unrewarding at times, for how busy you actually are
Advice to Management: None

Pros: Great work ethic and positive training. Lots of movement up in company. Free meals, 50% off take away meals. Benefits after 2 weeks!
Cons: 10 minute breaks is not enough time to eat on break.
Advice to Management: My Chipotle is amazing, but other locations, just keep that amazing enthusiasm as there was opening a new store.

Title: "Empowerment issues."
Pros: Great food and great company vision
Cons:
Over worked - underpaid
Broken Systems
Old programs for a young company
Field leaders and operations disconnect.
Culture and operations have a disconnect
NO WORK LIFE BALANCE -Chipotle is life in their business.
Advice to Management: Upper Management just recite definitions and feel their regurgitated concepts are law. They themselves preach being challenged and trying to build a positive people culture, but they themselves are not living their own concepts and ideas. They don't support their teams the way they should and don't know how to manage their own time with multi-units.

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Positive work environment, Fast paced. The work uniform
Cons: Can be a little to fast. Must remember a lot

Title: "Terrible"
Pros: Free employee meal. Pays you $9 to do nothing and reheat food that comes in plastic baggies.
Cons: Dirty, overworked, lack of encouragement or positivity. A lot of favoritism.
Advice to Management: Learn how to manage hardworking employees instead of overworking the good ones.

Title: "Great Culture"
Pros: The Hiring process is a little different than some so this results in creating a team in the in your restaurant that fits really well. You work with really great people who have potential and great qualities. Not high school dropouts with no redeeeming factors
Cons: Its food service, while there are opportunities outside the restaurant they are much fewer. You are going to be serving food and dealing with customers
Advice to Management: Keep doing what you're doing

Title: "Good transitional job"
Pros:
Good work environment - I loved my coworkers and still talk to them
Free burritos on the job and 50% discount when off the job
Cons:
High turn-over rate - my location was in a college-town and lots of employees came and went.
Not the best part-time gig for a college student - my location was understaffed, so my grades paid the price
Regional team acts like they care about you, but they really don't.
Advice to Management: Create more incentive to decrease turn-over rates; regional management needs to maintain better communication and a better relationship with the crew

Title: "Preparatory Cook"
Pros: Ability to move up over time. Great work environment, positive reinforcement.
Cons: Very fast paced. You have to do all the dishes at the end of the night. Low wages. Sometimes they have to reach out to other suppliers of meat and produce.
Advice to Management: Pay the employees more. REGIONAL MANAGERS, watch the cameras and see how well store managers are doing their jobs, have one on ones with all workers to give feed back about the managers performance review.

Title: "ChipoYAY!!"
Pros: Development, Communication from leaders about performance, employee meals, opportunity out-the-taco, clear goals set with your development leader about how you can receive promtions and raises, they pay for your college now, I actually Love chipotle food, even after working there for 3 years - I think that says something, they teach you alot about the culinary arts that you could use if you ever left Chipotle. General managers and Restaurateurs are making 60k+
Cons: I dont work there anymore I was put in a store that was difficult to staff properly, but business continued to increase. I wasn't a great enough leader to get the crew to buy in the way we did. As a result, I worked a lot of hours. (if 15-20 hours of overtime is a con to you I would take that today.)
Advice to Management: keep it up.

Title: "Great first job!"
Pros: Everyone gets along as a family , great managers and flexible schedules. Free food while working is also always a good thing !
Cons: It is a lot of work for almost minimum wage.

Title: "Watch Out For Bad Restaurant Level Management"
Pros: Free food is a plus. The company really does want you to succeed and grow.
Cons: Management at the store level can destroy your life at Chipotle. As much as I love the company, they believe in what's called a Restaurateur restaurant. This is a restaurant in which everybody is a Top Performer who is Empowered by their leaders. My GM constantly berated me and my co-workers and never took the opportunity to connect with us. Scope your your GM in the interview process. Although you may be desperate for a job, there are toxic people our there who can ruin your day. Best to apply at another Chipotle.
Advice to Management: Really look at the management and don't give GM's the chance. Weigh in the opinions of those who work for that GM, those who previously worked for him (internal and external) to determine if this person really deserves to be in a position to change peoples lives for the better or worse.

Title: "chipotle is a good first job"
Pros: Friendly coworkers, nice pay and benefits
Cons: very busy and fast paced
Advice to Management: consider monthly training

Title: "Crew"
Pros: Great coworkers. Shifts go by really quick.
Cons: Management can micromanage too much sometimes.
Advice to Management: Take a step back and breathe sometimes

Title: "Okay place to work"
Pros: The hours are very flexible, the pay is okay once you get to management, and the experience is overall good. Benefits are provided every six months, theres paid vacation, as well as sick days.
Cons: Overall stressful working conditions. A lot of responsibility expected for low wages and high volume of customers make discomfort a daily hurdle.
Advice to Management: Better structuring the way daily preparations and serving goes would greatly help the staff. There's an incredible amount of possibility for human error and it creates a lot of stress for management to be responsible for pretty much everything on a shift.

Title: "Chipotle changes people's lives."
Pros: Every person is committed to making the people around them better. Even as a GM, I am learning something new everyday ie. New things about chipotle, new things about the people around me, an even new things about myself and how I connect/communicate with others. The company promotes quickly and corporate is there to support you.
Cons: The company promotes quickly. Sometimes too quickly. Can leave those managers feeling overwhelmed and unprepared. Busy restaurants can be left struggling with 2-3 managers when they need 6.
Advice to Management: Keep your head up and always be honest. Smart! But honest.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: face paced, managment friendly and cares for employees. promote within.
Cons: takes awhile to make good money.
Advice to Management: none

Title: "DRAMA"
