Cons: The Chipotle I worked at was like high school all over again. If you didn't gossip with the general manager, you could kiss your paycheck good bye. Corporate was contacted by six different people for the same things happening and nothing was done and these employees eventually were fired or forced to quit.
Advice to Management: Grow up and be professional.

Title: "Its great!"
Pros: its great, really great, just hard work!
Cons: its great, just hard work!!!

Title: "Great Company"
Pros:
Free Meals
Great Staff/Nanagement
Overall Atmosphere
50% discount when not working
Good pay
Cons: Stressful (because it's so busy)
Advice to Management: Everything is great at this company. Very well run

Title: "Chipotle"
Pros: Good people, free food, chill environment
Cons: Unorganized at times, bad managers
Advice to Management: Needs managers that understand their positions

Title: "Cashier"
Pros:
Free meals
The people you work with are awesome
Time goes by fast
As many hours as you ask for
Employees are empowered to both work as a group and to have independent suggestions
Advancement opportunities
Cons:
$9/hr
Expect too much of you at once
Break is at the beginning of your shift
Always get out later than what your shift is scheduled for
Advice to Management: Keep up the good work but ease up a bit, you are too stressed out

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Make really great food and eat a free meal every time you work
Cons: Management can be uninformative and careless about fixing problems properly.
Advice to Management: Focus on helping the crew become stronger in their skills and knowledge of tasks they are given to do.

Title: "Job with good atmosphere but a fast pace"
Pros: All of my coworkers are supportive and really care about the work they do. Management cares about the atmosphere they create and are genuinely supportive. There is never a dull moment and work can be fun and stimulating and you learn a lot. Lots of benefits and free food.
Cons: Fast-paced work means you're constantly on your feet throughout (sometimes long) shifts. Also the work can be occasionally overwhelming and stressful considering the relatively low pay. There is room for advancement but sometimes a lack of good training means that managers are not completely prepared for the positions they move into.
Advice to Management: Continue to support your crew members, but a pay raise for hourly employees would be incredibly helpful. The culture and atmosphere in this company is good but the fast pace of work makes it sometimes stressful.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Great hours. Good tips. Great food. You eat free.
Cons: They work you like a SLAVE. Poor management and drama drama drama.

Title: "Going to end up quitting"
Pros: co workers are super cool & employe meals are the best because they're free.
Cons: Cleaning is such a struggle, chipotle closes at 10pm and the owner expectes everyone to be done by 10:30. I work tortilla, by the end of the night i had to finish cleaning the press WHILE ITS ON (385 degrees) (15-20 minutes) with no sort of protection. Weight the leftover meat. Put it back in the freezer(10 minutes) degrease and clean the line(10-15 minutes), restock; bowls, lids, kids plates,(5 minutes)scrub the floor numerous times, clean the back of the line(10-15 minutes). These are the main things we have to do, managers always ask workers to do other things as well.(5-10 minutes)
Advice to Management: honestly I think my managers are great but the owner gives everyone such a hard time a it getting out half an hour after we close. It takes time. I also believe that we should get paid more chipotle is small, but its always packed we get a lot buisness. There is never more than 10 people working during one shift. We are providing restaurant quality food and experience, but the pay does not reflect. Some customers are great but most of them love giving our crew a hard time. Ex: complaining about portions, prices, leaving trash everywhere)

Title: "Restaurant GM"
Pros: My pros,, I'm self driven, motivational, I learned how to teach my experiences throughout the 25 years I've been in the business to make a team, ateam for the business is sucess in life, I'm fair, I'm a hard worker, I help out in every way possible to guarantee all customers best experience, and great service, with a friendly attitude at all times
Cons: My Cons, I'm only 45, still need to learn more and more everyday about this business. Customers are my key tools for success in this business the more that I can learn is the more better I can get my cons are growth in the management upper management, and looking for Mentors to guide me to success. Have an equal balance between business and family and having full dedication to my comp lishments.
Advice to Management: My advice to management was to be strong in teaching, motivating, and guidance for our employees to treat our customers with the most respect, and friendly service. A manager is only as good as the team that he directs.

Title: "Fun enviroment"
Pros: Free food and unlimited amount of drinks while on duty is a plus for sure. Also working in line is a lot of fun and customers are usually nice.
Cons: Working on lobby is hectic and a lot of work you dont feel like youre getting paid enough to do that job. Also the fact that there are endless people in the back and you have to wait even after youre suppose to leave and you have plans for some new person to come in and take over.
Advice to Management: Put more than one person on lobby please please and make the schedule more open and reliable its too hard for me to tell you i cant work certain hours the next week because I never know if the schdeules made or not.

Title: "Chipotle Mexican Gril"
Pros: The pros were that I learned to handle people and everything going on even in a fast pace environment.
Cons: The cons of working at Chipotle would have had to be that the team didn't really always work together the way we should have.
Advice to Management: My advice would be to have more team meetings to get everyone back on the same page and remind them it is a partnership.

Title: "TOS - Medford Ma / Harvard Sq Cambridge"
Pros: I loved the job very much. Always learning something new, on your feet moving around, free food is a plus, new people (some friendly some arent), get to joke around a bit, be yourself, very accepting place.
Cons: However, managment was full of lies. Always saying they are going to promote you and never do. Take advantage of you : worked plenty of double shifts ( 17 hours in total sometimes back 2 back ) They jump to conclusions all the time, and screw you over in the end. I lost my home at one point and i asked for a transfer to a fl chipotle since thats where I had to go stay with a relative and they terminated me for abandonment instead of giving me my transfer. If they never did this I wouldve been with the company still
Advice to Management: Get your act together. Dont screw over your best employees. More communication is needed. More praise for good and hard work is needed.

Title: "Terrible Management"
Pros: High-energy, great morale, good values
Cons: Disorganized management/scheduling, over-hiring, no hours, training was not executed according to corporate standards
Advice to Management: Don't over-hire and give new employees 0 hours three weeks in a row and only 4 hours on a fourth week? I should be scheduled more than 4 hours in a month if you expect to call yourself my employer.

Title: "Burittoooo"
Pros: Fun place to work at but be prepared to work hard and stand long hours. During peak hours working at Chipotle gets a little hectic but it makes the time fly by. Definitely enjoy the free food and 50% off discounts.
Cons: Managers can be jerks but most of them are very nice and help you.

Title: "food prep."
Pros: i like to work at chipotle because its good to help the customer be satisfied with the food.
Cons: its sometimes gets hard on working through the line of the food prep but the good thing is that we have to be fast pace and always high energy.

Title: "Kitchen Manager"
Pros: Unorganized, Need more training, Good for customer service experience. For people who have graduated this job is useless.
Cons: Great Food, Food with Integrity

Title: "Only for the $$$"
Pros:
Great pay
Easy fun job
Cons:
Terrible managers, some way to young
Horrible hours
Advice to Management: Be more consistent and considerate

Title: "Service manager"
Pros: Different culture, great place to work and a lot of fun.
Cons: I don't have any complaints.

Title: "Crazy hours, very demanding, expectations are VERY high for the pay."
Pros: its a wonderful place for young people that my not have had the chance to show their potential to shine and get promoted! get the job, get the title and experience then get the hell out of there!
Cons: you work hours equivalent to 2.5 full time employees. The work is hard as a manager because the job is so demanding of part time employees who get paid next to nothing that they easily get burned out and quit on you with NO notice and then you are stuck working the shifts and picking up the slack. I hated working here 90% of time! I had my restaurant running very well and staffed with good people and was FORCED to uproot to another location that was barely getting by and stat over completely. I Finally had enough and walked out on the job 8 months ago and have been unemployed ever since because I cant find a job in my area, regardless not having a job is better than working in that slave pit every day.

Title: "Absolutely Amazing"
Pros: I think that this job is one of the best part time jobs you can get. They pay a good amount and they treat you right.
Cons: There is barely anything wrong with Chipotle. The only job that could be better is Home Depot, because they pay a lot.
Advice to Management: My advice to management is to keep managing your business the same way that you guys have been. Its perfect

Title: "Cashier/Crew"
Pros: Great coworkers, great customers. Works around your school schedule.
Cons: Management isn't so great. They all try to one up one another to the upper management. They claim nothing is ever their fault. Scheduling sucks, because managers are constantly making changes to the schedule, and never actually update the crew.
Advice to Management: Make a schedule and stick to it. Leave your drama at home.

Title: "Ugh"
Pros: They offer tuition reimbursement up to $5000 a year which is nice. There is a lot of potentional for growth within the company.
Cons: While there are many upsides it's just not worth it. It's an insanely stressful environment and quite frankly the base pay needs to be higher. Managers are not as flexible with the crew as they should be.
Advice to Management: Understand that your crew are people too and that they are not perfect. Try to work with them instead of intimidating them over everything. You shouldn't threaten jobs because someone needed a day off.

Title: "Business"
Pros: You enjoy yourself at work, and addition you learn how to build the perfect burrito, bowl, and tacos. Great place to work.
Cons: Sometimes the customers could get pretty rude. In addition the employees could get rude and you would have to handle all of it in a positive way

Title: "Pretty alright"
Pros: Competitive pay, decent hours
Cons: They want you to know EVERYTHING about their company and really push you to learn as you work. Also, they expect you to learn fast.
Advice to Management: Don't let the normal employee's run everything. Most of them don't know what they're doing.

Title: "Good company but hard work"
Pros: They really just use real, healthy ingredients. The management is really friendly, nice and helpful
Cons: It's a lot of work, you have to know how to do prep, line and grill. You have to finish the prep on time and work really fast. Payment 9.25 per hour if you have experience in kitchen

Title: "Had a full time position with part time hours..."
Pros:
Coworkers were fun to work with.
Getting free food was nice.
Cons:
Managers had a lack of communication.
Once I got my full time position they barely gave me 20 hours sometimes not even 10 hours, I was promised 45 hours every week.
The drive to work was very annoying
Advice to Management: If you hire someone into a full time position you should probably give them the full time hours you promised.

Title: "Great fast restaurant job if you're willing to commit and buy in"
Pros:
Legitimate chance to advance based on performance
More about what you're doing while there than what you've done at other places
Good constant training if the store isn't understaffed
Cons:
Understaffed stores can be a headache
Management expects a lot from the staff so if you're not all in don't expect to be around long

Title: "Okay"
Pros: Friendly, face-paced, good environment to work in, excellent training
Cons: Very routine-wise, lots of information to know, long hours
Advice to Management: Very good managers

Title: "Great environment but hard work"
Pros: Good hours, great management, always gave days off when needed, flexible with schedule, understood i was a student and worked with my availability, fun place to work.
Cons: Very low pay, hard work, can be stressful for many, if you do not like the kitchen atmosphere do not work here.
Advice to Management: Know what you are doing, follow the rules, have good people skills, be able to lead a team.

Title: "Could be better"
Pros: free food when on the job, 1/2 off MY meal only when not on the job. Good chances for advancement.
Cons: strict time limits. first few days no break.

Title: "Horrible Management / Favoritism disillusioned"
Pros:
Free Food on your shift
 Always a lot of decent people working with you
50% off when you aren't on the clock
food with integrity and the possibility that one day you !! can be a GM or RESTAURANTEUR
Cons: Cleaning the drain socks which are completely disgusting and the pay does not even come close to substantiate the disgust of pulling one of those dirty things out of the ground then having to rinse it clean. The fact you can get stuck by yourself for hours washing dishes alone in a smelly puddle of water because the drains continuously get clogged . Favoritism among managers and who will be promoted... Terrible scheduling where your schedule will come out 1 or maybe 2 days in advance and thats a big maybe... no work life balance , poor pay, you receive A raise 2x a year I believe it can range from 5 cents to 25 cents .... You can work so hard and really put everything you have into this job and the fact is if this store is run by people who are in somewhat of a clique environment you will not get ahead ...
Advice to Management: Get to know all of your employee's , Do one on one's like actually do them! Don't play favorites help your entire team succeed not just a select few ...Have actually meetings with the entire crew night and day for multiple reasons which should be obvious when you run a business...

Title: "Crew"
Pros: Nice friendly people and have a good environment
Cons: It working at a face pace and u get a lot of customers that come upset from waiting long

Title: "Hard work, learned a lot"
Pros:
- stuck to culture, vision, and mission
- driven leaders, encouraged leadership and development constantly
- free meals with every shift, no matter how long the shift
- teaches you how to manage and succeed in a fast-paced work environment
- entrusted with real responsibility and held accountable
- accountability is strongly valued
- strong possibility for upward mobility if you choose to go that route
- pay is higher than minimum wage
Cons:
- although higher than minimum wage, definitely not paid for what the work is worth, at all levels (Kitchen managers through GM)
- long shifts
- unreliable co-workers, high turnover, especially in college areas
- very fast-paced, can be very stressful to meet store goals
Advice to Management: Look into composting wherever possible because the amount of food waste, whether it's edible or not, is huge. Please try to compost!! Also, look in to paying your employees higher wages for the amount of work it takes to run your stores. I think the turnover rate would definitely go down for some stores.

Title: "Great part-time job"
Pros: You start at one station and then go into others gradually. Great systems and guides for employees to follow and learn.
Cons: Sometimes customers can get very rude and inconsiderate waiting on the long lines, especially during lunch and dinner rush.
Advice to Management: Great management team overall. Career outlook for employees can be further explored.

Title: "Good first job"
Pros: Was allowed to eat there as much and as many times as I wanted. Flexible with hours. Good people.
Cons: Apparent disjoint between management and upper-management. Communication was not always ideal. I usually was not given enough hours.
Advice to Management: Upper/senior management should try to be less spooky. They seemed to drop by at our store just to scare employees into making the place spotless. I would have enjoyed talking to them more, in retrospect.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: -free meal is provided during work breaks, saves having to spend money on food elsewhere
Cons: -managers unrealistically expect you to complete tasks in short time frame when they can't perform at that speed themselves

Title: "Will drive you insane"
Pros: Food with integrity and empowerment are real things to believe in. The things you learn here you can carry on to other places with great success. Learning how to hire people with the 13 characteristics will be invaluable to you. You will learn to write a schedule that will stick to labor laws and use salaried positions to their maximum gain - even scheduling the GM and APP for 7 days to meet peak hour coverage when they won't actually be working. Who would have thunk?
Cons: Maybe it depends on your TL or ATL. You may be promoted to be a GM of a failing store after having been an apprentice for two months with an R that is on vacation that entire time. No interview necessary! After you have been given that opportunity, your ATL may not show up at your store for a few months because the commute is too long. You may try to stick this out because you really care about your team and you are so inspired at the all GM conference in Vegas. But.... you are not allowed to ask for help outside your patch and your ATL is waiting for you to break. You are eventually terminated after you tell your ATL you were never properly trained. Whistle blowing is very much looked down on in this political environment. By the way, they may refer to you as "family", but once they've changed the locks on you, no one in your patch will ever contact you again.
Advice to Management: Maybe you shouldn't be trying to grow so fast? Two stores a day is great in theory, but we're all told how many people we need to hire, train and promote to be at model to give these people opportunities and then you give people bonuses based on who they promote. This is framed as making people better, but it's hard to see that when your R's refer to you as dollar signs. It would also be a little more empowering if your TD's did more than watch you on camera from the parking lot when they live down the street. Maybe they could come inside the restaurant?

Title: "Work at McDonalds, you'll get paid more and deal with less bs."
Pros: The only pro that I got out of working for this company is the relationships I built with team members that weren't idiots.
Cons:
*Overworked
*Low pay
*No breaks if you don't get your duties done
*Getting scolded for not having great cut sizes
*Managers only care about those that want to move up in the company
*It takes forever to get promoted
*No high standards - they now reheat the chicken from the day before
*Sometimes you're there until 2am cleaning the restaurant only to be there at 7am.
Advice to Management: Stop managing with dictatorship.

Title: "Good experience"
Pros: You can learn to be a productive team member and there is free food on your shift, half off when you're not working.
Cons: If you dont like working face paced- rushing in a lot of things you do, this might be different for you. Keeping energy in a face paced environment is a skill.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: People I work with is friendly
Cons: Nothing is really a con

Title: "Line Cook"
Pros: Free food for your lunch break.
Cons: I only wanted part time but ended up working full time. They wanted me to cut veggies a certain way and if I didn't, threaten to fire me. Not only that, they wanted me to cut fast. I cut my finger once and got in trouble for that too. Yeah, they give you a free lunch but only give you 9 minutes to eat it. How can I eat, go to the bathroom, etc in 9 minutes? I quit after ONE week.
Advice to Management: Hire more people, and give hour long lunch breaks because that's illegal to do so otherwise.

Title: "Sweet"
Pros: Great place and company to work for. Cool people, friendly guests, good environment.
Cons: Long hours, mean customers sometimes, not much room for growth or advancement.

Title: "service manager"
Pros: Good benefits, free meals
Cons: horrible management, they lie

Title: "Cashier"
Pros:
1. Free food-one free meal a day as long as you eat it there.
2. 50% discount on the food, but only one one entree, drink, and side.
3. The other regular employees are good people (most).
4. A lot of hours if you work hard and if you want it.
Cons:
1. If you struggle as a newbie they cut your hours and give it to others who are doing better.
2. Illegal- but they used to not give me my 10 minute breaks and sometimes not even my lunches. They forget and even if you keep asking they say they don't have anyone to cover you when they're really busy and when your shift is over they tell you if you want to take those breaks before you go but its like "I just want to go home and what is the point".
3. Because its true that people get promoted within, sometimes you end up with really stupid managers who don't seem professional at all. My manager was good at her job sort of but she had unprofessional relationships with some employees and they got favoritism.
4. They guilt trip you if they need you to stay over time and you don't stay. They make you feel like you're not a "Top Performer".
5. They make you memorize (its like a cult) these definitions and slogans and it is pretty pointless and annoying.
6. They pay minimum wage for very hard labor and they work you like a slave.
Advice to Management: No favorites. Treat us like humans. Remember when you used to be crew.

Title: "Disorganized, Unprofessional company"
Pros: Free company meal (after working a 5 hour shift) Nice uniforms, generally the employees are decent people. It's always busy so you always have something to do.
Cons: All of your managers/kitchen managers are no older than 29, so it's a very childish atmosphere. It's unorganized, & uncoordinated. I got hired, and wasn't scheduled for a whole month because they said they had other people to train before me. I called the week they told me I would be scheduled, and the manager told me I had to wait until the following week. Later that day, at 11:30 AT NIGHT (I was almost asleep) some manager I'd never heard of called me and told me I was working the following morning. Not asked, TOLD me. I called the next morning and quit on the spot. 0/10.
Advice to Management: My high school prom was more organized than this restaurant.

Title: "Good start to leadership"
Pros:
Fast track to management
Great leadership ethics
Free meals on duty
Paid Breaks
Cons:
Average pay for the hard work
recognition only by hard work and high standards
if you want to lead you have to build and put the work in

Title: "Working for Chipotle"
Pros: One of the major pros for me would definitely be the free food while you're working and 50% off ONE meal when you're not. Also I find a majority of the customers who come in are happy people which is nice plus in my opinion to help someone has an even better day. At the specific location I worked at after a while all the employees become friendly towards each other which helps for a nice work environment. Chipotle works with student schedules and now have some tuition reimbursement for college students. health benefits included
Cons: During my whole time working there there was sort of an inconsistency of hours. At this establishment they say there is real thing as a part or full time worker because they give hours based on the positions the store is needing for certain days. Also this isn't the type of job where you get any sitdown time except for a 30 minute break ( which is paid)
Advice to Management: My advice to the management is to be a lot more active when it comes to new hires, when I got the job I had no call back or email from them saying I was hired, just an email for workday ( their online system for workers to check hours and start the background checking process).

Title: "I love chipotle"
Pros: I love it there!! Its not like horrible journeys. Its defifnently new hire friendly. They make you feel good and they all help you work together
Cons: The only thing is that management are very strict which is understandable
Advice to Management: Keep caring for the employees and thank you for our free meals😁😁😁

Title: "Good Company"
Pros: Great Company, Move Up Quickly, Great Benifits
Cons:
*Inconstant policies (Depending on who you are and your position you can get away with a lot more than others; Smoking pot, drinking, sleeping with staff, ect)

*Leadership from your leaders don't reflect leadership of your company. I am lead through fear and intimidation and everyone of my peers feels the same way but is in fear to say anything or they will get fired. (This could be a great and I mean GREAT company if this was fixed)
Advice to Management: Sit down with your field leaders 1 on 1 not in some survey they doesn't make them feel cared about. Sit down and ask them 1 on 1 with out their TD or ETD knowing so they don't "prep them" for it like they do the surveys.

Title: "Amazing place to work at!"
Pros: Food: Produce is now completely GMO free, animals are responsibly raised. Management/Crew: When working in a properly run market like the one here in Albuquerque you can expect to be treated with respect and will honestly enjoy coming to work. Pay: Entry level employees are paid much better then other food industries. Benefits: Free food, insurance options, bi-yearly raises, and so much more. Opportunities: The room for growth with this company is unreal, anybody who wants it bad enough and is willing to put in the hard work can become a manager and move their way up the pipeline. Upper-Level Management: It is a good feeling when upper-levels visit the store on a constant basis and show their genuine care for every single employee they are responsible for. I have worked for several companies in my life and Chipotle is the stand alone leader in every single aspect.
Cons: As stated in other posts Chipotle is a very demanding job. If you are just looking for a job to stand around and make minimum wage your are better off looking somewhere else.
Advice to Management: Higher kitchen supplies budget, it's annoying going over every month! :)

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Creating future leaders and developing talent. Great vision of food with integrity and people culture to create encouraging circumstances to sustain high standards.
Cons: pay does not equal responsibility or volume of restaurant, trained full management at staff at neighboring restaurant with no compensation.

Title: "The best"
Pros: People the culture our high standards
Cons: I don't have any .

Title: "Lying by omision is still lying"
Pros:
Free food every day.
Decent benefit package.
Cons: Salaried managers get paid for 40 hours/week but are expected to work 50 hours/week. That's 520 hours/year that salaried managers don't get paid for.
Advice to Management: Work/life balance is totally non-existent. You're essentially running a slave factory.

Title: "Best Fast Food Restaurant"
Pros: Nice pay, good and healthy food.
Cons: We don't receive enough customers.
Advice to Management: Please try to improve advertisement.

Title: "their customer service is just horrible"
Pros: they work when they want
Cons: they are just horrible to people the food is poor

Title: "Good First Jon"
Pros:
Free meal every shift
Flexible Scheduling-good for working while in school
Always busy, so the shifts go by pretty quick
Easy to move to management positions
Paid breaks
Cons:
Only made $8/hr for a lot of hard work
Bi weekly pay which is hard when you're not making much to begin with-definitely can't pay bills on it
Advice to Management:
Going on break as soon as you clock in really defeats the purpose of a break
Pre shift meetings should be positive and not pointing out all things negative during last shift

Title: "okay experience"
Pros: everyone should work at a fast food restaurant at least once in their life. Good experience with customer service and food industry.
Cons: Tight nit family, maybe a little too tight. Managers tend to pay favorites over hours based on their work - friend relationships. Company rides themselves on "top performer" attitude, however managers lack the attitude and skills.
Advice to Management: Treat crew members a little more respectfully. there was a lot of tension between entire crew and restaurant manager. when upper management was called in they didn't really fix the problem. it only made restaurant manager more hostile.

Title: "Good Company Vision"
Pros:
A solid plan of promotion from Crew Member to General Manager

Thrives on high standards

Free Chipotle
Cons:
Work environment is always fast paced and demanding.

Difficult to achieve high standards if not everyone on your team is a top performer.

Title: "FUN"
Pros: Loads of fun! Great, fast past working environment. Great for my first part time job.
Cons: Dealing with rude people from time to time. All a great learning experience though.

Title: "Take out specialist"
Pros: Great hourly pay, friendly work enviornment
Cons: Hours were scarce, favoritism, mngmnt encouraged gossip

Title: "Not Recommended"
Pros: Great food! What started as an very cool place to work has become a top heavy ivory tower.
Cons: Smoke and mirrors. They portray themselves as an amazing brand, but at the end of the day, they are just like everywhere else. Boys club upper management. Ego's beyond belief. If you don't fit in their little box of what they think a manager has to be, you are kicked to the curb quickly. No room for opinions or free thought at all. They have let go of SO MANY great people it's unbelievable.
Advice to Management: Get off your high horses and learn to accept people for what they are. You all put your pants on just like everyone else. Your salaries are a slap in the face to all the underpaid people that sweat it out daily in your stores. Take a page out of the books of CEO's that draw a $1 salary and share the wealth with the people that really make it happen. Think you're a great company? Prove it. Put your money where your mouth is!

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: Fun, fast paced environment. Shift seemed to go by really fast when there were a lot of customers.
Cons: No downsides I can really think of at the moment except was a bit boring if there were no customers and not much to do.
Advice to Management: Treat employees with respect and don't talk down to them even if you're their superior.

Title: "Service Manager"
Pros: Free food, you get raises every six months.
Cons: It all depends on your team.

Title: "Great Place to Work if You're White"
Pros: Awesome benefits package, and tons of opportunity for growth if you're in the right department.
Cons:
They will sell you on the culture, but there are some serious cult like oppressive strategies in play. Zero minorities represented in Senior or Executive Leadership.
Lots of lawsuits being litigated continuously for overworked salaried employees that are under paid, not paid while working, or racial discrimination.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: An amazingly fun and supportive work environment, amazing people, and a true family feel. Great benefits, delicious food made fresh and with integrity, and a fantastic company with a moral conscience!
Cons: I would like to earn more money and even when your review exceeds their expectations, the raise does not ... 20 cents! It takes a while for most people to advance into a management position and even with the added responsibilities, the pay does not increase as much as I would like.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Free meals, always busy, never boring
Cons: Have to stand all day long, no breaks many days so you are working 8-10 hours straight
Advice to Management: Make breaks mandatory because crew do not work well without them

Title: "So Good, Then So Bad"
Pros: For years I loved my job, there were flexible hours for me, training on everything, but the best part was our amazing GM and so many of my hard- working co-workers. I loved coming in and helping my team.
Cons: Unfortunately corporate fired our GM, he was too-nice to fire people at times, so they brought in a new GM and Apprentice. I understand it would be a rough transition, but this was brutal. A lot of people got fired, and even more walked our because we just weren't a team anymore. It took a long time for things to level out again. It was a hard location to be in, but people just didn't seem to get how bad until it was too late.
Advice to Management: Making the crew feel like a team and work like a team is what makes Chipotle such an addictive place to work. I really CRAVED coming into work (Chipotle was our lives), until that all dissolved. The new management seemed determined to cause drama between people and set everyone into a "competitive" mindset that just turned everyone against each other instead of supporting one another towards their goals. It was heartbreaking to see such a change.

Title: "chipotle"
Pros: Great people and environment to work in
Cons: Not enough pay or hours some stores need more managers to train new employees
Advice to Management: Make more time for new employees wherever possible

Title: "Just began."
Pros: Paid break and free food. Also health benefits. Every member of the crew is really nice and very helpful.
Cons: Working in food is not a good idea too much cleaning
Advice to Management: Hire more people.

Title: "Interview was amazing."
Pros: You get your first free meal when hired on the spot. That's was great and my first time eating there lol
Cons: The commute for me hopefully won't be too much of a problem I live kind of far and the busses spot running after a certain time.
Advice to Management: Keep doing what your doing.

Title: "It wasn't too bad"
Pros: At my location, you got to serve yourself as much food as you wanted. Often times customers would look in horror as I filled my bowl with 4 or 5 scoops of steak or chicken. Management here was awesome, very laid back managers that took their time with you and did their best to address your work concerns as long as you worked hard. Ability to learn more than one thing while working also helped make work less tedious, I was on tortilla, salsa, and prep during my time there. Paid breaks was also a plus. Very flexible with their scheduling. Work attire is also very relaxed, you can where cargo shorts or regular pants with your work shirt and hat.
Cons: Very demanding environment, you're expected to "have a sense of urgency" at all times while also keeping a smile on, which can become hard to do under stressful circumstances such as during rush hour. Pay isn't bad but its not as great as other places, starting wage here is $9.50. Apart from moving fast, depending on where you work, coworkers with more experience may start treating you as a subordinate. In my experience, it was hard to learn other positions without being 100% perfect on your current station.
Advice to Management: Please raise the wages employees are paid, the current compensation isn't reflective of the hard work we do daily.

Title: "Horrible beyond my imagination! !"
Pros:
Free food

Title: "Crew Member"

Cons: The work is probably as you expect it to be. You'll greet customers the same way over and over throughout the day and do monotonous work on your feet all day. The turnover rate for new employees is high. Some employees drink the kool-aid about where the food comes from and how it's anti-GMO to an annoying level.
Advice to Management: There's no advice to give for where I worked, management didn't power trip over anything and generally did their best to keep the place running.

Title: "eh"

Title: "Kitchen Manager in Training"
Pros: Free Chipotle is great and the goal to gear fast food towards sustainable non-GMO foods is admirable. Paid breaks and ability to move up if you can master cut sizes and prep your station on time. Promotion from within.
Cons:
Not a good stepping stone for a restaurant chef position, a full menu doesn't have a handful of items and restaurants are less draconian about cut sizes, more presentation and how food actually tastes.

Work becomes monotonous fast especially if your manager is incapable of writing a schedule or struggles cross-training people on different stations. Put a hold on your aspirations of moving up.

They try to make you learn the tenets of Chipotle, but everyone that works there could care less. Most only care about a pay raise and their next promotion. Cut throat.

Work here if you want free food and slightly above minimum wage, avoid looking for a career. Too many lies and the stress will kill ya.
Advice to Management:
DM's need to avoid tunnel vision on their bonus paychecks for promotion, and actually help out the stores they manage.
Your false promises of promotion and pay raises make you sound like a snake-tongued salesperson. "I got her to SM in 6 months, I can get you to KM in 2" yeah riiiight.
Cross-train employees to keep things fresh and so it actually seems like you are making an effort to promote your employees.
Help your GMs! Don't hang them out to dry and then fire them so you can get another bonus by replacing them by promoting someone else.

Title: "Tough but Rewarding"

-friendly environment

Cons:

-difficult to call out sick, need to find your own replacement

Title: "Too Much Work"

Cons: Too Busy, Loud Music.. As the cashier you have to enter things on the POS, speak to customers, phone is constantly ringing, ppl walking up asking for bags, lids, extras sides, customers walking up for online orders while the music is on full blast, ALL AT THE SAME TIME!!! Its absolutely insane and completely overwhelming. And don't make a mistake, management gets totally upset!
Advice to Management: Have bags, lids, bowls, drink holders available to customers in the lobby. Have a manager answering the phone during peak. Lower the music, I cant gear the customers or the expo.

Title: "I have worked for chipotle full time for 9 months."
Pros: Great People. Great Company. offer a lot of benefits. can move uo in the company quickly.
Cons: Expect to move to fast in the company sometimes. Very fast pace. sometimes hard to get breaks.
Advice to Management: Take time to stay connected with the team even though your running a store.

Pros:
No experience needed as they provide full training.
Friendly environment
There was always work so hours were never cut (unless you weren't a good employee)
Flexible when it came to asking for days off
Benefits
Free lunch and paid break
Cons: I'm not saying all Chipotle's are like this, obviously the people are what make a difference. The manager would hire mostly girls even though we needed more muscle for grill and heavy work. He would mostly hire people that knew each other so the Chipotle I worked at was filled with teenagers from the same school, which created cliques. Because of these cliques there wasn't much communication between all of the employees which was a problem during busy times. Sometimes (not always) your hard-work wasn't valued, which is understandable at a point because there was no time to be congratulating people for a job well done. If you are good at a position (say cash, which I hated) then you best believe thats going to be your position til you quit because they have no intention to train someone else (unless you like repetitiveness then its a pro for you). I worked at their busiest location (Jackson) and even though it wasn't necessarily a bad thing, it is EXTREMELY busy, which was very tiring, to be standing in one spot for about 3-4 hours until the line died down. There was a lot of favoritism, some people got away with slacking off because they buddies with the manager.
Advice to Management: Stop the favoritism. Yes, its nice to have friends there and what not, especially if you click with someone cool, but during work ours its you and 20+ other employees that are there to work, not to chit chat. Also, training, give the people that are always on grill/cash a break and train other people in all stations (even though you're supposed to do it anyways).

Title: "Okay For College Work"
Pros: People are pretty great to work with. Free food while working is a huge plus. 50% off when I'm off is generous as well. Food is delicious and company seems to care about their employees.
Cons: Managers can make life a living hell. Upper management (despite otherwise saying) is all about nickel and diming customers on meat and guacamole. Upper management also wants everyone to want to move up, to the point of forcing their employees, even if employees are just looking at employment as a college job. Some management choices are more of a "we needed a manager" more than "this person has earned a management position". Customers can be a pain.
Advice to Management: Vet your managers better because I know of a good amount of employees that check their schedules assuring that they are not working with their GM's.

Title: "This place sucks"

Cons: Everything about the job. They brainwash you. Food looks disgusting after your first week there and youll realize its not that many combinations of food. Management and employees are insensitive to other employees. Theyre over priced and very rude.
Advice to Management: Stop being mindless jerk bags.

Title: "bad"
Pros: Was there for very little before leaving. It seemed good at first with their attitude but it completely changed once i started working there.
Cons: There was no training whatsoever. We were expected to be in the beginning of the lunch rush without any training how to do anything. Most parts were easy but we were not trained how to make certain menu items or other things a customer may request. Very stressful when you get thrown in without any idea what to do. Also they did not pay me for a day because they never gave me the proper information on how to clock in during the training or on my first day. Plus there was constant yelling from the higher ups.
Advice to Management: Allow shadowing and better training. Also, learn how to handle new hires better. And be sure to go over every aspect of the system.

Title: "A very unprofessional and unfair experience."
Pros: They gave me a good amount of hours a week.
Cons: The store manager knew that I had requested time off of work, and that it was approved. Although, he decided to schedule me twice on the days that I was out of town. When I went in to work to check my schedule, he told me that I was a "no-call, no-show" two times in a row and that they were letting me go. He also said that he "tried" to call me to let me know, although I had no missed calls or voice mails. This predicament was very cruel, unprofessional, and unfair.
Advice to Management: Practice being more professional and less selfish.

Title: "Chipotelle"

Title: "General Manager"
Pros: Chipotle offers opportunities to a lot of people that may not get it elsewhere. Their commitment to promoting from within is real. Free food, good experience building, semi decent compensation.
Cons:
Cons, woof. First off it's insanely competitive, at every level. Crew compete with crew every day to get promoted, and all managers are competing with their field leader's perception of them to hopefully move up or get compensated further.

My biggest gripe is that field leaders tout the company vision and expect strict adherence to it in all things, yet they seldomly hold themselves to that standard, and no one above them holds them accountable to that.

Bonuses and resource allocation at the GM level and up are largely competitive and very prone to favortisim/nepotism. If planning to move up in management be ready to suck up to your field leader or suffer.

In my case my agency was stripped from me. I was accountable for anything that went wrong, even though my field leader was dictating all of my major decisions. Gm here is just middle management at best.
Advice to Management:
Professionally: stop focusing only on growth and promotions and give your struggling restaurants or regions support before adding more restaurants, which take managers from the surrounding regardless of circumstance.

Personally: You stress one on ones at all levels, yet no TDs are doing regular one on ones with gm's to see how their field leaders are keeping with the vision. Issueing complaints to compliance about this results in them telling the field leader about it. I come from a patch with an external hire area manager who talked about the vision but rarely lived it.. If anyone would have just helped me help her Id still be there..

For a use it or lose it vacation policy, it sure isn't easy to use. I was frequently told I couldn't go unless ____. How can I plan a trip for the future under those conditions?

Title: "Pretty great experience"
Pros: great coworkers who encourage and care for each other, good food, wonderful atmosphere,
Cons: becomes your life, almost ways work extra hours, the "culture talk" is good in theory but can get in the way of productivity and it feels like you're being micromanaged all the time

Title: "It's a real hit or miss."
Pros:
There's a sense of pride that comes with serving good-quality, all-natural food. If something is remotely wrong it's discarded, which I consider to really be "food with integrity." If you need any help, you can always depend on your crew for a solution. My store fluctuates between packed and empty, which makes it feel more manageable.

The benefits are nice touch as well. The fact that the business pays for break periods is great. Free food before or after your shift as long you eat at your store; 50% off when you're taking it to-go.
Cons:
The managers should empathize with their crew more often. For my location, I've noticed that the managers are really comfortable with their position of power and they seem dismissive to the concerns of crew members. For a business that emphasizes creating a "unique culture," at times I notice managers criticizing crew members during downtime. It's probably the same with every business, but it feels more potent with Chipotle in particular due to half of the crew being a member of management. It's like high school with again, basically, but with 18-40 year olds.

The "rush" periods can also be overwhelming at times, especially if you're understaffed at the time. Scheduling also isn't very consistent at times.
Advice to Management: If crew members get one-on-one reviews with the general manager, I believe that service and kitchen managers should receive one-on-ones from the crew. Also, please don't openly criticize or yell at the crew in front of customers. Not only is it embarrassing, it also showcases unprofessionalism.

Title: "Kitchen manager"

Cons: Sometimes a GM can become power hungry and become very controlling but if you talk to them and let them know how you feel they will most likely abide to your needs
Advice to Management: Keep Pushing. It will pay off and you will be rewarded. Trust me I'm in my second promotion right now and will soon become an apprentice.

Title: "Memorable and Helps build great work ethic"
Pros: Very fun crew. It gives you a chance to be hands on and create a great work ethic for yourself. You learn how to have great customer service, cleanliness, high standards, and being empowered. You learn essential skills that you can take with you for the rest of your life. If you're fast and take the time to learn and teach others, then you will have a great time
Cons: Certain situations may require to work extremely hard if it is busy. If you have low performing teammates then you will have a bad time. Some managers are horrible to work under. Sometimes there is a lack of professionalism.
Advice to Management: Management is great but keep an eye out for leaders(someone who accomplishes a task with their team), not boss's (someone who assigns their team a task and and doesn't help them succeed).

Title: "Mediocre Management"
Pros: Free meal during your shift
Cons: The Chipotle I worked at in Dayton had awful issues with employee retention. I was told the restaurant was required to employ 36 people, at least, for its size. Instead, we had 11 staff members, with any new blood quickly fleeing the scene of chaos. I had to do the work of three employees in the prep stage of the kitchen, which was a bit absurd. A friend of mine recently began working there, however, and said the severe lack of employees had died down some, but this is just my experience from several years ago.

Title: "Great company, management questionable"
Pros: I love the idea of food with integrity and the values that Chipotle tires to keep up to.
Cons: A LOT of work for the little time allotted, not to mention definitely underpaid for the amount of work that has to be completed when closing. I was called a various amount of terms at our store and it made the environment really uncomfortable. My drawer was "short" and I had to pay it out of pocket. Definitely questioning the morals of that particular store and the management.

Title: "Good Company"
Pros: Nothing really bad or good. Part time job- good people to work with. Fast paced

Title: "Crew Member"

I would think that one could not have fun whole completing the job based on my experience at Chipotle. But, fortunately based on all my job experiences one can have fun and complete a job. OH AND THERE RETENTION RATE IS HORRIBLE!!!!!!! AND PEOPLE;E THAT WORK THERE ARE MEAN AND RUDE.

Title: "Loyal corporate culture"
Pros: All employees are involved in interviewing and hiring new applicants. Hours are flexible, non-stressful environment
Cons: if you are not the type of person that is completely dedicated and loyal to your part-time job's corporation, you won't fit in.
Advice to Management: General managers should be at least 21 years of age or older.

Title: "I love working here!"
Pros: Pay is good. High pace, high energy atmosphere. Friendly staff and managers. Crew chooses managers and who get hired and fired
Cons: Never leave at the time your supposed to leave at. Sometimes work long shifts. Can get a bit hectic when it gets busy

Title: "A very laborious job."
Pros: Free meals and paid breaks. Sometimes you will get tips if you took responsibility to split them up for everyone.
Cons:
Was offered nine dollars an hour and only got minimum wage.
Expect you to work without a break even though you are entitled to one.
Advice to Management: Be more knowledgeable on how to run a restaurant.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Fast paced environment, willing to expand you as a person, will listen to your concerns, and defiantly works with your schedule. The have a high turn over in order to get only the best employees (this is only a con if you aren't willing to work hard)
Cons: The customers can be very rude, and it is draining to keep a straight face depending on the day. It is just part of the restaurant experience, not just a Chipotle thing.
Advice to Management: Sit down with employees sometime that isn't the middle of their shift. It can get quite busy.

Title: "Excellent Opportunity for growth"
Pros: Benefits, competitive pay, and many opportunities to pursue a career
Cons: Constantly rotating leadership at my location, a lack of true ownership among employees

Title: "CREW MEMEBER"
Pros: Free food on shift, 50 percent off at your store while off shift, crew becomes your 2nd family if you make a small effort
Cons: Breaks are never 30 minutes, can't use the restroom during peak hours, can be stressful
Advice to Management: Lighten up of the peak hours of a crew member needs to use restroom allow them the oppurtunity, hire better GMS

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros:
- Great people to work with
- Free food with every shift
- Managers which work alongside you and are almost always the most hardworking member there. They don't just tell you to do things, they do it themselves as well, and then some.
Cons: - Waking up at 6am to start making chips wasn't exactly the best thing ever.
Advice to Management: - Just keep on doing what you do! Continue pushing your employees hard, keep your high standards, cultivate top performers, and lead by example.

Title: "opportunities to move up worked 60 hour weeks"
Pros: they have a wonderful vision and culture that anyone would love to be apart of
Cons: this job is best suited for those who are single. I worked a lot and I didn't have time or energy to do other things
Advice to Management: reduce salaried managers required hours from 10 hours per day to 8.

Title: "Heavily Dependent on store/area"
Pros:
Fun Job
Free food
Above minimum wage
I became friends with most of the people that I worked with while I was there.
Cons: In my store, we had a lot of managers sent to us and then fired within a few months of them arriving. We as a store were struggling, so it seemed like the managers they were sending us were expect to fail, and that way the company could fire them.
Advice to Management: They need to place less of the blame on the crew and store managers, and instead look at the middle management (Team Leaders) as being part of the problem as well. The constant firings made sure our store would never improve because we were constantly losing managers and them gaining new ones who liked to do everything different.

Title: "Great Company"
Pros: Everyone understands that what you know is very minimal. Ask questions about how to make burritos correctly!
Cons: There really are no cons that I have found with working for chipotle
Advice to Management: There really is no advice I can give to management.

Title: "Rewarding"
Pros: gmo-free, fresh food. Employees actually care. Managers are accommodating
Cons: hard expectations to succeed, expects you to be high standards all the time, and fired after being late 2 days in a row
Advice to Management: goes from the bottom, kitchen manager, general manager, to restaurantaur

Title: "Manager"
Pros:
High energy amongst employees
Everyone truly enjoys working for the company
Large focus on promoting and maintaining a great corporate culture
A lot of very intelligent employees
Cons: Paid time off is not in line with similar positions around town
Advice to Management: Continue to do what you are doing (and reconsider PTO policy)

Title: "Lame company,good food"
Pros: Free food,good hours ,a little bit of tips,good grilling experience ,opportunity for growth , black t shirts for uniforms , learn good knife skills
Cons: Lame company culture,rude co workers
Advice to Management: Relax

Title: "Working @ the mexican grill"
Pros:
Nice environment
Managers want the best from you, word hard and everyone will like you.
Cons:
Alot of work for only $9
No diversity
Alot of pressure to finish fast with the idea that everything has to be high standards
Advice to Management: Stop being bias and make the crew more diverse

Title: "KM"
Pros: Cleanest restaurant, empowerment, team effort,atmosphere
Cons: Overworked, understaffed, not enough chip talks
Advice to Management: Spend more time hiring

Title: "Didn't see a future!"
Pros: It teaches you alot, food with integrity , fun at times.
Cons: I would say that your success depends alot on who you know and are friends with. As a former GM I can say I didn't feel any support from area management. They were really good at pointing out opportunities at the store but never acknowledge accomplishments. They expect Alot from salary employees (assistant mgrs & up). Your scheduled to work 50 but only get payed for 40 and honestly most work weeks for me were about 60 hrs,at which point you start thinking of whether it's worth the salary. I said fun at times because I actually and genuinely enjoyed a fast paced rush and enjoyed serving customers. Their mantra is "you will be rewarded based on how much you make others around you better", and that works great until a certain point. Not everyone who got hired had a plan to become a restaurant manager and hiring people who were looking for "temp" jobs was a no no. They didn't hire managers straight up, they had to start as crew. Let's face it, 9 bucks an hr isn't too bad if you're in school or its a summer job but who's willing to make that a full time job,i certainly wouldn't. I was there for the learning experience and appreciate those who did help me out but as soon as I got my degree I said bye bye.

Title: "Get ready to work"
Pros: Most people I worked with were fun and friendly and we got a free meal for every shift.
Cons: There was a lot of miscommunication between the staff and management

Title: "Planting Seeds in Valuable Soil"
Pros: They want to keep you in the company
Cons: You get tired of eating Chipotle
Advice to Management: Keep on Rocking!

Title: "Kitchen manager in training"
Pros:
good culture, nice and friendly coworkers.
good food quality "theory"
Cons: uneven quality among restaurants, low hourly pay, promotion bias.
Advice to Management: get rid of micro management managers, regional managers have to be nicer to store managers, so that they will treat employees nicer.

Title: "Crew"
Pros: It feels like a family, we laugh and have fun but also know how to get the job done.
Cons: The manager hires and fires people without thinking of the other crew members and how it will affect us. There is no organization

Title: "Humbling Experience"
Pros: Great coworkers, amazing discounts, time passes very quickly, opportunities to advance, and you will learn the benefits of hard work.
Cons: Long hours on your feet, low pay for hard work, intense pressure to be fast enough, cashiers have too many tasks placed on them at once.
Advice to Management: Implement training workshops for employees to learn stress management techniques in this business. Learning how to manage the pressure and stress that comes with such a demanding job is just as important as learning how to make the perfect burrito.

Title: "Fast-paced and demanding"
Pros:
-Great people; coworkers and managers are generally helpful and friendly
-Free good-tasting food on shift
-Time goes by quickly because of how fast-paced it is
-Not sure how the wages are elsewhere, but my Chipotle starts crew members at $12/hr, which is a much higher wage than any other entry-level fast food or retail job in my area
Cons:
-Easy to get overwhelmed when starting out
-Chipotle forces a cult-like ideology on their workers in an attempt to build their "culture"
-Customers are the most demanding and needy out of all fast-food restaurant customers due to Chipotle's target clientele
-Easy to get fired so try not to mess up too much
Advice to Management: You're doing all right. Treat individual workers with respect. Don't blame workers when things happen that are out of their control. Also, don't play favorites.

Title: "Not horrible not amazing"
Pros: You learn alot working at chipotle. How to prep and cook foods, how to work in a high volume restaurant and it taught me to have high customer service.
Cons: Chipotle expects way too much out of their employees for the little pay they receive. I worked in the South Atlanta Metro area and only made $8.35 an hour . You will work hard and the job is far from easy.

Title: "Crew member"
Pros: You get tips everyday lol
Cons: It seems like you have to study while you have the job

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Great Environment to work in. Chipotle is good at keeping crew members happy with each other and you'll love the team like and friendly atmosphere between crew and management.
Cons: Breaks are handled poorly. They try to make you go on break at the top of your shift change which leads to you working non stop. Or they will give you a break at the end of your shift which is not a break at all. And you only get one meal per shift

Title: "Fantastic"
Pros:
Great benefits
Great people
Food on break or after work
End of Year Bonuses (if youve been there the entire year)
Relaxed atmosphere
Tattoos and Piercings as longs as they are not offensive are okay.
Everyone is helpful
Cons: There is a lot of labor involved.

Title: "GM"
Pros: The people culture is the number one reason I joined the Chipotle Team. The passion that is shown to create a team of top performers that are empowered to achieve high standards is inspiring.
Cons: It is a very simple concept, but it is not easy to attain. You have to really have a passion for people and their development or this is not for you.
Advice to Management: Continue the support that is embodied throughout Chipotle. I witnessed the co CEO stating that the only way to advance within Chipotle is to do great at your job and make the others around you better. I truly believe that this is the belief throughout Chipotle and want this to continue. Do not waiver on those principles.

Title: "Loud, childish, awful."
Pros: Fast-paced, not minimum wage, good food
Cons: Poor management, managers show up high, loud, bright, hot, apparently nobody knows how to schedule properly at Chipotle.
Advice to Management: Pick better managers!

Title: "I liked this job at the time, except for the staff at the time"
Pros: The job itself was not hard. I am a quick learner so it was not extremely hard. Quick turn time
Cons: Food service industry. Customers making a mess of dining room like usual.
Advice to Management: Communicate with employees instead of singling them out

Title: "Its okay"
Pros:
. crew members
. Food
.
Cons:
. favoritism
. never a set schedule
.
Advice to Management: Get your life

Title: "A very great working experience."
Pros: Great training, crew becomes your family, you get to have one on ones with manager, lots of opportunities to move up.
Cons: Very challenging, can be stressful, sometimes crew are neglected and ignored (especially when dealing with personal problems)
Advice to Management: Pay attention to your crew.

Title: "Good at first, but not the best job in the long run."
Pros: Free meals during paid break, 50% employee discount, co-workers are like best friends and family.
Cons: Always understaffed, overworking, 15 cent raise every 6 months, poor management, customers treat you like crap
Advice to Management: Try not to focus so hard on yourselves. If we're behind, help everyone out as much as you can. Do what you said you were going to do. Stop neglecting us when there's a line to the door, we know you're just spending your precious time in the office.

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: There was a very strong sense of family at Chipotle. Going to work, while it could be stressful, always felt like spending time with family! Chipotle's very intentional about building camaraderie within the team, and it definitely shows. There are also amazing opportunities for advancement if you want to make a career out of it!
Cons: The only negative about working at Chipotle is that the work itself can get very stressful. You are doing the work of a scratch kitchen, so it can definitely be difficult.
Advice to Management: Honestly, Chipotle is one of the few places that I really didn't see problems with the management. The company is extremely intentional about the structure of everything, and it definitely makes for a nice, stream-lined way to do everything. This is definitely the best management of any company I've ever worked for.

Title: "Good people who struggle with planning"
Pros: Friendly atmosphere, fast pace, good food, energetic staff, exercise of stress management, high stakes, people-oriented, promote from within, work with hands
Cons: Long hours, late and/or early hours, inexperienced managers, language barrier, stress, physically demanding, lots of cutting, difficult customers, difficult employees
Advice to Management: Remember kindness is not a weakness

Title: "assistant manager"
Pros: very relaxed atmosphere great people
Cons: very busy, always on your feet
Advice to Management: faster advancement

Title: "It's chill"
Pros: The learning experience and meeting new people everyday.
Cons: There is some favoritism.
Advice to Management: Look at each employee respectfully.

Title: "Unbelievely high turnover rate, disorganized, very poor leadership"
Pros: free food, hardly work over 40 hours, some nice people, and if your a slacker you don't really have to work too hard because it takes a really long time to complete anything and do to the volume of unhappiness, they do not push their teams really hard to be productive.
Cons: IT leadership doesn't really know what they are doing, not qualified to run a company of that size. Never seen a place where they hire and fire so many people on a constant basis and leadership is not held accountable for this at their level. Also trying to fit a culture of burrito rollers into corporate, doesn't work but they are too naive to realize this. Typical "good ole boys/girls" club at the director level.
Advice to Management: Run far away, and don't come back. Referring to the executive IT leaders.

Title: "line worker"
Pros: fun to work with good food
Cons: rude customers can often be annoying
Advice to Management: dont neglect your employees

Title: "team member"
Pros: pay, hours, friend ship & food
Cons: a lot of work labor
Advice to Management: move up people who will do a great job

Title: "Hard pay"
Pros: Good pay, good message, cool co-workers.
Cons: Very stressful and high paced. Threw me into stuff without fully training. Expects a lot. Not flexible with hours
Advice to Management: Aviod throwing people into situations without training them yourself. Better scheduling.

Title: "It was fun but a lot of work"
Pros:
-free meal per shift
-50% off when not on shift
-always something to do
Cons:
-they should pay more for the amount of work we do
-rude customers when the line is long

Title: "Team Member"
Pros: Good pay, flexible hours, body modification friendly, paid breaks
Cons: Poor management, no slowing down
Advice to Management: Schedule breaks better -- in the morning shift, if you don't move quickly, you don't get a break. I know it's incentive to work quickly and efficiently, but an employee shouldn't be punished if they are still learning or if they have more to do on a given day. It also would not hurt to make sure employees can get water or a bathroom visit if necessary; sometimes we got so busy you would go hours working frantically without a sip of water. Dehydration is not a good state for employees to be in.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: I love working at chipotle , the food is amazing and the work environment is awesome. I love that it is always busy and you never have to worry about when you click out. The hours are amazing too.
Cons: A lot of ingredients to remember
Advice to Management: management is great

Title: "Cashier, prep and grill, line"
Pros: The company has a good logo about their culture and their vision
Cons: They don't let you work in peace, the company uses too much terminology from laws and they are extremely strict, they make it seam like their crew members opinion really matter but reality is that the amount of work is beyond too much for what they pay and no thank you or gratitude at all.
Advice to Management: Train your managers better many of them got their positions base on favoritism, considered your crew members more a simple thank you for all your hard work might be enough, stop talking about the vision, empowerment, high standards, top performance on the rush hour very distracting and please let them enjoy their time working instead of people having to be fake provide a fake smile and feel like they are in high school studying for testes.

Title: "This company sucks"
Pros: Free food I guess. Also some nice people. Oh the the place is clean. Other than this, I can't really think of anything.
Cons: Everything else. They work you to the bone for little pay. This company is a vampire and a leech that tries to present itself as 'ethical', but they're just as shady as every other corporation out there.
Advice to Management: Stop treating your employees like garbage.

Title: "cashier"
Pros: The work is easy to get used to and it is a fun environment to be in. Its easy to get along with everyone since chipotle hires people who are outgoing and enthusiastic. The pay is also is negotiable and the hours are good and flexible for those who attend school.
Cons: Its easy to move up to higher positions which is good but sometimes they promote people to quickly. All managers should know about all the stations before moving up as a manger. They choose who they think will do well rather than the people who will actually show that they can do the part.
Advice to Management: Before promoting someone make sure they are motivated and dedicated to doing their best in that position. Just because they say they want it doesn't mean they are prepared to handle the duties.

Title: "Great job"
Pros:
Great pay compared to other fast food restaurants
Best staff
Cons:
Long, tiring hours
A lot of memorizing to do (recipes, vocab) almost like school
Advice to Management: You're doing great, keep it up

Title: "We're here for each other, unless you ask too much, then you're on your own"
Pros: Free food, Can wear your own clothes aside from the shirt and hat, Piercings hair styles and colors are your own style, great company values
Cons: Constantly running out of stock on everyday items, Everyone is a boss and acts like it, Managers say they are there for you and to ask for help when you are 2 1/2 hrs deep in a line but don't back it up or tell you to push yourself harder and do it yourself. Less focused managers equate less focused employees and bad teamwork
Advice to Management: Be more for the entire team, stop playing around and help your employees and less fraternizing, My GM is great, my lower managers are less professional and it carries over (employees are off their game)

Title: "crew"
Pros: Free food and great opportunities
Cons: Favoritism keeps you from moving up
Advice to Management: Get it together

Title: "Favortisim and unfair promotions"
Pros: Hiring unexperienced people and expect high standards.
Cons: Favoritism! unfortunately you have to be close or friendly with the right people to get good hours or promotions . TL s are friends of GM's and there is no way to get if you are not their community . Unfortunately GM's are unexperienced young managers .
Advice to Management: Stop favoritism .

Title: "Crew Member"
Pros: Working with nice people, some free food.
Cons: I've never made more than $2 in tips a night, really rude customers, lots of standing and repetitive work.
Advice to Management: Allow people to tip on credit cards, create a system that allows fair distribution of tips.

Title: "Eh"
Pros: Good people, free food and the ability to move up if you really wanted to.
Cons: Lots of politics going on at the restaurant, people not being seen for their work, long hours and they expect you to stay even your shift is over.
Advice to Management: Stop just singling out people who you "think" are the best (No favoritism) Actually look at the person and their achievements and don't treat your employees like crap.

Title: "Long hours"
Pros: Flexible scheduling, great food and company culture
Cons: Long long hours, young managers, overworked

Title: "Tired of standing for hours"
Pros: Great and funny people to work with. Free food. Free drinks.
Cons: Not so organized. You can't sit down during the whole day. Pay is low.

Title: "Nice and easy going, went by very fast"
Pros: Good pay better than most fastfood restaurants, friendly environment, nice people, positive atmosphere, very easy going everyone is just calm and most workers are around 16-25
Cons: Very fast paced but manageable, its usually really busy or extremely slow. There's usually no in between, its also very demanding
Advice to Management: For the three different interviews everyone asked me the same questions. Work on wider range of questions.

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: It was nice knowing that the food came from farms that care about the ethics involved in food. A lot of the staff were also really awesome.
Cons: The management always needed to be reminded about breaks-- if I didn't tell them, they didn't give one. Even when I did, I was constantly told that they didn't have anyone to take my place at the register so I wouldn't be able to take my break. Honestly, I probably should've reported them since I was unable to take breaks most of the days when I worked. The management also didn't understand some of the basics of handling their employees and were often rude.
Advice to Management:
1. Plan schedules more appropriately so cashiers can go on break; other types of employees didn't seem to have this problem.

2. Be more respectful towards employees. In the beginning, it was a great team environment. When the store opened, we all went out to celebrate and got to know each other. But after a few months, the management became strict and rude. I'm not sure exactly why.

Title: "disappointed"
Pros: Free employee meals, free shirts and hats for uniform, easy uniform
Cons: Short breaks if you even get them. Not paid enough for level of work.
Advice to Management: Treat employees better, get off your phones and help.

Title: "Service manager"
Pros: The pay was good
Cons: They just don't have a care
Advice to Management: Stop letting your managers rob you and not cute then all.

Title: "Great food, Decent company"
Pros: free food, good bonus programs
Cons: under staffed, tied down to register.
Advice to Management: Having your manager run the register is a serious waste of management training, give the managers enough staff so that they are not hog tied to the register.

Title: "Exciting"
Pros: Fun people and work place
Cons: Moving up can be difficult

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: They feed you a meal every shift. I lost 5 lbs working there from constant movement for 8 hrs.
Cons: They try to create this environment where everyone can criticise each other and "Grow." Often times I would get criticized for getting slow on the line, but I was only slowing down because I was dehydrated and felt like i was going to pass out. They didn't give me a break until the very end of my shift which made the cleanup process even longer. Only 4 people would close the store and we would frequently be there until 2am. The GM was really nice but the supervisors made it a negative environment. I felt like I could never do anything right and i'm a perfectionist.
Advice to Management: Don't burn out your quality employees. The reason some stores have such high turnover rate is because even the most hard working employee, will get burnt out from constant negativity.

Title: "Great, hard-working people to work with; company stresses importance of people"
Pros: People are amazing, innovative, hard-working and smart. Casual dress code. Fun social events for employees. Tons of opportunities for growth. Fast-growing company. Company has admirable goals and is setting new industry standards.
Cons: High expectations for low pay. Expectations and standards differ across departments. Growing fast.
Advice to Management: It's time to realize Chipotle is a big company and no longer a small, start-up.

Title: "Good for part-time work"
Pros: You get a free meal with every shift, the work is hard but not difficult, and the management can be supportive.
Cons: The pay is too low for as much time as you spend there and as much work as you do.
Advice to Management: Divvy out the duties so that employees have time to take their breaks.

Title: "chipotle"
Pros: It has a fun atmosphere.
Cons: Management needs to delegate more authority and micromanage less.
Advice to Management: Less micro managing

Title: "Incredible experience with great people and job satisfaction"
Pros:
Great culture
Flexibility with hours
True caring shown between management, coworkers, and crew
A place to improve and develop skills that can be used anywhere in the work force
Cons: Hard work with ok pay

Title: "Cashier"
Pros: Meeting new people, learning new things, seeing how food is prepared, helps build customer service skills, pushes you to work hard
Cons: Only important people in the store was management. You could bend over backwards for them and it woul never be enough. Very insensitive and out for self.

Title: "Opportunity is available if you have a solid leader"
Pros: Obviously the food is a plus, opportunity to advance is very real but you need a strong leader which is rare sometimes
Cons: Poor leadership leaves you stuck in your position, advancement requires training you're replacement and you're leader train job you
Advice to Management: Practice what you preach, hold general managers you hold shift leaders too

Title: "crew"
Pros: Free food (double meat, double guacamole, all free), mediocre pay(not great but it wasn't min wage), great learning experience.
Cons: The hours were terrible. I would have a constantly changing schedule (multiple left for this reason). I would always take my break but manager would get annoyed on certain days.

Title: "Loved it"
Pros: The reason I enjoyed working here was due to the other great crew members. The majority of the crew at my store were ages 18 to mid 20's, an even the management was young so the whole store had good vibes. Pay was ok, but I ended up with a lot of overtime so it made it a little better. This for me was only a summer job in my hometown, but I definitely did not want to leave when my time was up. In the short time I was there I was even promoted to Kitchen Manager in Training.
Cons: I do not really have any cons. The only one probably being that we could not move at all during peak hours and things could get pretty hectic when the store is busy. You definitely need multitasking skills to work this job.

Title: "a horrible company to be with and pay sucks"
Pros: Free food and free fountain drinks
Cons: evevery things sucks from the job to management

Title: "Kitchen manager"
Pros: Free food during break. No critical thinking involved. If you can move fast, you will ascend. Company model focused on promoting.
Cons: It doesn't really matter how good you are at your job or tasks within your job. If you can move your hands fast, you will end up being promoted. This may not seem like a con, but trust me it is devastating to an employees sense of self worth.
Advice to Management: It's fast food. Most people forget that and start to get a false sense of entitlement. Just relax and take it day to day.

Title: "I loved the people who i worked even my bosses, that was one of the best things about working at Chipotle."
Pros: This was my first job and it was great because it didn't require work experience. Free food is like the best pro, after work you could hang with your coworker and eat for free. I hated that you couldn't take the employ meal home.
Cons: I hated working there, it seems fun but its a lot of work. They expected me to do too much, most of the time i'm in the back.
